Item_Response: We are able, as in present day today, to learn about the many diverse cultures and history of many different groups of peoples that once ruled many elaborate empires and civilizatons across the continents. The discoveries that have been made about the Inca have a great importance in the  history of many early civilizations. Their way of running and controling a civilization was very different then others because they had no form of alphabet or even a system of writing at that. They made knots in strings to record their calender. However, as of today noone knows the meanings of these knots which makes understanding the history of the Inca's very difficult, but also very unique because there is very limited history about them which means there is alot yet to still be found.       Also of great importance to early civilizations was the Pueblans. They were also very unique in their own way because they often followed a very nomadic life style. They got the nickname the 'Cliff Dwellers' because they built their dwellings underneath overhanging cliffs. Historians have shown that the Pueblo people occationally packed up and moved, which gave them their nomadic lifestyle. However the history stops here for the Puebloans because once they packed up and left Mesa Verde, their home for most of the time, they travled south probably into Mexico and Arizona, and were never really heard from again.       Finally, probably one of the most talked about and most interesting civilizatons of all time is the city of Neapolis which is belived to resemble in detail alot of the myths of the 'lost city of Atlantis'. What is so unique about this myth is that it truly was a lost city since it was thought to be submerged down into the deep ocean. This was finally discovered by a team known as Pavlopetri. This discovery was so magnificent because it is proven that this underwater city dates back to more than 5,000 years ago. 'It is by no doubt', described by Dr Jon Henderson, the oldest submerged town in the world.'

Item_Response: There have been many civilizations since humans were created.  The Puebloans, the Greeks, the Incas, all were great civilizations.  What do they all have in common?  They all eventually failed.One of the main reasons we study these civilizations is to discover what made them fail.  Learning why ancient civilizations failed helps us learn about their civilization and make sure that we don't make the same mistakes they did.            The Incas were one of the most successful ancient civilizations. At the height of their power, the Incas occupied an area of land almost the size of the Roman empire.  The fall of the empire was caused by foreign invaders killing their king.  We learned know this because it was Spanish invaders who killed their king, who at the time had records of what happens, unlike the Inca.  If the Spanish had not recorded this, we could have discovered this by studying things from the Incas.  From studying the Incas, we learn that we should not immediately be trusting to new people.            Ancient Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde many years ago.  They were basket makers and would live in small houses called pithouses. As their populaton grew, they statred to expand their housing into stone houses with pithouses in front of them.  When their population reached several thousand, it started to drop, and the puebloan moved into the cliff dwelling that they had once occupied.  No one knows why this happened.  Eventually, we could find out why and make sure that we don't make the same mistake that they did, but only if we continue to study them.            Recently, a Greek civilization site was explored for the first time.  It is only now being explored because the site happens to be underwater.  From studying the remains of the site, archeologist have concluded that the city was submerged at around 1000 BC.  This is because pottery found at the site resembled pottery from the stone age, around 5000 years ago.  The only way that the city could have been submerged was if the sea level was rising, something that is happening today.  If we don't stop global warming, the icecaps will melt, and soon we will end up just like the Greeks, underwater.            By studying ancient civilizations, we learn more then just who they were and how they lived.  We see the evolution of their civilization, how they began, how they survived, and how they died.  By studying them, we can make sure that we don't make the same mistakes that they did, and that the human race always survives, and always thrives.

Item_Response: Engraved deep in human nature is the inborn want to know everything about the world. To want to know what happened before us, what is happening around us, and what will happen after us. Learning about entire civilizations before ours existed is an enormous leap in our understanding of our world. Not only can learning about the past contribute to our simple quest for knowledge, but it can in many cases help us improve what is happening around us. It is a well known and widely accepted fact that the more experience one has, the generally better prepared for life they are. As humans are limited by our short lifetimes, learning about those before us serves as our 'experience,' and can help us make decisions based off of their successes and failures. For this reason, the recent discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important ones. The discoveries of these three civilizations are vital because they allow us to improve our understanding of the world before us and help us improve our own.        Uncovering ancient civilizations can give profound insight into what turns history took before we existed. For example, the discovery of the lost city of Atlantis, the Pavlopetri's hometown, confirmed the legends captured by the ancient Greeks and filled a hole in our understanding of what happened during the time period roughly 5000 years ago (Smith). Without the discovery of Atlantis, we would have been left wondering what had happened. Several other similar instances exist, such as the ancient Incan empire and the Puebloans. The discovery of the Incan empire filled a significant gap, about one hundred years (1438-1532) in our knowledge of the events before us. It explained temples, buildings, and ruins still in existence, and more importantly contributed to the residents' knowledge of their ancestry and heritage (Gruber). The discovery of the Puebloans had a similar effect, it filled a hole in our understanding of our country's history and the people before us, and let residents descended from them know their heritage and personal history (Mesa Verde National Park). However, knowledge of the past is useful for more that just for knowing.        Discovering ancient civilizations can help improve our world, by learning from the past mistakes of others. For example, the discovery of what happened to the Pavlopetri civilization at Atlantis taught us that ocean level rising can have a disastrous effect on humans, and thus gave insight into the current issue of global warming. Similarly, lessons can be learned from each of the other civilizations, such as the dangers of drought from the Puebloans (Mesa Verde National Park).        Without the discovery of these three civilizations: the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, we know considerably more about the events before us and the reasons for why those events happened. From learning about these three civilizations, additional insight that we would have originally been without was provided into our current world, and the addition of these three civilizations into our history 'lexicon' will permanently change our understanding of the world for the better.

Item_Response: The Ancient inca of peru had no formal alphabet. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count on live stock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archeaologits have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is lot like solving a mystery.

Item_Response: Archaeologists learn about ancient civilizations and people through artifacts, weather, natural occurences, homelands, etc. The archaeologists sometimes need to use digital technology to help them study a civilization better. Also, they need to find artifacts to learn more about civilizations and people that didn't have information archived. The Inca, First Ancestral Puebloans, and the Lost Greek City all have one major thing in common, they all are studied by Archaeologists and they all have/are artifacts left behind.           The Inca didn't leave any archives for historians to study. This means that historians don't know that much about the Inca life. The Inca did keep records by using strings or quipus. The Inca used colorful strings and tied knots in them to keep track of the date and livestock. However, no one knows what the knots mean making a part of the Inca a mystery. There were clues left behind by the Inca that give historians and archaeologists clues about their art and architecture, government, agriculture, religion, and the way of life. Some of the information about the Inca comes from stories passed down about them. Europeans wrote down old stories when they arrived to the Inca empire in 1532. The Europeans wrote about the Inca in letters and diaries. However, these people didn't know the Inca language well so historians need to be careful when interpreting these objects. The artifacts and objects the Inca left behind give us the rest of our Inca knowledge. The Inca artifacts were made from: pottery, stone, gold, or silver. These materials last a long time, so you can find them. The artifacts were found in the ruins of buildings and in graves. The people were buried with artifacts as a sign of reincarnation. Looters still look for treasures to this day, and they take artifacts that might be important to archaeologists. Sites that are carefully dug up provide the bet idea of Inca life in Peru. Archaeologists are able to compare what they find to the Spaniards' accounts of the Inca. The Inca lived in high-altitude places like caves and mountains. This preserved more sites because looters couldn't get to them. However, archaeologists had to be expert mountaineers in order to reach these high-altitute sights. Bodies in the Andes are frozen in good shape because of the cold mountains. This allows experts to use scanning equipment to learn how the people died and lived. The Inca are definitley a interesting but hard group of people to research even to this day.       A long time ago (about 1400 years) before the Europeans explored America, people lived in the Four Corners region. They chose Mesa Verde or Green Table (in English) to be their home. In the late A.D. 1200s, this group of a about 2 generations moved away. This culture is preserved at the Mesa Verde Nation Park. Archaeologists call these people Anasavi translated from the Navajo word 'the ancient ones' or 'the ancient enemies. Now to this day we call them Ancestral Puebloans. The first Ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde around A.D. 550. There main livelihood was farming that replaced hunting and gathering. The Ancestral Puebloans were also known for their skill of craft (like pottery), so they were called 'Basketmakers.' They lived in pithouses in small villages (about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750). Pithouses had their living room a few feet into the ground. Around A.D. 550 the pithouses evolved into Kivas that were above ground. During the Classic Perios (A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300), the population began to grow making villages more compact. Due to the major population growth crafts began to decline in quality. Pottery began to be used more often, so there was less attention to craft. About A.D. 1200, there was another population shift and the Puebloans moved back to where their ancestors used to be. When this happened a rise icliff dwellings happened which made Mesa Verde famous. The Puebloans didn't leave any written records of their lives (same as the Inca).          Through artifacts, weather, natural occurences, homelands, etc., Archaeologists were able to learn about the Inca, The Ancestral Puebloans, and the Lost city of Greece. Artifacts and the settlements/homelands left behind allow Archaeologists to learn more about these ancient civilizations and people.

Item_Response: The discovery of the lost civilizations are important because we get to see what the ancient civilizations were like. We get to see what interesting made and we can preserve those artifacts even longer with modern day technology.       The discovery of the underwater city is important because it shows how far modern day technology has come that we can go to the depths of the ocean and find a 9,000 square mile city. It is also interesting because we can figure out how an ancient civilization sunk to the bottom of the ocean. Some theories include that the sea level changed, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami occurred and caused the city to go under water.       The discovery of the Inca remains is also remarkable. The Andes mountains serve as a gigantic freezer for the bodies. It keeps them so well preserved that we can use modern day technology to examine the bodies and figure out why the person died. The deserts also help preserve their pottery for us to examine.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru did not have all of the things we have today. They didn't have a formal alphabet of a steady writing system. This story is about the Inca and how they civilized, oral history, and the clues left behind from the Inca.             The Inca civilized for nearly 100 years. They ruled in South American empire that rivaled of ancient Rome. Today, we have heard of read stories passed down from generation to generation. Passing down these stories helps us learn, or want to learn, how the Inca lived, or at least how we thought they lived.             Today we know the history of the Inca. Passed down form generation to generation we know how they lived. We know these stories because they were written down by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. These Europeans were Spanish and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.The Spanish didn't no the Inca's language, so their descriotions werent accurate. Some Inca told stories rather than history.             The Inca left some clues left behind. Some of these include pottery, gold, silver, and stone.These materials lasted a long time, even if buried for hundreds of years. Some artifacts can even be ruins of buildings and even graves.Inca textiles and clothing also survived. We know now that the Inca lived in the high Andes mountain range and worshiped some mountain peaks.The Inca were usually buried in caves or on top of mountain tops.              In conclusion, The Inca were very imoprtant to American history. They were one of the first to establish our country today. Even though they didnt have a good alphebet or have a standard writing system, they are still apart of our history. This story was about the Inca and how they civilized, the oral history, and the clues left behind.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been found are very important. These discoveries have been famous throughout the history and they still are being explored by tourists sometimes. Wouldn't it be wonderful to know why these artifacts are so important in our history and why people are so interested in them?            These great artifacts are great because they have a lot of history to them, like people who used to live there, or how they lived or died. The Inca of Peru, was important because it had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They left nothing for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today nobody knows what the knots mean. People know the stories from ancient times because clues were left behind by the Inca, form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Archaeologists would study these clues and put them together. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived well but some were destroyed by the dampness. The most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.             The Puebloans are important in our history because people have found out that a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years they lived there and they were building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Archaeologists called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'. We now call them Ancestral Puebloans. The Anasazi built pithouses for a place to live in. They also built Kivas which was a ceremonial room where they can use it for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or good crop. Anasazi's lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years then Mesa Verde was deserted.              The Pavlopetri was one of the most important artifacts because it was a lost city that is beneath the waters off southern Greece. It is the oldest submerged town in the world. The shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. The seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. Marine geologists have yet to work our why the settlement sank. Some theories include it was because of sea level change, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or tsunamis. The Pavlopetri inspired one of the world's most enduring myths, the fable of Atlantis. Atlantis was a myth but it was a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.              These discoveries have amazing history to them. There are stories that some people would have never known if people have explored them. Its a good thing that archaeologists have discovered them. These ancient artifacts have made people go and travel to these places because of their great history. The history shows how life used to be for all different kinds of people in the ancient times, how they lived, where they lived, and how they died. Everything has a great importance in them.

Item_Response: Lost civilizatons are an important part of our history. There are many things that we need to look at when we talk about lost civilizations many things that we need to consider. Things like how we get learn things about these civilizations. Then there are many things we can learn from the artifacts that help us learn what life was like for them. Natural weather and things like lootings make it hard some times to locate these ancient civilizations.   We learn about these civilizations through diffrent things. Some were written down as old stories, some were passed through oral history through many generations. But through everything that you learn not everything is going to be true. And historians understand that some statements are false others are made up, like some of the Inca stories.   Historians also learn about these anicent civilizations through artifacts they prove to be very important. They learn things about their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, governement, transporatation and way of life. Commen artifacts are usually made out of, stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These types of materials tend tolast a long time, most of these objects have benn buried for over hundreds of years.   There are many things that make it hard to locate these anicent civilizations. Weather, and things like lootings are just to of the major ones. Weather is something that is always going to be unexpected so you have to be prepared for whatever mother nature throws at you. Archaeologists have to be prepared for anything. Lootings are always taking place and they dont tell us much about the sites. Some sites have been reported and some archaeologists are sent who can dig them up carefully. Sometimes things are lost othertimes most of it can be saved it all just depends on the situation.   Lost civilizations are very important to us, it helps us learn new things about our history. It is very important for archaeologists to take special care in preserving our history. Things like weather and  lootings slow us down in this process, sometimes things can be saved other things will be lost forever.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are important because we can see how the people lived and what they would use to make tools to carry food or water in. We can also learn what kind of foods they would have eaten if there is remains of the food in the bottom of the pot or bowl. We can see that people did have knowledge unlike some of the movies that make them look really dumb and don't know what to do.                People back in the stone age may have been cavemen but knew what to do to survive in the climate they lived in. They needed to make tools and weapons to make food and kill animals for meat. People would use every single part of what they would kill. They would use the bone and shape them into tools like knives for cuttinng through the skin of a deer. They would use the fur as a coat or blanket to stay warm at night.                 These discoveries are so important becasue maybe they had a problem like a disease that we didn't know about. If we found a body of a person that had that disease, and it was well preserved, we could use ccurrent day technology and find out how to cure the disease before it strikes again. Some of the fabric of what the people would wear could be found and show how they made their clothing without a cotton gin or needle and thred. If the people had writen documents it could show future civilizations how not to get in big arguments and how to keep a civilization running for a long time.                 People in the Mesa Verde clan managed to make sturdy houses to withstand the harsh conditions of the mountains. Then later on they would evolve into bigger houses to house larger families in one house. The people of Atlantis tried to build a city under water. They people of Inca actually built a city in the Peru coast and in the Andes mountains.                 Another reason that the discoveries of artifacts of the ancient civilizations is if you want to live there the people could have writen documents of how to live in the conditions there. The documents could tell how to maintain fields to farm crops in the conditions of where your at. They could also have cave drawings of what kind of animals live in that area. There could be tools to left behind you could use like a bone knife and mabe a bow and arrows or spears.                 In conclusion it is very important to know about the past of where you live so you know how to live there. Make tools to survive with. Learn how to make a house that will withstand the weather conditions of the climate there.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have discovered artifacts that date back to 5,000 years ago. There are the clothes warn by the Incas. Or even the pottery made by the Puebloans. These artifacts can tell archaeologists about our ancestors and their civilizations.                 Thanks to the dry deserts or the cold Andes Mountains, many artifacts from the Incas have been analyzed by archaeologists.  One of the artifacts found by archaeologists are the colorful strings with knots, called quipus, the Ancient Inca used to keep records. They kept records of calendars and livestock.  Archaeologists have not yet found  the exact meaning of the knots on the quipus. The knots have told archaeologists that the ancient Inca of Peru did not have an alphabet or a system of writing though. Some Inca clothing has also been found in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts and the cold Andes Mountains. These  can tell archaeologists what materials the Inca used to make their clothing and what materials they had access to.                  Archaeologists have also recovered artifacts made by the Ancestral Puebloans. The Puebloans used to use and make beautiful baskets, but this changed. The baskets found between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 showed evidence of declining in quality. This could be from the wide spread use of pottery. The pottery found, on the other hand, went from a simple design on a gray background to black drawings on a white background. This is why archaeologists believe that pottery more or less replaced baskets, and the craft of basket making was less well known.There were also the  smoke-blackened ceilings and walls of the Ancestral Puebloans homes, which showed evidence of fire. This told the archaeologists that the Puebloans used and had access to fire.                       In southern Greece, a lost city was found. This city is like the myth of the lost city of Atlantis. This lost city in southern Greece is submerged in water. Archaeologists have learned many things about this civilization from what is left of it. They know that the people who lived it the city from 2800 to 1200 BC were religious. This is known from the rock-cut tombs and religious structures found in the underwater city. Archaeologists also know that the people from this ancient city had main streets, courtyards, and buildings. The people of this city were not nomadic.                   Archaeologists can learn about a civilization just by looking at the artifacts discovered there. There would be no way of knowing that the Puebloans lost their interest in basket making if the pottery and baskets were destroyed.  We also would not know of the city underwater if  nobody found it. The more archaeologists find, the more they can learn where we came from.

Item_Response: PAST LIFE BEFORE US   Civilizations forgotten and left behind.                       All civilizations have to come to an end. Even a great and massive  culture like the Incas. The Incas had ruled all of Southern America for about 100 years (1438-1532). The Incas were very talented they knew art, architecture, transportation, religion, government, and even their own system of their lives. Archeologists today had found certain artifacts to tell of Incas past lives and to see how was life as an Inca. Although the Incas did not have any system of literature or an alphabet, the Incas still had records of themselves, of calenders called quipus. Although archeologists do not realize what the knots on the quipus mean, they need to know much of what had gone in Inca civilization. Today it is hard to find an origin of an Inca today. The fall of the Incas took place when the Spaniards took over and killed the last Inca king. Archeologists look all over Southern America and search for remains of Inca civilization.                      One generation to another, were Puebloans way of living on the Mesa Verde until one generation moved away and left. The Puebloans are known as the basketmakers because of there talent in craft. The Puebloans were skilled at making all sorts of handy objects such as weapons, pottery, baskets, and pit houses. At a time the Puebloans obtained a settled life and replaced hunting for farming, and men gathered as there natural life style. For a time the Basketmakers population multiplied.The Puebloans got there name from the Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers,' because around 750 A.D. they began building houses above ground. By A.D. 1000 the Puebloans began building advanced skillful stone buildings. As well as there art and pottery, changed and advanced, the A.D. 1000 were a high point for the Puebloans. Between 1100 and 1300 A.D the population had reached thousands, the result had impacted the villages, and needed new ways of making new houses. Another change was of the Puebloans moving  upwards to a cliff around A.D. 1200. The result was off-putting to many archeologists. The cliff dwellers only lived in the caves for about 100 years. By A.D. 1300 Mesa Verde was deserted, and the Puebloan kind migrated to the South into New Mexico and Arizona. Sometimes people are going to leave their homes and find a new one.                     The city of Atlantis, lost but true. The city took place back 5,000 years to the place of Southern Greece. The city remains dating back 2800 to 1200 BC long back before the glory days of classical Greece. Atlantis straddles 30,000 square meters on ocean floor right on Southern Peloponnese, that was sunken down back around sea on 1000 BC. Marine archeologists were able to properly survey the ruins of Atlantis. The marine archeologists found a world of buildings that was moved by shifting sands. The city was occupied some 5,000 years ago, earlier than the scientist had thought. The buildings  were over 9,000 square meters, but what was really surprising was a possible megaron. What the megaron means that the city might had been used by an elite, that could raised the status of the settlement. Marine geologists have yet to find why the settlement sank, a few reasons why is because of the sea level change, or an earthquake. Others had known of the city but had thought of it as a myth. The city is still remained unfounded, but there is still vast oceans out there needed discovered, and some day Atlantis will be found.               Article written by Pedro Ceballos

Item_Response: The discoveries found by the archeologists over time have given the public in the present a small glimpse of the past, and learn how they civilizations managed for the time that they did. It gives us an idea of how life was like back then, without technology or our modern uses, and how they managed with what they had. the discorveries of artifacts and daily lives of the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have imacted us by learning how life was like in the past.                The Inca Civilization had many discoveries found by scientist. For example, quipus was a colored string with knots that was used as a form of a calendar. They had textiles and clothing that have been preserved . they worshiped mountain peaks also. These discoveries show how their ways of living is still found in our societ, only in a different way.               The Puebloans were skilled at crafts, hence the name 'Basketmakers'. They were farmers, and have been giving up of their ways of a nomadic lifestyle into a more settled way. It has helped us seee how their way if living was.            The Pavopetri were a team of Anglo-greek ream that were on the settlement that sunk. It is dated back 5,000 years ago. Because it was so long ago, evidence of is not precise if it was wealthy or how large it was.        In conclusion, artificts found in these civilization have helped our knowledge of them to expand. Our former way of thinking of their lives have been replaced by this new prior knowledge. Hopefully, new discoveries can be made as to ebnhance our knowlege and alway keep the people of the past in our mind.

Item_Response: Incans: The Incans were a very addvanced civilization for their time. They developed a calander made by knots in colored strings to keep track of the livestock. No one can really understand--or read the string-- because back then it was very complicated to figure out. Most of what we know comes from orally told stories about the Incans and ancient Rome. We know for sure about these stories because they were written down by the Europeans that came in the empire in 1532. Many spanish soliars and priests. They tell about the Incans in diaries and in letters. Many historians realized that the Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language very well and they might not have understood what the Inca told them, so the descripstions would not be as accurate as two Incas speaking to eachother. The rest of the things that we already know and still have left to discover lay in ancient artifacts. Things like pottery, silver, gold, and objects made of stone. Many of these things are found in ruins or buildings. These artifacts stay in well conditions for a very long time.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca has alot of history to do with sience and weather. They had no alphabet or system of writing. About 1,400 years ago Europeans explored North America. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550.    Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in 1880s, acheologists have sought to understand these peoples lives.   The secret of a lost city that may have inspires one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable od Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. Item_Response: Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami       We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought,''   said Henderson, who codirected the underwater survey.       The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.           There is now no doub that this is the oldest submerged town in the world, said Dr Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the goly days of classical Greece. There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique.               Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reched several thousand. It was mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms,   often with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in the open. The stone walls of the large pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde, with their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. Baskets show evidence of decline in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery meant less attention to the vraft. about A.D. 1200,   another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centruies before.Why did they make this move? We don't know. Perhaps it was for defense ; perhaps it was for religious or psychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elemoents. Whatever the reason, or reasons, it gave to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is most famous.

Item_Response: The Inca civilization have given us a good idea of clothing and textiles, The Puebloans have given us ideas about shelter such as huts, or now called, houses, finally, the Pavlopetri have given us a good idea on how to make types of art and accessories. I strongly believe that the discoveries of the three civilizations are very important in our era.            The Inca's ruled a South American empire for nearly a hundred years that had rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome. Spanish soldiers and priests described the Incas in letters and diaries that were past down for a perennial amount of time. Inca artifacts have created a great amount of knowledge in our brains and we have made that knowledge our own and been on the path that the Incas would have been on for years. We have learned from the Inca and have followed their lead for years, that is why I strongly believe that the discovery of this civilization was important.            The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde at about A.D. 550. Mesa Verde means green table in Spanish. They learned to make pottery and made the bow and arrow, much more efficient for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. The people made pithouses and had lived in them; the pithouses had lasted from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, when settled agriculture had began. Next, the Kiva's came which were ceremonial rooms also known as churches. Our ideas of houses and churches mostly came from the Puebloans civilization, this meticulously shows why this discovery was so important.           'The Lost Greek city' has dated back 5,000 years. Luckily for the archaeologists, some of the artifacts were reserved by shifting sand and ocean currents, if not, then we would have had never known what this civilization did with its arts and accessories. The Pavlopetri were very skilled with arts such as pottery, ceramics and other type of arts. The Pavlopetri have given us a good deal of creativity and knowledge about fine arts like this. There is no doubt that the discovery of the Pavlopetri was important to us.             The Incas and their fine clothing artifacts, The Puebloans and their structure of houses and and materials they used, The Pavlopetri and their arts that created creativity and the knowledge of arts in our minds. The three civilizations have given us ideas about different things and how to do them. What would have happened if we never learned about them? We would have never been so creative and so smart, that is why I strongly believe that these discoveries are so important to our lives.

Item_Response: Why Acient Civilizations are Important         Civilizations such as the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are very important to our world now because, they tell us about our past, the help us remember what we used to be and it tells us about culture every where we go.      First, by finding the little things such as baskets and peices of pottery, we learn about how our ancestors used they're resources and what the area allowed them to use. Even they're homes tell us things. Stone or clay houses built atop cliffs give us a few reasons on why life there was so sustainable. We can give educated quesses such as, they needed an area to protect them from the elements. Or maybe protection against enimies. Each artifact gets us a step closer to learning what used to be.      Secondly, remembering what life used to be. Think about what are world is now, we have cars and homes with heating and electricity. Finding these civilizations shows us how peole before us used to live. They had horses, homes built by hand with rock or twigs even. They had fire for light at night and the sun during the day. Life was much harder for them, than for us.          Lastly, the world's culture. Look at the Puebloans, they're culture influenced their crafts and whole style of living. What beleived in set them apart from each and every other civilization in the world, how they hunted, ate, used materiels and even lived was based on their culture. Or the people who lived, or thrived in the now sunken city in Greece. The way the town was set up shows us how these people may have lived, and maybe how they died.        In conclusion you can see that discovering these civilizations improves our image of the past, seeing how life used to be, and the cultures we may know today.

Item_Response: Picture yourself climbing a mountain and then suddenly you are at the entrance to a great ancient city, imagine swimming around in the ocean and seeing a great city there on the sea bed, or even driving along to look up in the mountains to see pit-houses. Two of these are remains of great civilizations we have learned about. The other is a possible myth proved correct. All of these are part of history though. To relive history would be quite the conquest.        If you were climbing and suddenly you were at the entrance of a great ancient city then you have found the remains of the Incas. The Incas are a civilization that lived around the years 1438-1532. These people didn't have a written language making it hard for the archaeologists to learn more about them. All we know is that they used colored strings and knots to tell how many animals they had from year to year. They used this system for everything and it worked well for them.        Next is the sunken city on the ocean sea bed. This is believed to be the mythical city of Atlantis. Archaeologists are trying to figure out if it really is Atlantis or was just the sunken city that inspired the myth of Atlantis. What makes the archaeologists believe even more that this sunken city is Atlantis is, that it is the only city found underwater that has objects that predate the time when Plato wrote of Atlantis. The possibility that as few divers found Atlantis is quite powerful. Considering that the myth of Atlantis just may so happen not to be a myth but a fact.        Lastly if you were to have found pit-houses then you have found the ancient ruins of the Puebloans. The archaeologists have also called them Anasazi. The pit-houses were lived in from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. Another building found that was built by these people are Kivas. Archaeologists were notified of these around the 1880s. These were buildings made to have city gatherings. Archaeologists are still trying to find more out about the Puebloans because they too didn't have a written language making their history quite complicated to comprehend.        To relive history would be quite the conquest. Which is one reason why so many of us are trying to figure out history. However there will always be times when someone won't e able to find the missing pieces. There are times when we will be adding to the history books. Until then we learn more and more about history, possibly even making some history ourselves.

Item_Response: Have you ever wonder why archaeologists dig up old stuff. I know I have, and it is because there are more things to learn out in this world. If they didn't do their job we may not how anciant civilizations work. I have researched and read about three major discoveries all discovered by archaeologists. The first one is one about an ancient civilization called the Inca's. The second one is about a group of people who are excellent at crafting they are called the Puebloans, often knowna as the Mesa Verde. Lastly, this is one is about the lost city of Atlantis , and how they are trying there best to uncover something major.        The first one to start off with are the famous Inca's. These people were truly amazing in my personal oppinion. If you think math and algebra are hard just imagine being the Inca's. They had a unique system of strings. These strings demonstrated teh simple things that we have today. The strings helped them with math, the alphabet, and even a calender. However, the rest of their strange civilization is a mystery, but I have hope it will one day be more elaborate. The archaeologists have oral stories past down from generations to help the decipher the odd civilization that is the Inca's. Overall, I think this discovery was very important because, this discovery helped us understand a whole different civilizations way of living.       Another spectacular discovery is the one about teh Puebloans. These people from what I read were very strange. These people were very artistic and were masters at crafts. They made baskets and pottery. In the beginning they live in houses called pithouses. However, through many years the mastered something better than wood, stone! As soon as, they mastered stone houses out of no where the ventured to the mountains and built houses there. Nobody knows why, it could be because they were scared, maybe for defence, or even something psychologically. This is also a very important discovery for many reasons. I think it is important because in the beggining all they knew were sand,mud, and wood. then through later years they progressed in knowledge. They then lived in stone houses the same model as the wood ones, but these provided more protection. That is why this discovery was important.       Lastly, the amazing discovery by the archaeologists the Pavlopetri. These archaeologists are trying to uncover the lost city of Atlantis, not that is pretty extraordinary. They have found slight evidence that Atlantis will be real. They found ancient pottery and some tops to ancient greek buildings. They are still contemplating on why it sunk in the first place. Also, why wasn't it reoccupied. They have came to the conclusion that Atlantis is most definately the largest submerged city in the world. I feel this discovery is important because if they actaully uncover Atlantis it will be huge, and world changing. It will most likely be the most amazing discvoery of man kind. I find it even more fascinating because Atlantis was always a fable that parents tell their children, but now it is becoming a reality.       In conclusion, you now see why archaeologists are some of the most fascinationg poeple, and they improve history by a huge amount. All discoveries are important, and contain many unknown facts. First the Inca's with their extremely complicated way at life. Then with the Puebloans with their progress in knowledge. Lastly, with the Pavlopetri and almost findiong the lost city of Atlantis. It is reall quite amazing. So, never forget there is a meaning to everything!

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are very important ancient civilizations of our world today. Having known these civilizations makes some discoveries make more sense to the human population.        The Inca had no formal writing system, but used a system of knots in a string to keep records.  These knots were known as quipus. No one is sure what each knot represents, therefore trying to read them is like a mystery. The Inca empire kept records with the quipus too.  Inca Empire lasted for nearly 100 years before disappearing into the Spanish empire.            The pueblosns lived in the four- corner area. This civilization lived for around 700 years.  Most people translate them to being 'ancient enemies'. Basket-making was a skilled that they were great in. They lived in pit-houses and made more efficient weapons and homes.

Item_Response: To find out about civilization hundreds of years ago, archeologists find, study, reserch, and compare artifacts and clues left behind by the Inca. By studing these artifacts archaeologists and others can piece together details about the Inca way of life.     The way that archaeologists are able to find all of these artifacts after these hundreds of years is that some Inca artifacts are made from stone, pottery, gold, or siver these materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Also some textiles and clothing have survived good as well. some have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or also the Ande's mountains.      Although finding such artifacts are not easy the Inca lived high in the Andes and most of their sites are very high places so it makes it very difficult for archaeologist to get to. Another thing is their are treasure hunters and looters, who take anything that might be valuable.      So, Archaeology is a good way of finding out about civilization hundreds of years ago. Although it is not an easy process it is worth it in the end, finding out about the Inca life.

Item_Response: People in Peru have to live a bad life. This is why. They have to enoid any snakes from bitting them. Some people in Peru dyed from diseases from many kinds of animals. Over 200 people died from diseases. Egyptians found many new dicoveries like finding artifacts from mummies. They brought it back with them and showed everybody. Some people died after making the discovery. Some did not. People in Peru have found artifacts in their own house or carved in their house. Archaeologists kept these as a secret. Most of them kept it in journals about their dicoveries. Most people showed others, some kept it to themselves. When others found that the others that kept the stuff to themselves, they got mad at them. They would kill them and take what they own, even their discovery they found.        About 1,400 years ago, a group of people lived in the Four Corners region and chose Mesa Verde for their home. People left thier homes, to find a better home to live in. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') about A.D.550. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as thier main livelihood. They lived in pithouses, clustered into small villages, usually built on mesa tops, but sometimes in cliff recesses. people there learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower.       People go underwater to look for the world's most enduring myths- the fable of Atlantis- have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. Explored by an Anglo- greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years. About 40 years ago, the only year that the archaeologists could only find, put hidden cameras to record what they could find under the sea. When they came back home, they told people of their discovery. They said, ' We found ceramics, dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought,' said Henderson, who was co-directed the underwater survey.

Item_Response: Why are ancient civilizations important? They shaped the world we live in today, and studying them explains how they did that. The remains of ancient civilizations tell us our entire history. All over the world fragments of the past have been left behind. When we look at these, we can uncover our own history, the history of our world.             Ill start with the Incas. The Incas were one of three very important civilizations in Peru, including the Aztecs and the Mayans. Their empire was built high in the Andes mountains, where it was hard to reach and could be well protected and thrived from 1438-1532, when the spanish murdered the last Inca king. The Incas were very intelligent and were responsible for much of the beginning of modern agriculture in South America. For example the cities were built of such evenly cut stone, that it seems impossible for a human to accomplish it without a machine, like Machu Pichu. The religion, art, and culture are still prominent in South America today. We are able to learn much about the Incas because their remnants were well preserved by the cold of the mountains, even bodies buried in the caves can still be studied for they have been kept in such good condition. The Incas were one of the important links in South American history.               Not to far away, in what is now Mexico, the Ancestral Puebloans left behind their cities built into the sides of cliffs of what is now called the Mesa Verde. They first settled there in A.D. 550. They were no were near as advanced as the Incas. They lived in clay or stone houses built in to cliffs. They became very prominent farmers and depended on farming to survive. Over time they did develop agriculture and the population reached into the thousands. They became one of the finest expressions of human culture in North America. But by about A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was competely deserted. Their city still remains, which modern day archaeologists study and has become a tourist site. Some of todays pueblo people are still decended from the Ancestral Puebloans.               On the other side of the world, another civilization rose. The city of ancient Greece. It is most famous for its fable of the sunken city of Atlantis. Modern day marine geologists have discovered such a city that may have inspired the myth. The city know as Pavopetri was sunk some 5,000 years ago. Geologists hypothesize the reason for it, probally a combination of the land shifting and earthquakes. Because of the shallow water and shifting sands though, the city has been kept in amazing condition. It can give us a look into the myth that prople have been hunting for for hundreds of years.                All of these civilizations are very important to modern day historians. It gives us a glimpse of our orgins and how the modern world was shaped.

Item_Response: The important discoveries about the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlovetri:               I believe that the discoveries archaeologists made about ancient civilizations were very important for many reasons. First of all, these discoveries help histories find out about events that happened, scientists find out about land formations and how the earth has changed, and us know how much our modern society has evolved since their times. Secondly, these discoveries help scientists find out more about the land forms and other things that happened in the past and quite possibly could happen again in the future. Item_Response: In Ancient Inca the archaeologists tries to unlock secrets from the past. The ancient Inca of Peru had a different system of writing, while we spoke and wrote in English. The ancient Inca had a different language.                 From 1438-1532, ruled in the South America, some clues by the Inca form a portrait of their religion, art, and architecture. Some of what we know today comes from the oral history, of stories that were passed on from generation to generation.                Some of the Inca sites, have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that is valuable. Archaeologists who studies these sites that have looters, keep careful records. They take notes and try to learn as much information as they can. Some archaeologists can compare from what they learn from artifacts to what they know about the ancient history.                Long ago, people lived in pit houses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, when their agriculture began. The pit house has a four cornered roof and a fire pit. By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry.  The fires were built in the summer, because it was mainly for cooking. In the winter, when the alcove rooms were wet, fires probably burned throughout the village.                The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths from southern Greece. Archaeologists found ceramices dating back to the end of the stone age, underneath the lost city of Greece. Which is located near Neoplis and the Elafonissos Island.               The marine geologists have yet to work on why the settlement sank.                'It is very likely a combination of the first two,' said Dimitris Sakellariou. Which he is talking about the theorices that include ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.                The first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predate the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Item_Response: The unearthing of the hidden Inca people was a huge find. There are many reasons behind why they are such interesting news to our historians today. Now we know about more people who used to live on the Earth. We found artifacts about them so we now know their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Now that we know these things we know how people at that time were like. This fills up another page in our history books. The Incas loved to pass on stories and we now know some of these stories because of the artifacts that we have found about them. This is why finding the Inca empire was a great thing.                      Another thing we found were the Puebloans. So apparently there is a group of people who chose Mesa Verde as their home. They lived there about 1,400 years ago. The reason we found them was because we found their stone structures in which they lived. The reason this find was so amazing is because we found out about the houses they had at that time. The houses were called pit houses. These houses are actually in the ground and they had a small opening in the top where you could get in. This really shows us how far architecture and building has really come. But something very interesting about the Puebloans was that they were masters with stone. They could make the strongest walls at that time. We would not have known any of this if it weren't for our historians finding this. This is why finding the Puebloans was so great.                      The last amazing discovery that i learned about, was the discovery of the oldest underwater town in history. This means that Atlantis might actually exist and this might be a town a little off of their. Well the settlement that was found there dates back 5,000 years ago. This site straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. It is said that this town was engulfed by the ocean around 1000 BC. This town had buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, there were thousands of shards of pottery. What really amazes me is how they knew to look there out of all the places on the Earth. This is what i like about the findings on Earth.

Item_Response: There are a lot of lost civilizations. One of those lost civilizations is the Inca civilzation. I am going to talk about the lost Inca civilization.                  The Inca were from Peru and had no formal alphabet or system of writing. To keep count of livestock, the Inca made knots in colored strings called quipis. When the first Europeans met the Inca, they were stunned by how they used quipis to run a huge empire. When archaeologists found quipis, nobody knew what it meant. Nobody could read the knots tied into the colorful strings. Understanding it is a lot like solving a mystery.                         The Inca also ruled a South America empire for nearly a hundred years, and it rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome. The Incas left behind portraits of their religion, art, agriculture, architecture, way of life, transportation, and government. If they study the portraits, they can tell the way that the Inca lived.  The Inca have stories passed down from generation to generation that people still know today. Some of the old Inca stories were written down by some Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.                 The Inca lived in the Andes and they might have worshiped some mountain peaks. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, and they might have taken anything that was valuable in the Inca sites. A lot of the Inca's treasures were stolen many centuries ago, and people still take stuff till this day. Archaeologists have a hard time finding out stuff after the looters have been there. Archaeologists who study Inca sites keel records carefully. they write down and photograph everything that they find, and in the exact position that they find them in. They try to learn everything that they possibly can about every artifact that they find.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing they would make differnt things they would make knots in colorded strings called quips to record the callender.People know some of the old stories becuase they were written down by the Europeaons who arrived in the empire in 1532.The spinadors did not speack the Inca language well they may not have understood what the inca told them so their descriptions might not be accturate .Inca lived high in the Andes and may have even have worshiped some mountain peaks.Some Inca were burried in caves in cliff faces for example on mountain tops.Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good condition that experts can use mordern medical scanning equipment to learn about how people died.The bodies also reaveal information about how they died.       About 1,400 years ago long before Europeans explored North America a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.Homes got destroyed it caused them all to move away in the late A.D 1200.The first Ancestral prubloans settled in Mesa Verde witch is Spanish for 'green table' they are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft.Between A.D. 1100 and A.D 1300 during the classic Period the population may have reached several thousand.About A.D 1200, another major population shift saw people begin move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancentors centuries before.Perhaps it was for defense  Perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elements.Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1880's archeologists have sought to understand thes people lives.Scientific knowlege isnt that great though.The structures are evidence of a society that over centuries accumulated skills and traditions and passed them from generation to generation.Ancestral Puebloans builed dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs their basic construction material was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread.When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verda left they traveled south into New mexico and Arizons settiling among their kin who were already there.       The secrets of a lost city that have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths a fable of Atlantis have been brought to liight froim beaneth the waters off southern greece.Explored by an Anglo Greek team of Archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of the Homer's hereos and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented experts say.The site which straddles 30,000 square meters of oceon floor of the southern peloponnese is nbelieved to have been sonsumed by the seat around 100 BC.Less than 1% of the worlds oceon extradionary finf but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.

Item_Response: Explanatory Article                         Have you ever wondered why the Inca's, Puebloan's, and the Pavloperti's were so important? It was caused by the ancient civilizations that wondered all around Machu Piccu that made the Inca's so important. The Puebloan's had gotten important when the built their pit houses for pottery, and making weapons. Finally, the Pavloperti's got their importance when they became one of the founders of the secret of where Atlantis was.                        First, Machu Piccu is one of the wonders of the world because it was built on top of the Himalayan mountains.That was where some old stories came about. The stories talked about the Spanish soldiers and priests. Then, they would make a description of the Inca in diaries and letters. We know some of the old stories because some Europeans wrote about them. The rest of what we know about the Incans comes from thier artifacts, things they left behind, and the sites where the artifacts came from. Some things they left behind were: clothes, buildings, pottery, stones, gold, silver,and cloth. That was how the Incans were important.                                        Then, The Puebloan's were founded mostly by the Europeans because Europeans started to explore the world over 1,400 years ago. They believed that the Puebloan were either the 'ancient ones' or the 'ancient enemies.' They believed this because they believed in many gods instead of only just one. This was thought to be taken in the 'Mesa Verde National Park'. The Puebloan's built mostly Pit houses for war and for art such as pottery. There were also times when basket makers population multiplied because this was good the Puebloan could hire them to make baskets for food.                             Finally, the Pavloperti were founded by Greeks because they were located in Neapolis that was near where Atlantis was founded. The Pavloperti were the first of many people to find this island. The island was located under the sea. You can see where it is if you look at the map. It was hard for the Pavloperti to find it because without the scuba gear many of them died because the could not breathe. That was another problem because many of the Pavloperti were becoming extinct! That was when they finally found it and many people of the Pavloperti were happy.

Item_Response: Many artifacts and ruins have been lost and found. Some artifacts have been lost by the weather because they are buried.The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. The Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Today no one knows what the knots mean. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studing these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life. Some old stories have been written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Such materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years.           The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. About A.D 750 they begun building houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and muds.Fires built in summer were mainly for cooking. In winter, when the alcove rooms were dampand uncomfortable, fires probably burned throughout the village. By about A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. Several theories offer reasons for their migration.           Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist and known as Pavlopetri,the sunken settlement, Atlantis, dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heros and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. Atlantis has remains dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. This site straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. Marine geologist have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Some theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.           The Incas,  the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri had important artifacts that are found and there are some that are yet to be found. The artifacts and their discoveries are important because they helped create new artifacts and help learn about their past and how they lived it.

Item_Response: In the article title 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secretes of the Past,' by Berth Gruber explains that the Ancient Inca of Peru didn't leave any archives to study of historians and so it's a mystery.                   Berth questions that by the hundred years (1438-1532) who ruled the empire for South America? No one now's because the only things left behind were clues. Clues that were their religion by the Inca,art by the Inca, and their transportation by the Inca. By these clues people could piece every little clue together and and get more details about the Inca life. Inca lived high in the Andes and maybe have worship some mountains.                Source number 2 reports that 1,400 years ago even before Europeans explored North America a group of people who lived in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. Late in the A.D. 1200s in span of a generation or two ,left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde became a national park of ancient culture.The first Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde lived in Pithouses. They replace hunting for farming life.                                                                                                                                       The Cliff Dwellers archeologists have sought understanding peoples life's. Despite decades of excavation,analysis.classification,and comparison knowledge remains sketchy. By the classic period (A.D. 1100 TO A.D. 1300), Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization.                     That's why its important to learn history because they made items and created other items that's helped people in their life. Those are the reason why you should listen to history.

Item_Response: Discoveries toward the Inca,the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are really important topics. The Inca did not leave archives for historians to study. Archaeologist have found many ancient quipus-but today no one knows what they mean.Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion,art and architecture,agriculture ,government ,transportaion ,and way of life. Mesa Verde National Park preserves a great reminder of this ancient culture. Acheologist have called these people Anasazi. People lived ikn pithouses from about A.D 550 to A.D 750,as settled agriculture began. They lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there. Lastly, explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years. 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr Jon Henderson associate proffessor of underwater archaeology. What they found surpassed all expectations. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. This is an extraordinary finjd but there is still a lot more under there that has not been found. All these topics have wonderful stories to them, who knew the ancient places would be fasinating to study about.

Item_Response: The discoveries made on the inca are mainly given by artifacts . The Incas left no system of writing or archives. The incas left knots of colorful string called quipis to record thwe calender and to count the livestock they had.The Incas had run a whole empire using strings to keep records. No one knows what the knots mean even though they have been discovered.Clues left incas way of life,art architecture and culture  to be discovered like a mystery. What we know about the Incas is mostly passed on by ancient stories passed on through generartions, most likely legends. Some of the old stories were discovered by europeans who wrote them down most likely innacurrate because the europeans did not speak the inca language. The rest of historians knoweledge comes from artifacts left behind by the incas and ancient sites. Most artifacts were  gold, silver, pottery and stone. Some were found in the bulidings of the sites and others were found buried with the dead to be used in what they believed the afterlife. Some clothing peices were discovered as well and cloth was preserved welll because they were left in the dry desert where the Incas used to live. Some Inca sites have been destroyed by treasure hunters who take anything that might be valuable to them.The archeological sites are the best way right now to determine the Incas life. Archeologists need to track exactly were they find the artifact tomb or building or else it might get lost or there might be other evedince in the place they were looking. The inca lived in the high part of the Andes mountians and were believed to worship some of the mountian peaks. The usual spots for Inca villages are in remote high places. The giant mountians are very cold so the bodies burred in the caves and mountain tops are preserved very well and looters cannot usually get t them which makes the job a lot more difficult because they have to climb a moutain before they can get to work. They use medical scanning  equiptent to find out how the person died the way they did. In conclusion the discoveries about the ancient incas could not have been done with out the help of archeologists.

Item_Response: Have you ever heard of Ancient civilizations for example Atlantis? Of course you heard of the lost city. There are many civilizations out there in the world that we do not know of. Like how did we discover fire? How do we keep ourselves warm? How do we find food? These lost civilizations have been forgotten over the last couple thousand years. We should at least know our history to explain why we have such a nice living paradise now then we had back then.        Starting with the Inca civilization, I bet you're thinking right now that you do not know this civilization. This civilization was a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome. We all know Rome, I am quite certain that many are very found of the gladiators that have fought bloody battles. How did we find all this information about the Inca civilization? We, the archaeologists have found out that the Inca had no formal alphabet nor a system of writing. So how did we find all this information? The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed to see how the people of Inca could run such a huge empire without any trouble. The Europeans discovered strings that the Inca people use to keep records. Today the knots on the string are still a mystery today. There are many things we do not know about our history as we do with our modern city today.        1,400 years ago, a group of Europeans explored North America. They discovered another lost civilization, Mesa Verde. For more than 700 years, descendants lived in Mesa Verde and flourished here building elaborate stone communities. We know now that the descendants left this beautiful area moving somewhere unknown. In A.D. 550, the first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They were known as basket makers since they were so skilled at crafts. The Puebloans lived in pit houses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometime in cliff recesses. They were very well known for their crafts. They would learn to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow for hunting. These first civilize people had it better than the Inca people did.        Last of all the story you've been wanting to read. Atlantis. As many of you people know Atlantis is the lost city of Greece. The settlement dated back 5,000 years to the time Homer's heroes. Atlantis have been know to be the oldest submerged town in the world. It remained dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC. There were many sunken cities but nothing compared to Atlantis. Due to the shifting sand and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. Atlantis was a myth yet a story in out history.        Hoping someone learned something today, our history did matter. Many others probably wonder why we even bother with history. Why do we even need to learn about something that was in the past. There are many possibilities that the past can help with the future.

Item_Response: Early civilization tell us how humans had lived earlier in life.Artifacts can show us what they used to keep warm,what they used to hunt,if they had any religious ceremonies, and what they used for shelter.Ancient civilizations are found all over the world.The discoveries about the ancient civilizations like the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because these places have told us what we used in that environment to stay alive.       The discovery of the Inca was important because it showed us how they survived in the mountain region. The Inca had lived in the caves of the mountains and also had used the peaks and other caves for burying their dead.The Inca had used quipus to tell stories about them and their ancestors. The quipus' also had held anceint history that we can not find. People still cant read the quipus' now. The Inca civilization was destroyed after the death of their last king by the Spaniards.       The Mesa Verde were a very smart civilization in architecture.The Mesa Verde had lived in the Four Corners region of the present day United States.The Mesa Verde were a very advanced group were still advancing when they flourished.There artifacts have shown that they had changed from an atlatl to a bow and arrow for weaponry. They also had very intricate and huge shelters after a while. In the earlier times of the Mesa Verde they had lived in shelters called pithouses, which were small semiground huts,and then they had advanced to upper ground shelters that got up to be three stories tall.After they left their homeland they had came back and had lived under cliffs. they had made small rooms out of sandstone that were about six by eight feet.       The Pavlopetri had lived in a civilization that was sunken after they had died off.This civilization was a lot like a regular city in present time.The sands had preserved a lot of their artifacts including buildings, courtyards, main streets and other main structures. They had their own religion too due to the religious structures the archaologists have found.This civilization had been ruled by a king or emperor.       The finding of the Inca, Mesa Verde, and the Pavlopetri are important because they have told us what we did to survive in differnet regions of the world.These three civilizations had all shared they way they were sheltered. The inca lived in caves in the Andes, the Mesa Verde lived in huge buildings by the cliffs of mountains, and the Pavlopetri had lived in a now present time bay near greece. All these civilizations had a lot of important artifacts that led to us finding the lifestyles of them.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Incans, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are very important to society. They help us learn about ancient life, show us how advanced ancient civilizations were, and create new ideas about what else there is for us to discover.       From the Incans, archaeologists learned what kind of clothing they wore, what occured in their history, and how they practiced their religion. Puebloans left bhind evidence of their houses, drawings, and weaponry. In the lost Greek city, archaeologists uncovered buildings, tombs, and religious structures, showing the organization and planning involved to create the city.       You would be surprised at how advanced civilizations were in ancient times. The Puebloans ditched the atlatl, a spear thrower, for the more reliable bow and arrow. They also took the time to skillfully create walls of thick stone, often rising two to three stories high, and join them together to form units of fifty or more rooms. Planning and skill is also evident in the Pavlopetri civilization. They constructed an entire city consisting of buildings, courtyards, main streets, tombs, and religious structures.       After finding all these artifacts, archaeologists are left with ideas about other undiscovered civilizations. The lost Greek city was thought to have inspired stories about Atlantis, but who knows how many other lost civilizations there are beneath the 99% of ocean we haven't searched? If the Incans were smart enough to hide themselves in deep cave to prevent looters from stealing their posessions, why couldn't anyone else think of it?       These dicoveries help archaeologists understand the lives of ancient civilians, how advanced they were, and what else might be waiting for us to uncover it.
