Item_Response: The findings of evidence from the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because it helps learn how our ancestors lived and how life was like back then. The findings from the Inca helped us learn about our ancestors because it says that they used stone, gold, or silver to make pottery. It also shows what kind of clothes they had and how they made them.   The findings from the Puebloans showed us how the housing was back then.Farming replaced hunting and gathering was a main livelihood. They then aquired the bow and arrow and that is important because the bow and arrow is still used today.   The findings from the Pavlopetri are important because it showed us how the early city looked in the ancient times. Like courtyards, rock cut tombs, main streets, and religious structures.

Item_Response: You might wonder why we spend all this time and money learning about ancient civilizations. You might also wonder why its important to lean about these people. Well, we can learn from their mistakes. We can learn more about where we came from and learn more about the Earth and its history.        We can learn a lot from these people like how they grew food and what the grew. We can also learn were they lived and who they traded with, or who they went to war with. We can learn how they built their houses or if they lived in caves. We can learn about ancient money systems and accounting. Take the ancient Incas for example. They kept records of live stock and grain by tiying knots into colored strings. The ancient Pueblos used to live in the Andy's mountains. Then they moved o Mesa Verde and lived in Pit houses.Then they learned how to make houses out of stone. Although most went back to living in mountain caves we can still learn about them today.        We can also learn about what people made to trade. At first the Pueblos wove baskets then they became skilled at stone masonry. In the lost city, that is now under the southern Greek coast, thousands upon thousands of pottery shard were discovered with the ruins.        We can also learn about them from their art work. Like Native Americans Indians the Inca would paint portieres and and make sculptures. Some other civilizations made beautiful pottery. Others made buildings and sculptures.        Another thing we can learn about ancient civilizations is how they ran their government if they had any. Like stated before the Inca kept all records by tieing knots into colored string. That would get complicated!        We can also learn about natural disasters from these ancient people. We can learn about how often a land slide was or an earthquake. We can learn about how they protected them self against these things. We cold also learn more about tornadoes and hurricanes by looking at the destruction it caused the ancient people.        Religion is also something else that we can learn about. We can find out witch gods and goddesses they worshiped. We can learn and compare how their society worked and how our works today.        We can use all of this information and use it to learn about our past and maybe how to improve our future, all by studying these ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: I have been assigned to write an explanatory atricle explaing why the dicoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. Have you ever wondered what took place in the history before you were ever here? How did things develop? Read below and you will found out on how some of these facinating things have been discovers.       The Incas were found by clues left behind. Some comes from oral history or stories passed down from generation to generation. Some, though, were rather legends than history. Inca artifacts have been dug up or found in grave for the dead. Clothing and textils have survived because of the dry deserts and the old mountains. Archaeologists make sure to keep careful records of any artifacts they find. They also note there exact position. Above are just a few ways that archaeologists discovered things about the incas.       The Puebloans are known for there skill as Basketmakers.  They decided to lead a more settled way of life. They replaced huunting and gathering with farming and much more. They also advanced there houses. They were very smart and used nature to their advantage by building their dweelings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Once they left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizone. Some people there are still descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.       Alantis has been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. It has been explored by archaeologists and marine geologists. It contains remains dating back to 2800 to 1200 BC. There is no doubt that it is the oldest submerged town in the world. They found there surpassed from shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay. They still cannot figure out why the settlement sank, but there are theories. Atlantis is said to be a myth, but a myth that keeps the water exploration going.

Item_Response: The Inca's, The Peubloans, & The Pavlopetri   Have you ever wondered what it would be like to research ancient people and their artifacts? DO you know who the Inca's are? DO you want to find out who they are? Have you ever wondered what it would be like to learn about history and things that have happened more than 1,000 years ago? Did you know that their is a National Geographic Investigation that investigates these things? Well then let's find out..       Well discoveries about the Inca have recently come up as a topic lately. So the NGI decided to do some research and find out some things. The Inca originally came from Peru and have no formal system of the alphabet or writing. We also know some of their Emporers in our history classes and things like that. While the NGI was researching they found that the Inca have many intelligent people but also have a lot of what you would call theories about different things like they bury their people in Mountain Cliffs and in big rocks and boulders. Do you know why?       Most of our discoveries come from their artifacts, and other objects that they have left behind while traveling around the World. Their textiles and clothing has survived well and is still in what they call good- condition. Most clothing and cloth and things are destroyed from the rain and storms and maybe some animals that have found their belongings. Looters and Treasure Hunters have also desterbed the Inca area or civilization. Their are also cliff dwellers. The first local cowboys to report the cliff dwelling happened in the early 1880's. But the archaeologist have yet to understand these people's lives.       A few different things are in the ocean. On the ocean floor archaeologist have found many things like clothes, shoes, fur, and more. Divers were sent down to find more ancient artifacts and identify them as to what they are classified as. Artifacts have recently dated back to over 5,000 years ago. Some people are also known as Puebloeans, which is a Spanish word meaning ' village dwellers.'       I hope that you have learned more about the inca's and their culture and thancient artifacts that we have recently found and other things. I hope that soemday you will remeber and come back to this article and realize how long ago this stuff happened so long ago.

It might tell how people have evolved back then and how advance were there.   The only stories that the Inca had were written on a piece of string called quipus and no one knows what they mean. They also learned that the Inca buried people in the Andes mountains and this people learned that there were crime because they were buried there because it made it harder for thief's to get and loot the bodies.         The Puebloans were very good craftsmen and were known as Basket makers. What makes them interesting is that they farmed and made pit houses into small villages. They knew how to pottery, had bows, and arrows. Soon they began making houses that were strong and good. They expanded more out of their village and for some reason they went back to their village. They left nothing or evidence of why they left. It could be because there might of been earthquakes, they were attacked, or many other reasons.         The Pavlopetri were an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. They think the Atlantis is older than 5,000 years old. Dr. Jon Henderson thinks its the oldest submerged town in the world. This might of been the most important discovery of them all. There are many question about Atlantis like how advance were they, what did they use to make buildings, how they discovered about pottery, what did the believe in, and many more. This was a time before Christ was born and people were advance but this city is the most advance civilization probably then any other. They had many buildings like courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. Many don't know what has happen to Atlantis and less then 1% of water has been searched in the world.

Item_Response: Astonishing Ancient Civilizations          The first ancient civilization is the Inca. The Inca didn't have a writing system or a record of their past live. All they left us was these quipus, they were these colorful knots that keep record of their life style and told stories. Many archaeologist found many quipus, But theirs no one that can read the knots. So it made understanding the Inca like solving a mystery. There were these site that helped the archaeologist, but they were located in the Andes mountains. This helped preserve the bodies and structures of the buildings, but also made it hard for the archaeologist to carry their equipment up the mountain and if they found something they would also have to carry that down the mountain. the Inca also left clues like portraits of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their way of life. We already know some of the history through oral history or stories passed down through generation to generation. Although there wasn't any record of them they did leave a lot of clues behind for us to examine.           The next civilization is the Puebloans. they were very crafty people they would do pottery and make weapons for hunting. This civilization's population would multiply by a great amount.In 1000 A.D, the Puebloans architecture had advanced, even there pottery changed. Despite the decades they analysis the knowledge remained sketchy. The Puebloans didn't leave any records and what was important in their lives has perished away. the Building was of helped because it showed that there was evidence of a society that, over centuries they accumulated skills and traditions that were passed down from generation to generation. Today's some Pueblo people and other tribes are descendents of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.            The final ancient civilization i will mention is the Lost City of Greek also Know as the Pavlopetri. Many have said that- the fable of Atlantis- was just that a myth. Then an oceanographer discover the city and it was only this year that the marine archaeologist got help by digital technology. This site is covering 30,000 of square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. The site was enclosed and protected by the shifting sands. What the found was beyond their expectations. The exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. Also the sea bed was repleted with thousands of shards of pottery. The archaeologist found ceramic dating back to the end of the stone age. Their investigations revealed 9,000 square meters of new buildings, but what took the archaeologist by surprise was a possible discovery of a Megaron.  this site represented a frozen moment in the past. this was the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece. this was a very extraordinary find but there is still more to discover.              These ancient civilizations are just some of what the archaeologist have found, but there is always more to find because we have yet to discover the rest of the world.

Item_Response: The Civilization who Searched to be Remembered                     Over hundreds of years ago there was another civilization. A civilization nobody had remember or even imagined until recently old remains were found . These old remains told us many things about our ancestors. Things that our generation never would've known if it wasn't for these leftovers from the past generations. These remarkable things were only found out only because of artifacts or objects that our ancestors let behind for us to find and remember their culture by.                All of these new discoveries are very important because they tell us how our life used to be back then . This also gives us and idea of how exactly our ancestors had to live their every day life, we have found a great amount of  information and we're sure there is lots more to come. With this new information hopefully we'll get even an idea on how we would've lived, and did live back then . These people had a much harder life and they wanted us to know about it. Someday generations later we will be the ones being remembered as ' ancient civilizations ' and we would want those other humans to acknowledge all of the impactful and memorable things we human beings accomplished and conquered.                   With time, people forget many things. Maybe friends, family, but obviously this civilization wanted to make and impact some day and be remembered. And so it did. Up until this day we remember them.Thanks to all of the remains that they left for us to someday find. We have found all kind of found remains like clothing, ways of maintenance, and even bodies that they buried in very low temperature places so that when found, the can still be studied and displayed to the people. This was not only a way for us to know more about the ancient times but also a way to remember these ancient people. The  ancient Inca's did a very great job at leaving hints and left overs remains for us to find and study . They really made a impact on today's modern world and with all this information, hopefully this great and mighty civilization will forever be remembered.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca,The Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri are all important because they add on to more of the things we know about our ancient history and how people used to live and survive in different kinds of habitats and places in the world. In source #1 it talks about how they found how the Inca lived and where. In source #2 it talks about how the Puebloans lived as well in their habitats and where in the world they were all located. In source #3 it talks about them possibly finding the lost city also the home of the Pavlopetri.           In source #1, the Inca had no way of leaving a trace of who they were or how they lived so many scientists had to piece everything together. At a point in time the Inca were visited by the Spaniards.  They knew how to speak in the Inca language a little and barely understood what they said so when the scientists asked descendants of the Spaniards if they could possibly translate, the scientists weren't sure if they could have possibly translated wrong or they didn't understand it well or possibly the old stories were all myths so they weren't sure what to believe. Some of the evidence shows the scientists that they lived high in the Andes and worshiped in high mountain peaks. This also shows that they like to be in high places like mountains and such. The bodies showed the scientists how they died and how they lived.            In source #2, the Puebloans lived in North America long before the Europeans came to here to explore. they soon left because of the stone communities around them. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. they were also good at crafts, most of there things were nicely knitted and hand made. Soon later everything started to get a lot better and improve.they didn't leave any records or writings but there were structures to prove they existed. They used 'caveman style' do do a lot of things like set fires and clean clothes and a lot of other things like that. when they left, they all went to either Mexico or Arizona.            In source #3, it talks about the discovery of the lost city and how the Pavlopetri lived before the sea sunk it. they have now found proof that there was a city that was in the middle of the sea before the it sank. the scientists have now discovered that it is the oldest city in the world now. this exploration revealed many kinds of things that we have in our cities today. the city sank because of the sea level, the sea level changes every once in a while and when there was an earthquake it sank the whole city. the scientists have said that Atlantis was a myth but still keeps going and that about less than 1% of the sea has been surveyed.

Item_Response: The lost cities are very important for many reasons, they are important because they show us how are lives would be like in the past. The finding lost cities are extremely important to our history and life of people a long time ago. Learning about all of lost cities gives us information to see how much our cities have changed over long periods of time.           First of all, the Incas were a big part to helping us learn about our past, although we have not learned much about them because they do not have a formal alphabet or system of writing, so the Incas did not leave any archives for historians to study. But they did leave clues behind by portraits of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and their way of live. The ancient civilization of the Incas helped us learn way more about our history.          Second,is the Pueblos. The pueblos lived very differently than the Incas. Archeologists had found out many things about the pueblos and how they lived. one of the things they had found about them was the houses they had lived in, they were pit houses that the pueblos had lived in from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. the pit house featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof, and the fire pit had a deflector. There houses were a big part of history and learning about the ways they had lived.            Lastly, the pavloperti settlment dates back some 5,000 years ago. The lost greek city is really important and unique because it is the largest lost underwater city toi be found, and tyhere are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this. We have more imformation about tye lost city because the salt water preserved more artifacts and clothing than expected.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations         There have been many discoveries of ancient cities and artifacts that were found in them,but all are very important to our history as humans.I have read about three different civilizations that were discovered.All were very important,here's how.          The first civilization was the Inca.they did not leave any records but they're still very important.We can learn a lot about their religion,government,transportation,art, arctexturere,agriculture,and way of life through amazing portraits.With these archaeologists can piece together details of Inca life.The Inca had a special way of recording things,such as little strings with knots called quipus.The way of reading these has since been lost but the importance of them is still there.Stories of the Inca have been written down by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532.Most are legend but some have proven to be history.Inca textiles and clothing have survived in sites such as dry deserts of the coasts of Peru,and remote places high up in the Andes Mountains.Archaeologists record everything about where they find artifacts.With this knowledge they can learn more about this amazing civilization.It's important to learn about these people because for many years they not only lived well with a good government system,but also had a vast empire.With the help of aerial help archaeologist can learn about patterns Inca people left in the mountains.With all this important information we can learn about these amazing people.          The next civilization was the Ancestral Puebloans.They lived about 1,400 years ago.They lived in communities built in sheltered acloves in canyon walls.They lived in places like that for 700 years.Then they left their homes and moved away. These people left only there amazing arcitexture for archaeologists to decifer what there life was life.Early Puebloans were known as Basketmakers.They farmed and gathered.There number grew and they becan to build kivas.These stone weall of the large pueblos are reguarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde.This is what makes this wonderful civilization so important to our history.We have much to learn about these people but with each find we're getting closer.         The last civilization is the underwater settlement.This settlement is located on the southern coast of Greece.It covers 30,000 square miles.It's beauty was only found 40 years ago.In it you can find remains as old as 2800 and 1200 BC.But the settlement itself dates back to 5,000 years ago.This old settlement is a treasure.We can learn so much from them just by there pottery and stories.In this settlement explorers say they found buildings,courtyards,main streets,rock-cut tombs,and religous structures.This is unique because there are older sunken settlements then this one but none can be consider to be 'planned' loke this one appears to be.The settlement appears to be an elite society and also reprsents a 'frozen monument of time' which is why this find is so important to our history.       There have been many dicoveries of ancient cities and artifacts that were found in them,but all are very important to our history as humans.I have just told you about three that mean alot to our history.And there are many more with value to them.So when you look at an old city think about it's importance to human history.

Item_Response: The Lost Civilizations of the Past            How did the Incas, Puebloans, and the people of Atlantis live?  These lost cities of the past and find out what their world was like thousands of years ago.        The Puebloans lived in the small villages.  They wove baskets and farmed.  They hunted deer and gathered berries.         The people of Atlantis planned their towns.  They made pottery.  Atlantis was the first oldest town to be submerged.  The town that was found was 2800 to 1200 B. C.         The Incas lived in Peru.  They lived in the mountains.  They had no alphabet but they used the quipus to tie knots to show the cattle, the calendar, and the different types of cattle.  The strings were colorful.  The cold weather of the mountains preserved the artifacts well so the archeologists could tell the way of life then.        Archelogists found each location to tell us better information about ancestors lives before our lives.  They will research our lives and see what we lived today now and compare then and now.

Item_Response: Archaeologist Discover                 The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because we can learn about how the people lived, how they got food, where they slept, what they did, ext.             The Inca never had a alphebet or an actual writing system. They tied knots in colorful strings to keep records. They left behind artifacts such as, potery, gold, silver, and stone. From those clues it has helped us kinda kow how they lived.              The  Puebloans lived in pithouses. They farm instead of hunting and gathering. They  live in small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make potery and acquired the bow and arrow.               The Pavlopetri discovered many different artifacts from Atlantis. There were buildings and streets. It was like a whole town under water. There were artifacts found there such as, potery, silver, and stone.               Archaelolgy is very important because if we didn't do it then we would never find out about the poeple and things that went on in the past. We can learn about it by discovering artifacts and then study them.

Item_Response: Discovery of the Lost Past     Archaeologist discovered there were lost civilization such as the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavolpetri. These were found in an underwater city, that was lost years ago and now secrets are being unleased about this mysterious discovery of the past. The Incas were one of the civilizations, archaeologist found out that the had no form of alphabet or a system of writing. All they left behind were their colored strings that were called quipus which they marked their calenders with. They also left beatiful portriats of their religion, art , and architecture, agriculture, government and their way of life. Today nobody has been able to know the meaning of their strings because we can't read them.     The Puebloans were known as basket makers because of their skills in craft. They began to farm which replaced hunting and gathering as their main source of food and supplies. They lived in pithouses that were put into crowed villages, these were usually built on mesa tops but sometimes on cliffs. They learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow which was a better weapon for hunting than the atlatl- a spear thrower. When their population begin to multiply they started building haouse above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. They then became known as Puebloans- village dwellers.     The Pavolpetri known as the sunken settlement goes back 5,000 years. This site covers 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Thanks to the current technology we were able to reveal the world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock cut toombs and religious structures. We also found thousands of sharded pottery.

Item_Response: We have made several discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri due to some very amazing things. We have found things about the Inca due to the climate that they lived in, and the great moutain sites. The oceans have helped us greatly in the discovery of the sunken city that has lead to the discovery of the Pavlopetri. The sun dried area of the Four Corners has preserved the Puebloans for a long time. But there are plunty of obsticles that face the team of archaeologist.             Most of what we know about the Incas is from the mountains where they lived for almost 100 years. The mountains are like a giant frezzer that has frozen remains and artifacts from the Incan empire. The mountain tops have done a great job keeping the looters away (people who try to steel artifacts). The mountains cold climate is perfect for preserveing artifact that have given us a clue to the past of the Incas. We have found these colorful ropes that have been used by the Incas to tell stories, count, as a calander and to keep trake of live stock.            The sun dried desert area know as the Four Corners use to be a place for the Puebloans to live and celabrate religous things. The sun has dried and preserved the houses and living places of the Puebloans. When archaeologist went in the found old dwellings and the newest dwellings which changed dramticly over time. Before they use to live in Pithouses (houses that are lowerd a few feet into the ground). The last living places of the Puebloan were tall structers several stories above ground with under gound ceremonial rooms called Kiva. The artifacts recoverd from the places showed that over time that the pottery styles changed from traditional dull gray pottery to black drawings on white background. There is still many things still to be learned about them through the artifacts.             The lost city of Atlantis is no longer a myth told by old Greeks. We have found an underwater city off of Greece. The water has perserved it well and is not easy for looters to get to. This discovery of an underwater city provides us with lots of information about the Pavlopetri. The artifacts from this city has been dated to the end of the stone age making it the oldest sumerged planed city in the world. The artifacts fround in the city are one of a kind because the city was never reoccupied.             The geography, weather and other natrual occreances have preserved these artifacts well but they also make it very chalaging for archaeologiost to get to the artifacts. The ocean is an unforgiving place that dose not like to give up it secreates easily. The city is at the bottom of the ocean and this makes it hard to get all the right equipment and need things to find all the posible artifacts. The mountains make it hard to climb up to the sites to get artifacts espeisaly with equipment to use. Transporting the artifacts back down is even more tricky as some are heavy as well as fragal so they are very easy to break. The hot weater of the Foyur Corners make it hard to funcition well for archaeologist. It is also very easy to get dehydrated in the blistering sun and could easily do just as much harm to the archaeologist.            Even though we have had many set backs, chalages and obsticals we have found ways to overcome and manage to learn many things about the Inca, the Peubloan, and the Pavlopetri. We may have done this yet there are many more to come and many things left to learn from their artifacts and their homelands.

For example the Inca's in the article Ancient Inca: Archeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past, lived on a mountain and that might just be what wiped out their civilization. You don't find many cities on mountains anymore know do you? Though how  a city ended up in the ocean we'll probably never figure out exactly why, but we will always speculate and wonder why.                I think that is one of the main reasons that we search for things is to speculate and wonder why and just hope that someday we will actually find out why this is or why that happened. But we do have some answers like from the article Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and their World. The archeologists found about what time the civilizations started and when they ended.  They found out how they lived at the time and some of their cultural aspects that were obvious and really it is all important so we can better ourselves and mostly it's just learning about a different time and place in history.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important to not only archeaologists, but also to the common people, too.  Why?, because ancient civilizations like these three are a part of the world's history.  Studying these civilizations can reveal so much of human history, it also satisfies the wondering to the longing of so many people's wanting to know about the past.            These civilizations open up a door to the past through artifacts such as the calenders of the Inca, the cliffs and geography of the Puebloans, and the answers to the many questions of Atlantis -- the lost city/world -- also known as the Pavolpetri.  The main idea is that ancient civilizations can lead to other 'worlds', forgotten cities, and by finding all of these things we can learn more about our world.  Where it came from and sometimes learning about the past can lead to the ideas of the future.            By learning about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri we have discovered ancient writings, buildings, pottery, and many other artifacts.  These artifacts have left archealogists in wonder of what else they could find.  The Inca for example are many times confused with the Spaniards, so archeaologists must always make sure that the site they've found or are looking for is of the Inca.  They have discovered quipus, the Inca calender, which is made up of colorful string tied into knots is one form of technology that probably led to the making of greater technology.            Finding these clues have led archeaologists to new levels, ideas, and ways of discovering the past.  Without these clues we wouldn't know how our ancestors lived and we wouldn't know how our people evolved into what we've become.  So, just kept that in mind.

Archaeologist find better understanding of theirs life's  beacuse of the recording of information they collect exploring their lands and remote places .        The bodies that are found also give archaeologist information on how people died and how they also lived , even though no one knows why some of the civilization's  have been perished and completely vanished . Item_Response: The lost city               The lost city claims to be a city where roman gods lived but when the water started rising the city was drowned underwater. Today we are still trying to find evidence of the lost city. Many people belive that the lost city was never there it was all just a myth. Some inca textiles and clothing have survived remarkably. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been presevrved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centries ago, but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often do not tell archaeologists very much. Other sites are reported to archaeologists who can dig them up carefully. They provide the best idea of all life in Peru before and during Inca rule.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the ancient Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are important because they offer history on how people lived back then. Without these discoveries we wouldnt know much of anything of the people and the way of life. The discovery of Pavlopetri may also be the city that inspired the mythical city of Atlantis. The cities show what kind of temples or churches they had and what the worshiped .       When the first Europeans discovered the Inca's, they were amazed at the Inca's ran the empire. The Incas had no form of alphabet so they had no archives, they put knots in string to count and keep track of things. The Peubloans were nomadic and masters as basket making and other woven things. They clustered in small villages and acquired the bow and arrow. The Pavlopetri is theoldest submerged town in the world. Potery and buildings were found aswell as manumental courtyards.

Item_Response: There have been many great discoveries in man-kind. Most of them on land, buried or destroyed. But some of them like the 'Titanic' and 'Alantis' have been sunken. Now since our technology has been vastly upgraded to new inventions like Submarines and Scuba diving, we can explore farther into our Ocean. Also we've created more tools for use on diging such as bulldozer and jackhammers so we can dig farther into Earth. The plantet has been here for over a million years now and there are many secerect inside of it.           So far we have discoverd ancient civilations and vast ruins. But our lastest discovery has been a sunken city near the city of Neapolis, Greece. It dates back to the time Plato was talking about the sunken city of Alantis. It has 9,000 square feet of land and bulidings surrounding it. This also has been the first time theres been a city that dates back to 1200 BC ' The Glory Days '. Acourse Alantis was a myth, but it keeps our minds going; What is truly down there? and is there really a under water city submerged named Alantis?       Next we come to the Ancient Inca. They had no alphabet or a system that followed writing. They only used strings to keep records of about everything. The first Europeans were very amazed to see that they could keep record of everything only using string. No ones knows what the knots mean today but trying to understand is like solving a huge mystery that took place over a 1,000 years ago. We only know about them because the clues they left behind and how our scientist study there way of life. Mostly what we know comes from stories that were passed on generation to generation. Others come just from oral historie and examination. Some of the Incas got frozen to death on the job and were peserved very good for scientist to examine.           Finally we are going to look at the last group of civilations. The Puebloans. They lived about 1,400 years ago before the Europeans came to America. They lived around the Mesa Verde National Park. They are usually know for there craftsman ship in basket weaving. They were also formely nomadic. They lived in pithouses and were clusterd into villages. They learned how to make pottery and craft bows n arrows. The more efficent weapon was a spear. In the 1,880s there have been sights of cliff dwellers. Item_Response: The ancient Inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to recored the calender to keep a count of livestock. The first europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archeologists have found many ancient quipus-but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.       Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archeologists and marine geologists and known as pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say.   The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around around 1000 BC. Although discovered by a british oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archealogist, aided by digital technology, were able to property survey the ruins.       So how do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years (1438-1532) ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome? Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details in Inca life.

Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the classic period, the population may have reached several thousand. It was mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the Kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in in the open. The stone walls of the larges pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde, with their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. Baskets shown evidence of declined in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery meant less attention to the craft. About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before.                                       We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in the letters and diaries.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made with these different civilizations are very important. They can help us learn about history through different time periods and different cultures.            Each of the articles talks about a different civilization with a different culture. The first talks about the Inca people of Peru. The second talks about the Pueblos of Mesa Verde, and the third about an unknown sunken city off southern Greece.            In every article, there are different Artifacts found at sites, and they can all tell us something about life at the peak of that civilization.            Archeologists have found a most interesting way of keeping records for a vast empire such as the Inca. It has been found that the Inca kept track of numbers by tying knots in brightly colored strings, called quipus.            Most of what we know of the Inca has been told orally, by stories and legends passed from generation to generation. Some of these stories have been written down by the Spaniards. These cannot be totally relied on though, because it is not known how well the Spaniards understood the Inca. Also, like a lot of other civilizations, the Inca have left behind Gold, pottery, silver, and some stone implements. Clothes and textiles have also been found that connect to the Inca.            Pueblo Pithouses and Kivas have been found In Mesa Verde National Park. The pithouses were where the Pueblo lived from 550 A.D. to 750 A.D. they were a few feet deep in the ground, and were covered by a roof with supporting timbers. Kivas were like churches to the Pueblos. They were gathering places, maybe used for healing, or to pray for rain, good hunting, or a plentiful harvest.            Not a lot is known about the history of he underwater city, except that it is called Pavlopetri, and that is the oldest sunken city in the world. the site covers 30,000 meters and is covered in pottery.            There are always things to be learned from the past, and maybe it makes it a little more fun to solve a mystery.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet of writing system. The Inca used colored strings and knots to count livestock and read a calender. The strings could have been used to keep track of other records also. Today no one knows what the knots mean. Trying to understand the knots is like solving a mystery.               The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. They lived in pit housed also believe used for defense. The pit house was under the ground about 2 feet deep. It was only one living room and the four corners supported the roof. Some pit houses were joined together and made 50 other rooms.

Item_Response: The reason the discoveries about the Inca , the Puebloans, And the Pavlopetrei are important is because finding out the ways they lived can be helpful to us today. The ancient civilizations that were discovered showed us many phases of how that particular culture evolved and prospered or dwindled. This part of history is an important piece in time.   The ways that the ancient peoples lived and learned is  very different than how we do today. The ancient Inca of Peru had absolutely no form of alphabet of system of writing. All of their history was passed down orally or by word of mouth. The only stories or legends that were written down were written down first by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The Europeans did not speak the Inca language well and may not have interpreted it correctly. They didn't even have calendars, they used quipus or large pieces of colorful strings with knots in them to keep a count of livestock.    Archeologists sometimes have trouble recovering artifacts from the Inca because they lived high up in the Andes Mountains and many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were even buried in caves in cliff faes or on mountain tops.

Item_Response: Three Lost Civilization Explanatory                                                                                              The three lost cities that disappeared for a long time, were found by some archeologists. These lost cities were named the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavelopetri. The 3 cities are very important because they have left some fascinating artifacts, that archeologists can study and learn how they lived.       The first civilization was the Inca. First of all the Incas had no alphabet or system of writing. Although they had made quips to record dates of the calendar. The Incas had amazing portraits of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture government, transportation, and the way they lived life. Some of the Inca's ancient artifacts might be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Which last a very long time, even if they have been buried for over hundreds of years. Some of these artifacts have been taken by some treasure hunters or looters, but some artifacts were taken centuries ago. The Incas lived in the Andes and they may have even worshiped mountain peaks. Some Inca bodies have been found in caves, mountain tops, or in the freezing Andes. Luckily archeologists could scan the bodies and tell us how they died and how they lived.       The second civilization is the Puebloans. To begin with, the Puebloans were very skilled at crafting, there also known as Basketmakers. Instead of hunting and gathering, they farmed. The Puebloans lived in small pit houses clustered as villages but they were built in mesa tops. they learned how to make pottery, bow and arrows, but a more useful tool for hunting was a spear thrower. Later in about A.D. 750 because of the multiplied population the Puebloans began to build houses above ground. After that the Puebloans changed their life style, the mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture.       The last civilization is the Pavlopetri in Greek Atlantis. This lost city was believed to be a myth, but it was found underwater south from Greece. The city was found to be underwater for as back as 5,000 years. The Pavlopetri is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor, it is believed that it was consumed by the sea. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-out tombs and religious structures. We're luck enough to find this underwater city, because most of these cities have dissolved into the sand.       The three lost cities were thought to be myths. But found by some archeologist they have proved the theory of 'just myths' wrong. They have found fascinating artifacts to explain each finding. Archeologists still have more things to explore in each city.

Item_Response: The Lost Civilizations           The discoveries of the Inca empire were important. The Inca time had a lot of ancient items. The archaeologists didn't find a lot of items though during that Inca empire. The archaeologists found colored ropes called quipus. The quipus was used to record the calender and to keep count of livestock. The archaeologists were amazed how the Inca could run a huge empire. The Incas left behind clues that form a amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and how they lived in the Inca empire. When the archaeologists found Inca textiles and clothing they survived remarkably well. The Incas clothing has not been destroyed but the Incas preserved it in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.      The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in A.D. 550. The Puebloans were also known as Basketmakers for their skill during crafting. They settled their way of life by building pithouses which were clustered into small villages but usually built on mesa tops on cliffs. The archaeologists found that the Puebloans knew how to make pottery with their crafting skill also they acquired the bow and arrow which were their efficient weapon for hunting than spear throwing. The Puebloans evolved their pithouses into kivas. The kivas were like churches. In the kivas there were be different ceremonies. In the kivas there were different chambers in different rooms to have the ceremonies and also have cooking during the summer so they can use the fire pits. In the last quarter during the A.D. 1200s the Puebloans has droughts and crop failures. When the cliff dwellers left they south into New Mexico and Arizona by settling among their kin who were already there. Whatever may have happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.      In Greece their are lost secrets in lost underwater cities. Archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri which was a sunken settlement that dates back 5,000 years of time of Homer's heroes. The site which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. Thanks to shifting sand and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock cut tombs, and religious structures also on the seabed there thousands of shards of pottery. The settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago and at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought. The investigation revealed over 9,000 square meters of buildings. The marine archaeologists discovered a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, which also suggests that the town had been used by an elite, and automatically raised the status of the settlement. Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca's of Peru had no system of alphabet or writing.   However, they had many ways to communicate without these things. They made knots in colored strings called quipus to keep count of livestock and to record the calendar. The Europeans were shocked and amazed when they first met the Inca because they could run a huge empire using just strings to keep records. Without anyone to read what these colorful strings mean, the Ancient Inca would be like solving a mystery.   We know about this civilization because of the clues left behind    from the Inca. These clues left behind form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their life-style. Archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life by studying these clues.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so importantant to the people that live in the present and did not get to see how their civilizations lived. These discoveries are important, because they help us interpret clues about a civlization that were alive hundred of years ago.             Archaeologists are people who are interested in knowing all kind of this stuff, and find artifacts inorder to figure out the stories behind these civilizations. Some of what we know about the Incas came fromartifacts, sites, clothing, and records that wre left behind. historians help us discover the past civilizations. These people have these jobs, beacause they are interested to know how prople's lifes have progressed and technology. The orgins of the Incas are the most difficult to trace; archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world to discover more about the Inca's predecessors.               Puebloans became knon from their building of homes. Puebloans is a Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers.' The structures are evidence of a society that, over centeries, advanced in skills and traditions and passed them from generation to generation. In 1100 A.D. to 1300 A.D. Ancestral Puebloans were heir of a vigorious civilization, whose accomplishmentsin community living and the arts ranked among the finest expressions of human culture in North America. Whatever may have happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of the Mesa Verde.                 The lost city is now known as Pavlopetri. What makes this city unique is the fact that it has been sunken under water and still is in tact. Archaeologists aided by digital technology and were able to properly survey the ruins. What they found surpassed all their expectations. The exploration revealed a world of bulding, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tobs and religious structures. Marine geologists have not yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include that it was the result of either an earthquake or a tsunami.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important discoveries because they divulge cultures from the past and show how the people in that time lived. The ancient Incas created a device that counted the days and kept track of the days. This device was called the quipus. The Puebloans are known for basketmaking and are called 'Basketmakers.' Farming replaced hunting and gathering was their main livelihood. The Pavlopetri and the Puebloans are know to be in the same group.                      All of these groups  lived in South America and were advanced in textiles, buildings/religious structures, and in item making. Puebloans built house structures called pithouses. These houses were very simple structures that were easy to make and to be in.  Incas built their some of their buildings on high mountain tops. Due to the building of these buildings on high and cold mountain peaks, these artifacts have been preserved very well and contribute to our knowledge of the ancient Incas, Puebloans, etc. Having their artifacts help us to know more about what they were doing in that time and what they were advanced most in during that time. Seeing these artifacts(mostly the high pyramid-like structures) amazes lots of people because the Incas were good at making high pyramids while England or the Colonies were making guns that were not as hard to make. Making pyramid structures take ALOT of time and energy to make because thet are so colossal and complex. These ancient people are important because they tell us before technology was first used or thought of, they had their own methods and cultures that they would indulge themselves in. They also show that their cloth making was very similar to our cloth or textile making.                   Knowing that these people could have done such things as building elaborate buildings, making beautiful pottery, and keep track of the days shows the modern day that there were other people living in the world during this time period and were very skilled in their cultures. Although looters have stolen precious artifacts, there are still many more that are to be found and many more that will someday reveal all of our questions about the ancient Incas.

Item_Response: Discoveries that were made about three ancient civilizations, the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very necessary for our world history.       Some discoveries that were made about the Inca were the many artifacts that archaeologists found.  They discovered objects made from stone, pottery, gold, and silver.  These artifacts have lasted an extensive amount of time, which shows that the Inca were pretty organized and thought ahead.  Their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, and transportation all show us how they lived and what it was like back then.       There were many other discoveries that were made about the Puebloans.  The smoke-blackened walls show that the Puebloans lived in very cold weather, and needed a fire to keep them warm.  The structures of the Puebloans shows that they gained skills and traditions.  They are known to have the finest expressions of human culture in the North American area.       The last discoveries were made of the Pavlopetri.  The lost city was the reason for the fable, Atlantis.  Archeologists found buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures.  They even found shards of pottery.  All of these discoveries were found underwater by archeologists.  Because they found this underwater city, it can tell us more about the Mycenaean society and how they worked.       All of these civilizations play a key role in the discoveries of our world.

Also it proves the ways of how each ancient civilization were different for one another.           The foundings of old artifacts from ancient cities allows us to see how we used to live. They show us the different beliefs that they worshiped. Also how they built houses, farmed, and even drew symbols. It could led to archaeologists using their techniques and showing them to the rest of the world. For example in countries in South America, some people still use the underground house and the Kivas, a ceremonial room. The artifacts that archaeologists have dug up have shown us today the techniques of the past.            The artifacts that have been found, also show our advancements from those time periods. They led us to how we have developed, changed, and invented bigger and better things. For example, the houses of the Puebloans were called pit house and were very clustered into small villages. The pit houses were underground or in cliff sides. Today they have advanced into roomy houses with big yards and bigger neighborhoods. So home structures have evolved. When archaeologists find ruins of ancient civilizations, it helps humans conclude how we have advanced and added on to their techniques.           Furthermore, the findings prove to archaeologists of how each city in the past were different. Such as, the Incas and the Puebloans. They're both different from each other, such as there houses and buildings. The way they all disapered is different also. The Incas were taken over by the Spaniards when they murdered the last Incan king in 1532. The Puebloans supposedly left Mesa Verde to travel south into New Mexico and Arizona. The do not know what for surely happened to their kin. Artifacts helps to show that each civilizations were not the same.          The founding of ancient artifacts have helped us today to discover a few things. They led to prove to us how our type used to live. Also how we have advanced and bettered their ways and teachings. Each civilization was different and the remains show us tremendously how.

Item_Response: The discoveries of ancient cultures helps teach us about the way of life in the past. Archeologist cam use artifacts found in the living areas of the Aztec, Peubloans, and Pavlopetri. They can study these objects to learn when they were made, how they were used, and what it's made of.   The Aztecs had some quiet interesting objects that archeologists have found throughout the Aztec ruins. They have found quipus which are knots in strings to keep track of livestock and the calender. This shows us that the Aztecs were quite developed and intelligent in order to have a system on how to control records. Many other tools and objects like gold and silver have been stolen by looters but some were left behind in tombs deep in pyramids and the ground.The objects found allow us to know about the things that were buried with the people and the uses of those objects for the 'afterlife' for those people. Some archeologist have found full bodies preserved in the cold of the mountains. They may be able top study these people and learn how they died and what caused their death. All of this is important because it tells us how we as humans use to live in the past. Puebloans, or so called by archeologists, Anasazi , meaning 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies', were known as basket-makers. The baskets they crafted would be extremely important to archeologist and would help them understand the use of the baskets and the material made to be used in these baskets.The pottery, bow and arrow, and spear would be great tools to learn about the daily life of these nomadic people from the ancient times. Their homes, the pit-houses, were very well constructed with living rooms and fireplaces. They were very intelligent to be able to create homes almost like modern ones.   Last but not least the Pavlopetri. There was a lost city found in the in the ocean near the city of Greece. There were remains of an actual planned out community. The city dated back at least 2800 to 1200 BC and it had main streets, courtyards, churches, and homes. There were broken and fixed pieces of pottery in the homes that could be used for further study by scientist. It would let us know about how people long ago have lived. There are many discoveries around the world that provide information of the past lives. It is rather interesting on the types of objects you find in the different regions of the world. All of these objects allow us to learn and study more about our pasts as mankind.

Item_Response: Archaeological Find. Why so important?       Archaeologists have been searching for ancient civilizations for hundreds of years. Why are they so interested? Why are they so important? Many archaeologists are spending all their waking hours trying to find the lost city of Atlantis. Only one find has come close to being that city. The Pavlopetri found what looks like the remains of an underwater city off the coast of Greece.       Many are thinking it is the lost city of Atlantis. The civilians are ecstatic because their ancestors told them about an ancient civilization that lived underwater. The civilians didn't believe them at first, but after this find, they believe their ancestors at last. They take pride in this find because it was one of the biggest archaeological finds ever, and it was near their territory.       The find of the Incas was another big find in archaeological discoveries. We all knew their were people who lived in America before us. But after this find, we knew how they lived, what they did with farming, and what kind of religious beliefs they lived on. Everyone in America was awed by the find of this tribe. They lived for hundreds of years, but then the Spanish rule came and took over their land, spreading diseases, and killing innocent people.       Everyone want to find traces of ancient civilization. It is important to find out too, because it helps us learn from mistakes, and helps us shape our future.

Item_Response: Many discoveries have been made in different places which allow archaeologists to discover more about how these people lived during that time period. These discoveries are very inportant in the discovery world.           The Inca made knots in differnt colored strings to keep track of livestock or their other needs. This showed archaeologists how smart they were during that time period in Peru.           The ancient Puebloans advanced to double-coursed stone to make houses. This new advancement would have never been discovered if it weren't for the ruins and remains of houses or buildings. From what archaeologists discovered of the buildings, they can determine how they lived.            Archaeologists discovered that the Pavlopetri lived five thousand years ago from ceramics dating back to the stone age. From this discovery, archaeologists can see if their calculations were right or wrong about what time period the Pavlopetri lived in.            Discoveries from the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important beacuse they show archaeologists where they lived, how they lived, and during what time period.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations         You may think you know about the civilizations of the past, but there is much more to learn. Recently a group of scientists has found an under water Greek city, have studied the Inca and Puebloan people.     The  under water city was found off of the southern waters of Greece.This city may have been what inspired the myth of Atlantis. The diving team of archaeologists has to be extra careful though when trying to get better examples of what the under water city had within itself, because they could drown. The archaeologists still don't know what have caused this city to sink but believe that it was the combination of rising sea levels and an earthquake. This belief and myth will only lead to more intense exploration of this submerged city.      The ancient Inca had ruled a South American empire for almost a hundred years. The scientists that studied the Inca had a rough time because the Inca didn't live just on the normal flat elevations. They lived upon the Andes mountains, making it harder for the scientists to study artifacts and other clues left behind by them. The Inca  also were very strange and hard to study because of the fact that they didn't leave any written records. They only recorded stuff with pieces of string called quipus, that were very hard to understand.As you can see, these people had a large and intricate culture and civilization that is hard for people to understand today.      The puebloan people are a very interesting people for three reasons. One they were first known as basket makers. Two they figured out how to improve their houses into a more efficient housing style. Three they just vanished randomly. These people were called the basket makers because that's what they were very skilled at. These people first lived pit houses clustered into small communities, then eventually thought of a kiva(mainly used religiously), and then evolved in to making 'apartments' out of stone.Scientists believe that these people just left their houses and land because of  drought and crop failures. All in all, the Puebloan people are very interesting for the reasons stated.     In conclusion, these three ancient civilizations still have a lot of studying to do but have been explored enough to bring some truth to any myths or misbeliefs about them.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca is a very intersting group to learn about. It was a very smart and organized society. They were alot like solving a mystery. Item_Response: Inca: How do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome. Clues thet where left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of thier religion, art and architecture, agriculture, goverment, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together deatails of Inca life. We know some old stories of Inca life becouse of the old stories they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were spanish soldiers and priests. They describe the Inca in letters and diaries. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts ot ge cold mountins of the Andes.   Puebloans: About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for thier home. Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Archeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies.' We now call them Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern descendents.

Item_Response: I think that the discoveries of the Inca, tyhe Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because we learn really cool things about them all that we've never known before.                            Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus- but still to this day, no one knows what the knots mean. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quuipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. As soon as we find someone who can figure it out, then we'll finally know what the mean. The Inca have some really great stories they used to tell. the reason we know this is because some of the old stories were written down by the Europeans. Inca made most of their stuff out of stone, pottery, gold, or sliver. we have found many artifacts that were left behind from the Inca.                  Puebloans are know as 'Basketmakers', for their skill and craft. Eventually they started to build houses. They built houses one against another in long, curving rows. Puebloans are also known as, a spanish word meaning, 'village dwellers'. The marterials they used was some sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread. The mortar between the bloacks was a mixture of water and mud. The rooms were big enough for two or three persons.                     I think these discoveries really help us to find out and learn about how our ansecors lived and how they survived without the tools we have today. I hope we can discover some more interesting things about them later on in life.

Item_Response: The dicoveries that have been made about the Inca , the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because it teaches us about history and the way they used to live before house and everything else was invented. Fires were built in summer mostly for cooking and during winter they were built when the alcove rooms were damp and uncofortable. Fires probably burned throughtout the village. Using nature advantages, Ancestral Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. In about A.D. 750 Basketmakers began building houses above gound. they used poles and mud to make upright walls. They built the houses one against another in long, curving rows. They often built with a pithouse or two in the front. It is very important to learn about the Inca , the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.

Item_Response: The ancient civilizations of Inca, Mesa Verde, and the sunken city that has inspired the famous city of Atlantis are all some of the most important finds in all of history.  they are three civilizations that are spanned out all over the world.  They all also had some sort of downfall as well, whether it was a physical downfall or just being conquered by another nation.  all of these cities have also prospered at one time.   For example, ancient Inca was conquered by Spanish explorers, while the underwater city was sunken and preserved in a bay near Greece.  Other civilizations, such as the Peubloans of Mesa Verde were simply abandoned and moved elsewhere.  These three finds, however, are special in particular because of their locations.  The Inca civilization is in south America, while the underwater city is in Greece.  They are on two separate sides of the world, which means that researchers get a view of two different country's pasts.   Another importance is that they can see the different cultures and skills of the civilizations, such as the peubloans, who are known as the basket-makers due to their incredible basket-weaving skills.  The Inca were known for making pots and jewelery out of clay, gold, silver, and other precious metals.  The Pavlopetri of the underwater city, however, are known for their planned cities, road systems, and Greek style architecture.   Also, some of the cities, due to their climates, even have preserved their dead so well that scientists are able to study their cause of death and even how they lived.   Although all of these cities are differentin their own ways, they all are very important to the study of ancient history due to their living habits and rich culture.

Item_Response: Article of Ancient Inca       Explorers worldwide found ancient treasures of ancient inca and greece and look for evedence of the exact location of where the events took place.       In ancient Inca, there were lots of interisting buildings called kivas and pithouses and had spear throwers for defence systems. Pithouses featured a one living room and the fire pit had an air deflector,storage bins,and pits. A kiva is a hopi word for cerimonial room where cerimonies were held for healing rites or to pray for rain,luck in hunting,or a good crop.Also for gathering places and  sometimes to weave.To enter,go down the ladder through a hole in the roof called a sipapu-a symbolic entrance to the underworld.           The Puebloans built homes underneath cliffs and lived there for less than a hundred years and by AD 1300,the place was deserted for immigration.Their fires in the summer were used for cooking   and in winter,the fires burned down the villages.           Last but never least,artifact of Atlantis were found under the ocean because legend has it that it was sunken and isolated from the world like the Titanic. Recently,undersea explorers found things of Atlantis at the bottom of the sea and the site was 30,000 square meters of sea bottom so, scientists   searched hardly even 1% of the place.           And these are the paragraphs of Ancient Inca,Puebloans and Atlantis.   By Jayden Fox.

Item_Response: The discoveries of many lost civilizations fascinate and inspire us all to think about what else there could be but some may ask what's so important about finding lost civilizations? It is a good question but there are reasons why there are important. The ancient civilizations may help us understand more of the past and our ancestors.   In Peru, the ancient Inca lived. They used knots to record and stories to explain their history. The clues they left behind of their great culture help us piece together their lives. The Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde were skilled basket makers. These people evolved from a nomadic life to a settled life with farming. In A.D. 1200 their population shifted into cliff alcoves. They were adept builders, artisans and crafters from the evidence they left behind in their cliff dwellings. Off the coast of Southern Greece a lost submerged civilization was uncovered. It known as the City of Pavlopetri. In the Article from The Guardian, it is said it is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predated the time Plato wrote the tale of Atlantis. It is filled with insights of works from the Mycenaen culture. This ancient city is oldest subemerged city found in the world. It may give us insights on its old culture and far older cultures.   These discoveries can help us better understand our ancient worlds and the lost people of the past.   These disoveries of ancient civilizations may also help improve todays world. The knowledge of ancient civilizations can help us even if they are older than what we know. How they developed and expanded their technology and ways can help us do the same. Also how we disover their civilizations could help us explore more of our world. The oceans we could disover more about, the jungles, the cliffs, mountains and other unexplored regions. The disoveries also help us know what our people were like, our past was like. The ancient civilizations can help us.   The ancient civilizations tell us, help us understand more of the past they we ever realized. The Incas on how they ran their empire and influenced others, the Ancestral Puebloans on how they devloped and changed and the lost of Pavlopetri on how much we still have to discover. The ancient civilizations, the past, may help be prepared for future and more.

Item_Response: The research that archeaologist found on the Incans, Puebloans, and also the Pavlopetri are much needed in modern life.       For example the ancient Inca of Peru kept records of things using quipus due to not having formal alphabet or a system of writing. If we wanted to send something to another person without anybody else figuring it out we could take the Incans idea by using the quipus.   The Peubloans were known as basket makers due to their skill at the craft. The Peubloans showed us a more civilized way of living. For example, replacing hunting and gathering with farming, making pottery both for art and for daily use, developing the bow and arrow for hunting, and also living in small civilizations known as villages in pithouses.   Lastly the Pavlopetri showed a very modern way of architecture. By develping buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and also religious structures such as temples and churches. Also archeaologists discovered that the seabed was lined with thousands of shards of pottery from this ancient civilization.       As you can see these three civilizations add to our many wonders in the world. We have the Incas who gave us the idea of the postal system due to there idea of relaying quipus around there vast civilization. The Peubloans who brought us the idea of basket weaving, farming, the bow and arrow, building houses above the ground, stone masonry and much-much more. If it wasn't for these three civilizations, the world wouldn't have known about how the Incans did not have an official writing system and that they they used quipus (knots in colored strings) to communicate. Or about the Peubloans being known as basket-makers, and that these artistic people designed houses that were above ground instead of just a one floored house and they also developed multiple rooms, they also developed a ceremonial room that could also be used as a gathering place for people to weave. The ceremonial room was actually under the Peubloans houses. Lastly the Pavlopetri who are probably one of the oldest civilizations found underwater to remain as a whole. This civilization remained as a whole due to the shifting sands that protected the Peloponnesian peninsula. The Pavlopetri were advanced with there architecture. Archeaologists discovered courtyards,bulidings, stone masonry, and even worship centers in this modern civilization under the sea. These three civilizations are wonders.

Just like The Mesa Verde because about 1,400 years ago a group of four region of people chose The Mesa Verde as their home. Then in the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two the four region people who lived ther had moved away. Now years later Mesa Verde was publised as a national park which preserves a spectacular reminder of the ancient culture. For Archaeologists they call The Mesa verde the Anasazi which means ' The Ancient Ones' or ' Anicent Enemy's'. But now we call them Ancestral Puebloans.                        Everybody knows about Lost Greek CIty that has been undersea since 5,000 (2800 to 1200 BC) years ago! experts say it is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor of the southern peloponnese, it is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. A British oceanographer 40 years ago discovered The Lost Greek City, it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to proplerly survey the ruins.                      The location of The Lost Greek City is near Neapolis in Greece. their investigtion also revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. they were surprised when they revealed a discovery of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangle hall. some people find it most amazing about the Lost Greek City that has sumberged for so many years.
