Item_Response: Why Are The Discoveries Of The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri So Important?                    The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because it is important to have knowledge of the past. We also need to know were things originated from. For some people it is important to know about these heritages because some people want to know were there colonies or heritages originated from. Without knowledge of these people we wouldn't know where many of these ancient artifacts came from. For example, how would we know what civilization was like back then, like how they would hunt for food, or how they would make their clothes. We need to know how civilization was back then so we can look over how much things have changed now that we are in the 21st century. The Inca's, the Puebloans, are the Pavlopetri are so important because they made a huge impact on the lives of the people that lived back when. They were considered their own pack, or colonies and that is how people lived back then. They started their own colonies to get by just we do in the   America. Nowadays, people ask how they could survive back then without tv or internet, but back then they didnt even have eletricity so it is important to know how thay lived because people nowadays have their lives made easy when, back 5,000 years ago people barely had enough to get by. So, it is important to know about the discoveries of these people because they made are important to modern society.

Item_Response: Archaeologists know, and are still learning, about ancient Indians that lived many years ago. They learned about Ancient Inca, and how they tied knots. They learned about Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and how they lived. They even learned/ discovered that many civilizations sank under water!            Ararchaeologists have learned tons about the Inca. They know that the Inca lived in Peru. They also know that the Inca's have no alphabet because they tied knots to tell stories and even keep track of crops. These were called quipus. Quipus have many colorful strings tied into knots. But nobody know what the different knots mean. Many people know about the Inca if they relatives from Inca cultures because many stories were passed down from generation to generation. They believed it was important to preserve a community's history. The Inca even left behind many clues when they all left. They left back art, architecture, portrait, agriculture, government, transportation. These can all be pieced together to see how there way of life is. When the Europeans came in 1532, they wrote down the stories they were told by the Inca. No one knows if the stories are right because they couldn't always understand what the Inca were saying. They described tons about the Inca in letters and diaries.  The rest that people know about the Inca is just found artifacts. Some of which were buried with the dead for their afterlife. This is how people pieced together much about the Inca. Some of the Incas clothing and textiles were left behind. Usually, the material would of fallen apart or been destroyed if it got wet. But these were preserved in the dry desserts in Peru. Some were even found on the Andes Mountains. The archaeologists keep very careful records of what they find. They also take many pictures, and they even write down the exact position that the artifact was found.  The origins of the Inca are very hard to trace. But it is very easy to tell when the fall of the Inca was. Its easy to date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532. The Spaniards also took over their empire. The Inca lived high in the Andes Mountains. Many were buried in caves or on mountain tops. This is good because it helps keep looters (people looking for artifacts that shouldn't be) out, but makes it harder for the archaeologists.            The Mesa Verde National Park preserves and ancient culture.  Aarcheologists refer to the people that lived in the placed being preserved as Anasazi. Anasazi is a Navajo word that is translated as ' the ancient ones'. The Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde  lived in houses called pithouses. Pithouses were usually built on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and were the first to acquire a bow and arrow.  They even made a special tool for hunting called the atlatl.This is basically just a spear thrower. By A.D 1000 the people  started to make better houses. Above ground and two or three stories high. these were joined together with 50 rooms or more. They built fires in summer, but the fires were just for cooking. In the winter, the fire's smoke blackened the village and the blackened walls were/ are reminders of the bitter cold that the Inca's lived through.  Ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde for only 100 years, then Mesa Verde was deserted.             A diver discovered a sunken settlement in Southeren Greece. The sunken settlement dates back about 5,000 years. This was the time of Homer's Heros. Dr. Jon Henderson says, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.' The site takes up about 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. What they have found suprised them. Thy found the settlements enclosure, buildings, structure, and rock-cut tombs. They eventually revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings.Archaeologists discovered that Atlantis is just a myth, but it keeps under water searching going.           So as you can see archaeologists are still learning about ancient Indians.

Item_Response: As our world has gone through many years of survival, we have survived against all odds. Earthquakes, volcanoes, tsunamis have destroyed many civilizations, many people, but still we persevere. And as we progress, we look into the past, to see what we looked like, and how we did things; this sis essential to life. Where is one without the history of how they got to be in this world, how they lived, and how they evolved. The discoveries that scientists make about Inca, Puebloans, and the Palvopetri are essential to us because they represent our previous ways of life, culture, and structure of humanity.       The Puebloans were powerful and resourceful people. basket-makers, they had many things. They way they they lived was evident in what was left behind by them, scientists find many things that show how they lived. Houses, made of sticks and mud, show us how they made shelter for themselves using only rudimentary tools. Tools, showing us how they progressed humans, from leaving a more elementary stage to becoming developed, more complex creatures. And they found evidence that shows that they were farmers, instead of the hunters and gathers that came before them. Finding out how they lived is essential to us; it shows us how they progressed out way of life.       The Inca, a powerful civilization with the power to meet the likes of even Rome, ruled for almost 100 years. Located in the Andes Mountains, these people lived and worshiped here. However, they had no alphabet, just colored strings with knots. They ruled, for almost a hundred years, with out any form of proper records. The Spanish themselves were shocked, how could someone so great, so powerful, live without records? Scientists, however, found different things to help them. They found artifacts to help them see how the people lived, and how they survived. This is a great advancement  in out history.       Finally, the people of Atlantis. Great and powerful also, as science examines them, we see how their culture affects us. It shows us how they too, had large buildings to represent power, and that that they too could lead. All of these accounts help us, and progress us, in our knowledge of the world before us. Things like this are essential.

Item_Response: Have you ever gotten a question wrong on a homework assignment and then see it again on a test?  You surely wouldn't get that question wrong twice, right?  This is the exact same situation with historical findings.  As we excavate and find lost civilizations such as the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri, we learn how they lived and how they were destroyed.  It is from this factual evidence that we learn what to do and what not to do.  Archaeology and excavations are important because they teach us about the past and the mistakes that we should avoid from the past.        The Incas are a good example of knowledge from the past.  There is much to learn about the Incas as they were 'a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome' (Gruber).  This is a huge feat, as the Incas were able to match the Roman civilization at a fraction of their time.  The Incas also lived as a civilization filled with art, architecture, religion, agriculture, government, and transportation.  This advanced and rich way of life has taught us about technology, as they were able to accomplish greatness with such primitive knowledge.        Another civilization of greatness would be the Puebloans, as they have advanced greatly through their years.  They evolved from nomadic hunters to settled farmers, from adobe structures to stone buildings, and from pithouses to kivas.  Their progressions were immense, and they have taught us the art of change.        The Pavlopetri civilization has also taught us some things.  It was a grave mistake for them to build their city so close to the coast.  This mistake cause their city to sink underwater, inspiring myths of the mythical city 'Atlantis'.  Overall, these civilizations have taught us about life.

Item_Response: The Inca's had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave the archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Bodies foung in the icy Andes are in such good shape that the experts can use the modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived. The Puebloans were known as the 'basketmakers' for their skill at the craft. Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livehood. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths, the fable of Atlantis have been brought to light from beneath the waters of southern Greece.

Item_Response: Archaeology Digs       Have you ever been on a archaeology dig in a different country? Incas are a well known name when it comes to old civilizations but, did you know that they bury people in the Andes mountains. With the hidden city of Atlantis most people think it is just a myth but they did find it. Mesa Verde National Park they found these huts that the Anasazi people made called pit houses. Archaeology digs can be a great resource to finding new information about old civilizations.       How you ever seen the commercials about the theme park called Atlantis? Well that park is based off of the Greek myth about, how there was this lavish city called Atlantis and all of a sudden it  vanished and no one can locate it. On the contrary, an archaeologist did some investigating off the waters of southern Greece and there might actually be a city underneath the water that fits the description of Atlantis. This site spans 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor of the Southerner Peloponnese. It was to be consumed around 1000 B.C.  less than 1% of the ocean floor has been examined so this was a great find.       Have you ever heard of the ancient civilization of the Incas? They were located in the Southerner part of Peru. They had an interesting way of keeping track of the livestock. They would make a string calender. This calender help keep track of the livestock by toeing colorful  strings together. No one know what the mean but we are amazed by them. They also made objects from pottery, stone, gold, and silver these lasted a very long time. Some were found in buildings others were buried with its master. Remarkable textiles and clothing were found usually they would have been destroyed by the dampness but, the were persevered by the hot desert.       Mesa Verde  National Park is a national re-severe were the Ancestral Pueblo-ans used to live for 700 years. One of there skills is basket making. After that farming replaced hunting and gathering. They live in pit houses which were usually is in clustered in small villages. Pit house are houses that are square and the the living room floor is sunk in a few feet. Moving fro m Meas Verde they moved to New Mexico And Arizona.       Experiencing the trill if finding a unknown land mark or civilization it indescribable. Swimming to the depths of the biggest ocean looking for the most well known Greek myth in the world. Looking in caves for the remains of a ancient house from a Ancestral Pueblo-ans. Also just maybe wanting to learn more about the civilization we learn about in the fifth grade. Every expedition count because it cost money to go on an expedition. So, if it was not important why would they do it?

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca were important for many reasons. Clues left behind can reveal information such as their religion, art, agriculture, government and way of life. Some of what we know comes from stories passed down. Passing on these stories was important to the history of the Inca. We know some old stories from the Europeans who arrived at the Inca empire. They told about the Inca in letters and personal journals. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca come from atifacts that they left behind. Some artifacts turned up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried with the dead for the afterlife. Some Inca fabrics and clothing have survived as well. The fabrics were preserved because of the dry desrets or the cold mountains. Some Inca places have been robbed by hunters or looters. The high, cold mountains preserve bodies of the dead Inca people. The archaeologists can run these bodies through a machine, and learn about how the person lived and why they died.         About 1,400 years ago a group of people cose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years they lied here. In the late A.D. 1200s they left their homes and moved.  Archeologists have named these people Anasazi sometimes translated as 'ancient enemies' We now call them Puebloans. Farming was their main livelihood. They learned to make pottery and made the bow and arrow. About A.D. 750 they began building houses made of poles and mud. These discoveries were important because we would not have discovered their amazing inventions and discoveries.

Item_Response: The discoveries from the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopertri have been an important discoveries, so we can learn about there past and dont make the same mistakes they did way back then. They learned and adjusted to the way they lived and made mistakes while they were doing it. They made didffrent tools and gadgets to live in there enviroment. They learned to what to eat, kill to eat, and most importanlly they learned how to Live. That is why it is importat to know the Incans, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti.           The Incans were were very smart people that lived in the 1400's and 1500's. They had certain ways of during there writtin, Alphapet, and there Calender. For there calenders they made knots in colored strings called quipus. They used these to keep trck of farming and livestock.Many Forienors were very sueprised to see the Incans run a whole empire off of stings.Still to theis day Archaeologist can not figure out what the diffrent knotes mean.            The Puebloans were very smart in archetecture by building there houses and empire.The Puebloans designed a house called the Pithouse which is a rectangler bottom and slims as it gets to the top and then flqattens out.The Pithouse has a small living room that it lowered a couple feet in the ground and four large lems supported the roof of the house.It also had a fire pit with a smoke reflecter so the house would not fill up with smoke.Even though this house was invented by the Puebloans it still inspired others many years later.              Pavloperti is a Greek dive team of archaeologistthat have discovered one of the oldest submerged towns ever to be found.This town dates way back to Homers heros which is about 5,000 years ago.This submerged city seems to be about 3,000 square meters of the ocean floor.This city was also discovered 40 years ago by British Oceanography which has been left alone until the Anglo-Greek team found this year and can go more into detail about the city. While they have found many inportant artifacts of hostory there is still more to be found.               Although the Incas and Puebloana exsited many years ago they still have inspired many others some years later. Also the Pavlopertri is great diving team and they have discover many artifacts about these people ans im sure they will find many more.

Item_Response: Isn't history fascinating ! Look at all the things that have been uncovered today to learn about our past. This is why all the ancient people are so important.              The Incans were a very advanced and important society. They had no alphabet for records, only knots on a string. Archeaologist have found many of these cords, but none have discovered there true meaning. Maybe the Incans did this so no one could ever figure out the records, maybe they wanted to keep their society a secret. The Incans went through a great deal of trouble to deliver these cords; because they lived on the top of the Andes mountains they had to climb treacherous cliffs to deliver messages. The Incans have helped give us the language we have today.              Unlike the Incans the Puebloans have living descendants to help discover their ancient past. They are known for their basketweaving. The Puebloans had a more settled way of life. They replaced their life of hunting and gathering for farming in cliff recesses.They were a very crafty folk. They made more efficent weapons and pottery. The Puebloans have given us a very crafty nature.                As great as the Puebloans are the Pavlopetri are even better. They are curious and adventurous people. They have changed history as we know it, by discovering lost cities of ancient Greece.These people work long hours to discover these ancient things.                  In conclusin the Puebloans, Palverti, and Incans have helped us all in so many ways. They have made our society today very advance and who knows maybe one day we'll discover and uncover even more.

Item_Response: THE DISCOVERIES                   The discoveries that have been made about the Incas, the Puebloans were amazing. There are archaeologist all over the world that are digging up facts about them. There are very interesting discoveries about all of them.              Archaeologists have discovered that the Incas had no formal alphabet or system of writing and live in the Andes. They left nothing for scientist to look at. There was no formal papers or anything like that. Archaeologists have found many quipus, but today nobody knows what they stand for or mean. There has been a lot of art stuff that they have left behind and archaeologists have found.Most people wounder how archaeologist know nearly more than a hundred of years about them. They know this stuff because the Inca tribe left behind things that can relate to religion, government, and their ways of life. They have pieced all these puzzle pieces to make a puzzle. There have been stories passed down from generation to generation about them. Historians have to be very careful when they interpret those things. They also know that the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language very well like they do their own. Some of them may not have understood correctly what the Incas have told them so they wrote what they thought they heard. So because of that, their stories may not be exactly true. The rest of their knowledge came from the articrafts that were left behind when they passed. There objects such as stones, pottery, gold, or silver. Materials such as those things can last a very long time. Most of them have been buried for a very long time and archaeologist can still get information from them. Some of the clothing that the Incas had have survived that long period of time looking very well.Once the archaeologist have all the information from the Incas history, they then compare it with the Spaniards. There have been very different versions of it from both of them. The fall of the Inca was because of the Spaniards murdering the Inca king in 1532 and taking over everybody else.               The Puebloans are so important because of the discovery that historians have made. they explored North America 1400 years before the Europeans explored North America. The first ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. they are most known as basket-makers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main source of survival. People lives in pithouses which featured a living room, 4 corner timbers supported the roof, and that is what keep them mostly dry. They are very important people in history.              Most people don't realize that they are important to history. They are because that helps historians understand the past to make sense of the future. Without them we might not have know some things that we do now. They are very important.

Item_Response: CULTURE ESSAY                 In my essay i am going to start  with the is the Inca group-.This group has a lot of background for all the good will they have done for this world.These people had no formal alphabet or any writing skills what so ever.and they did not leave very many artifacts that we know of behind for people to see or find. but they did have a way for there calender they made knots with colorful string so that they could keep livestock.A lot of people are amazed on how well they ran there huge empire by using string to keep their records.Still to this day no one knows what these stings meant.we no about this civilization even existing is the expansion of Rome with out that they would have never known about this civilization.We found clues about that civilization and that is how we even no about the Incas and magnificent empire.We found so of there art and we found things about there religion we also found out about how they acted and what there lives were like and so much more we also no how they agriculture was like and how it affected us today.Europeans like to tell stories about the Inca civilization.They also like how so much of the things that we see today are part of what we paint and are abilities that we got from these ancient people.This was one of thr greatest civilizations that has shown alot of new things to us and so much more from all the art to the way they kept there records this was a hard working group of people to have a great society and a great empire.                 THE PUEBLOANS  -lived about 1,400 years ago long before Europeans explored the north America.The puebloans  had flourished at building stone buildings,house,and  whatever else they wanted in there  community they lived in a home town called Mesa Verde.This is now a national park that has all the puebloans artifacts.for more than seven hundred years there descendents lived here.Mesa verde national park preserves the spectacular events in the civilization history there nicknames were called Anasazi this is the Navajo word for ancient ones.The first puebloans that settled in Mesa verde were in 550A.D. They were .known as basket makers for there very skill and crafted basket weaving. these people lived in houses called pit houses clusters into small villages these were mostly built at  messa tops.this was there way of life.They replaced farming with hunting. they learned to make pottery and acuried the bow and arrow.This was a more efficient weapon for hunting then the atlati a spear thrower.this was very prosperous times for these people.The population also started to double about 750A.D.So they had to begin making more houses and that means that they needed more land for all of the population.Walls in these houses were made into fifty rooms or more that they also started to do  paintings on the dull background to make it look more efficient looking.between A.D1100 and A.D. 1300 during the classic age they reached to several thousand it was mostly concentrated and compact villages with many rooms.because if the wide spread of pottery there work was not admired as much.about A.D. 1200 a population shift and people started to move back to the cliff alcoves                    The population shift was caused by weather and they thought the alcoves would be better shelter.What ever the reason they now no that it gave people a reason to become cliff dwellers.When the cowboys found out about cliff dwellers in the 1880's archeologist have sought to understand these peoples lives.From whatever they no scientist still don't no much about this civilization.  but they are trying hard to figure out more this great civilization and all the in habitence to us through all there works of artifacts have taught us i think this is one of the most interesting groups that we can wonder about with all of there artifacts to teach us about there great and wonderful society. Item_Response: Archaeologists looked for things that happened a long time ago.  Archaeologists tried to figure out the important things about history.  I have to figure out what made the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri so important in history.     Inca made an alphabet with rope.  They knotted the rope and used different colors to make their alphabet.  The archaeologists also found gold buried in the ground. The last Inca king was murdered in 1532 and the Spaniards took over.     Next is the Puebloans, they lived 1,400 years ago before Europeans explored North America. They left their homes in the late A.D. 1200s. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde, Spanish for 'green table', about A.D. 550. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.     Lastly, we have the Pavlopetri.  At first, the archaeologists thought it was Atlantis; but it was just the sunken settlement that was part of Greece a long time ago. 'It was occupied  land 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought' says Henderson, who co-directed the underwater survey.  They are still trying to figure out how it got underwater and if anyone died.     In conclusion, I found the important things about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri and we learned more about these places.

Item_Response: For as long as humans have been alive, and since before even this, history has been in the making. The ancient ancestors of our own kind have sat and thought about everything, including the past, the future, survival, and life itself. Artifacts from the ways these people lived are preserved and kept waiting for the chance to be discovered and have their stories told.        One instance could be the Incas. They couldnt write. They were'nt legitimate and were unable to read. So how do we read into their lives? It is truly difficult, but it is also possible. There are oral traditions passed down that their neighboring tribes, the Spaniards, wrote down. These are not totally reliable, for in every truth there are lies or fables, but it is partially the best we have to go on. Otherwise, artifacts such as clothing, pottery, and objects made of different metals can be found. Clothes often are destroyed by the natural process of decay, but they do survive in the case they were buried in the desert or freezing mountain tops. The discovery of many of these objects, along with historical records kept by the European Spaniards, give us so much information. Without this, we would not have a single clue of the time around which the Inca empire fell. We wouldnt know of the religious, agricultural, or eeconomical practices of any of these tribes. They are very important to the discovery of historical facts and legend.         The ocean around southern Greece holds another ancient story with legends untold. The lost city of 'Atlantis' has been discovered, and divers have been exploring it for any new information they could use. The imagery of white pillars, cracked and slowly disappearing, is only the beginning of how right Plato was in his description of the lost city. An elite used this settlement, now his/her remains could be figuratively described as a 'Triton', ruler of the seas. We remain in the dark about much, but the discovery of this sunken city has shed a little more light on the historical subject of Greece. The shards of pottery scattered around the ocean floor tell us much about the lives of the people who used to live in this old undersea city, but much is yet to be found.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations            Lost Civilizations are always helping us to learn about the way that things were a long time ago. Also, they help scientist to better understand how the civilizations lived. Within the discovery of ancient civilizations, there are complications and there are things that help us to better understand the past and different ways of life.              At times understanding a lost civilization is hard when you cannot understand how the lived. An great example of this comes from the Inca. 'The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock.[...] Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus-but today no one knows what the knots mean.' (Source #1) Trying to understand that system that the Inca used, as  one can imagine, could be and most likely is very hard. Almost like a mystery.            Like a mystery, maybe sometimes, but other times are very clear as to how a civilization thrived and carried on. Even what they lived in can help archaeologist learn the civilizations beliefs, not just an entire civilization. Sometimes homes where a link to a civilizations religion and what they believed in. In Source #2, one can infer that even archaeologist sometimes can't understand why a house was built like it was built. 'PErhaps it was for defense: perhaps it was for religios or psychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offerend better protectionfrom the elements.' And other times you might not even know.            In conclusion, Lost civilizations are helpful and they help us learn a lot when we as humans sometimes need to learn a lot about the past to help us in the future.

Item_Response: The Incas did not have an alphabet they used beads and and knots for there math and writing. They used the knots and beads for there calenders also. They also used there writing system to keep track of there live stock. There system is called quipus.       What we know about the Incas mostly came from stories past down from generation to generation. Some stories were written down by Europeans that arrived. The people that came to the empire were Spanish soldiers and priests. They wrote down the Inca's description in a diary or letters.       Some information came from ancient artifacts, or some objects that they left behind. The artifacts were made of stone, gold and silver, or pottery. So most of there stuff was very important to the Inca's seeing as it was made out of gold and silver. One thing that was very important to them was there clothing. The archeoligists tried to preserver most of there stuff, but because of the dampness they were all mostly ruined.       The Inca lived up in the Andes Mountains. A lot of there sites they lived in high points in the mountains. Being way up in the mountains help preserve the sites the archeoligists could bring back artifacts in one piece. Everything they found they took back to study. The dead bodys also helped the archeoligists see how the Inca's lived. Thats how the Incas lived.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca, the Ancestral Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important to us, because of many reasons. All the discoveries, and work that we have done to reveal the history of them isn't quite complete but has mostly payed off.             The Inca are important to the history of today because the more we learn about all the tasks and things that they did are different and unique then what we do today. People say that they are just myths and legends but they really aren't, they are fact. The Inca had a unique and different way of keeping track of their food supply, cattle, and many other things. The Inca used colorful strings to do so, but we don't know how to translate it or know what they mean. Some of what we know about the Inca today was passed on through stories that the Europeans who arrived there in 1532. The only bad part was that the Spanish soldiers and priests didn't know a lot of the Inca's language. Few of the Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters/looters, who took anything that may be valuable. Inca's also lived in the Andes mountains where they may have worshiped the mountain peeks. The mountains are like giant freezers and have kept some bodies in good condition. Experts are still studying the Inca bodies and they have revealed a lot of information about them.             The Puebloans are important to the history of today because they were the first Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde. They were also known as Basketmakers for their skill in basket making. They were formally nomadic, but became more settled in their way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their way of getting food.They lived in small villages, in pithouses to be more exact. Usually built on mesa tops but sometimes on or in cliffs. The Puebloans learned how to make pottery and the bow and arrow which is more efficient way to hunt. Eventually they began to make houses above ground using poles and mud. They used fires to cook and left Mesa Verde and traveled south to New Mexico and Arizona.             The Pavlopetri are important to the history of today because many people think that the city of Atlantis is a myth, but Atlantis is very real. It is the oldest submerged city in the world. Atlantis was first discovered by a British oceanographer about 40 years ago. Experts found ceramics and pottery dating back to 5,000 years ago. Marine geologists still have to figure out why the settlement sank, but their theories include earthquakes or maybe even a tsunami.             The Ancient Inca, the Ancestral Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important to us, because of many reasons. All the discoveries, and work that we have done to reveal the history of them isn't quite complete but has mostly payed off and now we know what they have been doing with their lives.

Item_Response: There were many civilizations that we have learned about. They all are important because we learn from them. Archaeologists find artifacts and other evidence to try to figure out new things about different cultures before ours. Once they find out about other peoples and how their civilizations worked, they try to apply that to our lifes today.          The Inca were a well known civilization that are studied a lot today. They were a thriving vast empire and had many ways to do things. They did not have a written language, but they thrived still. The Inca were important because we learn form them and try to cennect their story to other ancient empires of the time. The Spaniards came and the empire fell. If we knwo what happened to the Incas we can help ourselves by learning form their mistakes. Archaelolgoists try to find out why this happened so we can prevent it from happening now. All that we have learned from the Incas has helped us today. It helps us better understand what happended to them and what may happen in the future. Aside from being interesting, the Inca culture helps us learn to help tomorrow.          The Puebloans were a people in Mesa Verde. They are also an important peopl. Learning about them is interesting because it is of human nature to be curious about others. Archaeologists study artifacts and structures that can show a lto about the people. THey were atfirst a nomadic tribe that adapted to learn how to farm and build standing houses. It is interesting and important to know how the people before us could do the same things that we do today. If we know aboyt how the people could survive without all out the things we have today, it makes us feel luckier that we have these oppertunitites. It aslo shows us how a people can adapt to their needs and become more modern and smarter. We learn many lessons and things from the ancient Puebloans.          The Pavlopetri were a people that lived in a city that is now sunken. They are important for many reasons. It helps us understand  about a new people and shows that sumbereged cities are possible. It helps us prepare for the future and know what can happen and why. It gives us a more deep understanding of the world and the dangers. The underwater city is not only interesting to people becasuse it is underwater but because it also teaches us about the world.      All in all the ancient cities teach us lessons about what can happen to us and what has happened to others in the past. If we didn't study these cities we would not be able to do what we do today.

Item_Response: As people of today, we wonder what is life like in the past as part of human curiosity. These past civilizations aren't only interesting to look at, but are places frozen in time for us to learn about the past. What we discover and learn about these civilizations, the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, help us understand life in their time and how the world has improved and evolved from then.       These discoveres are important for many reasons. One reason is that we can learn more about the past and how life was like in their time. We live in a time where a lot of our things rely on technology like electricity. In those days, they didn't have the luxuries that we have today. Take the Puebloans for an example. They lived in houses called Pithouses located in on mesa tops, but sometimes in cliff recesses. As we take a look at the inside of the pithouse, we can see many similarities between their homes and ours. These houses had living rooms just like houses of today. The pithouses would evolve into kivas. As we can tell from the artifacts, their homes will come closer and closer to what our house are like today. In fact, their name as Puebloans is a Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers.'       Another thing many wonder is how were these civilizations run. The Spanish were amazed to see the Inca civilization using just strings to keep records. The Puebloans created houses similar to houses of today and started to group them together to form small villages. Most of our buildings are still built with that same idea in mind. Sadly, there isn't much for us to know about the governments of these great cultures as many accounts from that time are many times inaccurate.       Also, these discoveries of these ancient civilizations can teach us many lessons. There is a saying in that me can learn from the past. Take the buildings of these civilizations for an example. The houses of the Puebloans had a ventilator which helped push smoke out the building. We still you this same principle today. Their buildings were located in cliffs which gave shelter to their homes. Another example is the city of Atlantis. Even though cities are still built near shores, we now know that cities can become submerged in the sea like Atlantis. Cities have taken precautions when a storm or tidal wave hits them. Lastly, we know about the endings of some of these civilizations. The fall of the Inca is known due to the Spaniards murdering the last Inca king in 1532. We know can know not to do the same actions as these now gone cultures so not to end up like them.       Since we are curious by nature, the past has always interested us. These civilizations help tell the stories of their culture and civilizations. What we discover and learn can help us compare life in their time to ours today. We will always learn more and more about them as the years go by.

Item_Response: Artifacts of the Ancient Civilizations                    Have you ever wondered how the Incas lived and how they ran their empire with knots ? Today, no one knows what these quipus are or what they mean. Our archaeologists have made some amazing discoveries, like finding the inspiration of the well known myth, 'Atlantis'. These discoveries lead us to knowing more about the Incas, Puebloans and Palvopetri. These amazing discoveries are extremely important to us because it lets us see into the past and know how it was like for people thousands of years ago.                 One of these discoveries was things called 'quipus'. Quipus are these strings with knots in them. Since the Inca did not have an official alphabet, they made knots in string instead to tell stories. Today, no one knows what they mean. The Incas were very interesting people. They did not have archives for historians to study. However they did leave us their ruins which shows us their amazing way of life. For example, they would bury stuff high up in the Andes mountains so that it would be hard for looters to grab. It also made it hard for archaeologists to study the sites up there. If we have not discovered the ruins on the Incas, then would have never known a culture as amazing as they are.                Another amazing discovery was the Puebloans. These people settled in Mesa Verde around A.D. 550. They are known for their amazing skills of basket making. They replaced hunting with farming for food. About A.D. 750 they started to make houses above ground made from mud and poles called pithouses. The pithouse contained a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four poles made of wood supported the roof. By A.D. 1000, the Puebloans acquired the skill of stone masonry. Pottery also changed from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. The discoveries of the Pueblaons are important because learning about different types of culture and religion can inspire so many people today.               The last discovery that is important is 'The lost Greek city'. This discovery contains an ancient Greek city that sunk about 5,000 years ago. This might sound familiar, a sunken city underwater that has been missing. Yes, it sound like Atlantis. This discovery of the settlement underneath the water inspired one of the famous myths in the world. It is said that this city was probably sunken by a tsunami or an earthquake; maybe even both ! However, geologists still do not know for certain what made the settlement sink. It has remains dating back to 2800 to 1200 BC. This site is very significant because as submerged, it was never reoccupied. This is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Palto wrote his tale of Atlantis. I find this discovery more important than any other because it brings mystery to the world and makes a good myth !               I find all of these discoveries very important because it teaches us more about ancient civilizations. It teaches us about how they lived; what their culture was like; what they believed in, and etc. It must have been amazing to discover these things and have so many questions to ask to make a mystery.

Item_Response: Humans have always had a fascination with finding out about their past. Modern archaeology makes that possible. Over the last few years, we have found out a lot about what the ancient world was like. Three of the most important recent archaelogical discoveries include the discoveries involving Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.              The biggest of the threee civilizations, the Inca, were located in present day Peru. With no formal writing method, archaelogists have a tough time uncovering details about the Inca. The Inca created a huge civilization for nearly a hundred years, one that controlled nearly all of South America. However, in 1532, when the Spanish murdered the Inca king, and the Inca civilization suddenly dropped off. So far, archaelogists have found ancient ruins and burials high on the Andes Mountains, as well as textiles and clothes that provide insight into how the Inca went about their daily life.              While the Ancestral Puebloans civilation was not as large as the Inca, they were much older, dating back to A.D. 550, in Mesa Verde. they started with pithouses, but later moved on to building large houses of stone. The Puebloans were also skilled with pottery and hunting with the bow and arrow. After the population grew to a peak of about several thousand, the Puebloans quickly shifted back into the cliffs, arond A.D. 1200, perhaps because of a drought and crop failure.               The last of the three civilizations, the Pavelopetri in southern Greece, is also the oldest, starting around 3000 B.C.. This Greek civilization is signficant because it sank into the water around 1000 B.C.. The sinking could have been caused by an earthquake, tsunami, or sudden change in sea level. This could be the inspiration of the classic myth of the lost city of Atlantis. So far, many artifacts, including ceramics and tombs, have been recovered from underwater, because of the extraordinary preservation of the items in the shallow bay where the sunken city was discovered.                Overall, it is easy to see how these three civilizations provided for the most significant archaelogical discoveries in recent years. These fascinating civilizations each had a unique aspect that set them apart from other civilizations of the time, making them so important today.

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because they are apart of the our history and they changed our history. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are all different and important.               The Pavlopetri is a sunken settlement that dates back 5,000 years when Homer's heroes around.  Atlantis is the oldest submerged town in the world. It was dated from 2800-1200 BC before the glory days of classical Greece. This sunken city takes up 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Atlantis is protected in the bay thanks to shifting sands, the exploration revealed consists of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cute tombs, and religious structures. What makes Pavlopetri so important and unique because none can be considered to be planned like Atlantis.              Puebloans lived in mountain tops where they may have worshiped mountain peaks. They liked high places. Incas were buried in caves on cliffs or mountain tops. That has helped to preserve the sites. The Incas are so important because they used some of the most advanced techniques in the world. Ariel photography can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that you can't see from the ground. The fall of the Inca happened in 1532 because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king. A lot of their advanced techniques affected our techniques today, this is what makes them so important.                They Puebloans were so important because of thir skill. They are known as basketmakers because they are really good for craft. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting. They used pithouses to live in. Pithouses had a four corner timber which supported the roof, the firepit had an air deflectoror, and it sunk in a few feet from the ground. the Puebloans affected the crafts and inventions today.

Item_Response: The Inca people had no specific way of living. They were a very unorganized empire. They made knots on colored strings called quipus to record the calendar in order to keep count of all the livestock. When the Europeans discovered the Inca, they were astounded that they could use nothing but knots and string to keep count of all of their livestock.       It's hard to know for sure how the civilization worked back in 1438. The only way that we know for sure that the Inca even existed is because of all of the art work that they left behind. They left art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and a way of life.       All of what we know about the Inca today comes from a different generation. It is passed on from generation to generation and so on. Some of the information may not be as accurate because the tellers of the stories about the Inca people didn't speak the Inca language very well. And some of the Inca stories were legends rather than History.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are so important because they tell us how people before us began, survived and died out. The Inca's, for example, left behind amazing art and architecture that formed an amazing portrait of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and way of life. The Inca's left knots in colored string called 'Quip-us' to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Farmers today just write it down, unlike the Inca's.                Before the Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde as their home. This group was called the Puebloans. For their skill of basket weaving, they were known as Basket-makers. Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main way of livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops and sometimes built in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow an arrow, a more effiecient way of hunting and gathering that the atlatl or spear thrower.                Ever since local cowboys reported cave dwellings in the 1880s, archaeologists have sought to understand these people's lives. But despite decades of excavation, analysis, classification and comparison, scientific knowledge remains sketchy. Yet for all their silence, these structures speak with a certain eloquence. They tel of a people adept at building, artisitic in their crafts and skillful at making a living from difficult land. The structures are evidence of a society that, over cenrturies, have passed accumulated skills and traditioons from generation to generation. By the Classic Period, Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilazation, whose accomplishments in community living and the arts rank among the finest of human culture in North America.

Item_Response: Ancient discoveries are important                                                      By: Curtis Taylor                 Discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlovian are really important for they uncover the past and reveal to us the history of each to these cultures. The reason why discovering artifacts about these ancient societies is important is because each little artifact we find on these groups, gives us more information about how they lived, worked, created, and how they battled. The three supporting paragraphs below will be about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlovian.                 First of all, discovering the ancient history of the Inca's way of life is crucial. It is crucial because, if we uncover most of the history of how they created items and how they worked with such primitive tools to create such masterpieces. Also, we will learn how they fought battles and survived the harsh conditions off the Andes Mountains. Knowing this tells us the history of the Inca's lives, and what rituals / religions they worshiped.                 Secondly, finding as many artifacts as possible about the Peubloans should be the most important priority when excavating an area near this tribe. This group can teach us about construction of pit-houses and kivas'. These people survived for centuries just in these homes and with a little discovering, we could figure out how they were constructed, and how these people worked; also what they worked with. These people can teach us all about the way of architecture and how they advanced in it. The Puebloans, are a very intelligent and advanced race that has created masterpieces that have shown the world that they were ahead of their time.                In addition, searching under water for the great lost Greek city is the one thing that should drive all deep sea archeologists to do. Finding these big sunken cities will reveal to archeologists that this city was once high and mighty, but with a little research on the remains of the civilization, they could determine how the city was crumbled into the sea. once we continue to find these sunken civilizations, we can figure out, if not even put aside some myths of how the cities actually went down. Also, there would be dangers like marine life guarding and swarming these ruins. This would prove troublesome to archeologists, but with a little bit of work we can clear out the area and finally get the important, glorious research we so desperately need.       In conclusion, discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlovian are really important for they uncover the past and reveal to us the history of each of these cultures. All these societies can be the future of our technology or architecture if we find out the secrets of each of their villages, times, and order systems. Also, we could finally figure out what had happened to these great tribes and monuments thousands of years ago.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru is very interesting. They had no formal alphabet or system of writing. That is hard for us, now, to figure out what they were trying to say. But it also makes it more of a mystery. I think it is so cool that after so many years, the city is still preserved underwater.             I think the most important discovery we have made is that the lost city is still here, just underwater. I think that is so cool that the city has survived. '...is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.' Although it was only discovered around 40 years ago, it has been there for a  very long time. It is located underwater, somewhere in Greece.             When finding the underwater city, they also discovered a few other things. Some were types of ceramics. ''We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age...'' This suggests that the settlement was occupied around 5,000 years ago. That is 1,200 years earlier than most people had thought.             Of course since the city is underwater, there is some wondering involved. The main one is, why did it sink? 'Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank.' They do have a few theories, though. Some of the theories are sea level changes, ground subsidences from the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.             The underwater city is truly a mystery. Maybe we will never know exactly what happened to the Inca and their city.

Item_Response: The ancient Ica of Peru made an alaphabet and told stories from knots made from colored strings called Quipus. Only some of the old stories are known because they were written down by Europeans who arrived in the Empire in 1532. Some Incas told Spaniards stuff but the Spaniards did not understand the Incas langauge. And some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history. the rest of the knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts or objects they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found. Inca artifacts might be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Some Inca textiles and clothing have survived remarkably well. Ancient materials are usually destroyed by dampness.

Item_Response: Discoveries of the Past       The past is a major part of our learning in this day and age. We have Social Studies and history classes that explain a lot about the past and how we have learned from it. One way that we are learning from the past is by looking at artifacts and other clues found about ancient civilizations. Ancient Civilizations show us how much we have learned from our past, and also about how we lived long ago. Archaeologists today are searching for a few ancient civilizations in particular, called the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       The discoveries of the three civilizations stated above are important to find what happened long ago. One piece of evidence that suggests that this is true is found in the article 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past'. This selection is about what the Ancient Inca tribe was like long ago and how archaeologists now are finding artifacts and evidence as to what happened back then. 'Ancient materials like cloth... have been preserved in the dry deserts... or the cold mountains of the Andes.' this is one quote that shows that archaeologists have found something that was used and made by the Incas long ago. These cloths are used to find more evidence and clues about ancient civilizations such as the Incas.       The ancient people of a sunken city referred to as Pavlopetri also give us clues of the ways of life long ago. According to the article 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets.', architecture was a major part of the people of Pavlopetri's way of life. '...the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.' According to Dr. Jon Henderson, Pavlopetri has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before classical Greece.       With each new day, archaeologists like Henderson find more and more evidence about the past. They are always finding new ways to get evidence, and there is always going to be more artifacts to find. The artifacts that are found by archaeologists are major parts of discovering more about people back then, and are very important. Someday, the things that we use every day will become artifacts for archaeologists hundreds of years from now to find.

Item_Response: Because Ancient Inca had something to do with the alphabet and the calendar but mostly the calendar because they made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records.Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today nobody knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion,art,architecture,agriculture,government,transportation and way of life.If the archaeologists study these clues then they will be able to piece the details of Inca life together. There was a story about Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests.They described the Inca in letters and diaries. The Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language as well as the Inca did. Their stories were legends rather than history.The information being told to the Spaniards wasn't as accurate because they were unable to understand what was being said to them from the Incas.Most of the information we can find out is the artifacts and or objects they left behind and from the sites where artifacts are found. as many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts might have or could possibly be made from stone,pottery,gold or silver.These materials lasted such a long time the were used for people who were living and the people who were dead to be used in their afterlife. Some of the Inca textiles and clothing survived remarkably well. The ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness,but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Most Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters,who take anything that might be valuable. Treasures were taken centuries ago,but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often do not tell archaeologists much.Other sites are reported to archaeologists can dig them up carefully.They provide the best idea of all about life in Peru before and during Inca rule. Item_Response: Have you ever wondered about the lost civilizations? For example, Ancient Inca? What about Mesa Verde? The Lost Greek City perhaps?  Nobody new what happened until now.              First, Ancient Inca. The source used is named 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks Secrets of the Past.' By Beth Gruber. Ancient Inca was in Peru. They didn't leave any archives for scientists to study so archaeologists had to research. Inca lived high in the Andes and could have possibly worshipped some mountain peaks. May of their sites were in high places. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by the dampness, but they have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.Some artifacts that they found have been found in ruins of buildings. Others have been found buried in graves for the dead to be used in the afterlife.              Next, Mesa Verde. The source used is named 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World' illustrations by NPS/Roy Anderson. About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. The people who lived here were called Anasazi, before being called Ancestral Puebloans. The first of the Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They were formerly nomadic and lived in pithouses.              Last, the Lost Greek City. The source used was 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets' by Helena Smith in Athens. The secrets of this lost city inspired the fable of Atlantis. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going' said Sakellariou. ' Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find bu there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.'              In conclusion, Ancient Inca, Mesa Verde, and the Lost Greek City. They were all home to people of the past and we can learn more about them today.

Item_Response: People rely on evidence to discover things. With evidence, people conclude certain ideas. The objects, paintings, buildings found about Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri give scientists and archaeologists clues as to what life was like for these groups of people. The discovers about these tribes are the reason we have information about them.                                                                                                                                     For example, people found ancient letters, diaries, pottery, textiles, clothing, and many other artifacts about the Inca people. These discoveries can help us conclude traits of the Inca, such as the fact the Inca people spoke their own language. Without any of the evidence we have, we wouldn't even be able to know the Inca people existed.                                                                                                                                                                                                      The same goes for the Puebloans. Some person out there discovered artifacts about the Puebloans and scientists concluded everything we know about the civilization. We know so much information about the Puebloans, and it is all because of researchers and scientists. For instance, archaeologists found a Puebloan church. It gave them an idea about the customs of the Puebloan people and their beliefs.              A diver found an underwater settlement near Greece, which gave geologists and archaeologists an idea of when the Pavlopetri tribe was around and what they were like. Using their own previous knowledge about how the ocean works, they figure the settlement was built around 2800 to 1200 BC. We would never have known this if it weren't for that diver finding the key evidence and also the scientists comparing the present to the past.             There is so much we can learn from artifacts. Buildings can describe what materials were used in the past and how and why people made their houses the way they did. Written material give us ideas as to what language past people spoke and what their everyday life and conversations were like. Paintings and drawings help scientists understand what people from the past thought about. Everything we know about the past tribes was from evidence found today.             One thing many scientists look for is connections from the evidence to present day Earth. It helps give them an idea of how our present day society has formed from the evidence. Scientists also do the opposite by using present-day artifacts to predict what the past was like. It is a good way to understand how the past events effected the future.             Everything we know about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri was from discovery. This is why discoveries are so important. They are the only way we are able to connect to the past. It gives indication on our past Earth, while also giving explanations on certain things we have today. It's a type of special bond that the universe has, and discovery is the key to unlocking it.

Item_Response: Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable.The origins of the Inca are more difficult to trace. Archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world to discover more about the Inca's predecessors. Anything they find about the Inca has to be carried down to the mountain for study. The first ancestral Pueblo-ans are known as Basket-makers for their skills at the craft. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learn to make weapons strong enough for hunting. Farming accounted for more of their diet than before and much mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture.   They built the houses one against another in long, curving rowsa, often with a pithouse or two in the front.

Item_Response: The discovery of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetria was fascinating. Archeologies learned about them by learning about their living environment and studying the artifacts that has been left behind. Learning about them was not easy, for example, the archeologists had to do all these research and do any things to find out. For example, archeologists had to swim below to the floors of the ocean to find Atlantist. They also had to climb to the top of mountains so that they could find out where the Incas have lived. The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavopetria were learned by the artifacts that ere left behind and the living conditions.       The Inca lived in high places in Peru which were mainly on high mountain peaks or caves in cliff faces. The Inca left many artifacts, which were thing left behind for hundreds of years, such as clothing and textiles. The clothing and textiles were in good conditions even though they were buried for hundreds of years. Clothing usually got destroyed because of the dampness from the dry deserts. Textiles were usually in good conditions. The Inca sites were usually disterbed by treasure hunters. They usually stole the treasures of the Incas and was taken away.       The Poebloans lived in Mesa Verde. The first Ancestral Puebloan were caled Basketmakers. Basketmakers were good at crafts. They began to settle in a new way by farming instead of hunting. Basketmakers also began to live in pithouses which was built above ground. Instead of using poles and adobe bricks, they used stones which had a greater benefit of building them two or three stories high. Soon, the Poebloans had advanced from the pithouses into using cliff dwellers. They built the cliff dwellings with sandstone and mud.       Atlantis was a city that was located in Greece. It was sunken down and was the oldest submerged town in the world. Atlantis was 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor and because of the shifting sand in the ocean, archeologists found Atlantis. There they saw, the buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock- cut tombs and religious structures.

Item_Response: Amazing discovers from the past             Anicent civilizations have been found be many archaeoloists in Peru,Mesa Verde,and in southern Greece.  Two Civilizations were found on land and one was found underwater. Archaeoloists have been looking for these Civilizations to study how they survived.          The first Civilization that they've looked for was the Incas. These archaeoloists have goin to Peru looking for things that the Incas could have used. Incas would make colored strrined knots called quipus,but archaeoloists have found them and they do not know what they were for.Archaeoloists have portraits of the Incas religion,art,architecture,agriculture,government,and way of life.What the archaeoloists know about the Incas comes history and stories.While the archaeoloists were in Peru, they also found artifacts of the Incas. Archaeoloists think the artifacts are made of stone,pottery,gold,or silver.They were found in many different places. They also found the Incas textiles and clothing. The cloth was well not destroyed, but it was kept preserved over time.Archaeoloists have records of the sites of the Incas that were disturbed.The Incas lived high up in the Andes Mountains. The archaeoloists found dead bodies in the mountains and the help reveal how they lived.            The second Civilization that they've looked for were the Puebloans. Archaeoloists have goin to Mesa Verde for things the Puebloans used to survive. The Puebloans were known for their skill at the craft of basketmaking. The Puebleans lived in pithouses. They learned to make pottery and how to use a bow and arrow. For hunting they a spear thrower called atlatl. Their population would multiply. Soon they begin building houses in long, curving rows. Afterthat the Puebloans became more advanced at construction. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, their population grew several thousand. The Puebloans were a vigorous civilization among the finest expressions of himan culture in North America. They built dwellings usind sandstone the size a loaf of bread.               The third Civilization that they've looked for were the Pavlopetri. Archaeoloists have goin under water in southern Greece looking for the lost city of the Pavlopetries. This city dates back some 5,000 years ago. This city was before the days of classical Greece. There are older sunken sites that are not as interstine as this one. The city is 30,000 square meters in the ocean. Archaeoloists have found buildings,courtyards,main streets,rock-cut tombs, and religious structures underwater that was with the city. There are 9,000 square meters of new buildings underwater. Archaeoloists are tring to figure why the city sank. They think it was an earthquake or a tsunami that cased it. Archaeoloists say it is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece. Atlantis may be a myth, but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.

Item_Response: The ancient Incas had no alphabet or writing system in their society. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what they nots mean. The ancient Inca was like a solving mystery.       Clues left behind by the Inca from an amazing portrait of their religion. By studying these clues, Archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life. The Inca comes from an oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation.       Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. They may not have understood what the Inca told them. And some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history.

Item_Response: Discoveries in Ancient Civilizations       There are many ancient civilizations not yet discovered. There are also some     ancient civilizations that we know about. For example, we know about the Incas the Puebolans and the Pavolpetri. The discoveries archeologists have made over the years are amusing. They can show us how people lived in their time.       Incas were amusing. They made knots on colored string to keep track of livestock   and keep track of the calendar. The artifacts that were discovered by archeologists were made from gold, stone, silver, or pottery. This means that the Incas were dedicated to what the made. The Incas wanted their belonging to last a long time. archeologists also found human remains in the Andes mountains. This means that when a family member dies they don't wan anything to happen to their loved ones so they bury them in the mountains. This shows that families were very close.       People in Mesa Verde were mostly known for basket making. they mostly lived in   pit houses in clustered small villages. At about 750 A.D they started building houses above ground. Their houses were made of upright walls made of pols and mud. AT 1000 A.D their houses were made of thick stone walls.By 1200 A.D the population moved back to cliffs.The attention to baskets became noticeable people began to make more pottery.              Not to long ago, a new civilization was discovered by a British oceanographer. The civilization's name is Pavlopetri. It is located in southern Greece.Archeologists have found buildings,pottery,courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. This civilization was very wealthy no one knows how it got sunk. The evidence that Archeologists lead them to believe that this civilization was very unified.       These civilizations were very different. Their way of government is not at all   simaler. These discoveries let figure out how civilizations worked before modern day technology. Our ways of life is way different then how their was.

In the first topic I will be talking about the Inca then the Puebloans then the Pavlopetri.   The Inca have a wierd way of keeping records they color and put nots in string for records.  The Inca's way of life is their religion, art  and architecture, agriculture,government,transportation.  Some of oral history comes from stories past on from generation to generation.  We also know is from the Europeans describing the Inca in letters and in their diaries.   The Puebloans lived in th canyon walls and in small villages.  Were efficient hunters using bows and arrows in stead of spears.  They houses one against another in long, curving rows, whit one or two pithouses in the front.   The Pavlopetri about 40 years ago that the aid by digital technology, were able to properly surey the ruins.  Thanks to shifting sand and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay the exporation was revealed.  They found a world of buildings, coutyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.

Item_Response: There has been many great discoveries throughout the past, but not all of thoes discoveries have been great ones. Some of them have been good and others of them have been bad, but with thoes discoveries there has been change. With each new discovery there has been some sort of change that has happened somewhere in the world. Now three of the greatest discoveries have been of the Inca, Puebloans, and the great Pavlopeti.        One of the great discoveries about the Inca are even though they didn't have a formal alphabet they were still able to keep records by using quipus which was a form of knot tying to help keep things orgonized. When the Europeans came they were amazed by how the Inca could keep their giant empire organized with knots. Other important finds about the Inca are their forms of art, religion, architecture, agriculture, governmant, transportation, and how they lived their lives. Most of thoes artifacts are made of pottery, silver, gold, or even stone so most of them have survived but not all. They have found most of them in building that have been discovered, so anything found is an important find in they eyes of an archeologist.        An important find about the Puebloans is their housing, it has been found inside the cliff alcoves of the Mesa Verde. They have found many Puebloan housing facillities there along with some pithouses out in feilds, open land, or prairies. Other artifacts that have been found to be important are thoes of the baskets that the Puebloans had made over time. Even though they had not left any written records for the people of today they are still learning about this amazing culture.        The last important city or town that has been discovered is that of the Pavlopeti. Their city was discovered many years ago but was never able to be researched by archeologists becuase the technical advances to be discovered were not around at the time it was discovered. This city of the Pavlopeti was discovered off the coast of Greece, and one of the great discovery of the town its self. Other great discoveries about the Pavlopeti are that there was many pottery peices found, even though they were all broken they still show great evidence about what the city was like and what type of art they made. One of the greatest finds about the Pavlopeti is how well mapped out the town was, becuase they had found rock-cut tombs, religious structures, there was also buildings, main steet with others and courtyards.        The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopeti have all been great find from over the years. Even though archeologists haven't been able to get much from them they have learned many new things about how life was back in ancient times. There have been thoes bad finds and thoes good ones, but I would say that these three places were great finds. Thank you for your time I hope you enjoyed.
