Item_Response: Hello, today I am teaching you why the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are so important. Not only are they important for learning about our history, but also because we can take the ideas and inventions from this point in time and put our own modern spin on it.                 First, the discovery of the Inca community is important because it provides the best idea about life in Peru before and during the Inca ruling. Also Archaeologists can compare what they learn from the artifacts and sites with the Spaniard's accounts of the Inca and can sometimes confirm historical records. The Inca lived in high parts of the Andes mountains and from the discoveries are assumed to have worshiped some mountain peaks. Most of their sites are in high remote places such as mountain tops, caves or cliffs. Because of the well preserved cites, archaeologists have been able to examine the bodies that have revealed information on their living cycle.                  Next, is the discoveries of the Puebloans are so important because their skillful stone masonry was so astonishing. They had much of an idea of crafts. They were also the first community to farm instead of hunt, and gather as their main livelihood. But even though hunting was masked by farming, still hunting occurred. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting. The discovery of how they built their settlements (Pit houses) is truly amazing. The pit houses featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof. The fire pit in the pit house had an air deflector. To me I think that pit houses were the original houses we have today.                   Lastly, the findings of the Pavlopetri is so significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied. Meaning that it was never touched so it stayed in perfect condition. Also, the findings underwater made the archaeologists think on why it was underwater. This thought made them  come up with the conclusion that the sea level changed, ground subsidence as a result of earthquakes, and or a tsunami. As the world's oldest submerged city it is truly amazing. It not only shows how people lived but also shows natural scientists about how the waters around it are so shallow. In my opinion all of these settlements helped shape our world today. This are some reasons why the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important.

Item_Response: Have you ever heard about the lost city of Atlantis? The discoveries of not only the lost city of Atlantis, but the Inca and Puebloans are so important. They are a big part of new discoveries of anctient civilizations! The Inca lived in Peru, the Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde, and the so called 'myth' of Atlantis is actually true!                    Archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life by studying clues left behind of the Inca's. Some of the things we know about the Inca comes from oral history. That was an important way to preserve a community's history. As in many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts may be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Some textiles and clothing of the Inca have also shown up very well! The cloth as been preserved by dry deserts on Peru's coasts or way up in the cold Andes mountains. The Inca lived in the Andes and many of their sites are in high, remote places. Some Inca were buried in caves or on mountain tops. The mountains act like a good freezer because they can preserve the bodies very well. The bodies can also reveal information about how the Inca lived .                    The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. The Puebloans are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small vilages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. The Puebloans learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow which is a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. Their population expanded and it was prosperous times for basketmakers. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground with upright walls made of mud and poles. By 1000 A.D. the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, the population reached several thousand.                    Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, this sunken sttlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. In Neapolis, this underwater city has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 B.C. This site consumes or covers 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Due to shifting sands and the sttlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of building, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. Ceramics were found dating back to the end of the stone age!

Item_Response: Finding new settlements are very exciting. You get to learn about how people from the past lived and what they did. New settlements can help make you learn how to live. The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are important because finding these new settlements can help us learn new things and learn about what can happen to our cities.       Inca lived in the mountains and objects and bodies have been frozen to be kept in good condition. The Inca discoveries can help us learn about how they lived and how they hunted. We can learn many things from new discoveries from the past. The Inca have already helped us learn facinating facts about them       The Puebloans and the Pavlopetri are also facinating. The Puebloan's arts and crafts are very facinating and showed that they were very good at making objects. They were nomadic people and they farmed. We can relate to them because some of the people today are nomadic and very good farmers and very good at art.       The Pavlopetri is a very cool under water settlement. It is located off the coast of Greece and is very unique do to the fact that it is underwater and still in shape. Pavlopetri can tell us, by the buildings that were there, that the peple that lived there were of very high class. The discoveries made about these settlements and people are amazing and interesting.

Item_Response: The Incas are a lost civilization in Peru with no system of writing nor recording things. They had an odd calendar system with strings called a quipus, no one can understand how to read it.The civilization nearly ruled in south america for 100 years (1438-1532) and yet we barely know about them. We can piece together some information about the Incas through their artwork and from stories passed from generation to generation.          The Mesa Verde native american group lived near the 4 corners 1400 years before europeans came to america. The native americans were good at basket makeing and farmin which soon replaced hunting for them. From year 750 to 1300 the population reached several thousand. By about the 1300s Mesa Verde was deserted and nobody knoows why, archeologists know of a drought in the end of 1200s but their not sure why they moved. Around 1880s cowboys saw the cliff houses and archeologists investigated to learn more about those people.          The lost Greek city under the water was a huge find for archeologists. The lost city may have been the inspiration for the myth of Atlantis. The sunken city dates back to 5,000 year ago. The city is 30,000 meters big and is thought to have been under water since 1,000 BC. Sence the city was in a protected bay the city is not very damaged. Nobody knows why it got sank or if it is the inspiration behind Atlantis but some of the people near there say that the older generations knew something was in teh water so it may be the reason behind Atlantis.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri            Recently around the world there have been discoveries of ancient cities, artifacts, and many more. The recent discoveries were located in well-known cultures such as the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Could what they have found at these sites affect our lives or could it just be another thing we found that could be cool looking but priceless and pretty much worthless? In this essay I am going to figure out why the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri articfacts found are important to us.        So who exactly are the Inca? The Inca are an ancient civilization that is still around today that are still carrying on the traditions of the elder Inca tribes. As in the article it shows that archaeologists have located ancient remains of things such as pottery and buildings. So are the things found in the Inca city important to us today? The answer to this question many people are asking is yes it is. The reason the artifacts found in the Inca city are important is because the lifestyle of the Inca could help are life. People today could learn about Inca architecture and how to add on to our knowledge of art.        The Puebloans were first formed at around 550 A.D. and were known for many things. Recently there was a question asked if the artifacts loacted in the Puebloans civilization is important to us today since we have far surpassed machinery and artifacts that early people had. The anwer that is easily fit to this question is yes. The reason for this answer is because the Puebloans could have had something very important that we don't have and could be very useful. If you do not think that these ancient artifacts are important and that the newer technology is the way to go just think about how the Egyptians built the pyramids in weeks or maybe even months and how we can barely figure out how to build them. But if you are still dead set on answering this question with a no i will not tell you its bad.        Last but not least are the Pavlopetri which are my favorite. By the city of Neapolis archaeologists have found a city that resembles the fabled city of Atlantis. Artifacts found at this site are buildings, courtyards, streets, and types of pottery. These artifacts are important to our society because there has been a vast amount of stories told about the city of Atlantis that people have grown up with. If your a parent and told your child a story of atlantis but later on he/she thinks its just another fable. Since people have found this underwater city then people have something to look forward to hearing about and knowing that the stories they heard as a child are not fake. Another reason it is important is because maybe we could find documents of the peoples history and just what exactly happened to their city whether it was just a huge wave or for those who are into Greek gods maybe it was Atlantis's patron god of the sea Poseidon that wiped out the city.        The architecture and other designs by the Inca are important to our soceity today because we could take what we learned and build off it. Puebloans are important to us because we can add on to the art we already have and make it more like ancient civilizations. The Pavlopetri are important because it will help people believe in stories more and have things to inspire them to do. I hope you enjoyed my essay on the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.

Item_Response: The discovery was very important to people today. It inspired many people to keep looking for more lost cities that are submerged. It show archaeologists the way people used the live there life and what technology they had. How they used to communicate and what they believed.         This town is now the oldest submerged town in the world. There are older sunken sites but the lost city is the most unique.  It has remains from 2800 to 1200bc. But a British oceanographer just found this city 40 years ago. They have found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. They have found 30,000 square meters of buildings.         With all the years of exploring this cite they still haven't found out why this lost city was submerged. Many think the sea reveled changed, a tsunami, or a earthquake occurred. With more investigations they have revealed over 9,000 square meters  of new buildings. Only 1 percent of our worlds ocean floor has been surveyed and there still is a lot more to be found.

Item_Response: After reading and taking notes on these three different sources about ancient civilizations I have come to consensus that these three things are important in world history not because it was explained but how it was thoroughly documented.    First of all concluding the Incas, Ancient Puebloans, and Greeks, the Incas in a matter were a very unique civilization. What made them unique is up to question as most historians are baffled as they have to be very careful when they interpret accounts of their history. But what I think what was really unique from their history is their use of the colored knot system called quipus which was to record their calendar to keep a count of livestock. The most interesting thing is that archaeologists do not know what the knots means further leading the Ancient Inca into mystery.    The Puebloans were a group of people living in the Four Corners region in North America and chose Mesa Verde as their home where they flourished for 700 years until mysteriously disappearing. The Puebloan society at first lived a nomadic way of life but throughout the centuries living in Mesa Verde they became to lead a more civilized way of life such as farming and building huts. Throughout their time living in Mesa Verde the Puebloans became skill stone masons which was in my opinion one of the most interesting thing to learn about them. Further living the Puebloans disappeared from Mesa Verde for reasons that are up to question today.    In the islands of southern Peloponnese a lost greek city was found further leading that the myth of Atlantis was true however that was plausible as the city dates back to between 2800-1200 B.C. , a time before Plato wrote about the city of Atlantis. This lost Greek city which is called now Palvopetri was discovered over 40 years ago by a British oceanographer but has been furthered studied by archaeologists today. According to reseach Palvopetri is the oldest subemerged city in the world and may have sunk from a earthquake or tsunami.

Item_Response: Have you ever heard of the Incas? The Incas were an ancient civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled South American that rivaled the expanse of  ancient Rome. But how do we know that? Clues were left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion,art, architecture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these these clues, I found that archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life.           The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings called quipus to keep records. They used knots in colored strings to record on the calendars.Some of what we kow about the Inca comes from oral history , or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history.            Historians have to be when the spaniards interpret the Inca. Some of them didn't speak the language very well. So their descriptions might not be very accurate.The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts. Some Inca sites have also been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable.            The Inca lived in the Andes mountains and may have even worshiped some mountain peaks.Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces and this has helped to preservethe sites, because looters can't easily get to them. The bodies found in the Andes also reveal information about how they lived.

Item_Response: The ancient sites discovered helped archeologists fill in the missing parts of the past.       The Inca, found in Peru, left many clues about the past. Textiles, clothing, pottery, gold, silver, and other stone objects were found and helped our knowledge of our past. Sadly, looters have found many sites and stole many artifacts. Thankfully, the looter didn't find all the sites or graves. Looters couldn't find many graves because some were buried in the mountain top or in a cave on a cliff face. The Inca left many artifacts for us to find.       In North America, the Puebloans left artifacts that archeologists have discovered. Archeologist have found stone buildings, baskets, pottery, and bow and arrows in Mesa Verda sites. These cave dwellers created their villages in stone and in the sides of mountains. THey were also skilled basket makers. Origninally nomadic, the Pueloans settled in Mesa Versa and began farming. We understand and have knowledge of our past because of the atrifacts we find.       Off of Greece, we have found the lost city. Submerged underwater, is the oldest and largest underwater city we have found. In this underwater city we have discovered a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, religious structures, and thousand of sharts of pottery. This discovery has lead to vast knowledge. The lost city helps us connect our past to the present.       Without these discoveres, what would we know about our past? These discoveries help us understand our past and connect it to the present. It shows how much humanity has evolved over the many years.

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, an the Pavloperti so important?   The discoveries of the ancient Inca, Peubloan, An Paveloperti so so important because during their time they didn't know how to read or write. So they never wrote down their history. So the only way to learn about them is to study the artifacts they've left behind.                 In source one it says 'The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing' on the first line. this just means that they couldn't write anything down. So like I said before the only way they could leave stuff behind for us to discover would be their buildings and pottery objects.                 In source two it says 'For more than 700 years they and their descendents lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls.' One way these discoveries of the ancient Peubloans are important is because with finding the stone buildings they have left behind it tells us how they survived and lived in North America.                 In source three it says 'The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.' This is an example of how we have to use artifacts to sometimes discover information about ancient people. Because like this sentence says this old city was underwater so even if they could have been able to write it would have been washed away.                 These are just some of the many reasons why we have to use artifacts to discover information about ancient people sometimes.

Item_Response: Ancient civilizations have captivated us for years. Archaeologist have made many discoveries about them over the years. Some have even changed our ways of thinking about people of a certain time, or whole civilizations. Recent discoveries about the ancient Incas, Ancestral Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have been very important to understand them.                         The ancient Incas of South America created an empire that almost equaled the size of Rome for nearly 100 years. Archaeologists have discovered many findings about them, and they have been very important and useful in the understanding of this great civilization. They have left a great picture of the government, religion, agriculture and more, such as art and architecture, and their way of life. The climate in the region has helped preserve many artifacts just waiting to be found. Textiles and cloth or clothing have been been saved very well by the dry deserts, or cold mountains. The art and architecture, like many ancient civilizations, might be stone, pottery, silver, or even gold, these artifacts can last a long time and give us a clear picture.                 Mesa Verde was once home to a people called, Anasazi; who lived there way before Europeans explored North America. These people are now called Ancestral Puebloans due to their modern day descendants. Before they moved to Mesa Verde, they were nomadic, but they began to lead a more settled lifestyle. The first Ancestral Puebloans arrived in Mesa Verde around A.D. 550. They built their homes into the ground, they were known as pithouses. It was a fairly prosperous time for them, as their population multiplied. By A.D. 1000 the people had evolved from pole-and-adobe construction, to stone masonry. Around A.D. 1200, people began moving into the cliff alcoves their ancestors, centuries before, had lived. The arts achieved while living in the alcoves ranks among the best ever seen in North America.                 The source of what inspired one of the most famous tales in human history- the legend of Atlantis- might have been discovered by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists recently. It is an ancient Greek town dating back to Homer's Heroes; that's 5,000 years! There are remains from before the glory days of Greece. This town is called Pavlopetri. It covers 30,000 square meters off the southern Peloponnese. Evidence shows the town was occupied at least 1,200 years earlier than previously thought.                 All of these were very important discoveries. they helped us understand, ancient peoples, like the Incas and Ancestral Puebloans. Without discoveries by archaeologists we wouldn't know a thing about them. We also discovered the oldest submerged town in the world. These discoveries will help us understand history, and the people who have lived throughout it.

Item_Response: Discoveries of the past have always helped us whether it is with learning from our mistakes or simply finding out how we evolved as a species. Discoveries like the discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri and their lifestyles. First lets talk about the discoveries made of the different peoples.      First the Incas we know they were a civilization that ruled South America with an empire that rivaled Ancient Rome from 1438-1532. Although the Europeans arrived in the empire and described them in letters and diaries they did not speak the Inca language well so they may be inaccurate. Historical records of peoples like these are important for us to understand were there empire went wrong and learn from there way of life.      Next the Puebloans the first of them were settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550 they first lived in pit-house until they began building house above ground. Also acquired the bow and arrow more efficient weapon for hunting then their original atlatl (a spear thrower). Then at about A.D. 200 they began to move back to their ancestors way of life on the cliff alcoves and we do not know why. Records like these help understand how we have evolved and how we evolve provided by the information above this helps us understand how far we have come.      Last the Pavlopetri, were the lost city in the waters off southern Greece. This has inspired one of the most famous myths, Atlantis. It dates back to 2800 to 1200 BC much farther back than the Puebloans or Incas. This gives us even more information about our original ancestors. Investigations of this city have found possible governing techniques such as a monumental structure  which suggests it had been used by an elite. It shows how people lived at that time but also is of interest to scientists.      Whether we our leaning about our ancestral past or learning from their mistakes, discoveries like these have helped and will always continue to.

Item_Response: After reading from the sources Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past by: Beth Gruber I have realized how important ancient civilizations are. These civilizations can tell us as modern day people about how life used to be. It just amazes me how much can be learned about ourselves through learning about ancient civilizations. The Inca have been very hard to find any information about, because they left no written history. Although they did live in high in the Andes mountain which made for something like a time capsule. ' The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn abour how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived. After reading Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World I realized how much houses and buildings have changed people used to live in houses called pithouses which are just a pit dug a few feet into the ground and then overlayed with sticks and materials to make a roof. These houses had a small hole in the roof for an air duct for fires. After reading Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets. by Helena Smith in Athens I realized that there are so many things that haven't been discovered that may be very close at hand but yet so far. In this quote ' Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have been surveyed.' i think well that means that there is alot that we could discover if we could just go a little bit deeper. This is why I think the discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and The Pavlopetri are so important.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations by Brant Schaffitzel        Have you ever wondered to yourself what ancient civilizations were very important? Well you should. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations were all super important civilizations. The Inca's amazing art, the Puebloans great crafts, and the Pavlopetri's crazy good buildings of their time! They were all amazing is the only thing you can say.        The Inca of Peru civilization did not leave archives for historians to study, but they kept records on strings. Also, clues left behind from the Inca helps archaeologists and historians find information about the Inca. The discoveries about the Inca show us, that religion was very important and so was art. Other discoveries show what the Inca built their objects and buildings out of. I think that the Inca of Peru were very advanced for their time based of these discoveries.        The Puebloans left many clues that showed us that they were known as Basket-makers for their skill at that activity. Also, it is seen that the Puebloans started to build houses above ground, with upright poles and mud. This great civilization only lived about 100 years on their main land, and archaeologists have found several reasons on why they might have migrated. Without archaeologists, this ancient civilization would have probably never been found again.        One of the most interesting ancient civilizations, that of the Pavlopetri, went undiscovered for about 5,00 years! The town where the Pavlopetri's lived was sunken at the bottom of the ocean just sitting there waiting to be found. When archaeologists did finally find this magnificent city, it was amazing. Archaeologists discovered a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. The Pavlopetri were definitely way out of their time of civilizations. I think they were one of the most important archaeology finds ever.        All of these very important discoveries of ancient civilizations could have never been done without archaeologists finding them. The importance of archaeologists is getting bigger and bigger as eagerness for finding more new ancient civilizations is growing. I hope one day archaeologists can find our civilization and be just as amazed as I was while reading about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetris.

Item_Response: Discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are extremely important and provide contribution to the way we live our life today. It might not seem that way in the 21st century, but the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri invented and inovated multiple materials and concepts that we could not live without today.       The first important discovery of the past involves the Puebloans. 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World' by the National Parks Service U.S. Department of the Interior says this: 'Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood...they learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow.' So basically, the Puebloans were some of the first groups of people to settle down, farm, and become civilized, birthing the whole idea of a civilization and nations, cities, countries, etc. While doing so, they invented the process of making pottery, and the bow and arrow, which later evolved (although we kept the bow and arrow) into a gun, which is mainly what the United States uses for protection today.       The second important discovery of the past involves the Inca. 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past' by Beth Gruber states this: 'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologist and others can piece together details of Inca life.' The archaeologists' discoveries allow them to piece together an Inca past, giving the modern age clues to how people in the past lived. We're learning where we came from, the origin of our ideas and inovations.       For these two reasons, it is concluded that the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri invented and inovated multiple materials and concepts that we could not live without today.

Item_Response: The discovery of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri is one of many major discoveries for human kind including their tools, their agriculture, and their disappearence.                         The Incas were one of the first technicians to be on Earth.  Incas have made clothing by hand, a writing system, and even calenders that were used by the sun.  The puebloans however were one of many ancient civilizations to farm.  Farming and hunting was their only way to get food because there was no other villages around them.  Greek civilization is by far the most complex agriculural system.  Greeks made temples, kingdoms, drama, and myths.                          Secondly, their agriculture was very different than today.  Incas and Puebloans lived in strong huts, but Greek life was lived in a large empire.  Greeks were polytheism, meaning believes in many gods, like Zeus, Hades, and Poseiden.  Puebloans built a temple to pray for rain for their crops to grow.  Incas however had a religion where some were sacrificed to the heavens.                          Lastly, some people don't know why their temples, and kingdoms disappeared.  It's because of strong storms, and volcanos.  Incas have lived their lives close to a dersert which means the possibility that Inca is buried with sandstorm, and same thig with Puebloans.  Greeks however built one large city named the city of Atlantis, and it is now gone.  The reason why is because that city was made really close to ocean and there was a volcano that errupted.  The city of Atlantis went under water and still is.                             To conclude the importance of ancient civilization, Inca, Puebloans, and Greek are all both very important towards today.  People today still use the tools they used then.

Item_Response: Inca was an formal of Peru, it had no formal letter(Alphabet) or system of writing. Inca made up alot of things like colored string knots called quipus to record calender to keep a count of livestock. Europeans was so amzed when they first met the ancient Inca of Peru. They were amazed because they could run a huge empire using strings to keep rcords. Archaeologist found lots of Inca. But today it seems like it doesnt exist, because no one knows what knots mean.                    Civilization lasted for 94 years, nearly a hundred years(1438-1532) thats almost a whole century. It ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome.  Some of the Inca stories was legends rather than stories. They may not leave have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate.                     The inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountains peaks. Many of theirsites are in remote, high places. Some inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on moutain tops. This has helped to preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them. But it also makes he job of archaeologist more difficult.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopertri are important because we learn about what happened in the past.  We will also learn about their housing and where they live and about their artifacts.          The Incas lived in Peru from 1438-1532.  Clues that were left behind for archeologists helped the archeologists picture life for the Incas.  Archeologists found artifacts that were made from gold, silver, stone, and pottery.  Archeologists also fond textiles and clothing from the sites.  Some archeologists even found some remains frozen in ice in the Andes.           The Puebloans lived in North America and for 700 years they lived there but in the late A.D. 1200s they left.  The first Puebloans settled around A.D. 550.  They were good at basket weaving and they were nomadic.  They then started to settle down and they started to farm.  They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages.  By A.D. 1000 the people started to make better houses.  They then started to make pottery which made the baskets decline in quality.  They then started to build houses called Kivas.  By about A.D. 1300 the Puebloans left.          The  Pavloperti lived in Greece.  There town is one of the oldest submerged town in the world.  Some of their remains date back to 2800 to 1200 BC.  It is believed that the town was consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.  Archeologists have found ceramics which date all the way back to the end of  the stone age.  There are theories of why the town sank.  But we may never know.          That was important information about civilizations a long ago.  We have learned a lot about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopertri.  I hope you have learned a lot about all these civilizations.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca:                            Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past                                    Have you ever wondered about the Inca?       The discoveries that archeologists have found are pretty amazing like metals, pottery, buildings, bodies, scrolls, and documents. The ancient Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They actually mad different colored strings to keep track of everything. They even kept track of livestock with strings thats pretty amazing to me! But nobody knows what these strings tell they could possibly tell stories.         Many archeologists have not found anything before because of grave robbers or looters but in the Andes where some Inca lived the Inca but their treasure on mountian tops or in caves where nobody could get them. Archeologists have found preserved bodies so the experts can scan the bodies and tell them how the Incas lived and what they did. In Atlantis the experts have found main streets, buildings, metals, religious buildings, weapons, scrolls, and documents. They have even found clothes that have been down in Atlantis for a long time which is pretty amazing. Inca lived in Pithouses where it had four corner timbers support the roof. It had a living room sunk a few feet in the ground and the firepit had an air deflector. It also had a antechamber that might of contained storage bins or pits. The Pithouses later became into Kivas.

Item_Response: This article is going to explain why I think that the Inca, Mesa Verde, and Lost Greek City are important. This article is going to provide a brief incite on my opinion.               I feel that it is important that we discovered the Inca because they provided us with the system of string and knots. According to the article, that is the system they used to keep their civilization running so smoothly. Although there is noway of knowing what the knots on the string meant it is documented in the writings of the Europeans. I also think it was good that the Europeans documented what they saw to help depict the Inca civilization. I feel that it is important to see how the Inca lived to help subdue some of the curiosity we have as humans.               I feel that it is important that we found the Mesa Verde civilization because we were able to see how they lived and how organized they were. The Mesa Verde civilization was very well thought out. They left behind the houses that they lived in and they also showed how the were expressed through the art of pot decorating. I think that it would be very important to find some of the baskets that they weaved because you can see what kind of people they were and also how they progressed in their talents throughout the years.                I feel it is important that we found the 'Lost Greek City' because it was a legend that people grew up with all over the world and I think that it is cool that that legend can be confirmed that there really was a lost city in the ocean. Even though it wasn't Atlantis, it is still pretty cool. I think it was important that the town did end up underneath the ocean because otherwise, I feel like another civilization would have probably inhabited it and it would not be how they left it.               I hope this paper provided some incite as to how I felt about the ancient civilizations. I also encourage the reader of this paper to study the ancient civilizations because I think that they are very interesting to learn about and attempt to understand.

Item_Response: Archaeologists do not know how the Inca lived, but they do have clues. The Inca lived in the Andes mountains and may have even worshiped some of the mountain peaks. They use to make knots in colored strings to record the calendar and to keep count of livestock. Some clues they left behind form an amazing portrait of their religion like the art, arcgitecture, agriculture, government, and way of life. By looking at these clues we can piece together details of Inca life.       Some of our knowledge comes from atrifacrs or objects that they left behind for us. The objects might be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These materials last a long time, even for a hundred years. Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings or in the graves of the dead.       Most Inca sites are destroyed by treasure hunters or looters, who take nything that they might think is worth some money.       Inca is important because they make us realize that nothing is easy, (like this paper) and that it could be fun to research, search, or reveal the unknown.       And what makes the Lost City so important is that it is the oldest, underwater mystery EVER! And there are many legends told... but im not gonna get into that right now.

Item_Response: Discovering these ancient civilizations in so important because they are an advance civilization and we can learn from them if we pay attention to their legacy.               The Inca of Peru were very advaned they had no formal alphabet or any system of writing.  They made knots in colored string called quipus to keep record of the calendar and/or to keep count of livestock.  The Eruopeans were amazed that the Inca could run a huge empire with only a string to keep records on.  Archaeologists have managed to find some of these ancient quipus but to this day no one knows how to read or interpret them.  The Inca lived high up in the Andis Mountains so some of the bodies are frozen up there, these bodies can lend us great knowlege of how they lived and what they ate ect.                The Puebloans also called the cliff-dwellers lived in the four corners region of the United States.  These Native Americans were some of the firstin the area to start settleing down and replacing hunting with farming.  They built more permanent dwellings and they learned to make pottery to cook in.  Not much is known about these people, they left no written records and very few pictures so all we know about them is through their buildings and structures.                 The lost Greek city proved a lot of fun family myths to be true.  This ancient city sits on 30,000 square meters of land underwater.  Scientists think that the city was swallowed by the sea around 1000 BC.  Scientists used digital technology to survey the ruins.  Since the city was protected by the bay it was not hard to survey the whole town.  They found all kinds of very very old artifacts which took everyone by surprise proving that it was older than once thought.                 These are just some of the reasons that I think these civilizations are important.

Item_Response: Inca of Peru       The ancient Inca of Peru had no system of writing. They didn't leave anything for us to study but they did leave knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Archaeologists found many of the ancient quipus but no one really knows what the knots mean.       Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history. Oral history is stories that get passed down from generation to generation. Passing down the stories was very important for knowing about how they lived.       Also we know some of this stuff because they were written down by the Europeans who went to the empire in 1532. Those people were soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.       We also know from objects they left behind. Such as tools or pottery or even weapons. But also some of them were buried in graves for the dead to use them in the afterlife.       Clothing and textiles also remarkably survive. Usually ancient materials like cloth usually get destroyed by dampness. Especially if they were in the cold mountains of the Andes.       The Ancestral Puebloans       A group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. This happened about 1,400 years ago long ago before Europeans explored North America. For more than 700 years they lived in Mesa Verde.       The first Ancestral peubloans settled in Mise Verde about A.C. 550. They were known as Basketmakers because they were skilled in crafting. Formerly nomadic, they began to lead a more settle way of life. Like farming replaced hunting adn gathering as their man livehood. They lived in pithouses. The pithouses were clustered into small villages. They made pottery and aquired the bow and arrow. The bow and arrow was a more efficient weapon for hunting than the spear.       The peubloans lived in pithouses from about A.D, 550 to A.D. 750. It featured a living room that sunk a few feet from the ground. The four corner timbers supported the roof.       By A.D. 1000 the peobloans of Mesa Verde got better on their artwork. Their artwork advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Pottery also changed. It changed from simple designs on a gray backround to black drawings on a white backround.        In the 1880s local cowboys reported cliff dwellings, archeologists have sought to understand the people's lives. But some of the scientific knowledge remains sketchy. We will never know the whole story: they left no written records and much that was very important in their lives has perished.       Ancestral Peubloans lived in the cliff dwelling for less than 100 years. By about A.D.1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. We know that the last quarter of the A.D. 1200s saw drought and crop failures but these people had survived earlier droughts. Perhaps there were social and political problems, and the people simply looked for new opportunities elsewhere.       When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexicoand Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there. Whatever might have happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and probobly other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa verde.       Antlantis       The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.       Antlantis has been explared by an Angle-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of sice and wealth of detail is un precedented, experts say.       Atlantis straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is belived to have fallen in the sea around 1000 BC. Although 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists were able to properly survey the ruins.       Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs adn religious structures, In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.       Our investigations also reveald over 9.000 square meters of new buildings. But what really took us by surprise was the discobery of a possible megaron.       Marine geologists have yet to work out why the lost city sank. But theories include that sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earth quakes, or a tsunami.       'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going,' said Sakellariou. 'Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.'

Item_Response: Acient Inca has been one of the most mysterious cilizations that has been studied. So now the scientists are still trying to discover more details of this mysterious civilization. They had great farmland to have this civilization on the run. Also they left some artifacts after the end of this civilization.        Greek Mythology has influenced the Marine geologists today to try to discover all of their work. The geologists have tried to intent to complete this mission but they have never found nothing. This civilization was 'flooded', and sunk to the bottom of the ocean and was called the 'Lost City'.Today scientists are trying to find out if this was a myth or a fact.

Item_Response: It was important for them to find the discoveries that they did about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri because it is interesting to people. It tells them about what their ancestors where like and how they lived. Finding more about these things educates people and lets them know stuff they may have not known before.            The Incas lived in Peru. They didn't have an alphabet or system of writing so they used colored strings and knots. The Incas left clues for archaeologists to about their religion, art and agriculture, govenment, transportation, and way of life. Some of what we know ab out the Incas came from objects that had been left behind like stone, pottery, gold, silver, textiles, and clothing. Graves and building also gave them information.            Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde. They are known as basketmakers. They lived in pithouses in small villages. Later on they began building houses above ground and over time they got bigger and better. People began to move back into cliff alcoves after time went on. When the cliff dwellers left they went to New Mexico and Arisona.                Pavlopetri is the lost city. It is beneathe the waters off southern Greece. It is the oldest submerged town in the world that was a planned town. Around 1000 BC is when the city was under water. Protected buioldings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, pottery, and religios structures where found.                By finding these things it proved that there are sunken cities. It also tells about other peoples lives that have lived on earth before us. They can study these thihngs to find out more information about the past and even about them.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architeture, agriculture, goverment, transportation, and way of life. As in many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have discovered quiet a few ancient civilizations in the past 100 years. Three of them are the Inca's, Mesa Verde, and a lost Greek city. The archaeologists have had a hard time searching all three for artifacts and answers about how they lived.       The archaeologists had a hard time with the Inca's ancient civilization because of treasure looters. Treasure looters are people who go to ancienct civilizations and other places just in search of artifacts that might be worth money. The Inca's lived in the mountains, and had some well preserved artifacts. Archaeologists found sticks with knots of colorful string, which they thing was the Inca's way of counting livestock. Since the Inca's lived in the mountains, it was difficult for the archaeologists to get there with all of their supplies.       The archaeologists discovered how the people of Mesa Verde lived and hunted. They lived in houses called pithouses. They had one wall, and a partial wall. The roof only covered 3/4 of the house, and two walls were left open. The people of Mesa Verde used bows and arrows as their deffense technique.       The archaeologists had the most difficult time getting to the lost Greek city because it is under water. The archaeologists found many artifacts covered in sand because of the water currents. The archaeologists found many buildings, tomb stones, and some pottery while searching the lost city.       The archaeologists had hard times exploring the many ancient civilizations they have found because of where they are located, or because of treasure looters. Overall, archaeologists have found many different ancient civilizations over the past 100 years, and three of them are the Inca's, Mesa Verde, and the lost Greek city.

Item_Response: Finding cities from the the past makes many people excited because we get to learn about how people from the past used to behave and live.We can also learn  why the city or people no longer exist. The Inca, the Ancestral Puebloans and the Lost City are three important discoveries.       First of all, the Inca is an important discovery because it was a mighty empire that came to an end. Artifacts found in the Andes mountains are important because we get to know hoe the manage to live and survive int the colds of Andes.We know we get to know how they kept up with records and number and other daily things.Finding artifacts about the Inca might help us know where the Inca people came from and what language did they speak.       Next the discovery of the Puebloans is important because it's they first well elaborated city found in the U.S. We get to know how they lived.Puebloans were able to build their house on top of rocks.But what we don't know is why they disappeared.Hopefully with artifacts and the new technology we get to know.       Also the discovery of the Lost City in Greek is important because it makes us wonder even  more if Atlantis is real.It's also important because it the oldest city found. The city was also very well organized.       Lastly, all this discoveries are important because we get to know about the pass.Hopefully we will find more cities to help us know even more.

Item_Response: Historians and archeaologists have been finding valuble artifacts from long ago civilizations. These artifacts help them figure out how the civilizations lived their life, and how hard thier life was for them.      The artifacts are important because we can find what happened years before, how ancient people lived thier life, how they were entertained, and so on. For example the Inca are ine of the civiliztions historains and archiologists are studying. Thanks to artifacts, we now know a lot of stories about them, what they wore, where they lived, what time period they lived in, and so on.        Nother example are the puebloans. They also left artifacts behind such as, their homes baskets, pottery, and so on. by their artifact we know that at one point they made a lot of baskets, farmed a lot ,and so on.     Another example is Atlantis the artifacts found can help find when it was made, which can tell us when thhat civilization was started, or ended.      If we don't find a lot of artifact then we do not know a lot about that certin civilization. Take  the Cliff Dwellers as an example, they did not leave a lot of artifacts, therefore we know almost nothing about them. The more artifacts we; find the more we konow about the civilization. the less artifacts uncovered; the less we know about that civilization.

This is why the discoveries of these amazing places are important to us.

Item_Response: Archeologists face many problems while searching for artifacts, they also come across many great finds as well. the artifacts they find help them learn more about how the civilization lived, kept records and much more.        Over time artifacts begin to fade away or become destroyed. weathering and erosion are a very big part of this. if an artifact is found that is eroded, nothng is learned about that civilization. exceptionally, preserved artifacts are a very important find as it shows the culture and prosperity of the civilization.         Ancient Inca is mostly known for its oral history because the artifacts that are found are either badly ruined or not very understandible. Many artifacts are found burried in sand or in graves. The dry climate in Peru helps to keep these artifacts preserved.          There is also other civilizations that are very known, such as Atlantis. This place was mostly a myth until a diver in Greece came across an underwater city. This city is believed to be spread out 30,000 miles uner the ocean. Courthouses, streets, religios structures and thousands of shards of pottery were revealed. Being the oldest town semerged under water, it is also very well preserved and tells about the everday lives of the peole that lived there.            Archeologists are still finding many artifacts located in these spots and continue searching, in hopes to find more about the people that lived there.

Item_Response: Archaeology             The acient Artifiacts from Inca are very valiable. The people who go and actually find the artifiacts they have to take a task. The task they go through they have to be very careful.           In acient Inca they had no way of formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives of historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored rope to keep track of their livestock.           The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archarologists have found the stings with knots in them before, but no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.           There have been lots of clues left behind by the Inca. Such as portraits of their religon, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying the remains the atcharologists can piece together some of the ways that Incas' lived. They also have heard differnt stories about the Inca.            The fall of the Inca is easy to date beacause the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. The area where they lived had long been inhavited by different peoples. Arvhaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world the discover more about the Inca's predecssors.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. You find about the religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.            Archaeologists confirm historical record. Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it. Some Inca textiles and clothing have survived remarkably well. Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that the experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died and how they lived.            Puebloans known as basket makers for their skill at the craft began to lead a more settled way of life. They replaced hunting and gathering for farming as there main livelihood. They learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. The basket makers began building houses above ground from pole and mud. Later on they advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Pottery also changed, from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. Cliff dwellings tell of a persons adept of building, artistic in their crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land.            Pavolopetri, the sunken  settlement dates back some 5,000 years is considered a planned town, that's why it is unique. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. What took the investors by surprise was the discovery of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, which also suggests that the town had been used by an elite, and automatically raised the status of the settlement. 'It is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied,' said Elias Spondylis. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece.            The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. There are a lot of things that are still yet to be discovered. Archaeologists are still searching and finding things right this very moment.

Item_Response: The discovery of ancient civilizations have led many archaeologist to learn about the history of the past.There are many discoveries that are important to the world. Do you wonder why some historical discovers are so important?There are three very important discoveries such as the Inca,the Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri.          The discovery of the Inca civilizations was important for several different reasons. They did not have a formal alphabet or system of writing instead they made knots in colored string called quipus.Quipus were used as a calendar to keep a count of there livestock.The first Europeans were surprised that the Inca ran there huge empire by using strings to keep records.The stories that were tied into the strings,will probably never be understood.Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion,art, and architecture,agriculture,government, transportation, and there way of life.We also know some of there stories because the Europeans wrote down when they first arrived to the empire in 1532. Historians have to be cautious when they interpret the writings.Some of the information may not be accurate plus some of the Inca stories were legends.Some Inca sites have been looted and taken because they are valuable.The fall of the Inca was known because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king om 1532 and took over the empire.These are some of the reasons why the Inca's are important.            Next,The discovery of the Puebloan civilization was important for several different reasons.About 1,400 years ago, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde to live at.The first Ancestral Puebloans were known as Basketmakers for the crafting skills.They lived in pithouses inside of small villages usually built on mesa tops or cliff recessed.They made pottery and efficient weapons for hunting.By 750 A.D there population multiplied so they started to build there houses above ground instead of below.They changed there building skills to stone masonry which was building houses our of stone.There population soon reached more then one thousand causing them to change there living style to a compact village with many rooms.The Puebloans baskets declined in quality because pottery became widespread.They worshiped in Kiva's or ceremonial rooms.Kiva's were used for healing rites such as praying for rain,hunting, and good crops. Ancestral Puebloans built dwellings beneath overhanging cliffs which they lived in for less then 100 years.Mesa Verde became deserted.The main theory why it became deserted is because of possible migration.There was a possible land depletion. After they left the moved south to  New Mexico and Arizona.This is why the Ancestral Puebloans are important.            Finally,the Pavlopetrians are a Ancient Greek team that learn about Greece. They are a group of archaeologists and marine geologists who studied Greece.A sunken settlement that dates back to about 5,000 years ago was discovered by a British oceanographer 40 years ago.It is called Atlantis because of Plato had a allegorical tale about a sunken continent.Dr.Jon Henderson said 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world' because it has remains dated back from 2800 to 1200 BC long before the days of classical Greece.There are older sunken sites but none of them seem to be planned towns such as Atlantis.Atlantis is 30,000 square meters on the bottom of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese.It is believed to be consumed by the sear around 1000 BC.The exploration revealed a world of builds and courtyards and many more things.'Atlantis was a myth...' said Sakellariou.This is why the Pavlopetrians are important.            In conclusion,There are three very important discoveries such as the Inca,the Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri.There are many more reasons that are being discovered or have not been discovered yet.Although these are important discovery's there are many more waiting to be discoveries by society and history.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca              Long ago there was an ancient empire. The people of  this empire were known as the Inca. Scientists have been trying to find information on this mysterious empire.             The Inca had no written system, however; scientists have still been able to find clues about the Incan civilization. Some of what we have find out comes from stories passed through generations. Most of what we know about the Inca came from artifacts and sites where the artifacts were discovered. Archaeologists have found objects made from materials such as stone, pottery, silver, and gold. Scientists know the Incans believed in afterlife from artifacts buried in graves. Scientists have found textiles and clothing that has survived through the generations. Many of the sites discovered have been looted by treasure hunters, although some sites have still been useful to scientists. Many artifacts and sites fit with the Spanish accounts of the Inca.             In conclusion, it is impossible to know everything about the Incan Empire. What we have learned though has been good information for our world history. I expect much more to be learned about our world's past.

Item_Response: The Incas were Native Indians that kived long ago. They livedin Peru before the Mexicans. They belived in an afterlife, spirits, and other agicultrial belifs. They used thread of assorted colors to keep record of things, like a calender, or codes. They had made bueatiful empires, and had made them of stone. Some people call them Anasazio, a navajo word meaning 'the acient ones', or 'the acient enimies'.  The Spanish had arrived in  1532. The Incas befriended them, thinking they were gods, serving them with gold. Item_Response: Have you ever heared of Ancient Ince? Or the Mesa Verde? Or even  the lost Greek city of Atlantis? If not then you should because this or importent fact you should know. Well even if you don't know i will help you to know the importent fact.        This are some fact of Ancient Ince. The Ince of  Peru didn't real have a alphabet or system of writing. They didn't leave nothing for us to study about. So you may think then how we know about there civilzation for hundred's of year's ago well that easy they left clues like religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government , transportation and way of life. Well some of what we know about them came form oral history or stories passed down from generation to generation. We know some of this stories because they were written by the Europeans who arrived in the emire in 1532. People who study these site keep careful records. People may say then what happen to them well the Spaniards murdered the last Ince king in 1532. Well that all we know about them so far but archaeologists are still trying to find every thing about them but there are just so little we know.        Some facts of the Mesa Verde. About 1,400 years ago a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for thier home. But in the late A.D. 1200's in the spain of a generation or two they left their homes and moved away. Archeologists call this people Anasazi and it mean's the 'the ancient ones'. They are real skill at crafting. In A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the classic period the popuation had growen several thousand. About A.D. 1200 another major population shift saw people begain to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancesrors centuries before. In the classic period of A.D. 1100 to A.D. 1300 the Ancestarl Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous cicilzation whose accomplishment in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America. Kiva is like a churches to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop. Thats all we know about them for now.        Some facts of the Lost City of Atlantis. One day a diver explores the sunken settlemant beneath the water off sourthen Greece. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths the fable of Atlantis thats have been brought to light from benath the water off southen Greece. Dr Jon Henderson said that is the no doudt  the oldest submerged town in the wrold. It has been remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the classic Greece. The site which straddles is 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off of the southen Pelopnnese, that it is believed to have been consuned by the sea around 1000 BC. Although discovered by a British oceanographer spme 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists aided by diital tecnology were able to proerly survey the ruins Whta the found surpassed all expections. Thanks to shifting sand and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a wroid od buildings, counrtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. IN addition the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. Well thats all the know about the Lost city of Atlantis.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca: Reveals Secrets from the Past       Ancient Inca unfortunately didn't have a system of communicating such like writing or an alphabet, and didn't leave documents for further research. They did made something called quipus  which were knots with colored strings in order to record a calendar to keep a number of livestock. The first Europeans to discover that the Inca used knots to keep a record were really surprised. Recent studies from archaeologists have discovered many quipus but not know what they actually mean. In understanding the Ancient Inca, its like understanding a mystery without many clues.   A useful thing that has helped us identify their religion, art, architecture, government, transportation, and many more are clues that were left behind. Most of what we know about it is because of oral history, which was a fantastic war to keep a cummunity's history. Spanish soldiers and priests were able to describe the Inca by diaries and letters.Since the Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language, it makes it hard for historieans to interpret the accounts. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts that were left behind.   Something we know about the Inca is that they lived high in the Andes and worshiped mountain peaks. Many Inca were buried in case/mountain tops, which helped to preserve the sites. Expert mountaineers are high-altitude archaologists which work really hard because of looters. They have to go through colds because of freezing mountains!       Mesa Verde Nationa Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World       Mesa Verda National Park serves as a wonderful, fantastic reminder of ancient culture,(now called Anazi) and is translated as 'ancient enemies' or 'ancient ones'. In about A.D. 1000 Mesa Werde's people advanced! Pottery changed now on a white background. Then by A.D. 1300 its population reached to several thousand.During summer, fires were built for cooking, then in the winter the alcove rooms were uncomfortable and alcove rooms. Ancestral Puebloans lived in dwellings for about 100 years! By A.D. 1300 Mesa Verde was sadly deserted. There are many theories for the people's migration, most likely because of social and political problems.       Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets       Atlantis was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologits have been studying thesunken settlement of the times of Homer's heroes. The site is about 30000 square metters of ocean off the southern Pelopomnsese. Although the settlement was discovered by a British oceanographer, it was this year that it was aided by digital technology! This exciting search revealed courtyards, rock-cut tombs- religious structures, and building. A question still needs to be answered, why did the settlement sank? Marine-geologists have to work in the questions and still need to answer.Overall,  Atlantis is a wonderful myth that may keep going and discover more about underwater exploration going! Who knows what may be discovered in your lifetime!

Item_Response: Many important discoveries have been made in the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Some Inca textiles and clothing have survived. Usually, Ancient material like cloth are destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry desert on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Also, several Inca sites have been disturbed by the treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today.  The Inca lived in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. As the years pass by many discoveries, and facts about the Inca have been discovered.            The first Ancestral Puebloans were in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. This Puebloans were known as Basketmakers because of their crafting skills. Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for almost 100 years. Mesa Verde was deserted by about A.D. 1300. After some time, Puebloans migrated and there's several theories that caused it. When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south to New Mexico and Arizona, settling with their kin who were there already. Many of our tribes are descendants  of the Ancestral Puebloans.            The sunken settlement beneath the waters of southern Greece, known as Pavlopetri were explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. Their findings were a surprice to all of them. The exploration reveled a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights in the workings of Mycenaean society. This is how we have been discovering about this important societies.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the ancient Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because they show us things from acient time. The artifacts found and discovered can help teach us about their way of life from long ago. The discoveries are crucial to our history.          One of the important discoveries archaeologists have made is about the ancient Inca of Peru. They had no formal alphabet or system of writing. Because of this, there are no written artifacts that historians can study. But, there are other things that we can learn from. The Inca made colored knots and put them in a string to record the calendar to keep count of their livestock. These colored strings are called quipus. Although archaeologists have found these quipus, it is very difficult to figure out what they mean. Alot of what we know about the Inca has peen bassed down orally, or through stories that have been passed down from generation to generation. We now know of the stories because of the Europenas. When they arrived in the Incan empire in 1532, they recorded and wrote down what they heard. So, even though we have no written references from the Inca themselves, we have references from the Europeans. Most of the artifacts that historians find that the Inca left behind, are made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. The reason they made their tools from those materials is because they last a long time and are very durable, which is why we can still dicover them today.          Discoveries have also been made about the Puebloans. Long ago, before even the Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in a region called the Four Corners, chose Mesa Verde for their home. For over 700 years, they and their descendants lived and reproduced here. They eventually started building communities of their own and sheltered themselves and their families in alcoves of canyon walls. Then, sometime during the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes behind and moved away. The National Park of Mesa Verde preserves a reminder of the acient culture of the Puebloans. Archaeologists have discovered many interesting things about them, and have even called them Basketmakers, because of their crafty skill. They had once been nomadic, and moved from place to place often, but they were beginning to lead more permanent lives. Instead of hunting, they began farming and gathering food. They all lived together in what is called pithouses and were clustered into small villages of amny groups of people. They acquired the skill of pottery, bow and arrow making, and even started to make spears for spearing fish. For a very long time, they were doing reallty well, and the population continued to grow larger. By the time A.D. 1000 the Puebloans of Mesa Verde had advanced their skills from adobe construction, to the skill of stone masonry. Another thing that changed for the better was pottery. It used to be plain and simple, but now, it was detailed and even had interesting designs on it. Somewhere between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, the population may have reached about several thousand people. This time period is known as the Classic Period.          The last empire that has given archaeologists many things to study and learn from would be the Pavlopetri. The settlement of this group of people is now sunken beneath the waters off southern Greece. It is known as a lost city because it is now underwater. It also may have inspired one of the world's most fascinating myths, the fable of Atlantis. This settlement dates back some 5,000 years. People have also said that this may be the oldest town submerged under water. The settlement is said to have been consumed by the sea somwhere around 1000 BC. It was discovered by a British oceanographer about 40 years ago. What him, and many other people discovered from this settlement beneath the sea was far more than they had expected. Because of the shifting sands and the encolsure of the stellemt, it protected the bay. The town underwater revealed many buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and even religous structures. But there was more. Along with all of that, the seabed was covered with thousands of shards of broken up pottery that was once created by the Pavlopetri. The cermics that they found is said to have dated back to the stone age. That dicovery suggests that the settlement was occupied 5,000 years ago. This particular settlement is significant because as a submerged city, it was never again reoccupied after the Pavlopetri. The settlement dicpvered is extremely important to our hisotry because it is the first sunken city that has been found in Greece.          In conclusion, there are many important dicoveries that have been made, with the help of three interesting empires : the ancient Inca of Peru, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. With all the dicoveries that have been made, archaeologists have been able to learn so much from what they have seen.
