Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incan, Puebloans, and the city of Pavloperti are so important in their own ways but the most important part is that it shows what humankind has done and what we as a race has accomplished in the times before our generation and it teaches the generations to come.           The discovery of the Incan Empire was very important for researchers because it shows us that they were able to keep track of an entire empire just by using strings called quipus. The Incans also lived in  mountain ranges like the Andes. Since it is very hard to to scale the mountains it was very hard for attackers to be able to reach them. The next ancient civilization is the Puebloans.          Puebloans were very intenlligent for their era in which they lived. It was such an important find for researchers because they had superb architectural skills, in which they built very elaborate communities made of stone and alcoves that kept them secure and safe in the canyon walls of Masa Verde. The Puebloans were also very skilled in the hunting trade. They first used an atlatl which threw spears, later on they built a very high tech bow and arrow, for their time, to hunt. These peple also excelled in the art of pottery and wall building, they created large stone masonry and they also painted with more color and art than just painting a single color. The next important find was the city erected by the Greeks.          Pavlopreti was an underwater city spotted by a team of marine geologists. This city is so important because it dates back to over five-thousand years ago and is one of the oldest submerged towns of all time. The importance of this town is that most of its buildings and houses are intact. This helps the researchers see the beautiful and brilliant Greek architecture. When they were close enough to the city they could see buildings, courtyards, tombs, main streets, and religious buildings, most of them were not destroyed and still stood tall. The team found pottery scattered all over the ground and when they researched them, the pots dated back one thousand and two hundred years before their first assumptions on how old this city was.         All of these civilizations are very impotant because it shows us what our race as humans have excelled in and what new technology each one of them have found. The Incan are important because it shows us that they could keep an entire empire in conrol with strings called quipus. Puebloans are important because of their advances in architecture. Finally underwater city called Pavlopreti was such an important because of their planning of the city and the architectural skills of the Greeks. All of these ancient civilizations show you how skilled and advanced they were for their time.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopatri are major discoveries because it shows how people lived in the past and how their societies were.  It will help us show what these societies did wrong and right and we can learn how to better ourselves and our communities.         The Incans were one of the first discoveries.  Ancient Incans used string as their tool to keep records if thing in their society.  To be able to run a society with strings and no words is an amazing accomplishment for a primative society.  Since the Incas also live in the Andes Mountains so archeoligists could learn how their community survived on the side of a mountain.  Even though Incans were a primitive society they could adapt and survive to their environment.        The Ancestral Peubloans became nomadic and replaced their hunting and gathering with farming.  This helps us prove that in any situation their society can change when it needs to.  In their houses they have a firepit that had an air deflecter which meant that it was harder for the fire to be blown out.  This helps us show how even back then human life was intelligent enough to build a working mechanism that them live in harsh weather.        The Pavlopetri were a team of archeoligists and marine geologists that explored Atlantis that ahd been suken beneath the water for centuries.  The sunken city dated back to about 5,000 years ago.  This team Found one of the oldest submerged towns in the world.  Due to shifting sand it preserved this remarkable artifacat and the team found An entire city with courtyards, buildings, churches, and even rock-cut tombs.  This evidence helps use prove that if a civilization could be preserved for thousands of years then we can do the same.       In conclusion the importants of finding these civilizations are cruscial.  The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri help us make our society better by studying what we did wrong and choosing the right descision.

Item_Response: Inca Civilizations   The Inca civilization is a very confusing thing. They had no form of alphabet or any system of writing.This then was very hard to figure out the colorful strings that they had. This was probably their way of communicating however to us we can not understand it and we can not discover much through this. However they do have clues left behind by the Incas. They had a wonderful portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Through these clues we discover more about the Incas and their way of life. The Incas were also a civilization for nearly a hundred years. Those years were 1438 to 1532. We also learn from the Incas from their oral history, or from stories passes down from generation to generation. We know some of these stories because they were written down by the Europeans. They arrived in the empire in 1532. Also the Spanish soldiers and priests described the Incas in things such as diaries or letters. However a problem with this is that the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language very well so historians have to be quite careful when dealing with this to know what they say or mean.       The Inca king was murdered in 1532 and the Spaniards took over the empire. However the origins are hard to trace before this. There was other different people that lived there before and archaeologists have to be careful to know which things are to which certain people.       Many of the Incas sites are in remote, high places. This is because they lived high in the Andes and is said that the may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. This is where some of the Incas were buried. Looters can not get here so it can preserve their sites. However even for archaeologists they have to be expert mountaineers to get up there. This is is a great place to fund them though.The cold isolates their bodies so they are in very good shape and can easy be used for scanning to know how they died. Also these bodies are good for revealing information about how they lived and overall helps archaeologists study more about their kind.       Mesa Verde National Park       Long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living Four Corners chose Mesa Verda for their home. This was about 1,400 years ago. They lived there for more than about 700 years and their descendents also lived there and eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. In the late A.D. 1200s they left their homes and moved away.       The Mesa Verde National Park however preserves a reminder of this ancient culture. Archaeologist call these people Anasazi. This was form a Navajo word translated as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies. Today we call them Ancestral Puebloans. This reflects their modern descendants.       The first ones settled in Mesa Verda in about A.D. 550. They were formerly nomadic but they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. This was when farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They also started to live in pit houses clustered into small villages. These were often built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. Then they started to learn to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. This was a more efficient weapon for hunting than a spear thrower.       In about A.D. 750, they started to begin building houses about ground. With Upright walls made of poles and mud.From then on these people would be known as Puebloans. This was a Spanish world meaning 'village dwellers.'       Then by A.D. 1000 the people in Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe constitutions to skillful stone masonry. They had wall of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stores high. They were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. At this time pottery also changed. It changed from a simple design on a dull gray background to a black drawing on a white background.       The cliff dwellers of Mesa Verda left and traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona. They settled among their kin who were already there.       Lost Greek City- Atlantis           The fable of Atlantis has been brought to light beneath the waters off southern Greece. It was explored by an Anglo- Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. The sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going' says Sakellariou. He also states that less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed.

Item_Response: Many discoveries have made these three civilizations more important. Discoveries about the Incas include artifacts left behind, Spaniards' accounts of what the Inca were like, and stories originally told by the Incas that have been passed down from generation to generation. Some archaeologists have even found bodies preserved by the icy Andes mountains that they have been able to exam and find out why these people died.   Discoveries about the Ancestral Puebloans include many things found in the area they lived in, which is now Mesa Verde. Archaeologists have found that the Puebloans used to live in pithouses and that they used to be nomadic, but settled in Mesa Verde and replaced hunting and gathering with farming.      The discovery of the underwater city was a huge discovery for the Pavlopetri. It told archaeologists more about how these people used to live and how their everyday lives were. Archaeologists were also able to determine how old the city was and when and why it went underwater.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing making it hard for archieologists to figure out facts about them. They used strings, or quipus, to keep count of population, amount of animals they had, crops, and even days of the year just through these colorul strings. They lived in pithouses and, by A.D. 1100, their population may have reached several thousand. Although no one knows what the quipus says, we can infer and keep looking for new artifacts. These people are important due to my research.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations                     Did you knw there actually are lost cities? Like the myth of Atlanis come true. There have been a multitude of lost cities found over the years. Painting the picture of our past, intriging people everywhere. Three examples of lost civilizations are Ancient Inca, the Ancestral Puebloans, and the underwater lost greek city.            To begin, the lost civilations are very interesting. First the Ancient Inca, they were a thriving civilization with record keeping, tombs, temples, burial grounds, ect. So what happened to them? The spaniards may have had someing to do with it but no one knows for sure. Second the Ancestral Puebloans, they moved from the home in Mesa Verde but then went back years later. What happened there? Lastly the underwater city, this town was marvelous courtyards, buildings, streets, tombs, and even religious structures. What caused the city to sink? How did it just all of a sudden dissappear? In conclusion, finding these cities is like sovling a puzzle, and even today we are still trying to fit the peices together.            All in all these lost cities are still mysteries amd are still bringing questions up today. What would you do or think if all of  sudden you stumbled upon a city like Atlantis? That could be you.

Item_Response: Mesa Verde was a nation that devolepd. Many people were known for their pithomes.   Their ancestors devoleped many ideas that amricans use today! ideas on farming and pottery told us alot about their socity. they also knew how to make bows, they used them for hunting.          In about A.D. 550, the first Peubloans settled in Mesa Verde. Normadicly they they were begging to lead a more settled way of life. Hunting was replaced with farming, & gatheringas their main livelihood. A good hunting wepon they made was known as the atlatl, or a sper thrower.          In about A.D. 750 they started to build homes above the surface. homes with upright walls made of poles and mud. The homes were oftenly built together in long curving rows. Their were often their were often pithomes or two in front. From then on they were known as peubloans or 'village dwellers.'           Between 1100- 1300 A.D. during the classsic Period, population reached several thousand. Mostly concentrated In  compact villages of many rooms, often with the kivas(,pithomes that evolved, ) that built the enclosing walls rather than out in the open. In about 1200 A.D. another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff  alcoves that shelterd their ancestors centuries before. Nobody knows why they made this move.            In the end, when the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left they travled south into new mexico onad arizona. they settled among their kin who were already there. whatever happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes are decendants of the ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde. they were very special to our history so we can learn and grow from what they did.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are fascinating because these are civilizations that were hard to learn about. There have been findings of artifacts, lifestyles, and how people lived and survived. How archeologists found, studied, and learned about each civilization is all included.       The Inca's are a lot difficult to study because they had no real evidence to help with every finding of their civilization.There is no evidence of the alphabet or writing,they used stings to record things. Archeologists learned about the Incas from clues given from their oral history,old stories,and Inca artifacts. One of the biggest finds for the Inca civilization is found in the Ande Mountains where they found bodies that reveal info about how they lived and died.       The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde, they were known as Basketmakers.They built most of their settlement and made mostly everything they used.They used nature to their advantage and built dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs.They lived in cliff dwellings less than 100 years then went to New Mexico and Arizona settling among family.       The Pavlopetri is an underwater finding under Greece.This is important because it makes the Atlantis story a bit more true and interesting.It also makes the first sunken city to be found in Greece that predates Plato.

Item_Response: With each new discovery of the past, the sciences and histories of today have advanced and learned. Thanks to civilizations such as the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri we now know how they lived, what many of there customs were, but most importantly, how they survived. Knowing how other civilizations lasted and what caused their downfall is what will help today's society to survive. But there are other useful pieces of knowledge left behind that can teach us new and different ways on how to live. All of these societies were unique, and all have impacted us in some way, shape, or from.   The Incas were a daring, advanced, and quite smart culture that built their settlements atop high mountains, so as to protect from any invaders. Although they still eventually faded away, the impact left was enough for us to study. Showing very advanced knowledge in the areas of math and architecture, the Incas created temples that exceeded and researchers limited imagination. Only visible from the sky and on certain days, some Inca temples show amazing patterns using the stars and sun, and this allows us to realize how important the sky was to them. Knowing this we may learn more about our own universe, from a culture that survived almost 600 years ago.   The Pueblans were quite a contrast from the Incas, dwelling mostly in caves and focusing on basketry. But they too, impacted our society. They showed a new and quite innovative way of living that baffled but also amazed those that first saw it, and still does today. There strange customs and homes have show that every civilization is different in their own unique way, and to compare to societies is like comparing apples to oranges.   The Pavlopetri may yet to be the most strange yet wondrous find ever. This glorious lost city was swept under the mighty ocean years ago, and only recently have we been able to study its mysterious  past. The most magnificent and rich city and that surpassed all expectations has shown that even 5,000 years ago, this civilization was more advanced than some today. Although the ocean provides challenges for excavating this underwater mystery, science has exceeded this limitation and we can know thoroughly investigate and learn all that we can. This rare new find has shown scientists around the world how advanced a culture can become over time.   Throughout the history of the Earth, countless societies have existed together, always wondering and always researching. But only recently have we discovered new more exciting things thanks to the advancements we have today. Because of the scientific discoveries, many researchers today know more about the past than ever before.

We have been greatly given clues and the understanding of the world before us.  By these amazing discoveries we are able to know what we started from, because I know we are all curious.  It uncovers the mystery of our past and shows us the sophistication and brilliance of those who came before us.  By leaving behind, scrolls, clothes, drawings, religous artifacts, journals, tablets, and food, we are able to discover our ancestors way of life.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri cities were very important. Finding these cities will help us understand how much humans have come along in the past few thousand years.        The ancient Greek city of Pavlopetri is a very unique city because it is one of the oldest and only submerged cities and it is the oldest planned city. Scientists believe that the city was submerged in around 1000 BC. Some artifacts were found that were created as old as from 2800 BC. The youngest of Artifacts that were found are suspected to have been made in 1200 BC. The Submerged city of Pavlopetri is a very unique city as it is the oldest planned city. This doesn't even include it being submerged.        The ancient society of the Puebloans was a pretty important find. It is important to today's society to know where we started from. This society lived in pit-houses for about two-hundred years from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. These pit-houses were built on mesa tops and on cliff recesses. We also need to see how far we came along in tools and weapons. We evolved from using just bows, arrows, and spears for hunting.        We know what we know about the Inca's because of the Europeans who had taken over the Inca's and kept records. When the Europeans took over in 1532, they had written down information about the Inca's in letters and in diaries. This gives us a great deal of information even though archaeologists have to be careful when reading and translating these because the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language. We also found information through artifacts such as clothing, pottery, and more valuable items like jewelery. Some of the Inca treasures were stolen, however, by treasure hunters. Some of these artifacts may have been taken years ago or maybe even just yesterday.        In conclusion all three of these cities were very important finds for today's society. All three involve knowing where the human race evolved from in the last few thousand years and with this we can look at what we will evolve into.

Item_Response: Will we ever fully know about our past? Archaeologists, people who find ancient sites and artifacts, contribute their findings to enlighten us about history. For example, we now know about the Incans and a Greek city rumored to be Atlantis itself.                           Inca, a past civilization of Peru, left behind several clues to help archaeologists determine their everyday lifestyle. One of the things Incans left behind was quipus. Quipus was used by them to record the calender to keep track of livestock. These were made out of corlorful string. Another example of materials left behind would be textiles and clothing, but were remarkably well preserved in Peru's arid deserts or cold mountains. Not all artifacts left behind would be preserved well, however. In fact, some of the sites have been raided by thieves, who might take anything valuable. Another hinderance to finding certain Incan artifacts would involve Peru's geographical locations-cliff faces or mountain tops would be difficult to obtain Incan traces. As you can see, the Incans held a fascinating culture, and thanks to talented archaeologists, we know more about it.                     Long ago, the Puebloans were another gathering of people living close to the Mesa Verde region, before the arrival of European explorers. Other names for these people would be 'basketmakers', as they are good at crafting, and 'Anasazi', derrived from a Navajo word. The Puebloans were assumed to be gifted architecturally, because as their population multiplied, they started to build houses on ground level, containing upright walls, poles, and mud. 250 years later, their crafting skills advanced, and they now constructed strong stone masonry. The stone walls are often referred to as great architects.                      Have you ever heard of a myth telling of a secret underwater city? A lost Greek city discovered may have just been the thing that inspired the myth. Investigated by the Greek team of marine geologists and archaeologists-known as Pavlopetri, it is said the deep underwater ruins could date back to 5,000 years. The city was not always underwater. The site is believed to be consumed by the sea around 1,000 BC. This does not mean that everythig was lost. What marine archaeologists found shocked them. Revealed inside the sprawling ruins was a system of buildings, main streets, religious structures, tombs, and courtyards-not unlike what many of our cities have today. All of this was preserved well underneath the ocean's shifting sands and the site's enclosure in a protected bay. If it hadn't been for this, we might not know nearly as much about the find.                      Pieces of the past definitely do teach us different customs and culture. Without the help of archaeologists, we would certainly be 'left in the dark'. In conclusion, historic sites hold fascinating traces of other civilizations not too different than our own that we need to know more about.

Item_Response: Discoveries of the Inca,  the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important discoveries because archaeologists have found and learned many things of their culture and the way they lived. Archeologists have found artifacts made of stone, pottery, gold, and silver from the Inca civilizations helping them in their knowledge in learning about the Incas. The Incas lived in the Andes Mountains, which was freezing, and bodies that were left behind froze and were preserved for archeologists to later find. These bodies later helped scientists learn about how they lived and what caused them to die. Ancestral Puebloans also were an important discovery for scientists because when they left, structures were left behind leaving archeologists to wonder about these peoples lives. These structures do tell us of people who adept at building, artistic in thier crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land. The lost city of Atlantis also is important to archeologists because archeologists have found ceramics and other artifacts dating back to the end of the stone age. These discoveries have benefitted archeologists in many ways in the learning of the old civilizations.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had a new type of formal writing.They did not leave artifacts to have historians study.The Inca made knots in colored strings called quip-us to record the calender to keep a count of livestock.The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could use a real huge empire using strings to keep records.Archaeologists have found many ancient quip-us but today no one knows what the knots mean.Without anyone who could read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a like solving a mystery.                   To begin, The rest of the knowledge of the Incas comes from artifacts,or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts might be objects made from stone,pottery,gold, or silver.Such materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years.Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings.Others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.                      Further more, The most important things to learn about in civilization are where it came from and what happened to it. The fall of the Inca is easy to date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. The origins of the Incas are more   difficult to trace.The area where they lived had long been inhabited by different people.Archaeologists have to be careful to make sure exactly which people built which site.archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world to discover more about the Inca's predecessors.You'll see how aerial photography can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they cannot see from the ground.                                                                                            In Conclusion, Anything they find has to be carried down the mountain for study.The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived.

Item_Response: There are many important reasons why the discoveries were important to us. For one, they taught us a lot about ancient civilizations.       First off, the Inca tied knots in a colored string, called quipus, to record the calendar and keep track of livestock. When the first settlers came they were surprised that they had such a big city, and they kept record with string. Understanding the Inca has not been easy. Even though we've found many quipus, no one knows what the knots mean.        Secondly, the Peubloans built highly complicated stone buildings and structures. The Peubloans were very skilled in architecture and crafting. They also learned how to make bows and arrows, witch was more effective than a spear. There houses where sometimes multilevel and usually very complicated They had rooms for storage and were very efficient.       Lastly, are the Pavlopetri. The Palvopetri were ancient Greeks who built a city that got flooded and was only recently discovered. This city may have started the rumor of Atlantis.

Item_Response: We have always been intrigued by ancient history. Greece, Rome, Egypt, and Mesopotamia were some of the mopst influential. But what about the unknown holes in history? Who inhabited the Americas before Europe came over? Archaeologic discoveries provide us with evidence of the ancient people who once lived in the lands familiar to us.       Before Spain took over South America, the Incans lived in the Andes mountains. Archaeologists had difficulty finding information about them, as the Incans did not use written records. Instead of keeping a written record of people and livestock, the Incans used quipus, a collection of knotted strings. But we do have information about how they lived from clues left behind. For instance, there are terraces dug into the mountains. These were made by the Incans to farm on, due to the difficulty of living in the mountains. Also, statues and other carvings can tell us about their worship. Evidence uncovered that they had hundreds of gods!

Item_Response: People have always wondered why we care so much about ancient civilization. What they don't understand is that these civilizations are apart of our history, and we want to learn what they learned back then, and to see how advanced they were back then. The Inca had no formal writing system and they didn't leave archives for historians to study. They did however, make quipus, which were knots in colored string to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. This lets archaeologists see how the Inca lived and how they kept track of stuff in their every day lives.   The Ancestral Puebloans are known as Basketmakers for their skill at craft. Archaeologists look at their crafts and homes to gather information about wehre they came from and how they lived in their environment. They study the pithouses that were found and the pottery and hunting tools that they used.   The secrets of the lost city of Atlantis has broght many archaeologists to Greece to study the oceans where the ancient city is said to have sunken in. The site that they have found staraddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor and is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. You would think that nothing is able to survive that long under water, and if it did it would be nowhere near the site in which it sunk. That is where you are wrong though. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, teh exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main street, rock-cut tomb and religious structrues. They also found that the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of potter. As you can see, the artifacts that they found can help us discover and understand past civilizations.

Item_Response: Artifacts from ancient civilizations are incredibly important to archaeologist's studies. Artifacts give archaeologists a clue about how ancient civilizations lived and what they did on a daily basis. With these clues, it helps us find out about our ancestors.             After finding Inca clothing while researching them, archaeologists get an idea  of what they wore and what types clothing symbolized different parts of the social structure. Clay work and buildings are huge discoveries to archaeologists. They get an idea of how they lived and what they built their homes with. The clay work shows them what they carried things in, and if they had artwork, what they worshiped. Letters and notes left from the Spanish after they conquered the Incas shows archaeologists what they experienced when they were there and how they died out.            The Mesa Verde Park in North America symbolizes the Ancestral Puebloans civilization. The park preserves the culture of the people and the place that they once called home. Archaeologists preserved the civilization so that it will be remembered and not just destroyed to make a new house community or shopping mall. The Anscetral Peubloans lived in small houses that were similar to tents called pit houses. Archaeologists discovered that they made pottery and used the bow and arrow. Their pottery contained black drawings on it and farming started to count more of their diet then before. In A.D. 1200, a large amount of the population shifted back into the cliff alcoves, which was a main area that was shown inside of the park. The Ancestral Peublans left no written records but their structure told of people who were artistic and skillful.             Anglo-Greek Archaeologists and marine geologists discovered the settlement known as Pavlopetri. The civilization is found on the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. Archaeologists discovered buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures inside of the sunken city. The city is said to be the oldest sunken structure and is where the tale of Atlantis came from. The Marine biologists are still trying to figure out how the structure sunk , but they think it was sea level changes, earthquakes, or a tsunami.              Artifacts are an incredibly important part of our past. If we did not have any left over, we would not know where we came from or what the past was like.

Item_Response: There are many things that can be learned by examining old civilizations. The objects left behind can give us new ideas and lead us to great discoveries. The buildings and art would inspire many great minds. These three civilizations, the Incans, Ancestral Puebloans, and the Greeks all had major impacts on today's society with their discovery.         The Ancestral Puebloans left behind their homes and other buildings, and their pottery and basketry. This tells us how they lived in their homes and what one of their arts was. We can see the type of pot change to see different trends, and when the quality of the baskets go  down we also see the quality of their pottery going up. all of this tells us many things, such as their cultural trends, and their changes in daily life.         The ancient Incans left behind no record of any kind except quipus, which were strings with knots in them.Quipus were used to record everything from the number of llamas a farmer had to the number of people in the empire. This was amazing to learn that they could run a whole kingdom with nothing but knotted string.         The sunken city of the Ancient Greeks shows that over 5000 years ago, we were capable of planed citys and large monuments. The impact of this discoverd city has sparked new intrest in searching for other sunken citys, because only one percent of the ocean floor has been explored.         These three lost civilizations are all important to modern society in the way their past lives impact ours, and how what they left behind has impasted us.

Item_Response: We all know that ancient finds are important, but why are they so special? The, very informational, discoveries that are made. They are such for three reasons:knowledge, learning from the past, and history.           The reason knowledge is important is so we know the lives of the people at the time. For example, what they wore, used as weapons, and tools, did to pass the time, study math with, and also what they wrote.           Learning from our past is really important! Why learning is such is so we don't end up with another Hitler, or Kim Jung UN, Sudan Hussein, you get the point!!! We don't need another totalitarian military dictatorship claiming everyone except them are evil.           History is perhaps the most important reason that discoveries are important. 'Why?', you ask? Because it can help our children of this and future generations learn from the mistakes our ancestors made and help the world instead of hurting it.           So, now that this essay is complete, one would highly suggest that after reading this you look back to the mistakes of other people during significant events in history and learn from them. Don't let history repeat itself.

Item_Response: Many discoveries about ancient civilizations helped us learn much of what we know today. Archaeologists and Geologists make much of this information possible. With many years of recording and confirming the information sources we now have a basic idea of the ancient civilizations known as the Inca,Greek, and Puebloans.               There are three civilizations that I will talk about that left clues to help us learn about their society.Ancient Inca is a civilization in South America that was alive for nearly a hundred years. The Ancient Inca used quipus to record information, although nobody direcly knows what they meant they are still a very important part of discovering who the Incas were. The Ancient Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde for over 700 years. Puebloans lived in pithouses began weaving baskets and sculpting pottery. Ancient Puebloans lived off of cliff dwellings but bcame desserted in the 1200's A.D. Some of the Ancient Greeks are sunken underwate. Some of the sunken civilizations date back about 5,000 years ago. A city called Pavlopetri covers about 30,000 square feet of ocean floor. There they found ancient building protected by a bay of sand. They found thousands of shards of pottery some that even date back to the Stone Age. These civilizations teach us very helpful information that helps us have a basic understanding of life in ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: The Incas are so important because they created new ways, they kept record and built pottery and other architecture. The Incas built knots in colored strings to record the calenda to keep a count of livestock called quipus. The Eupropeans were suprised when they found the Incas big empire. They were suprised bcause they never thought Incas could build this big empire and keep records by colored knots. Incas made stuff from stone, potery, gold, or silver. The Incas even made up their own language. The Incas lived high in the Andes and have maybe even worshiped mountain peaks. The Spanicards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. That was the fall of the Inca empire. The Spincards did not speakthe Inca language very well.                   The Puebloans are so important because 1,400 years ago Puebloans lived in the Four Corners region and lived there for over than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here. Eventually after, buildings elaborated stone communties in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. But then, in the late A.D. 1200's they left their homes and moved away. The mystery on why they left never got revealed, no one never found out why left. People lived in pithouses from A.D. 550 TO A.D. 750. They built a living room in their houses that sunk below the ground a few feet.They also used Kiva. Kiva is a Hopi word of ceremonial room. They used Kivas for healing ritesor to pay for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop. Later they were called churches.                 The Pavlopetris are so important because no one never knew that their city and live style was real. People thought it was a myth that there was a city underneath the sea that was once a city along time ago. When searching under the sea the explorers weresuprised at what they found. The exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. Also, the seabed was hiding thousands of shards of potterey. Exploerers found over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. They were very suprised at what else they found which was their discoverey of possible megaron, a monumetal structure with a large rectangular hall.

Item_Response: Lost civilizations               The Lost Civilizations are ancient land dwellings that where ihabited by various cultures of people.The lands of these ancient people where once flourishes with people,plants,animals,bulidings,etc. How the people of these ancient lands dissapeared is a great mystery to us;That we are trying to solve with the help of  digital technology.I am going to talk about three different Lost Civilizations in this article;Ancient Inca:Peru,Ancestrial Puebloans:Mesa Verde National Park,and Pavlopetri: Lost Greek City.               ?Ancient Incas:Peru.   The Ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet system of writing.They did not leave archives for people to study.Instead the incas had quipus knots  in colored string to record the calendar and keep track of livestock.Archaeologists today found many ancient quipus's but didnt  know their meaning.Without anyone to read the stories in the colorful string quipus's i understanding it is just an ancient mystery.Clues left behind by the incas paitng a protrait of their religion ,art ,architecture,agriculture,government ,and way of life. By studing this archaeologists can peice together details of  Inca life.Some of the knowlege we have is passed down by oral history or stories passed dwn from one generation to the next.some of it also comes from the Europeans stories about the incas too.Inca stories where legends rather than history.The rest of our  knowlege comes from artifacts left by the incas, orsites where they lived or the artifact was found.There where a variety of artifacts that where founds like:objects made from stone ,pottery,gold,silver such materials lasted a long time even if they have been buried for hundreds of years.Some inca texiles and clothing have survived remarkably well.Ancient materials like clothes are usually destroyed by dampness but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Perus coast or the cold mountians of the Andes.Some inca sites have been disturbed by hunters or looters , who take anything that might be valuable;looted sites often do not tell archaeologists much.Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records.They need to learn as much from ever single peice of evidence.Among the important things to learn about a civilization is to learn about where it came from ans what happened to it.The fall of the Inca is easy to date because the spaniards murdered the last Inca King in 1532 and took over the empire.Incas lived high in the Andes many of their sites are remote high places.this was good because a looter couldnt get to the bodies as easily but it makes the jobs of an archaeologist more difficult because they have to carry all of their equipment up the mountain and anything that can be studied has to be brought back down the mountain.The cold mountains act like freezers thast preserve bodies for medical scanning that can be used to find out how they lived.                   Ancesteral Puebloans:Mesa Verde National Park.   ?About 1,400 years ago , long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.The first  Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for'' green table'') about A.D.550.Tthey are known as basketmakers for their skill at craft.Formerly nomadic they where living a more settled life.Farming replaced huntingand gathering as their main livelihood.They bulit pit houses clustered into small villages usualy built on mesa tops but sometimes clipp recesses.They where fairly prosperous badsket makers,and their population multiplied.They bgen builing houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud.Between A.D.1100 and A.D. 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand.It  was made u p of mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the Kivas built inside closing walls rather than out  in open.Ever since local cowbys first reported the cliff dwellings  in the 1800's, archaeologists have sought to understand peoples's lives.We will never  be able to know the full story: they had  left no written  records  and tmuch that was improtant in their lives has perished.They tell of a people  adept at building, artistic crafts, and skillfull at making a living from difficult land.Using nature to their advantage , Ancesrtal   Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs.When the cliff dwellers left the traveled to New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who where already there.                   Lost greek city:Pavlopetri.   Explored by an Angelo greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known and Pavlopetri., the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and weath of details is unprecedent, expert say.'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,'' said Dr Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the Nottingham.There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, Which is why it is  unqiue.This site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the sourthern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the see around 1000 BC. What they found surpassed all expeditions. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.More than any other underwater site so far,the find offers potential insights into the workings of the mycenaean society.''It is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied,'' said Elias Spondylis, who co-directed the survey as the head of greece's underwater atiquities department.It is the first time a sunken city has been found in greece that predates time.

Item_Response: How were the discoveries of of Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlpetri so important? There are so many things discovered such as traits about the life of the tribes that archeologists discovered  at different places. Archeologists have found many ancient quipus. The ancient Inca is like a mystery to be solved. There were so many things such as clues left behind that archeologists have studyed and put pieces of and gathered up that details about their life. Anything that we know now about the Incas comes from oral history and storied that have been passed on for generations.               What archeologists found was ancient quipus. Inca left behind amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life and this showed us their daily life. We know so much of their stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire un 1532. Most of their knowledge comes from artifacts, or objects they left behind such as stone, pottery, gold, and silver. Archeologists who studied these sites keep carefull records. They write down and photograph artifacts. The most important thing to learn about is where it cam from and what happened to it. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may have worshiped some mountain peeks. Many of their sites are in high places like in mountain tops. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies have been found in the icy Andres and they have been in good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning to learn about the people died.                  The Puebloans were a gruop of people who lived in Mesa Verde. They were farmers who lived in small homes known as Pithouses. There was a major population shift that showed that some of the Puebloans began to move back to the clifff alcoves. Archeologists dont know the reason why they did they that but they said it had a large impact on the life of the Puebloans. The late tribe talked about were the Pavlopetri.                 The place where the Pavlopetri lived is now submerged underwater. This site was 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. It was thought to be the atlantian city. No one ever knew if it was a city for sure. There were many things revealed such as world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religous structures.                   Marine geologists have to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.

Item_Response: The Incas, Puebloans, and Palvopetri our ancient groups of people that lived hundreds of years ago. They all have artifacts that were left behind from their civilization. Archaeologists are the scientists that find these artifacts, but how they find them differs from the other. Finding these artifacts is very important for our knowing of older civilizations and maybe even our ancestors and their way of living. I strongly believe that all artifacts or remains of an ancient civilization; more specifically the Incas, Puebloans, and Palvopetri people, helps our world discover what lives were lived before our own.                                                                                                                       One example of an important artifact, is clothing, this helps you see what ancient people wore back then. The Inca's cloth has been found and been concluded as a very durable piece of cloth (Gruber). This conclusion was made from how long the cloth had been preserved, which by numbers, is around 450 years. To add, they've been found in the dry deserts on Peru's coast or in the frigid Andes Mountains (Gruber). Many of other clothes would have already been destroyed by dampness or extreme heat.                      Another way of using artifacts to understand life before us is looking in the content of their own ancient structures. Like the Puebloans for example, they started by making pithouses, which is a underground home with the door on top. Which was later upgraded into a kiva, which kind of like an underground chamber that is mainly used for religious purposes (Anderson). Archaeologists also noticed that while the complexity of the Puebloans' structures increased, it chain reacted into the Puebloans' basket making skills to decline. Reason being because the Puebloans were so busy in creating more structures, they forgot about their once-known trademark, baskets.                    Now we have all been told that Atlantis is a myth, but recent findings have led archaeologists to suspect that their once was a civilization called Atlantis that later in its existnence, fell into the ocean. The people of this civilization were known as Palvopetri. Archaeologists have found the site of Atlantis in Southern Greece and it is abundant in shards of pottery. They have also plenty of buildings, rock-cut tombs, courtyards, and statues to name a few (Smith). Thanks to the shifting sands and other natural occurences, these artifacts are were able to survive for almost 5,000 years.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca                                         The Ancient Inca had a lot of history behind them. Them also have a lot of things they left behind when the new kind started to rule them. Archaeologists  try to find out new things about how these people lived, what they ate, how they kept track of time and a lot more.                       The Inca trib was located in the in the dry dessert right next to the Andes mountains. it might be had to belive but the Inca left a lot of things behind, including cloths, pottery, jewelery, and art. This helps archaeologists know a little more about how they lived. Most of thses items where made out of gold, sliver and stone. So a lot of thses things are still in good condition. Archaeologists even found some Inca bodies in the mountains. They would not ever find any bodies in the dessert because it is to warm and there bodies would break down and desentergrate. But the mountain act like giant freezers and keep the bodies preserved through out the years.                       Archaeologists have found out some thigs about this tribe. They and no was of keeping track of time, no system of writing, or number or anything. They kept track of this but using strings. And most of what we know about them where passes down from ancient stories, so most of what we know might now be true. Some of the stories where written down by the Europeans during the time the Incas where still alive. We still know a lot of these people even thought they lived over hundred of years ago.                        Archaeologists use some of the best techonolgy to figure out how thses people lived. It is no easy job though. The archaeologists have to carry all the equipment up by hand. And anything they find they have to carry down to study. And also they are master mountainears, because if they where to get stock the would die.

Item_Response: Many have come before us, creating civilizations, making history and changing the world. We have learned form them, advanced form them, and have become who we are because of them. Among these ancient civilizations are the Inca, the Publoans, and the Pavlopetri, all very different, and form different stretches of the Earth, but all leaving their mark in history, to one day be found and have their legacy shared throughout the world. Now archeologist around the world are discovering and learning information long lost and forgotten form these ancient civilizations for all to learn.The discoveries made about the Inca, Publoans, and Pavlopetri are important, because it teaches us about the way of life of our ancestors and how time has changed us.        The Inca are one of the most fascinating ancient civilizations, though it lacked much of what today is found to be essential for success, they were able to form a strong empire by creating their own way of doing thing.They had no written language or alphabet but were able to efficiently keep records, by instead tying knots into colorful string.They created beautiful art, architecture, and a government and empire competing to Rome in their own way, differing form anything that had ever been done and has been done sense this time. A lot can be learned form such a civilization, and it's unique ways and customs that made it a successful empire that prospered without today's fundamentals. We may be able to learn of better ways to solve our governments problems by learning about the strange, yet successful ways that ancient civilizations such as the Inca have to offer.        In a completely, yet just as important way the ancient civilization of the Puebloans, can also teach us what we must do if we are to remain a striving nation as it saw it's great rise and saddening demise. We can study this civilization's entire history form the time they arrived at Mesa Verde near 550 A.D to when it was deserted by them around 1300 A.D. This is a major learning opportunity for humans because it allows us to not only know about their way of life, but also how it changed over the course of hundreds of years. We can see their advancements and changes of life, but more importantly it allows us to see into the rise and fall of an ancient civilization as most others do not allow. Throughout history it has been known that the downfall of a civilization is brought upon by another even stronger civilization, but here is one of few circumstances in which it bring upon it's own demise.By studying and learning about the Puebloans, we as well as all nations can learn how to avoid bringing upon one's demise and bring upon solutions that can prevent from once again occurring.        Until the discovery of the Pavlopetri, we had never before studied a sunken civilization, making it a learning experience for the archeologist who are studying it. The Pavlopetri being a sunken civilization, makes it much more difficult to explore and study required much more sophisticated technology and the the help of marine geologist. It being a sunken civilization also has it's advantages, for example since it sunk before humans could re inhabit the area and the water helps preserve the artifacts, it still remains much as it did when it was inhabited meaning it can provide much more information. The discovery of such a civilization finally allows us to put a name   on what the sunken city of Atlantis really is, which is Pavlopetri, a sunken city in Greece near the present city of Neapolis. The discovery of this city may also allow us to finally know why it and other cities like it have sunken, though this still remains unknown. Also the discovery of this city allows us to know of the way the ancient Greek were since this city sunk many years before it was an empire and teach us therefor how it can to be that which it is known as today.The Pavlopetri has taught us very much about the archaeology of sunken cities and civilizations, as well as what the lost city of Atlantis is, and the way of life of the Greek before it became the empire it is known as today.        Overall the discovery made about the ancient civilizations such as the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important for many reasons. They teach us about our ancestors: those who came before us and their way of life, as well as how we has humans have changed over time, and learn how to prevent the downfall of our nation by learning of the mistakes of those that have come before us. All these things are very important for knowing about our past lets us know we are as we are, and learning form the mistakes of those before us, allow us to prevent them form ever again reoccurring and better increasing our chances of success.Learning about ancient civilizations is important because it teaches us who we come from, as well as how to be successful in life, for they who have come before us already know and we must just learn form them.

Item_Response: The Incas of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. The Incas made knots in colored string called quipus to record the calendar to keep live stock. But today no one knows what the knots actually mean. Because no one knows what any of the colored string meant. But one of the things we know is some stories because europreans wrote them down and we found them in diaries.  Also the other stuff we know was from the artifacts and objects they left behind, and we found some of there clothing and it actually was in descent condition.       The Puebloans made stone house in the side of cayon walls. They also made little homes called pithouse that eventually evoled into kivas. All they had in them was a fire place and a little hole that shows the 'underworld.' They were made to hold up to two or three men and only were six by eight feet big. These people were also known as cliff dwellers. And these cliff dwellers also made these little homes out of sand stone! In summer they only really used the fireplace, and if they did use it they used it to cook, but in winter they used them to mainly keep warm.       A diver explores the sunken settlement beneath the water off southen greece. But they say there are old sunken places in the world. They also found out that there is this hidden place called atlantis but they are not sure if it is a myth or not.  And only 1% of the worlds ocean floor has been surveyed.

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries of Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri civilizations so important to us and our history? Well for many reasons; these ancient civilizations shaped our future, we are all descended from them, and in order to learn about our history, we must learn about them. Therefore, archaeologists are working hard to uncover the mysteries of our history.             The history of these people; the Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri, stretches back thousands of years, their empires are a mystery to us. Humans are very curious creatures, we will stop at nothing to achieve what we want. So if the leaders of the human race decide that they want their children and their grandchildren to learn about historic civilizations in school, then they will need to acquire knowledge about it.             The history of the Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri civilizations hold many fascinating traditions and different ways of life. With some cultures, there is still a bridge connecting these traditions to ones that go on nowadays. We can also compare our age of electronics to their time, where they lived off the land and changed themselves in order to adapt to the land, whereas now, where we just change the land to adapt to us. It is important that we recognize these changes and point them out. A lot of rich history is out there and is waiting to be discovered. The history of our people is very important, and these three great civilizations are a key part of that history.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important. Without these dicoveries, we would only have very limited information about the ancient civilizations and how they worked.   'The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not have archives for historians to study.' Due to the fact that the Incas never recorded anything onto paper for future reference, it was more difficult to learn about these ancient beings. Without archaeologists to finds old artifacts, very little would acually be known about the Incas. 'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.' Modern people would have no idea about this ancient way of ife if it wasn't for these 'clues' left behind. 'The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found.'

From there they try to tell why or how those people lived on with their lives, and if we didn't have archaeologists to help us find this out we would never know how to make better housing or other products.       The Inca civilization left many artifacts such as art work, architechural stuctures, government systems, trasportation devises which then hepls us predict what may have happened and how it happened.  For example, the Incas left knots in a colorful string or called quipus to help them record the calendar or keep track of the livestock.  In addition, the Europeans were amazed that Inca built such a huge temple and some of the Europeans wrote this down in letters or diaries.  Story telling for Inca was much more like Oral History or passing down history from generation to generation. Item_Response: What is your favorite part about history. History can be a very interesting thing to learn about.There are many different civilizations and three of them are; the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti. Also there are many important discoveries made that have gave geologists their knowledge of history.            The Inca are people that live in a civilization in Peru. The Inca had no set alphabet or system of writing. The Inca used quips or colored strings with knots in them to keep records. Geologists have found many ancient quips but still tody no one knows what the knots mean. Most of the things known about the Inca comes from oral history. Some of these stories have been written down by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Objects found from the Inca are things made out of things like stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Also things like clothing and textiles are found in the dry deserts of Peru.             The Puebloans lived in the Four Corners region and in shelters built into canyon walls. Geologisets have found artifacts like pithouses, bows and arrows, pottery, and spears. The Peubloans relied heavily on the pottery that they made. There were no written records of the Peubloans so geologists had a hard time learning everything about their culture.             The Pavloperti were very advanced for their time and had a very important mythical city that was called Atlantis. Marine geologists have found what they think is the remains of the city Atlantis. The civilization dates back 5,000 years and geologists say that Atlantis has to be the oldest submerged town in the world. Geologists have learned that Atlantis covers about 30,000 square meters. There have been ceramics found in Atlantis dating back to the end of the stone age. Less than 1% of the world's ocean floor have been surveyed and Atlantisis the most extrodinary find yet.             Even though history may sound boring many of the things you can learn from it may just supprise you. If it wasn't for learning about history how would you know all of these very interesting things even happened. Three of these interesting civilizations are the Inca, the Peubloans, and the Pavloperti. Hey you never know maybe you may be one of the geologists that uncover the next big civilization.

Item_Response: Why Discoveries of Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are Important       Without the discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri we would not have many of the things we have today.  These three groups of people are very important to the way we live life, many of the things we do and use during the day were invented by them.       The Inca made many advances to their people during the time of their reign. They ruled the South American empire for nearly one hundred years and during their rule they amazingly increased their skill of art, architecture, agriculture, and their way of life.  Many of the things we know about the Inca are passed down from generation to generation. Inca made knots in colorful strings called quipus to record the calender and keep count of livestock, nobody knows what the knots mean.  Much of the knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects left behind by them.  Artifacts may be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver.       The first Puebloans were settled in Mesa Verde during about A.D. 550.  They were known as Basket makers for their skill at crafting them. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops or cliff recesses. Skilled at making pottery and used the bow and arrow for hunting.  After living in pit houses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 they started expanding their population and build houses above ground with walls made of poles and mud, but by A.D. 1000 the Puebloans advanced from pole and adobe to skillful stone masonry.  Walls made of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and joined into units of 50 rooms or more.        The Pavlopetri were Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologists.  They were the first known team to explore the sunken settlement of Atlantis.  Without the discovery of them we would have never known who first discovered the sunken town under the sea of southern Greece we all know as Atlantis.  Discoveries have led to over 9,000 square meters of new buildings.  Also a possible megaron with a monumental structure with a lare rectangular hall.  Atlantis is a myth but the thought of having a sea sunken town under the sea is enough to think about for a long time.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are very important to the world because they give us insight on how some of the mightiest civilizations had lived. The Incas lived in cold and harsh lands of Peru, the Puebloans lived on cliffs of the Mesa Verde, and the Pavlopetri lived in on the now-sunken coastal shores of Greece. They were still able to be simple livers, great craftsmen, and amazing architects.      The Incas were a simple but mighty civilization. The Incas ruled over South America for nearly a hundred years. They used knotted string to record important data, did not have a formal alphabet, and left artifacts such as objects made of stone, pottery, and even gold. This civilization shows us how the ancestors of who we are today survived in very basic ways.      The Puebloans of Mesa Verda were also known as 'Basket weavers' for their crafting skills. They lived in pithouses that eventually formed into kivas, learned to make pottery, and created to bow and arrow which was a more efficient atlatl. The Puebloans that some of our ancestors were great craftsmen.      The Pavlopetri are an Anglo-Greek group of archaeologists and marine geologists that are studying settlements that have been dated back about 5,000 years. This was the time of Homer's heroes. Ceramics were found dating back to the end of the stone age. Over 9,000 square meters of building have been discovered. The investigations have also a possible discovery of a magaron, a huge building with a large rectangular hall. This shows that even some of the oldest of the ancient civilizations were great architects.      The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are some of the oldest found civilizations in the world, and have taught us amazing things about the past and their way of life. They lead simple lives, but made great accomplishments that put us where we are today. That makes the discoveries of these places important.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca   The Incas had no alphabet or writing system. They did not leave much behind for historians and archaeologists to study. However, the Incas left behind clues that archaeologists can use to piece together the ancient Incas' lives. Most of the information said about Incas come from stories told by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. These people described the Incas in letters and diaries. Most artifacts that are found are very precious. They are normally made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These materials last a long time because they have been buried and preserved for such a long time. Inca clothing and textile have been discovered as well. Cloth and other forms of clothing are usually destroyed by dampness, however these have been preserved because they have been buried in the dry deserts on Peru's coast or the cold mountains of the Andes.       Mesa Verde National Park   Before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region had chosen Mesa Verde for their home. Over the course of 700 years they and their descendants lived here, building stone communities in sheltered areas of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, they moved away. Mesa Verde National Park provides a reminder of this ancient culture. Experts have named these people 'Anasazi.'   The first people who settled in Mesa Verde were known as Basketmakers for their skill at the crafft. They also began farming as a replacement to hunting. They lived in pithouses clistered into small villages built on top of cliffs. They learned to make pottery and later gained the bow and arrow so that they could hunt easier. From A.D. 1000 to A.D. 1300, the population skyrocketed. They continued to flourish until they started seeing drought and crop failures which urged them to leave Mesa Verde.       Atlantis   Everyone has heard the tale of the ancient underwater city of Atlantis. However, archeologists have predicted that Atlantis is just a sunken city off the coast of Greece. The sunken city dates back 5,000 years. Dr. Jon Henderson said, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.' The city is believed to have been devoured by the sea around 1000 BC. It was discovered by a British oceanographer about 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists can use advanced techonology to properly survery the ruins. They had revealed that the city was complete with buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition was thousands of shards of pottery. They had found pottery dating back to the end of the stone age. They also discovered over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. Marine archaologists are intrigued because this city is an example of how adavnced people were back then and what they accomplished with architecture.

Item_Response: Once apon a time there was a Zebra, named Samuel. He didn't fit in with any of the other zebras, he didn't have many friends. All the other zebras called Samuel mean names. One day Samuel decided that he wanted a friend. He went up to talk to one of the more popular zebras, and the zebra just walked away laughing.        Samuel was so sick of being the odd one out, that he would always just stay under the tree all alone. One day a zebra named Jackie came up and decided to talk to Samuel. He was jumping with joy that he finally got to talk to someone. Jackie said that she has always wanted to talk to him but was always too scared. They talk for a long time, but then all the other zebras were making fun of Jackie for talking to Samuel. Jackie didn't care, she promised Samuel that they would be best friends forever. They both lived happily ever after.    The End.......

Item_Response: Discovering new things is very important. Especially when it can change the history of a civilization. Also, it becomes even more important when they are about major civilizations like the inca  Pueblos, and Atlantis.          The Inca were one of the most powerful and successful civilizations in history. So, discovering new things about them is very helpful in understanding what they were like. One of the most useful things to find is artifacts. They can tell what the Incas used and how they lived. They also tell what they believed in. For example, the artifacts can have pictures showing what people are doing.           The Pueblos were a very interesting ancient civilization. They lived for hundreds of years in a place were many people wouldn't survive. They had elaborate communities and lived in houses built into walls of a cave. When they left these houses, they also left pottery and other useful artifacts. These were used by archaeologists to learn more about how they lived and where they came from.          The lost city of Atlantis is a sunken Greek city in Greece. It is on the sea bottom and has been explored by many people. It is one of the only societies that is underwater that scientists know about. So, when archaeologists find something they didn't know about, it's an extra big deal.          Overall, artifacts from civilizations can be some of the most useful tools for people to learn about. They can tell what people did back then or even something that they ate. So, these are very important to defining history and where we came from.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti are all important because they tell us about the world's past and how humans lived prior to all of our technology.        Some of what we know comes from oral history, or stories passed down from generation to generation, but there is a lot that also comes from artifacts and records kept by many ancient people. Some textiles and clothing have survived remarkably well because of their enviornments and climate. Even bodies found in places such as the Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern scanning equipment to learn about how the people died and how they lived.        Archaeologists have even recently found an entire underwater civilization near Greece that has been hidden for hundreds of years. There are apparently hundreds of buildings and plazas under the sea that were waiting to be found for years.        In conclusion, these findings are all very important because they give us facts about the past and could even help predict the future. Plus, these crazy findings are also very interesting.

Item_Response: Learning about the past can be important because we can learn how ancient civilizations grew, how the prospered, and how they fell.         The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing but they sill thrived and ruled for nearly one hundred years. Artifacts are like clues left behind so we can learn of the ways of life of The Inca. Most history of the Inca was passed down orally, soem stories are legends rather than history. Europeans described the Inca in diaries and letters, some even wrote and translated Inca stories. Artifacts sometimes confirm Historical record.     Natural geographical features preserve artifacts. The Andes even preserved bodies so well that experts can find cause of death. The bodies also revealed how they lived.         The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known for their skills in basket making. Soon they learned pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon than the atlatl, a spear thrower.     People lived in pit houses for about 200 years, then as the basketmakers population multiplied they began builing houses above ground, with upright walls. From here on the people were known as Puebloans, a spanish word meaning 'village dwellers.' By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Walls of thick, double-coursed stonenoften rose two or three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. Pottery also changed from simple designs on a gray backround to black drawings on a white backround. Farming accounted for more of their diet than before, and mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture.     The population reached several thousand in A.D. 1300. The stone walls were regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde. Baskets began to show a decline of quality, possibly because of the use of pottery. In A.D. 1200 a major population shift saw people begin to move back to the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors. Why they made this move nobody knows. Maybe for religios purposes or better protection. Whatever the reason, or reasons, it gave rise to the cliff dwellings which Mesa Verde is most famous.     Structures tell of a people adept at builing, artistic in their crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land. The structures are evidenc that over centries a society accumulated skills and traditions and passed them down generation to generation.     Ancestral Peubloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. When they left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among kin who were already there. Whatever may have happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancestral Puenloans.             Secrets of a lost city may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis- the city has been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. The settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. There is no doubt that it is the oldest submerged town in the world. it has remains dating long before the glory days of classical Greece. There are older sunken sites but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique.     The site is believed to have been consumed by the ocean near 1000 BC. Although discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine achaeologists, aidedby digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins.What they found surpassed all expectations. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of builings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seebed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. The ceamics found dated back to the stone age.     Investigations revealed over 9,000 square meters of new builings. a suprising discovery was of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, which also suggested the town was used by an elite, and automatically raised the status of the settlement. More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings if Mycenaen society. The site is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied. It represents a frozen moment of the past.     It was the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.                 Ancient ruins or artifacts can put legends to rest or prove stories passed down and told to every generation.
