Item_Response: The reason the discoveries of the Inca, Puedloans, and the Pavlopetri are important is because they tell archaeologists about how early life was like. The Inca left us with one of the mysteries of all times. NO one to this date can translate the Inca's quipus, or they ancient recording system. The reason that the Puedloans were important is because they showed us how they built early buildings. They built shelters out of stone, wood, mud, and even in cayon walls. The reason the Pavlopetri is a important discovery is because they showed us how they made early clothes. They would take wool and cotton and make covers. They would take deer skins and string and make basic clothes. And that is why the discoveries of the Inca, the Puedloans, and the Pavlopetri were important discoveries.

On another hand, the Pavlopetri is very interesting, you would never think a whole city vould be sunken into the sea right? But that is quite possible off the coast of Greece where many marine geoligists have found remains of cities under the crystal clear waters of Greece. You could find many artifacts and structures under water, which is key to help finding out about that bit of history.            In conclusion, the discoveries of all these civilizations are very important to the life we have today, because we could easily figure out what life was like back then and how much we have improved the world one step at a time. Im sure we will find many more remarkable discoveries in the near future.

We have discovered that they mysterisally left their homes and died off. Our society can learn and observe this. Plus alot of the world has an Inca heritage.   Second is the Puebloans. Their homes known as 'Pithouses' are good remains to show us their lifestyle also.

Item_Response: The Importance of The Lost.       an article by your home dawg Tia Hannah  ♦       ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------          Lost cities are clues to the past and the evolution of human kind as we know it today. Some of the most important technologies we have today are derived from these ancient people. Some of these discoveries made can clue us in to some of the biggest mysteries out there.  I mean, imagine if you found a completely intact city just of the coast of your hometown.  Wouldn't you be curious? I know I would.  Or what about a ruined town on the peak of Andes, wouldn't you want to know what happened to the people or how the town got there? Not only have these discoveries moved us forward with new efficient ways to do things and bright new idea but they satisfy our thirst for knowledge. But what makes each lost city so important and valuable?             The Incans lasted for nearly a hundred years, they dominated most of south America and challenged ancient Rome in expansion! Yet now their great city lays in ruins. But even though it's gone, we still learn about it.  Why? Maybe because it's interesting but also because it set precedence for many great nations to come, the Incas were one of the most successful and dominant world powers of their time so it's no surprise that their culture was succeeded by smaller countries, states and towns.  There is a reason their empire lasted so long, and it is smart to identify what made them a successes before they died out and try and incorporate it into future cities.  That's evolution.  Everything evolves and so do cities.  People looked at the Incas for an example on what to do to make a successful city and what not to do, they took the Inca's best ideas and modified them to make a type of government that worked.                The discoveries made at the ancient Inca sites show us a key step of human civilization evolution.  It also helps us understand our history, and early forms of cities.  Ancient empires are especially interesting because it lets us know what life was like back then and what kind of things worked.                The same goes with the sunken ancient Grecian city.  They were one of the earliest Greek cities and were obviously one of the more domesticated civilizations.  What makes that city so important is not only the sheer mystery of it but also how it played a role in Greek's youth.  This city just brings up so many questions, why was the sinking of an entire city not recorded in Greek history? How did it get to the bottom of the ocean?  Everything about the city screams intrigue and humans are naturally curious.  This city brings up the question on whether or not there are other ancient cities beneath the waves, these cities could clue us in the natural events that occurred thousands of years ago such as a devastating tsunami or the earths surface movement. But the unique thing about the discovery of this city is that it is Greek? So might there be an city of gold in the water too, a.k.a Atlantis?  This topic has piqued human curiosity, and has made us wonder what the ocean could really be hiding.               The settlers of Mesa Verde however are perhaps one of the most intriguing stories ever told. They are called the ancient ones or sometimes even the ancient enemies.  They thrived for 700 hundred years and have lots of descendants.  These people were one of the key steps to civilization evolution and built elaborate towns, cities, and homes.  Their inventions were most impressive for someone of their day.  They definitely played a major role in the evolution of our city system.              These cities clue us in to our past and show us how our way of life has evolved.  They pique curiosity in us and make us want to learn more about what our world was like a lifetime ago.

Item_Response: How do we learn what we know about the past? Many ancient artifacts have been destroyed, but yet many have also been found and are in spectacular condition. We learn what we know about the past by finding artifacts and hard evidence so we can infer things about their cultures and rituals.       The Incas of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, so historians have quite a bit of trouble discovering information about the Incas. Archaeologists have found many quipus which are colorful pieces of string with knots, but historians have yet to figure out what those knots mean. We know things about ancient Rome because they left behind portraits of their religions, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the ways they lived their lives. Europeans wrote down stories, and they describes the Incas in letters and diaries. The Spaniards did not speak the Incas language, but they could infer what they were doing, however, their descriptions may not be accurate or correct. The other knowledge of the Incas came from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, however some of it was destroyed because of weather deterioration.       We know information about Mesa Verde because some of the Pithouses that they lived in were still around when archaeologists were looking for information about it. In addition, they have skillful stone masonry, and advanced pottery.  They also constructed their buildings very stratigacly, so they kept together well for a long time. Other tribes have also given us information about them.       Sunken settlements have been recently found in southern Greece, so we have been able to  discover information about their culture. It is the oldest sunken settlement in the world, so it is quite remarkable that it was found. The settlement has been protected by the bay, and to the often shifting sands. Another contributing factor is that the water near by is very shallow.       In conclusion, we have been able to find out information about ancient cultures as a result of finding ancient artifacts. These artifacts include writings, stories, poteries, settlements, and different forms of artwork. Without this hard evidence, we would know close to nothing about these ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have made significant discoveries about cultures all around the world.  These discoveries have greatly contributed to our knowledge about these civlizations today.  The information found about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very inportant today.       Archaeologists used ancient stories and ledgend to learn more about the Incan civilization.  They have discovered that the Incans were a very advanced socety and achieved greatly.  Archaeologists aslo used evidence they found in the Pueboans in Mesa Verde to find out how they built their shelters.  Puebloans in Mesa Verde lived in pithouses from 550 CE to 750 CE.  Archaeologists were even able to investigate the ruins of ancient greek cities to leart about their culture.  They found that the ruins of their cities were well preserved and still in tact, along with many other artifacts.       The discoveries made by archaologists were very significan to ones understanding of these civilization.  More information is now know about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.  Hopefuly archaeologists will continue to discover many great things about civilization around the world.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because its all old history. The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet of system of writing. They didnt leave anything so historians can study on. Some of the stuff we know now about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories or passed from generation to generation.          The Puebloans are known as basketmarkers for thier skill at the craft. Farming was replaced by yhunting and gathering as thier main livelihood. It was mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather than out in the open. Whatever the reasons it gave rise to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is most famous.          The Pavlopetri explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. What they found supassed all expectations. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaean.

Item_Response: The discoveries on the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are very important to the archeological world. The Inca people had no written language or actual alphabet so finding out how they led their daily lives was a bit more challenging. Some of what we know nof the Inca people comes from their tradition of oral history, stories passed down genereation to generation. Some of their stories were recorded by Europeans when they came to the empire in 1532. Although they recorded things the Europeans did not actually speak the Incan's languge so we do nopt know how acurate their recordings are. Some Incan clothes and artifacts have survived quite well because of the conditions they were kept in. Some Incan sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters and things may have been stolen.  Since the Incans lived high in the moutains they were buried in caves and enclosed places. The high altitudes have helped to preserve the sites.

Item_Response: The Mysteries of the World Just Waiting to Be Unfolded   Today Archaeologist everywhere are working hard to find and preserve the artifacts from our past ancestors.  They find many things daily.  From the ocean floor to the huge desert they find many things from many different people helping us understand the way they lived and functioned.  I'm going to talk about the Incas, the Ancestral Puebloans, and The Lost City of Atlantis.         First of all, I'm going to talk about the Incas.  The Incas lived during the years 1438-1532.  They did not have a formal alphabet or system of writing, they wrote and kept records by a system called a quipus.  A quipus is a string with a whole bunch of knots in it.  Archaeologist have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what the knots mean.  Archaeologists are people that find ancient artifacts and figure out how long ago they were used and why.  They also have to figure out how the ancient people lived by looking at where they live and other thing that the archaeologists find.  Some of the things the archaeologists know come from stories passed from generation to generation, artifacts found in the desert or up on the cliffs they lived on, and from the homes they built.        Second of all, some of the items the archaeologists have found are objects made from stone, pottery, gold, silver, and clothing preserved in the hot desert.  One of the most important things to learn about a civilization are what happened to it and where the people came from.  Archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques to discover more about the Incas like taking Arial photography so they can find patterns in the ancient monument that they can not see on the ground. Some of the things the archaeologists found out are, the Incas lived high up in the Andes mountains and may have worshiped some of the mountain's peaks.  They buried their people in caves on cliff faces or on mountain tops. They also usually put items in with the dead so they could take it with them when they left the earth.       Next, I'm going to talk about the ancient people, Ancestral Puebloans. The Ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde for almost 700 years.  They built huge stone communities in the alcoves of the canyon walls. In 1200 A.D. the Ancestral Puebloans moved away.  The Ancestral Puebloans were known as the Basketmakers for their skill at the craft.  Farming replaced hunting and gathering.  They lived in pit houses in small villages built on mesa tops and sometimes in cliff recesses.  They learned to make pottery and started using a bow and arrow for hunting.  The population increases rapidly during the next few years and so the villages grew to.  The stone walls of the pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built with their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. About 1200 A.D.  the Ancestral Puebloans people began to move back into the cliff alcoves.  No one knows why they made this move maybe for defense, or religious or psychological reasons or maybe the cliffs were better protection from the weather.  The archaeologists found a lot out by the structure of the Ancestral Puebloans villages and structures.  The buildings were evidence of a society that had accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on through the generations.  The Ancestral Puebloans were very smart, they used the nature to their advantage by building their dwellings inside cliffs so they could stay out of the weather, their basic construction material, sand, to make their homes and the mortar between the blocks of sand was a mix of water and mud, and they used their space wisely to grow their crops, build their homes and other structures.       Finally, I'm going to talk to you about the lost city of Atlantis.  Atlantis was found by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist.  The sunken settlement dates back to some 5,000 year.  It is the oldest submerged town in the world.  Its remains date from 2800 to 1200 B.C. It covers 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor.  It is believed that the sea consumed it around 1,000 B.C. When the marine geologists found Atlantis they found court years, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.  Something that took them by surprise was a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall.  Which means the town had been used by and elite.  The marine geologists think there are many things that could have sunk this town. It could have been caused by sea level changes, ground subsidence as a result of an earthquake or tsunami.        Archaeologists have not found everything their will always be something new to find out there.  Now you know about the Incas, the Ancancestral Publoans, and the great lost (not so lost anymore) Atlantis.

Item_Response: During ancient times, humans always have wanted to know their past, to expand their knownledge about their ancestors. Some civilizations may have been really significant in history, others, not so much. All events are significant in history no matter what.       Inca civilizations were a rival against the Roman empire which is quite significant since by that time, Rome was a huge country that rules a big part from europe. Sadly the Inca civilization only lasted for a hundred years since it had falled after the last Inca king was killed by Spaniards.       Puebloeans or also known as Basketmakers had a life of farming that replaced hunting and gathering, they lived in cliffs they cleared out and became known as Mesa Verde or in spanish: green table. Their population increased and for unknown reasons, 1200 A.D. they moved out.       The lost city or Atlantis was insipired by a sunken settlement in southern Greece. Atlantis is one of the most enduring myths that states there is a secret underwater city by the seas of Grece. They found some clues of civilizations living in the 'sunken city' like structures or ceramics. Being sunken meant that noone has ever looted it which means it has stayed as it was 500 years ago apart from the erosion, earthquakes and tsunamis. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going, less than 1% of the world's ocena floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found'.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered what it was like living in ancient times? Thanks to archaeologists, we are able to discover how people lived back in the ancient civilizations. The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because they help us learn what life was like in ancient civilizations.          Most of what archaeologists know about the Inca is either from artifacts or stories that have been passed down generation by generation, so historians have to cautious with what they have. The Incan civilization did not have a system of writing, instead they used knots of colored string to run their empires. These clues help us know how they lived.          The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde about 1,400 years ago. They were known for their basket making skills and lived in small villages on mesa tops. The houses they built were evidence that the Puebloans not only grew in population, but they also gained more knowledge as they adapted to their knew way of life. They used nature in their favor to build their villages beneath overhanging cliffs. The ruins of those villages help archaeologists know how the Puebloans lived in ancient times.          The Pavlopetri lived 5,000 years ago. Thanks to the geographical area they settled in, ancient cities have been preserved underwater for many years. With what was found, archaeologists were able to infer that the Greeks were wealthy and well organized. They were amazed by the huge buildings that take up 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor.        As you can see, the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopertri are very important to our present because we learn about our past.

Item_Response: In the modern world, we have cultural influence from ancient civilizations, but how exactly did we find out about these civilizations? Artifacts and stories. Artifacts have been able to show us more than stories have about these civilizations, but that's only because stories were sometimes only legends.       When it comes to the Incas, we don't have any artifacts actually written by the Incas, but we have quipus. No one these days actually understands what quipus mean, but when the Spaniards visited them, they actually wrote down as much of what they could understand of what the Incas were telling them. Archaeologists have been able to find artifacts that back up the stories written by the Spaniards. The discoveries of the Inca civilization are important because they tell us what life was like in ancient Peru.       In the article, 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Pueblanos and Their World,' we learn about the ancient civilizations of Meas Verde. We learn that they used nature to their advantage by making an atlatl to prey for their food and using pithouses to shelter themselves. Archaeologists have never been able to fully understand the Pueblanos, as they left no written record of their daily lives. The homes and other buildings of these ancestral Pueblanos has influenced more modern buildings such as churches.       A Greek sunken city built and drowned before the fable of Atlantis was ever created may have influenced the myth. This town wasn't found until recently because, believe it or not, humans haven't explored more than 1% of the world's ocean floors. The myth of Atlantis and this sunken city may have influenced some of our modern day culture.       Despite the hard work that archaeologists have to endure, such as mountain-climbing, ocean exploring, and cold weather, they continue working to find information to influence our modern day world.

Item_Response: There were many great civilizations in the past that created many wwonderful and important discoveries. These civilizations include the Inca,  the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. These civilizations make up part of our world today. Without these civilizations, we would not be where we are today.           One of the great civilizations were the Inca. The Inca had no real alphabet or system of writing. They didn't leave archives for historians to study. They invented the quipus to record the calendar and to keep a count of livestock. Clues left behind by the Inca teach us about their religion, art and architecture, transportation and way of life. By studying these artifacts and clues, archaeologists and others can study and understand the details of Inca life. All of the other knowledge comes from artifacts that were left behind .           The Puebloans were another great civilization. About 1,400 years ago, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. They were known as Basketmakers for their skill at their craft.Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. they lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa topsbut sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and made the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting.           The last great civilization was the Pavlopetri in Greece. You may heard of Atlantis. Well that is where they lived. Archeologists found pottery dating back to the stone age, building, courtyards, main streets, tombs, and religious structures. Atlantis was a myth that kept underwater exploration going.                  These civilizations made an important part of our world today. They created many things we use in everyday life. Archeologists have discovered many artifacts that have taught us more about history. The old days were the invention and improving days.

Item_Response: Ancient Discovery's                                  In this article there will be three stories you will be hearing about. These stories are the Incas, Puebloans,and Pavlopetri. The three of these are very important, and I will tell you why they are important. I will be talking about how they managed to do work, what they slept in, and most importantly how they lived.              To begin with, The Incas of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, so they practically only talked there own language to each other. The Incas had left no achieves for the historians to study or learn about. But one thing that the historians found was that the Incas would use some type of colored string to tie knots witch was called quipus. They would do this to record the calendar to keep a count on the livestock. Many of the quipus were found but till this day no one knows what the knots mean and without anyone who knows what they mean they wont know what story is behind it. Some of old stories about the Incas we know because they were stories written down. They were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532, they were Spanish soldiers and priests. Most of the Incas belongings were found, it was mostly there pottery, it was made out of gold, stone, or silver. The Incas lived way high in the Andes, many of there sites are in remote high places. Some Incas were berried in caves, in cliff faces, or on mountain tops. It makes it hard on the archeologists to get there corps and examine it, because its so high up in the mountain.             Next, about 1,400 years ago, way before Europeans explored North America a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde as their own home. For more than 700 years their descendants lived and  flourished there. But in the late  A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde National Park, preserved a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture.The archeologists have called them Anasazi, from a Navajo word. Its sometimes translated as ''the ancient ones''or ''ancient enemies.'' We now call them Ancestral Pueblaons. They were the first to settle in Mesa Verde, about in A.D. 550. They were known as basketmakers for their skill in crafting. They would farm instead of  hunting for animals. They would live in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.They also learned how o make pottery and use the bow and arrow.Their basic construction material was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks.The mortar between the blocks was a mix of mud and water. There space was about for two or three persons. In the winter they would burn fire to keep warm. Some of today's Pueblo people and other tribes, are descendants of theAncestral Pueblaons of Mesa Verde.             Many people have herd the myth's of a long lost city called Atlantis. This was one of the bigest cities that they  have found. The archaeologists and marine geologists known as Pavlopetri, have explored the sunken settlement. It dated back some 5,000 years ago to the time of  Homer's heroes. The city of Atlantis is one of the biggest and oldest submerge town in the world. There are many other sunken towns but no other can compare to this one. This one is unique. If i were able to find some thing in Atlantis it would be to find some type of sculpture or art. This city was found in  Greece,Neapolis. Many are trying to figure out why it is that this city sank. But they found thousands of pottery, like vassles. They did find courtyards, mainstreets, rock cut tombs and religious structures. This city was there even befor crist. So they are cirious about what religion was.

Item_Response: Discoveries of the Lost Civilizations                         In the article of Ancient Inca, the discoveries of this lost civilization has been immense. The Inca had a very unique way of ruling their city by government. They used a string horizontally which had many strings attached to it vertically; the vertical strings had knots on them to keep track of supplies and other governmental records. The Inca lived high in the Andes and worshiped some mountain peaks. They buried the dead in caves and cliff faces. this was hard for looters to get their hands on but also for the archaeologists. With the dead bodies the Inca also preserved their clothes in the high mountains. The bodies also told information on how they lived.               In the article of Ancestral Puebloans,this civilization lived in an area called Mesa Verde (which is 'green table' in Spanish). They are known for their basket making and their skills for crafting. They started to Hunt and gather than farm, they lived in a house called Pit house; these house's living room was sunk in the ground for a few feet. It also had a hole on top to let all the smoke come out from the fire inside. The population kept increasing and by A.D. 1300, the population  may have reached several thousands. soon the Puebloans left Mesa Verde and settled into present day New Mexico and Arizona.            In the article of Lost Greek City, this city may have inspired the myth of Atlantis. This city must have been built around 2800 to 1200 BC. This city is unique because it is about the only one that is almost totally complete. This site is about 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. The findings pass the expectations. Thanks to shifting sands and a protected bay you can see main streets, buildings, religious structures, court yards, and statues. the sea floor was covered with thousands of shards of pottery. This city predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Less than 1% of the ocean floor has been seen and there is still a lot more down there that has not been found yet.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing . They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strinds called quipus to record the calendar to keep count of liverstock.                    About 1,400 years ago , long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. for more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of  the canyon walls. Then , in the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away.                      The secrets of the lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. Explored by an Anglo - Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts.

Item_Response: Rey Valerio             Per.1       ~Lost Civilization Explanatory~           The Inca civilization had no form of writing. Instead it    had colored knots named, Quipus to communicate with each other. The first Europeans were amazed to find a huge civilized city with only communicating with knots.  Archaeologists have found these colored knots but no one knows for sure what they all mean. The Incas ruled the South America for about a hundred years. The Spaniards did not speak Inca however, they told stories about the Inca empire but some were mostly false than true. Archaeologists have found Inca clothing in the mountains near Peru's coast. The Incas lived in high mountains in the Andes, some Incas even worshiped mountain peaks. The fall of then Inca empire happen in 1532 when the last Inca king got killed by the Spaniards.       The Puebloans civilization chose Mesa Verde as their new home in A.D.     550. The Puebloans were known for their skill in crafting and were called, 'Basketmakers'. They started to farm instead of hunting, made many crating ideas such as, the bow and arrow, pottery and a new type of spear thrower. They started to make houses with about 50 rooms connected with each other.  During A.D 1100 and A.D 1300 the population has reached several thousand. But by A.D 1300 the Civilization was abandoned because some theories suggested that they migrated because their was a drought and could not grow crops properly.       The lost city of Atlantis were a important find in history, because it    showed us that there might be a Greek City under the deep sea.   Archaeologists think it might have sunked in 1,000 B.C. It was founded 40 years ago by a British oceanographer. Its not until last year that modern technology could go beneath the sea to see how big was the city really was. Archaeologists believe it sunk by a earthquake or even a tsunami. It has yet to be Discover all the way down because archaeologists have only studied 1% of the worlds ocean floor.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations    Throughout the course of the world's history, there have been Numerous cultures that no longer exist in the World.Even though you may not know it, People learn about the past because of those Lost Tribes. we learn lots of things like how Human lived at the time or how could Human Survive.So lets talk about 3'lost tribes': The Incas, Anasazi, or Puebloans; and Pavlopetri's.       Let's Start with the Incas. The Incas lived a long time ago in Ancient Peru where they were known as the Incan Empire. the Incas were the most powerful Empire in Peru before the Spaniards took over and Destroyed. After the Spaniard takeover, little is Left of the Incans. The only thing left of them are the assortment of weapons and stories they left behind.Treasure Hunters and Archaeologists still come to Peru to look for more hidden Treasure that the Incas left.                  Next we have the Anasis, or want we Usually call them The Puebloans. The Puebloans were a Acient Tribe who lived in North America right before the Spainards explored the place. The early Civilization of Puebloans lived in North America  for 1,400 Years in a place called Mesa Verde or 'Green Chair'. Also, The word Anasazi means ' The ancient ones' when translated to English.             Just Like the Incas, The Puebloans Had a lot of cool But old school weapons like Bows & Arrows and Spears, which can still be Found Today. Scientist think that Puebloans Made baskets and were very good at making them too.                                                     They also lived in small Houses called Pit houses.In the Early 13th Century, The Puebloans Suddenly moved to different places. Scientists don't know where or why the Puebloans moved.Maybe they were Forced  By Spaniard Explorers to leave there homes and made them move to the Southern area Like New Mexico Or Arizona: or There was this huge Drought and the Puebloans Moved to a New Area.Like I said Before, Scientist are not so Certain where or why the Puebloans move and it's still a mystery.One thing for sure is that the Remaining Puebloans In North America May still live in Southeastern United States.           So far you've learned how the Incans and the Puebloans lived when they existed.

This article is about a diver explores the sunken in southern Greece. he finds out a secret of a lost city that may have inspired one of worlds most enduring myth. The sunken was settlement dates from back in the days, back some 5,000 years ago of the time or Homer's heroes . In terms of sizes and wealth or detail.  There was this man called 'Dr.Jon Henderson.' He was a associate professor of the underwater archaeology at a University of  the Nottingham. That university has been remained dating from 2800-1200 way longer before the glory days of classical Greece. Item_Response: 'The Ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, They did not leave archives for historians to study. Item_Response: The findings of the past civilizations are important because it shows how people in the past lived their lives and how advanced their technology was. The pueblans made pithouses which showed archaeologists what they lived in. The pavlopetri made a lot of structures like buildings, courtyards, tombs and religous structures, which showed what places they used during there day-to-day lives.       The findings also showed how advanced the civiliztions were. For instance the Incans' advanced technology was how they could live in such high mountains and run that big of a empire. Another example is the Pueblans' advanced technology which was how they made baskets. The Pavlopetris' advanced technology was all the buildings they made.       All in all the findings of the civilizations were very important for history and for archeaology.

Item_Response: Do you think the discoveries that been made bout the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Palvopetri are important? I think they are very improtant. You get to understand how people lived back then, what they worshiped, objects that they left behind, and much more. Not everyday you see a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece,finding bodies in the Andes mountains, or find acient culture in Mesa Verde National park.        The ancient Inca of Peru had many important things for people to find. There were bodies in the Andes mountain that were in such good shape because the mountains acted like a giant freezer. Archaelologist can find out how people died back then and how they lived. Archaelogist found textiles and the type of clothes they wore.         Mesa Verde National park preserves a spectacular reminder of the ancient culter. People found out they lived in pithouses. Then they eventually started to build houses above the ground. They left behind baskets, stone, crafts, and etc. The people decided to move and no one knows why, but there was clift dwellings. No one would ever find out.         Not everyday you find a sunken settlement in the ocean. There is no doubt that its the oldest submerged town in the world. It revealed courtyards, buildings, main streets, rock cut tombs, and religious structures. The sumerged site was never reoccupied.

Item_Response: New things are discovered all the time, everyday, but not many things are as exciting and important as learning about what our lives would be like if we lived in the past. Finding lost cities may be rare, but they are very important to our history and teach us a lot about what life used to be like thousands of years ago.  Lifestyles have changed dramatically, and the lost cities of the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri contribute to the finding of ancient artifacts to lead to the conclusion of how our world has changed.             First, the lost city of the Incas taught us a lot of our past.  In kindergarten you learned the alphabet, and how to count.  Could you imagine not having a formal alphabet or writing system, how would you communicate with people other than talking? The Incas did not have an alphabet, and they used string and colored beads to record the calender and keep track of livestock.  We have also found a lot of clues about our past from the artifacts left behind in Incas time.  The objects found were artifacts made of pottery, silver, gold, or stone. Many Inca clothing and textiles have also survived, so we even have an idea of how our styles in clothing at jewelry have changed.             Second are the Pavlopetri group.  Their city was found sunken in water.  No one knows how or why it sunk but it has remains from 2800 to 1200 B.C.  it was discovered over 40 years ago, but examined this year.  Many building and artifacts such as pottery and clothing were found and preserved for later research.  Ceramics were found and dated back to the stone age, which suggested settlement was occupied 5000 years ago.  The salt water also preserved clothing really well, so this lost city taught us a lot about their styles too.             Lastly, is about the Puebloans. The Puebloans lived much differently from the Incas, but the objects found taught us some of the same stuff.  Out of the lost city of the Puebloans, archaeologists found houses that were lived in. People lived in pithouses from 550 to 750 A.D. They featured one room sunk in to the ground and supported by a roof.  There was a fireplace in most to keep warm.  Also found were building called Kivas.  They are ceremonial rooms usually used for churches. You entered on a ladder through a hole in the roof.  It also had a fire pit, a bench, and a ventilator.             In conclusion, lost cities really mean a lot to our world today.  Things are taught and found that we could have never imagined would ever be taught or found.  It is amazing learning about the changes our lifestyles, and our world have gone through in the years that have past.  Archaeologists have an important job of keeping us educated of our past, and thanks to lost cities and ancient artifacts, they are good at their jobs too. We can never learn everything about ancient times, but lost cities help us learn enough.

Item_Response: Archaeolist make many discoveries,but I think the discovories for the ancient Inca, Mesa Verde, and the Atlantis myth is one of their greatist discoveries.  I think they are important because of thier artifacts, the way they lived, and how they vanished.                  The artifacts of these ancient places are very interesting.  The Inca made knots with strings called quipus to record their calender, in fact the first Europeans to meet the Incas where amazed to find that they could do this.  The Mesa Verde had pottery and the bow and arrow.  The Atlantis city had pottery, religious structures, and rock-cut tombs.                   The way these ancient races lived was way different then how we liv now.  The Incas lived on high in the Andes mountains and worshiped mountain peaks.  Mesa Verde either lived in pithouses,caves,or Kivas.  The Mesa Verde lived as farmers.  The Atlantis people live in buildings, or other structures.                    Now the most important fact, hoe these races vanished.  The Inca started to go away when the Spaniards killed their last emperor and took over the empire in 1532.  It was never known on how the Mesa Verde vanishied, it was thought that they had crop failure and migrated,or they had social and political problems and looked for opportunities elsewhere.  The Atlanis race may have disipered with the city.  There are theories that suggest an earthquake or tsumai hit the city, but it is never known.                    I think these are the reasons why these finding by archeaogist are the greatist findings ever by them.  Perhaps somday in the future they could find more clues to these answers.

Item_Response: Recently there have been many discoveries about ancient civilizations. These discoveries are very important to us because it teaches us about our past and it helps us piece together what their lives were like before the technological advancements that we have today. The three civilizations I have studied are the Incas, the Pueblons, and the Pavlopatri. All are from different places and all are different with something in common, that they all hold knowledge of how people used to live at one point and in a certain place.        The Incas, llived in the mountains, in South America. Going to their long abandoned home has given light to the subject, that their life's are so unique to the others of their era. They had advancements that we didn't believe to be available during that time like how they kept record on a piece of string with knots. This is important because we know more about some peoples ancestors.        The Pueblons were a civilization that was once nomads but settled at mesa verde. This was an important place to find because we know that they were smart enough to build houses with fire pits and other things that we have resemblance to today. This would be very interesting to learn if you were their descendant.        The Pavlopatri was a Greek city, before it became below sea level. This city is interesting because no one knows how it became an underwater city, and because there are still some artifacts that haven't been ruined by the water. This can help us learn not only about the Greeks but about geographical issues with water that can possibly happen again.        All of these cities have given us a clue to life back when they were modern. Even though all of these were from different places, they all gave us knowledge. The more we find out about ancient civilizations the closer we will be to finding more about our history.

Item_Response: In the article, 'Ancient Inca: Archeologist Unlocks the Secrets of the Past', 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World', and 'Lost Greek City that may Inspired Atlantis Myth gives up Secrets' tells up how each Ancient Civilization lived, hunted, and disappeared.  These stories have been proven by archeologist that have studied these civilizations for years.           In the beginning, the narrators all described the places where they live and how it was built.  They Incas lived in the remote mountains that were very cold and brutal but they survived there for almost a hundred years. 'Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how people died' stated by Beth Gruber described how cold these remote location are and how brutal they can be between life or death.  But, these specific locations helped the Incas' from invaders.        Also, in hunting the Puebloans lived in region where farming replaced hunting more. Mentioned by Roy Anderson that 'They learned to make pottery and acquire the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting that the atlatl, a spear thrower.'  This statement says that hunting got more advanced when the bow and arrow first came. Hunting became more efficient but later declined after it was replaced by farming.  They soon disappeared after farming became more effective.           Finally, in the disappearance of a Greek city was finally awaken questions were asked.  Whether this was the center point of the Greek myth 'Atlantis'.  No one has a clue why the settlement sank under the sea.  Marine Geologist try to predict with various experiments why, when, and how this city sank beneath the ocean. Said by Sakellariou 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.'  He refers to the fact that fewer than one percent of the world's ocean floor has ever been surveyed.  The mysteries of land and sea have yet to been fully understand.        In conclusion all these articles have a common point of how they lived, hunted, and disappeared without remarks.  These mysteries have yet been solved but, in the future will soon foretell these tragedies with predictions.  Throughout thousands of years modern society still have not given up on how to test the ancient civilizations facts and opinions made my archeologists.

Item_Response: Unlock the Secret Codes       How do we learn what we know about the past? Archaeologists studies of the   Unlocks Secrets to/of the Past. They [archeologists] will tell us facts that have been proven  of the Inca's writing system, artifacts, a little of how they lived, Puebloans, Cliff Dwellers, and Lost Greek city inspired Atlantis myth.           The Inca's of Peru had no formal alpahabet or writing system. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep count of livestock. The very first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. The Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery. Clues left behind by the Inca form ana mazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.            About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of theis ancient culture. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D 550. They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. These were fairly prosperous times for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied.            Cliff Dwellers, ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1880s, arecheologists have sought to understand these people's lives. The structures are evidence of a society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on form generation to generation. When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, the traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who already there.Whatever happened, some Pueblo people today, maybe other tribes, are descendants of the Ancesral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.            A diver explores the sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. Secrets of the lost city have inspired one of the world's most inspring myths. ' The Fable of Atlantis' is one of the myths. The sunken settlement dates back to 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. The area there, is about 30,000 sqaure meters of ocen floor off the southern Peloponnese, Consumed by the sea around 1000 B.C. It was the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece predates the times that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.

Item_Response: Ancient Incas       The ancient Incans did not have a formal alphabeit like we do today. We have learned their ways by artifacts left behind by the incas. Some of what we know comes from stories passed from generations. Also from oral history. Some Incan textile and clothing have been left behind as well. Historians have to be careful when the interpret these accounts though. Not all who visited the incas spoke their language, so some of the information may not be accurate. Some incan sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, stealers who take anything that seems and is valuable.

Item_Response: The Discovery of Lost Civilizations                   The discovery of lost civilizations has told archaeologists a lot about how they lived. These ancient civilizations include the Inca, Mesa, and underwater city of Atlantis. The powerful Incan empire ruled fornearly a hundred years(1438-1532). Since the Inca had no formal alphabet, they made knots in colored strings to keep records for the entire empire. Some of the Inca artifacts left behind include objects made form stone, pottery, gold, or silver. They might turn up in the ruins of buildings or buried in graves. Some of their textiles and clothes have survived well. Cloth was preserved in dry deserts or cold mountains. Some Inca treasure sites have been disturbed by looters, looking for anything valuable. Archaeologists study sites carefully and record everything to learn as much information as they can from evidence. They then can compare what they learn with the Spaniards' information about the Inca. They lived high in the Andes Mountains in remote places, such as caves or mountaintops. These cold peaks have acted like a giant freezer by preserving bodies and artifacts. These reveal more clues about their civilization and lifestyle.                   About 1,400 years ago, a group of people, later known as the Anasazi, chose to live in Mesa Verde. They eventually built complex stone communities in the sheltered canyon walls. The first Ancestral Puebloans, known as Basktmakers for their craft skills,  came to Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. Now they were farming for their main survival instead of hunting and gathering. They learned how to make pottery and made the first bow and arrow, which replaced the atlatl(a spear thrower.) They lived in pithouses, which later evolved into kivas. About A.D. 750, they began building above ground houses and were known as Puebloans. By A.D. 1000, they had advanced to skillful stone building. The Cliff Dwellers built citys beneath overhanging cliffs. They built with sandstone, mud and water. By A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted.              The underwater city of Atlantis was proven to exist off the coast of Greece by a British oceanographer. It is the oldest submerged town in the world. Shifting sands have allowed marine archaeologists to properly survey the ruins with digital technology. It revealed buildings, courtyards, tombs, and religious structures. The seabed also held thousands of pieces of pottery.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations       There have been stories of lost cities like Atlantis. We used to think that they were only myths. But what if I told you that archeaologists have found things that may have lead to the making of the myth of Atlantis? Yes, its true. Archeaologists have uncovered a sunken Greek city and believe this was the beginning of the stories of Atlantis. But, why study an ancient city that is underwater? The answer is quite simple-the people from the past may have known things that we do not know now. Why is it so important to know about lost cities? Well, lost cities may contain information that can help with science, medicine, culture, and other topics.       But Atlantis was not the only lost civilization. There were also the Incas. Most of the knowledge of ancient Inca is mostly told by recovered artifacts. Most Inca artifacts are made of stone, pottery, silver or gold-items that last a long time. But why collect artifacts? Well, they can tell you about the writing system, music, art, and other lost treasures.       Then there were the Puebloans. Most of them were basketmakers. They learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, which was more effective than the atlatl, or, spear thrower. They lived in pithouses, in-ground homes. Later, pithouses evolved into kivas. When the Puebloans left Mesa Verde, they settled in New Mexico and Arizona.

Item_Response: 3 Ancient Artifacts     Well we know that these Ancient Discoveries are all mysteries that nobody knows if it is true or not. Like the Inca is from Peru and had no formal alphabet or a system of writing. They did not know if they left anything behind or if they did. The Inca made a string called the quipus to record a calender to keep count of their lifestock. The first Europeans to to meet the Inca were amazed how they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records.   So how do we know about this civilization? We think that it was told by there family until these days. This culture ruuled the South American empire that rivaled the expanse of Ancient Rome. The Inca lived in high up houses that were called the Andes. Most of their sites are in remote, high places.   High-altitude archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all of their equipment up a mountain before they can start there discovery. Some bodies were found on cold mountains that act like a huge freezer. Bodies that were found in the icy Andes were in such good shape that the archaelogists could use modern medical scanning on the bodies to learn how the Inca's died. The bodies also reveal information about how they live in their cultures.   About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans arrived and explored North America, a group of people that lived in the corner were called the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde as their home. For over more than 700 years ago they're descendents lived and flourished here. Eventually building stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. In the late A.D. 1200s, the span of a new generation left their homes and moved away.   The Mesa Verde park is a reminder of the spectacular reminder of the ancient culture. Archaelogists called these people Anasazi, from the Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or ' ancient enemies.' Now these days people call them Ancestral Puebloans. The very first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in A.D. 550. they are known as the Basketmakers for their really good skill at crafting.   These people lived in pithouses  from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, as they settled agriculture, began. The pithouse had a feautured living room that sunk in a few feet into the ground. Four Corner timbers supported the roof. They had a firepit that had a deflectror. An antechamber was to contain storage bins or pits. The sipapu was a hole for a passage to the underworld, from which they came from. Pithouses later became envolved into kivas.       The secrets of a lost city have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths- the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off of Southern Greece. It was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of the Homer's heroes and in terms of the size and the wealth, the detail is unprecedent, experts say.   This site is straddled for about 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the Southern Peloponnese, is belived to have been consumed by the sea around 1000BC. Although it was discovered by a oceangrapher some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, they were able to search the ruins.   Henderson said, 'We found ceramics dating back to the end of the grey stone age, and suggested the settlement that was occupied about 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought.' Henderson co-directed the underwater search. ' Our investigations also revealed about over 9,000 square meters of the new buildings. But what really took us by surprise was the discocery of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, that also suggests the town had been used by an elite, and automatically raised the status of the settlement.'                                                                                                                                                                                                         hi :)

Item_Response: Important Discoveries                        Why are ancient artifacts so important? The reason they are so important is because they help us learn about the past. Archaeologists can piece together details of the people who lived before us by studying artifacts that they left behind. Discoveries made about the Inca, the Pueblanos, and the Pavlopetri have helped us understand ancient ways of living.                Archaeologist found out that the Inca made knots in colorful string to keep track of their livestock and to record their calender. To this day no one knows what these stories tied in knots really mean. Most of the information we know about the Incas is from what the Spaniards wrote about them. If we hadn't found the letters and diaries the Spanish soldiers and priests wrote we wouldn't know about the Incas. The cold weather up in the Andes preserved bodies from the Inca civilization. Scientists can use modern technology to find out why the person died. The dry deserts in Peru have also preserved clothing that the Inca wore. If we hadn't found any artifacts like statues, clothes, pottery, or jewelry, we wouldn't know anything about the Incas.                The Pueblanos from Mesa Verde were skilled basket makers. How do we know this? We know this because of the baskets they left behind. Archaeologists learned how the Pueblanos made their houses. They made their houses with poles and mud, but soon advanced to skillful stone masonry. When local cowboys reported cliff dwellings in the 1800's, archaeologist were determined to understand these peoples lives. However, we still don't know the whole story since the Pueblanos never left any written documents. Even the evidence archaeologists gathered seems sketchy.  We still don't know why they disappeared, but there are some theories. These theories include, crop failures, social and political problems ,and droughts.                 Many people are intrigued by lost cities. The lost city of Atlantis is one of them. However this particular lost city isn't Atlantis. A team of Anglo-Greek archaeologists and marine geologists explored the sunken settlement. They found thousands of shards of pottery along the seabeds.  They also found main roads, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. From this we can see how they built their cities in the past and we can also learn about their religion. Theories of why the Greek city sunk include, sea level changes, ground subsidence, or a tsunami.                 All of the things that the archaeologists found has helped us learn more about the past. We have found out so much from the things that they have found. We now know about ancient architecture, religion, art and living styles.

Item_Response: Mysteries Behind Civilizations       The Inca: The Inca was one of the greatest civializations that were ever existed, some of its discoveries surpised the whole word in fact some of its discoveries haven't still been answered. For example Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus and in each each colorful string shows a story full of mystery and surprises. But we still haven't found the answer to the mysteries that lay behind this quipus. Archaeologists also found Inca textiles and clothing left behind in the dry desers on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. This was a surprise because many Inca clothing was destroyed by dampness. Archaeologist also found bodies on top of the mounatin cliffs of the Andes, this bodies were remarkly found in good shape in which now they could scan those bodies using modern day medical technology and learn how this people died and how they live.       The Inca Pt. 2:Now in day archaeologist could use aerial photography to find patterns on the ancient monuments instead of seeing nothing on the ground. This Incla discoveries are very important because we would know how they live, how they dress, their religion and how far were they from our technology. But there is still so much to be learn from this civilization like what does those colorful strings mean is a time of tragedy, drought or a time of happiness. I guess someday we wil figure it out.       The Puebloans: We learned a lot about the Puebloans, so much but we still have two questions to answer. One of those questions is that why did the Mesa Verde desserted there settlement On A.D 1300's? The other question is we will never know who lived there? Because they never wrote records, the only thing they found was this magnifecent buildings. Archaeologist have found arts and crafts made this people, in which this was a extradionary find.        The Puebloans Pt. 2:They also found Kiva which meant a Ceremonial room. Archaeologists alos found pottery and buildings that arose to a anormeous height of 2 or 3 stories high in which it occupied 50 rooms or maybe even more. Many archeologists found pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recess. They also found pottery and bow and arrows in which they use to hunt because it was a better for hunting then just a atlatl, a spear thrower. But theres two main questions missing. Why did the people desserted the settlement on A.D 1300's? The other question is who live there?       The Pavlopetri: Also known as the people of Atlantis. Atlantis was a civilization that thought that never existed, but now in day technology, we know it did existed and we know it dates form 2800 to 1200 BC. We also now that this is one of the most unique planned out towns that we had ever found. This imaginary world unfolds a world of buildings, courtyard, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. But in a sudden surprise we also found thousands of shards of pottery.       The Pavlopetri Pt 2:But we know it was built around a protective bay and back then our grand parents say it did existed and now we could support that comment. This settlement was found off southern Greece. But there is still one more mystery left to uncover and it is how did this magnifesint settlement sank? Is it because of sea level changes, ground subsidence, earth quakes, or a tsunami. I guess thats one mystery that we have to look forward to.

Item_Response: Facts about the Lost Civilizations                                        Throughout years years there have been stories and myths about lost cities, but archaeologists are trying to find out if this was true by looking for artifacts, body remains, items that will give them clues. The myth of the lost city of Atlantis could or could no be true but archaeologist are trying to find out. The are also trying to study about the Ancient Incas and the Ancestral Puebloanos .                            The Incas made colorful stings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock. Some Europeans were amazed how they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archeologist have found many quipus but no one understands how to read the knots and what they mean and for us it is like a mystery. The Incas left many clues behind such as portraits of their religion, art and architecture, and their way of life. Most visitors were Spanish soldiers and priest and they would describe the Inca in letters and diaries, but some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history. Archaeologist have also found bodies and they can reveal information about how they lived.                  The Ancestral Pueblanos were known as basket makers for their skill at the craft. They did not have to hunt instead they used farming as their main livelihood. They would live in pit houses clustered into small villages and usually built them on mesa tops or sometimes in cliff recesses. Archeologists found basket and they show evidence of decline in quality.  Archeologist have sought to understand these people's lives, but despite decades of excavation, analysis, classification but still scientific knowledge remains sketchy. They left no written records and much was important in their lives has perished.                    The lost city of Atlantis is one of the most enduring myths. An Angl-Greek team of archeologist and marine geologist explored the sunken settlement. This is the oldest submerged town in the world. Archeologist  a world  of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. They also found the seabed  replete with thousands of shards of pottery. Marine geologist have yet to work out why the settlement sunk, it could of been an earthquake or tsunami that caused this as of right now it still remains a mystery.                     As you can see there are still a lot to uncover. We don't really know a lot of things it's all up to the future geologist, scientist, and historians to find out what happened.

Item_Response: Today I will be talking about the discoveries of ancient Inca,ancestral Puebloans,and Pavlopetri.       The discovery of Inca was a good discovery because it showed us how this old country was able to run or  keep up with records by using strings. To this day most likely nobody knows what these strings mean.Also its good because through clues we can see what  religion they worshiped also we can see the way of life that they had.Also the bodies that the experts found can help research what sickness they had or what they went through which could explain why the citiy died off.            Ancestral Puebloans was also a very important find as well because it could have been the place that skill of crafts men came from because they were know for there basketmakers.They replaced hunting with famering which they gatherd and used as thier main livelhood, Also they learned how to make pottery which we today have some what alot of.Then they houses out of mud and made them side by side which we can see through history thta this was not the only time that houses were made or built like this,which we benifited from.There population grew and grew pass the thousands and along with that they skills grew to all but the basket makeing which they were know for which is most likely because of thier advancement in pottery.The Puebloans were also know for there cliff dwellers who really proved to be smart because they used thier enviroment to the full by building there dwellings under the overhanging cliffs.So we can see the Puebloans advancments and much more in a way helpd us get to were we are today.       The Pavlopetri is a lost city remains of this city have been found under water and is said to be the oldest submerged town in the world.It straddles 30,000 square meters on the ocean floor said to have been consumed by the sea more than 1000 BC. Although found 40 years ago it was only this year it could be properly surveyd and thabks to the sand on the bottom of they sea the enclosure was protected to today.

Item_Response: Having artifacts from long ago is very important. Don't you want to l eave something behind and have your great great grandchildren find it?         The Inca of Peru didn't have and leave a formal alphabet or system of writing for historians to study, the Inca used colored strings with knots to keep count of livestock, and keep records. Archaeologists have found many of these quipus, but they still haven't found the meaning of the knots. Clues left behind from Inca tell us that they were very religious, and artistic, they did architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and just lived their daily lives. Pottery, gold, and silver were all left behind such as textiles, and clothing which gives a clue on their way of life.         The Puebloans were known for their basket makers, skill, and craft. They had more of a settled life, and were nomadic people. People lived in pit houses which contained of storage bins and/or pits. They left no written records, and we will never know their whole story.         The Pavlopetri, was sunken back 5,000 years ago. They found buildings, courtyards, tombs, religious structures, and main streets. Archaeologists also discovered shards of pottery which gives of a clue of their interests and belief.        Having pieces of ancient history, is very important. It gives archaeologists a grasp on their daily lives and their culture. We could now know their interests and daily lives, just by having amazing discoveries like pottery, and such.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered what people many years ago were like? What they did in their   free time? What they did for work. They didn't have the luxuries that we have today: iPhones, PlayStation 3, Xbox- they had simple wooden toys. Archaeologists are people that go out to find these things, and bring them back to get studied.       The archaeologists have gone to the old site of the Incan civilization. There, they found quipus, which was their idea of a calculator. the Inca left behind a lot of information, which helps us find out who they were. Some of what we know about the Incans was passed on by stories. The Inca ruled for almost 100 years, just to be destroyed by the Spaniards. But they left behind a very important legacy, which makes them important.       In Mesa Verde national park, Archaeologists have discovered more artifacts from a different race of people, known as the Ancestrial Puebloans. They lived in Mesa Verde for about 1700 years, and then moved on to a different area. They built pithouses, which were hpuses that were sunken into the ground a few feet, and invented the bow and arrow. Eventually, their houses went from being dirt and wood to stone, and cities were built. Archaeologists have found a lot of baskets and other small items here.       Finally, we have the Pevlopetri, a city that sank underwater in Greece a few thousand years back. I am going to refer to it as Atlantis because this is the city that supposedly inspired that myth. And Atlantis is easier to say. The city dates back 5000 years-Homer's time. The city is 30,000 square meters, and is full of artifacts. Atlantis is full of buildings, gardens, courtyards, tombs, and some religious structures. The city is believed to sink around 1000 BC. Pottery that dates back to the srone age was found. The archaeologists also found a megaron, which would have been used by the Elite, which would have raised the town's status. This is the first underwater city found that dates back to before Plato's famous tale.       These three civilizations have provided doorways into the past, but there is still a lot of world out there to be explored. We have only explored 1% of the ocean floor, so there could be a lost country out there and don't even know it. The world may never know a few things, such as 'What did the dinosaurs look like?' 'Were ancient people nice?' That's what archaeologists are trying to find out.

Item_Response: How do we learn what we know about the past?            We learn what we know about the past from discovering ancient artifacts or buildings and anything that had writings or pictures.  We can learn how people lived back then by observing these objects and artifacts.                                The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are important because we can learn how they lived and what happened to them.            Archaeologists have found many artifacts of the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri.  They have found Inca bodies that are frozen and can determine how they lived and how they died.  Historians have found pithouses and kivas from the first Ancestral Puebloans that show us that they advanced their technology.  Geologists have found many artifacts of the Pavlopetri such as many buildings, courtyards, main streets, and religious structures.            Historians have found some clues about what happened to the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri.  They know that the Incas were killed by Spaniards in 1532 and the Spaniards took over the empire.  The Ancestral Puebloans had crop failures and their land's resources were depleted so they moved into New Mexico and Arizona.  The Pavlopetri's settlement sank due to an earthquake and/or a tsunami.

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have provided the archaeologists with great knowledge. Archaeologists have developed many ideas and theories about how these three tribes about how they have lived and developed in the past. Each of these three groups have different unique ideas ideas about each. They each have developed different houses, tools, weapons, religous ceremonies, and much more. Even though all these three tribes have not survived to this day, they were all very succesful in the past.                       The Inca was a very succesful tribe living in the Andes Mountains in what is today known as what is Peru. Although the Inca left no archieves for historians to study, archaeologists have figured out hw to read the quipus, which are colorful knots made by the Inca to record the calender to keep count of livestock. There civilizatrion lasted from 1438 to 1532, and they ruled the South American empire. Many clues have been left by the Inca which gave us ideas about their religion, art, and way of life. Much of what we know now about the Inca has come from oral history or or stories that have been passed down.                           The Puebloans were a very succesful group of people, who chose to live in the region kown as Mesa Verde in North America. They lived in North American hundreds of years before the Europeans came. They lived here for more than seven hundred years and there people flourished here. The first settlers that lived in Mesa Verde, replaced hunting with farming, and were known as a very peaceful group of  people. They were known for their great skill and technique of basketmaking and other crafts, such as pottery and weaving. They also made a more efficent hunting tool called the bow and arrow than the usual a spear thrower. Also they lived in pithouses which consisted of a living room, and a firepit. Then in late A.D. 1200s, this great civilazation, left their homes, and moved away.                            In Southern Greece, the secrets of  a lost city may have inspired one of the worl's most famous myths, the fable of Atlantis. This civilazation dates back five thousand years. Archealogists know almost nothing about this civilazation, but they have started searching. This is one of the oldest suberged towns in the world. It has remains dating back to 1200 BC. There is much more to be figured out anout this tribe.                             All in all these three tribe have had there glory days, and know it is to us to figure out about the history thay provide. They each are very unique and different from each other. Archeologists have much more to figure out about these three fantastic civilazations.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study but they made knots in colored strings. The knots were called quipus and they were used to record the calander to keep a count of livestock. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but even today no one knows what these knots mean. Clues were left behind the Inca and form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, goverment, transportation, and way of life. The Inca has its history and stories passed from generation to generation. We know some stories beacause they were written ba Eurepeans. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well so they couldn't understand what the Inca told them. Some Inca stories were legends rather than history. Archaeologists who study sites keep careful records like writing down and photographing any artifacts they find.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca's of Peru used different material to communicate with each other using special colored strings called quipus to record livestock and act as a calendar. Evidence of their art, religion, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life was also left behind. Much of the information we have discovered on the Incan civilization comes from stories that were written down in their records or passed down from generation to generation. Historians have to treat every single artifact with care in the hope that nothing is permanently damaged. Pottery, gold, and silver are such artifacts that archaeologists have found within the tombs of ones who have died or in the ruins of ancient buildings. Some incan textiles were surprisingly in great condition while others have faded away or broken into pieces, depending on the weather surrounding the objects. Many artifacts have also been taken/looted by people passing by which does little to help the archaeologists. When artifacts are taken by an archaeologist, they often compare them to other items that have been taken around the same area. when archaeologists do find special, peculiar artifacts, they must be careful carrying the items down the freezing mountain for study to preserve the items. Bodies are also some of the artifacts that are found within the mountains. By being able to take these bodies into study, it helps archaeologists find out the reasons for why/ how they died.
