Item_Response: In Ancient civilizations the Incans, The Puebloans, and The Pavlopetris were all huge discoveries and set an example for the world and the humans today. In the late 1500's the Incans were settling in the high Andes and may have worshipes many peaks. Many of the Incan sites were located very high up in the mountains. This makes it difficult for the acheologist to discover the incan territories. The bodies that are found also help reveal information about how the Incans lived. They then moved away in 1200 A.D.       The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about in 550 A.D. they were known as very skilled workers in the basket making and craft making industries. They also learned how to make pottery, bow and arrows, and more efficient weapons such as a spear thrower for hunting animals. Puebloans had also made little houses to make  a living in they were called pithouses. In the pithouses there were fireplaces,storage bins, and there was also a sipapu (a hole for a  passage to the underworld, from which the people had to come.)   By A.D. 750 they began builing houses above ground  with upright walls made of poles and mud.They used to build the houses one against  eachother in long,curving rows, usually with a pithouse in front. Later pitthouses turned into kivas. People of Mesa Verde had an advancement of pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. By 1200 A.D. the population grew to an abundance size!    During the summer fire was usually used for cooking.     In conclusion are later ancestors set an example for us humans today and made us who we are today. If archeologist didnt discover these artifacts who knows what we would have to this day.

Item_Response: Many ancient cultures help us understand about the past, such as the ancient Inca of Peru or the Puebloans of Mesa Verde. Through these cultures we can learn about their architecture, religion, economy, and even how they lived out their average lives.
Item_Response_Tag: JJ NN NNS VBP PRP VBP IN DT JJ , JJ IN DT JJ NNP IN NNP CC DT NNPS IN NNP NNP NNP DT NNS PRP MD VB IN PRP$ NN , NN , NN , CC RB WRB PRP VBD RP PRP$ JJ NNS .

Item_Response: The ancient Inca civilizations provide a great example about what archaeologists have learned from past civilizations. The Inca did not have an official system of writing, or archives for future scientists to examine. Instead, they used colors string with knots to hold massive amounts of data from all over their lands. Among the huge amounts of these ropes archaeologists have found, no one knows what they actually represent or mean. This leaves scientists everywhere with a mystery, but it's not just the Inca. Civilizations all over the world leave undecipherable text, but examining artifacts and material objects that the ancients might have used daily can give us a clue as to how they lived hundreds of years ago. Uncovering these ancient mysteries is a priority to understand our ancestors better.                        Up in the Andes mountains in South America, the Inca thrived despite the unforgiving weather and terrain. They used a plethora of innovative farming, hunting, building, and organization techniques but were put down by Francisco Pizarro and his Spanish army. However, they only took the valuables in plain sight, leaving the more durable artifacts for us to study. Not only were artifacts found, but the land was left near untouched even though the weathering and erosion was inevitable.These records mistakenly left behind by the Inca are crucial to discover how they lived their everyday lives. This way, we, as the modern population, can learn from their mistakes and not lose our progress in one mistake.                 The Puebloans at Mesa Verde thrived in alcove in a massive cliff face until around 1300 A.D. The Puebloans thrived in this environment, despite the high elevation and difficulty to gather necessary supplies. Mesa Verde was the home of nomads starting to establish a permanent settlement. They were skilled craftsmen and learned to make pottery, bows and arrows, and spears. By examining the Ancestral Puebloans' homes called 'pit-houses' scientists have discovered smoke-blackened walls, showing that they can create fire and might have burned down homes during the cold, crisp winter months. The main mystery about their civilization is why they left their settlement. Nobody knows if the crops did not grow, if a massive drought occured, or if the natural resources around the area were entirely used up. They might have had social differences or decided to move to a new region. Whatever the reason, it leaves us to marvel at their amazing cliff-side homes and examine the ancients' lives.                Off the coast of southern Greece, a recent discovery was found that might have fueled the myth of 'The Lost City of Atlantis'. The city is definitely the oldest sbmerged settlement in the world, dating back to 2800 B.C., the Classical Greek era. The 30,000 square meter ruin has provided a great deal of information to archaelogists to geologists everywhere. It is believed to have been flooded around 1000 B.C., insisting there was a large flood and more land. Scinetists have discovered large amounts of broken pottery on the sea floor and a megaron, meaning the city was used by nobles and elites of society. The city hold a frozen moment of the past, preserved by the sea, of all things.              Studying minor historical settlements is just as important as studying the widely-known ones. Sometimes they grant a gift like being the oldest submerged city, or how astonishing their architecture was. These civilizations can us a great deal about what life was like all over the world in the past. Studying their mistakes and lifestyles can help us better prepare if history repeats itself.

Item_Response: Throughout the years, archaeologists have discovered multiple ancient civilizations, helping people today learn about their ancestors. Uncovering information about people that lived on Earth before us can help us compare and contrast the past and the future. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are arguably some of the most important discoveries of the ancient world.          Archaeologists have scavenged the globe for bits and pieces of our ancestors. They use special tools and techniques to help dig up artifacts. The Inca are one of the civilizations they have uncovered. The Inca civilization was unique in the way that it kept track of records, like calenders or the number of livestock someone owned. The Incan people had no formal writing system, instead they tied knots into strings to count numbers. The Incas show us that there is always a way to get something done, no matter how difficult the task may seem. They are also en example of how evolved people at that time might have been. To learn about the Incas' every day lives, Archaeologists can study artifacts, listen to stories that have been passed down from generation to generation, or even read notebooks that were left behind by the Spaniards. These discoveries help us in the present day by telling us what the ancient Incans might have done to survive.          1,400 years ago, Mesa Verde was occupied by the people now known as Puebloans or 'village dwellers'. The Puebloans lived in cliff alcoves. They left no written records and most artifacts hey might have left behind have perished. However, the Puebloans left archaeologists another great insight to their lives: their homes. The structures that the Puebloans lived in have provided archaeologists today with clues to how these people lived and thrived. They not only show us what kind of houses they built, but also what kind of things they did, what kinds of materials they had available to them, what they cooked, and even where they slept. They also provide a little insight as to what civilizations in similar geographical areas may have worn because of the similar weather.          The Pavlopetri are one of the most unusuall civilizations in the according to many archaeologists. The Pavlopetri were not destryoed by a conqueror, nor did they move to another area. The Pavlopetri, for a reason that historians have yet to decide, fell into the waters off the coast of Southern Greece. This sunken civilization has shown researchers how earthquakes, sea level changes, and tsunamis can change the geographical look of a town or even a whole city. What archaeologists have found in the waters of this ancient city is astonishing. The water has acted as a sort of camera, keeping everything picture perfect and without change.          Every archaeologist dreams of discovering an artifact that will continue to teach the people today about the past. The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are important in how they have shed light on the past and have helped us better understand our ancestors.

Item_Response: What archaeologist find throughout the ancient history is unbelievable! When we usually hear about what they have found we see them as pointless things but, really they're an important part of our daily lives. They teach us about religion, culture, and what our ancestors went through in order to survive. Our ancestors help us learn and progress throughout the years.       Paintings, pottery, and money help us with figuring out what they believed in, what god they worshiped. Most paintings would portray something about a might god that would help them through trouble. Pottery usually would have small drawings in on the outside, usually of hunting, or daily task they had to go through. Coins were found in the Inca territory, maybe that was there way of using money.      Buildings in the lost city of Atlantis were discovered, they way they built stuff could also have a big impact on how we build buildings now. Colosseum built in the Puebloan territory could be the reason why we have stadiums, churches, or houses.     We never really realize what our ancestors left behind help us grow. What they leave us may help with making technology better. It's fascinating to know that we have grown so much and learned from out mistakes just through simple objects like a pot.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered why the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important?   These places of the bast have helped us in where we are today. If we didn't have these findings we may have made the same mistakes, and not been able to function in government. The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important to our history.                   Ancient Inca was apart of the world in 1438-1532 in ancient Rome. They had no formal alphabet or system of writing. However, they did have a calendar. They used colored strings, quipus, to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Some of what we know from Inca has been passed down from generations. In 1532 they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire. We also know a lot about Inca because of the artifacts left behind such as, pottery, silver, gold, textiles, and sometimes clothing. Since the Inca's lived in the Andes they may have worshiped the mountain peaks. The fall of the Inca was in 1532 when the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king.                       The  Peubloans lived about 1,400 years ago, living in the four corners region. They were known for there skills and craftswork. Puebloans did more farming than hunting. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages. They also learned to make pottery. In the late A.D. 1200s, they left there homes and moved away.                         The Peloponnese is believed to have been consumed by an ocean in 1000BC. They discovered many buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. similar to others they also had pottery. The Peloponnese was off the tip of Greece. There was over 9,000 square miles of buildings! There was also a discovery of a possible megaron,monumental structure with a rectangular hall.                           All in all, these finds were extremely important to our history. Uncovering the past can be useful to the future. Learning these findings will let us know what we have to do in order to be sufficient. Inca, Peubloans, and the Peloponnese are amazing finds in our history.

Item_Response: In this article,I will explain how the discoveries of the Inca,the Puebloans, and the Palvopetri are so important.All around the world,many artifacts and lost kingdoms are found.These artifacts and kingdoms are very important,because they tell a lot about the past that we did not know.The historical finds help us learn from our mistakes and find out about how their culture relates to us.They are great discoveries and historians are eager to find out more about them.               The Inca had no system of any writing or a formal alphabet.This makes it hard for historians to study about their culture and who they were.Yet,they used strings called quipus to tie knots and keep track of their history.Archeologists found many old quipus,but they could never figure out what they said.The Inca did leave behind many clues about themselves.They left behind their government,art and architecture,transportation,religion,agriculture,and their way of life.                The very first Ancestral Puebloans settled down in old Mesa Verde in around A.D. 550.They are skilled at crafting and are known as basket-makers.They discovered farming and that took place instead of hunting and gathering.Learning about how to a bow and arrow helped improve their weapons.This was a good thing,because bow and arrows were much stronger than a spear thrower.They lived in pit houses which were slightly sunken in the ground and had a air deflector for the fire-pit.                          The Pavlopetri lived in a city in Atlantis called the lost city.It`s called the lost city,because it sunk in the Atlantic Ocean.The city sank about 5,000 years ago and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented.Dr. Jon Henderson even said,'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world!'. What they found in the city was amazing courtyards,buildings,main streets, and religious structures.Thanks to the shifting of sands and the oceans currents,the city was well preserved.                 In conclusion,there are so many discoveries and things to be found.You would be surprised what history could be hiding underneath the oceans floor.From the research of Mesa Verde all the way to Atlantis,there are still many questions on how the cities fall.How did the city of Atlantis sink?What does the quipus`s say?There is so much we haven`t figured out and so many questions still unanswered.

Item_Response: Discoveries that have meen made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important for the history of the world.  Making discoveries allows us to learn about the ancient people and learn their lifestyles.  By learning about the ancien people, we can know how we came to live how we do now.       Archeologists have to be very careful with the artifacts that they come across.  FInding tools, clothes, art, writings, and many more things can be very important.  By finding these things, we can know how they survived in their location.  We can figure out what language they spoke and how they communicated with other people.  With tools, we can know what they used to hung animals or anything like that.  Through art and writing, we can know thier religious beliefs.  By finding little pieces left behind by the Inca, we can form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, and way of life.       In conclusion, having these important discoveries help a lot for us to figure out the ancient life.  Us as humans, we are curious about everything, and being curious about the people many years ago is one of those curiosities that we have.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered about how ancient civilizations where found or how they lived? Many important discoveries from the civilizations help us today to know more about the ancient times.In the next few paragraphs you will learn about the Inca , Puebloans and the Pavlopetri.                 First the Inca of Peru was one of many ancient civilizations. The Inca was a civilization for many years from 1438 - 1532. The Inca had no formal system of writing .They tied knots together called quipus. Many articifacts like stone, pottery, gold , and silver where found.Those artifacts where found in ancient building or even in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. The archeologists learned that the civilization came from and how i fell. The Inca lived high in the Andes , where they worshiped some of the mount peaks.The fall of the Inca was in 1532 when the Spaniards murdered he last Inca king , and then took over the empire.                A second ancient civilization is the Puebloans. The Puebloans lived about 1400 years ago. For over 700 years the Puebloans flourished and lived in there descendents. The Puebloans built stone communities, and sheltered alcoves. Many of the peubloans where know as basket-makers , because of their skill in making crafts. they lived in homes called pitohouses clustered into tiny villages. Puebloans huntented , made potter and guns. The people learned to make pole-and-adobe construction. they made units to live in that had 50 or more rooms. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 was called their classic period. in this period the population was at over several thousand. Over years the pueblonas made new and improved strusture like churches. the church was based on modern puebloan practice. they used kivas for healing rites , to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop season. Ancestral Puebloans lived in dwelling for less than 100 years. By A.D. 1300 the Pueloans was deserted.             One of the most inspired myth was the fable of Atlantis. The town's remains ae dating back to 2800 - 1200 BC. The town was found beneath the waters of Greece which straddles 30,000 square meters. Atlantis was found to be consumed in about 1000 BC. Down in the town many artifcats where found like a ceramic datting back to 5,000 years ago. while investigating the underwater world the archeologists found 9,000 square meters of new buildings , like possible megarons , and a monumental structure. This is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Palto wrote his allegorical tale. Researchers haven't figured out when and why the fall of atlantis was.            All in all there are many ancient civilizations that may be discovered and those where just a few. The Inca, Puebloans and the Pavloperti have gave many opportunities to archeologists to know more about what happened before many where alive.

Item_Response: Discoveries of Ancient Civilization             This article is mainly about amazing discoveries around the world that is now history today. For example, in 1438-1532, the Inca of Peru had no alphabet, so they made knots in colored strings. No body to this day knows what the knots mean, but the strings were very colorful. There were some old stories written by the Europeans, but the Historians had to be careful because they could not understand some of the writing, so it might not be very trustworthy. Most of what everybody knows about the Inca is based on artifacts or stuff they left behind. Some of Inca's sites have been destroyed by visitors, or hunters. Some Inca were buried in caves, or high mountain tops. The bodies found in the mountain tops are in such good shape from the freezing ice that scientists can learn how they died.        About 1,400 years ago, a handful of people living in the Four Corners, picked Mesa Verde as their home. In the late 1200s, they left their homes and moved away after a couple generations went through. People lived in pit houses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. The living room was sank down a few feet under the ground, and four corners supporting the roof. They began to build houses in A.D. 750. The houses were built one against another made of poles and mud.        When cowboys first discovered the cliff dwellings in the 1880s, no body could really figure out how these peoples lives were like. They lived in Kivas, or underground chambers built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. They traveled into New Mexico and Arizona.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system writing. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. When Europeans arrived in the empire in 1532, the visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They could not speak the Inca language.      Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniard's accounts of the Inca. The Inca lived high in the Andes and even have worshiped some mountain peaks. Some of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This helped from looters, because they cannot get to them easily. The high Andes is like a giant freezer, and bodies have been found in the icy Andes in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equpitment to learn about how people died.      About A.D. 750 they began building houses above the ground. Puebloans are know as the Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers.'Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff acloves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before.

Item_Response: The Greek City                                More than forty years ago a city was found under the sea by a British ocea nographer in Greece. Its was off the southern coast of Peloponnese. It is one of the most unique cities found. The size and the wealth of detail has never been seen before. The city is very unique, well preserved, and its surpassed peoples expectation.                       The city is very unique to everybody that heard or read about the cities ruins. What makes the city so unique to everybody is it was a planned town with smart people and with great detail. Also, it size and the city has never been heard of. The city was very wealthy it had great detail to lots of things in the city. It straddles 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. The seabed was replete with lots of pottery. They also have rock-cut tombs.                          The city is very well preserved the sand under on the sea bed shifted and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay. This city being well preserved is great because it revealed  buildings, courtyards, main streets, and religious structures. The religious structure means the city was well unified under one religion. Main streets also mean there was trade going on in the city. The courtyards is saying the city got together and had discussions which also means that they were unified.                  The city surpassed everyone's expectations of the city. They were so impressed on how wealthy the city was and how unified it was. It also surpassed the expectations by the structure of the buildings on how well it was made and the detail that everything had. They certainly took pride and effort into there work. This also is impressive there pottery is everywhere on the seabed. Which can mean that mostly everyone was skilled. Even though they did not have advanced technology they were still very impressive.                 This civilization is a great even though we have very little information on them all you tell is good by the city. The only question is, 'Why is there nobody there' and ,'Why is the civilization now under water.' Some possible answers might be ,'They got so carried away with making there city a very good town they did not  focus on the natural disasters.' But a counter example might be, 'They had courtyard which where they go and have discussions somebody must of brought up the question.' This might be a red flag. Warning us to focus on religion to be unified ,but do not forget the natural disasters especially now that we have global warming where natural disasters can come without warning. So be prepared because you never know when or where it is going to happen.

Item_Response: People around the world have been searching for lost and ancient civilizations for many years. Their finds put the pieces together with fact not just with stories or legends. Clothing, pithouses, and pottery are what make the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri discoveries so important.   We have little information about the strange and mythical inca people. Most of that information comes from spanish soldiers or priests who described the Incas in diaries or letters. One of the most important discoverie we have made about the Inca people are the quipus which are colored strings knotted together in a complex system of knots. From the stories we have assumed that the knots were used for keeping track of cattle or other animals around the Inca terratory. That find was important because it gives us some evidence they did have some kind of system of knots with strings.   The Puebleans are very good at craft and building. One of the most common discoveries we made about the Puebleans are there pithouses made out of mud, clay, and wood. In the pithouses we have found artifacts such as pottery, tools, bows, beds,  and weapons. these finds were important because they help us piece together daily life of the Puelean people.   Pavopetri has had hndreds of stories of untold rickes and amazing technology surrounding in for years. Now that we have found it we have been able to explore this mystical place discovering pottery shattered throughout the ruins. This discovery has been able to help us learn more about these ancient and mystical people.   There will always be ancient civilizations out there hidded as we hunt for unreal mythical version of these magnificant places. We have found out a lot in our history from studying the civilizations. And that is why clothing, pithouses, and potter make the Incas, Puebleans, and Pavopetri peoples discoveries are so important.

Item_Response: A Blast From The Past       The importance of our history is immense. Without knowledge of our past it would be a different world as we know it.We have learned so much from our ancestors and we are thankful to all the people that made that possible. This article I am going to write will be about how important it is that we keep searching and studying our ancestors and their way of life. Although some civilizations are hard to learn about due to the way they lived like the Inca's because of their complicated way of keeping records and talking to one another.       The Incan civilization lived in The Andes mountains in Peru. They had a very complicated way of keeping records by making knots on colored strings called 'quipus'. With that they could keep track of livestock, have a calender that was always right and speak to each other almost like a text message. Almost all we know about them has come from oral history.       The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde about 1,400 years ago. Archeologists called theses people the Anasazi, a Navajo word that is translated to 'the Ancient ones'. Thanks to modern technology we have learned a lot about how they lived and what they did. Archeologists were able to dig up some of there city's and recreate what they lived in called 'Pit houses' with out being able to find these cities we would have no knowledge of how people used to live. Some of their designs are currently being used today which is very helpful and neat looking.       One of my very favorite stories as a young buck was the fable of the city of Atlantis. We have created technology useful to the search of the lost city and have been able to find it thanks to some B.A. technology. The story says that town sunk at least 5,000 years ago and at that time it was one of the most organized civilizations ever. We have learned from exploring the underwater city that the god of Atlantis was Posiden the god of the sea which is funny because the town is under the sea.       What we have learned from our ancestors and their city's is so useful in modern day and will be useful in the future and probably forever. I am thankful that people are willing to risk their life to learn more and become a better world. Without knowing about our ancestors and their cities the world could be a different place. This has truly been a 'blast from the past'.

We always have that desire to see whats it is like in a different time. Some of the greatest civilizations were a part of the past. Some of these civilizations are mysteries. Three of the best civilizations were the Incas, the Mesa Verde, and the Greeks.        The Incas were are somewhat of a well know civilization today and a mystery at the same time. The Incas are well known for living in the Andes mountain range and their unusal form of writing known as quipus. Quipus is a system of tying colored knots to represent letters and numbers. This applys to our daily lives in the sense that this form of writing is so advanced that we can't understand if even today. We still know lots about the Inca even though we can't comprehend their writings. We know that the

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important studies. The Inca are a unique people. They had no alphabet and they didn't have a system of writing, but they have an interesting way of keeping records. What they did was tie knots in a string which is a unique way of keeping records. To this day nobody knows what  the knots mean.                                                                                                                          The Ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde about 550 A.D. They are good at basket making which is why they are called Basketmakers. They lived in shelters called Pithouses. Kivas are gathering places and also used to weave things. To use nature as an advantage the Ancestral Puebloans built their houses underneath the overhanging cliffs.

Item_Response: Can you imagine the lost city of Atlantis, dwellings under cliffs, and an empire high in the mountains of South America? Well places like these are being discovered and learned about today. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because they teach us about ancient cultures and answer ancient legends.             First of the three is the ancient Incan empire which is still being learned about today. The Inca are very impotant because they dominated the Andes and the surrounding areas for a long time. We don't know much about them because their form of writing the quipus 'but today no one knows what the knots mean' and their language is lost to time. They made ancient calendars and thousands of miles of roads proving they were very advanced for their time.  The Inca are a a very impotant ancient civilization.            Secondly the Puebloans are mysterious because they left their homes for no reasons as far as the modern world can tell. 'Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years.'

Item_Response: Many people don't know much of the Inca. The Incas had no writing system or formal   alphabet system nor did they leave any archives for historians to study from. The Inca left only clues of their existance that archaeologist had to put together to learn about the Inca. There are stories of Incas from Spaniards and Europeans, but some of them are legends. Luckily, the Inca left some artifacts for archaeologist. Artifacts and the area they were found helped the archaeologist learn more about the Inca.                   The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. Puebloans. Archaeologist found out Puebloans were basket crafters. Through out the years for the people of Mesa Verde, they kept improving in the structures they built and pottery. Then some Puebloans started moving back into cliffs. Archaeologist have no idea why they did it. Puebloans live in cliff dwelling for less than a hundred years. Then they migrated south into New Mexico and Arizona.                           Pavlopetri has sunken about five-thousand years ago. 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr. Jon Henderson. 'There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique.' said Dr. Jon Henderson. Pavlopetri had buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs. and religious structures that were in great condition. The archaeologist search showed over nine-thousand square meters of buildings. 'It is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied,' said Elias Spondylis. Pavlopetri is the first sunken city to be found in Greece.

Item_Response: Uncovering the Secerts                                                        By: Emily Beach             Archaeologists have many things they have to do and learn from when undcovering the past. The smallest of things can be some of the biggest keys to uncovering secerts. When archaeologists unlocked the past to the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, it changed the world's point of view.         When looking for clues about the ancient Inca of Peru, archaeologists found many artifacts that later help them unravle the story. They found textiles and clothes, that showed what the conditions were for them to wear certain clothes. One of the biggest clues was the way the Inca documented everything. They would use something as simple as string to record all of the city's infomation. This amazed many that such a big empire can run documents on string. All of the artifacts found play a big role in discovering more about their everyday life. When each artifact is discovered, it widens the whole world's knowledge on the ancient empire.         But archaeologists don't only find amzig stories in far away countries. The Puebloans were right here in America! The Puebloans were very talented . From the artifacts and stories archaeologists can tell they were very sucessful basketmakers and craftsmen. Even today, America keeps the Puebloans in close memory by keeping the area were they settled a national park. Without learning about the Puebloans, we would not be able to reconize them today.         Have you ever heard of Altantis? The city lost under the sea? Well, archaeologists found something that is pretty close. An ancient Greek city was found completly suberged in water. The sercerts and stories were all put together. When exploring, archaeologists were baffled that this had gone unoticed. Suddenly all the myths became reality. The people that lived around the site were filled with excitement and honor, that a story so close to home was revealed.         Without discovering ancient civilizations and learning more about them, humanity would start to question our past. These discoveries effect the people around the historic area and the world. With every new discovery, the world's knowledge expands. It is important to reconize these ancient civilizations because without them, we may not be here today.

Item_Response: The inportance of the Inca, Puebloan and Pavlopetri discoveries are many, and differ from find to find.       The Inca discoveries are rather inportant for they can show details about a vastly unexplored culture. The procurement of Inca artifacts and excavation of ruins shed light on a society of strong religious and spiritual beliefs. We can understand current South American culture better if we research and understand it's ancient predecessors, and as such it is a big contribution to social histories.       The Puebloan finds are a distinct step in understanding Native American histories. Usually due to their nomadic ways there is not a very specific place to study these people's ancient histories. This is a way for many modern Native Americans to learn of their heritage, much like white Europeans can.       The discovery of Pavlopetri is a signifigant step in European history. Based off how it has shown us artifacts dating back to 3000 BC, it can show us a view of the ancient Medditeranean before civilizations like Rome took it over and lost much history. It is also inportant in relation to the fable of Atlantis and other ancient stories.       In many ways, these finds accomplish similar things. They can teach us about lost culture, history and religion. They can help us understand myths and legends better. And above all, we can use this knowledge to expland our histories, and connect our stories into a single tapestry of knowlege and experience on a worldwide scale.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were all very important discoveries because they helped us figure out more information about ancient civilizations. Archaeologists have done a phenomonal job of putting puzzle pieces of their history together to form a detailed description of the lives these ancient people lived.        The first reason that the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were all very important discoveries is the mistakes that we can learn from. When archeaologists make new discoveries about ancient civilizations, we can learn more and infer more about the past. The reason that the past is so important, is becuase we can learn from the people of that time period. We should not make the same mistakes that people made back then, because we know that their empire fell or the food they ate made people sick, etc. In Source #1, the author writes, 'The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing.'   We know now how to read and write. We can communicate with each other and keep records, which helps our country keep things under control.        The second reason that the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were all very important discoveries is that we can learn from their inventions and buildings. In Source #2, the author writes, 'By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Walls of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and were joined together in units of 50 rooms or more.' Ancient people's buildings, I am sure, have helped us advance in our designing of homes and other buildings.        The third reason that the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were all very important dicoveries is our knowledge about ancient civilizations make. In Source #3, the author writes, 'More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings of Maycenaean society.' This tells me that once archaeologists find out more about this civilization, we will be even more knowledgable about ancient civilizations.        The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri were very important for many reasons. In fact, discoveries about any ancient civilization is very important. I love hearing interesting facts about the way that people in history acted and lived, and I hope that archaeologists continue to discover civilizations of the past.

Item_Response: Sometimes do you ever wonder about unkown civilizations of the past? Three of the most intruiging civilazations were the ancient Inca of Peru, the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde, and the dwellers of the sunken city of Atlantis near Greece. These civilizations and myths are  some of the most thought about and reasearched peoples today.              There have been new discoveries that provides us with very astonishing information, such as that the city of Atlantis was real in a geographical way but not a realistic underwater life way. The city of Atlantis dates back to to around 2800 BC. The city itself more or less likely sunk because of Natural Disasters such as a Tsunami or a land slide. At the sight of the Underwater city there were ceramics that dated almost 5000 years ago! The water submerged city of Atlantis is one of the greatest discoveries to date.                The next important civilization were going to talk about is the ancient Inca of Peru. This civilization had no written records. The Inca used quipus or knots in colored strings to mark things such as keping count of livestock. In fact, the only records they kept were the quipus. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history or storytelling. Some of these stories were recorded by the early Europeans that arrived in 1532. There were arrivals that spoke spanish and were called 'Spaniards'. The Spaniards recorded some of the Inca stories too but did not speak the language of the Inca so the interpretations might not be correct.                 The final civilization we'll discuss is the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde. The Ancestral Puebloans communities lived in the shelter of alcoves and canyon walls. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in about 550 A.D. Their highly expert skill in crafting got them the nickname of 'Basketmakers'. The Basketmakers were Nomadic. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. The Ancestral Puebloans usually lived in pithouses.

Item_Response: Do you like to know about past civilizations and how they lived well you could never learn about the past without archaeologists. Archaeologists are people that help discover and uncover old artifacts. Without archaeologists we may never have been able to uncover the past. The past would just be forgotten           Without learning from the past we would never get smarter as a species. We need to know how the past civilizations lived so it will help us live today and in the future. We may also never know what is true and what isn't. For example we never thought that the myth of Atlantis was remotely real until archaeologists found a underwater city that was 5000 years old. This discovery really brought some light on the myth.           Because the city was underwater it was like a moment frozen in time. The city has not been reoccupied or changed in any way.This means we can learn about life there just by looking at the city.But we can find even more about the past here on land In the Second source it says ' In winter,when the alcove rooms were damp and uncomfortable,fires probably burned throughout the village. Smoke-blackened walls and ceilings are reminders of the biting cold these people lived with for several months each year.' From this observation and more we know how they survived and lived.           We need to know how they survived and acted to better put together the past.Each discovery is like a puzzle piece. We will probably never discover ever artifact from the past but for every one we do discover we add another piece to the puzzle. In hundreds of years archaeologists could be digging and finding artifacts to put together the world we live in now. But unless a major event occurs i don't think so

Item_Response: The ancient Incan people of Peru had no foral alphabet or system of writtig. So how do we know about a civilization that for around a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of Rome. The Incans left behind clues that form an magnificent portait of thier religon, art and architecturr, agriculture, government, transpotation, and their way of life.            Some of what we know comes from  oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on this infromation is importiant to preserve a communite's history. We know some of the old stories becuase they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532.

Item_Response: For my article I will be talking about the Incas, the Puebloans and the lost city of atlantis. I will be describing their signifacance in being a not so lost city anymore.         The incas had no formal alphabet or system of writing so its kind of hard to understand what happened to them back then. One thing they did do was make knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar and to keep a count of livestock. But we do not know how to read them. One thing we do know is that they ruled South America from 1438 to 1532 this is when their king was killed and the Spanish took over. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from the artifacts.         The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They origanaly learned how to make houses out of mud but then made them out of stone. Between 1100 and 1300 the population could have reached several thousand. They even learned how to make better pottery.         The under water city of atlantis streches over 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. They think the settlement sank because of an earthquake of a tsunami. This is the first time a under water city has been found in Greece.

Item_Response: Over many years, discoverires on ancient times have increased. Us modern humans have began to find out more and more about our past and how we used to live. It is important to know more and more about the past to discover how things were back then. Three big secrets of the past involves, The Ancient Incas, The Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World, and A Lost Greek City.                The Incas, a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire, left behind mat clues that form an amzing idea on how they used to live. So many clues have been found that we know about their religion, their art and arcitecture, agriculture government, transportation, and how they lived. Some information that we know about the Incas is from oral history. These are stories passed from generation to genration but these are not one hundred percent proven. Some of what we know  is written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and priests. They described the Inca in letters and diaries.               About 1,400 years ago, a few people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. The people living there built buildings and elaborate stone communities in the shetered alcoves of the canyon walls. These people were intelligent and built many things, like Pithouses, pottery, wepons like the bow and arrow and spears. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. Around the year 1200 A.D. a ginormous population shift was seen among the people living here. Nobody knows why this happened but a few guesses are that  it was for religous or psychological reasons; or maybe because the alcoves offered better protection from the elements.              The secrets of a lost city named, Atlantis, have brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. Explored bty an Anglo-Greek team of arcaeologists and marine geologists ad know as Pavolaopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years theime of Hormer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. It is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 100 BC. A world of buildings, courtyards, main streets rock-cut tombs and  religous structures have been found under the sea in this area. Along with thousands of shards of pottery. Less than 1% of the earths ocean floor has been investigated so there has to be much more out there.

Item_Response: Although they may be many miles and years apart, the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are similar in their ancient ways. For many years now archaeologists have been studying the ways of these ancient societies. Their daily life, deaths, and historical stories are just a few things they have found out. Although this information is amazing to have, archaeologists have to go through a lot of trouble to get it.              In the case of the Inca society, decoding their history is quite difficult. Their recording system is made up of strings. Different colors and sizes indicate their events. Since no one knows how to decipher these strings, finding out their history has proven to be very difficult. Also since the Inca were located in the Andes mountains, traveling to find artifacts is another challenge.             Although it took a while, the history of the Puebloans has proven to be much easier to find out about. A national park has already been set up for them to share their history with the world. The Mesa Verde National Park has preserved many artifacts about the Puebloans. They also share information on their homes, weapons, religious places, and many other things. This national park helps preserve the history of the Puebloans.              The Pavlopetri civivlization seems to be the most difficult of the three. The city of Pavlopetri was sunken under the ocean about 5,000 years ago. Constantly moving waters, sand, and sea creatures  cover and uncover this ancient city. You never know when you'll find something today but lose it tomorrow. Archaeologists are in a never ending battle with the ocean to uncover this societies history. The archaeologists studying this city don't even exactly know how it became submerged.               Archaeologists work hard everyday to uncover these mysterious cities. Hard work and determination drive them to discover more so the rest of us can understand our past. After years of digging there is still so much more to find out. Although they are thousands of years and miles apart, these three societies still manage to confuse and amaze our modern world.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavloptri are important to society today because the helped develop society today. Like the constant improvement of the Puebloans helped make future peoples of the world construct homes and/or useful city buildings. And the way Inca kept records on just strings proably helped future civilizations keep records on paper with their own language/ writing. And the Pavloptri made myths about Atlantis to explain things so that it made sense that it's there. These discoveries and improvements of these ancient peoples and civilizations are important to us and society because it helped shape society today.

Item_Response: The discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri are really important for many reasons. The discoveries help us know how those civilizations lived and how their daily life was like.       The Incas didnt leave written records of themselves, but they left a lot of important things which were buried or written down in Europeans diaries or journals. The discovery of their things that were made of either gold, stone, or silver showed us how their daily life was like and in what conditions they lived in.       The discoveries of the Puebloans were houses. Their houses have been found in the mountains called pueblos. Those houses were called pitthouses. The archeologists saw how the houses were built. This also showed us their daily life.       Also the discoveries of the Pavlopetri were underwater. Archeologists found lots of houses that were once on land but are now underwater due to some natural causes. These were very to discover because in was more than 30,00 square meters of ocean floor. These discoveries help us know how civilazations lived before us and how our world changed.

Item_Response: The discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans,and the Pavlopetri are very important  to our learnings. They tell us interesting facts we need to know about them, to compare how life was back then to now. If you can see it was very different from now, they had difficulities on getting food, and building there homes. They were very hard working people, they worked night and day to get their job done.      The Incas comes from an oral history,or stories passed from generation to generation. They had alot of amazing things going on around them, like art, architecture, and agriculture.The Incas had visitors such as the Spanish soldiers and priests. Even though the Spanish did not understand anything the Incas were saying they still enjoyed there company. The Incas lived high in the Andes mountains. I believe they lived high in the mountains to stay away from enemies and from being caught. Some Incas even died at the mountain top or even buried in caves.        The Puebloans were the first  settled in Mesa Verde in about A.D.550. They were known as Basketmakers for their skilled work on crafts. They would make a house known as a Pithouse, which was a small living room, with four corner timbers, and a roof. It wasn`t very much for a skilled craftsman, but it was good enough to sleep in.  They would build Pithouses against one another, curving rows. That way it would make it warmer for them and bigger.        It`s a great thing to know about all these facts on ancient people to get to know what has happened in their life. It is very important to know about history because you will need it in life and the history is one of the most important things to know.

Item_Response: I think that the empires in the past influence life today. Incas were said to have left lots of art, architecture, government, and transportation. Archaeologists have made amazing discoveries because of lots of artifacts they had left from their past lives. Many of those things were also passed down by generations to preserve their history. There are also many Inca myths that we know today and lots of great places. There have also been many weather occurrences that have helped archaeologists discover things that have helped us to the discovery of how the Inca lived. Archaeologists have recorded many things, places, and people from Inca history            The Puebloans period was also known as the Classical Period. Pithouses were used to live in before this time. Pithouses were like small huts that people used before houses. In this period walls of thick, double-coursed stone were made that were about 2 or 3 stories high. I think that their architecture influences the homes we make now. They also made the bow and arrow to make hunting more efficient, as you might now, the bow and arrow was a very useful creation. Also, they made Kivas which resemble churches now.            The discovery made in source #3 is also very important. There have been countless movies and myths about the lost city of Atlantis that people are not even sure if it's true. This discovery proves them wrong. A diver explored a sunken settlement which is thought to be the city of Atlantis. This site is important because it is said that the site was never reoccupied, it is considered a frozen moment of the past. It is also said that not only was it the oldest submerged city, it was also populated and had an interest in natural science. There is a lot more to discover to this city than has already been. To me all of the discoveries made by archaeologists about past lives are very important.

Item_Response: Archaeologists decided to make discoveries on the Inca's because, they wanted to see how they lived, what they ate, where they slept, how they took care of their business etc. Archaeologists also wanted to find out their formal alphabet or their system of writing. They want to see how the kings lived and what were some of their rules. They want to pass on stories to preserve history. The archaeologists also wanted to compare the what they learned from the artifacts and sites with the Spaniard's accounts of the Inca.         Puebloans and the Mesa Verde National Park preserve a spectacular reminder of ancient culture. Archaeologists wanted to find out more about the Puebloans skill in craft. They lived in Pithouses, the Pithouses featured a living room and an air deflector. They also had Sipapu an underground hole in which people came in. Pithouses later evolved into Kivas. Then there population multiplied. They started to build above ground houses. Archaeologists found out that Mesa Verde went from pole-and-adobe construction to stone masonry. Some houses even had units of 50 rooms. Archaeologists also wanted to find out more about the Puebloans religion during their study they found Kiva, which is a church they prayed for rain, luck in hunting, or good crops.         Atlantis Myth keeps archaeologists crazy looking for clues and more exploration than any other thing. These secrets inspire one of the most enduring myth - the fable of Atlantis. Archaeologists have found ruins of Atlantis. Archaeologists say that there are older sunken sites but none as unique as Atlantis. They have found ceramics dating back to the stone age. Archaeologists also know that maybe they will never find anything, but the search is still going. Atlantis is a myth, but that myth keeps underwater exploration going.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the ancicent civilizations such as the inca , pueboloans, and pavlopetri are aso important because they help confirm historical information, as well as their weather and natural occurences ,lastly  the reason they no longer exist today.       The ancient inca civilation was around from about 1438 up until 1532. the inca had no system of writting and no formal alphabet. they were settled in south america. in order to keep records the inca formed strings. certain clues that were left behind  have portrayed images of the inca religion, art, and architecture. studying these clues helped others piece together the inca life. the inca lived high in the andes and many of their sites are in the remote high areas.       The ancient puebolans civilization were around for about 700 years. the first of their ancestors settled in mesa verde. the lived in pithouses that were clustered into small villages. ancestral puebloans builts their dwellings benath the overhanging cliffs. the puebolans educated themselves to make pottery and specialized in the bow and arrow which was used to hunt.       The pavlopetri where the oldest submerged town in the world. atlantis is the first sunken city found in greece. their are 9,000 square metter of buildings.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavelopetri are so important because they are unique sites that have been discovered and are finding new information every day. For example, in the Inca civilization the archeologist have been finding artifacts every day even tough it is hard for them to find them because the Incas lived in remote, high places. The archeologist have been studying Incas homelands and way of life. The artifacts and settlements tell give them a lot of information to find out how this ancient civilization lived.       In addition, the Puebloans civilization also is an important discovery because some of  their homelands were in cliff alcoves that were the homes of their ancestors. The Puebloans are said to live in those areas because of religious purposes or for better protection. Also, the Puebloans  are an important discovery because these people lived in harsh cold for several months with just a single fire.       The Pavelopetri who lived in the lost city of  Atlantis are also an important discovery. This civilization is important because the marine geologists are still trying to figure out what caused the city to sink. This city was found 40 years ago but was completely discovered with the help of technology. The lost city was revealed more by the shifting sands and the enclosure in the protected bay. This site is significant because it has potential insights on the workings of Mycenaean society.

Item_Response: The discoveries we have made of the Inca, Puebloans, Pavlopetri are very important because they give us clues of the past. Like how they were able to track stars and planets with tools of just rock. How well they were at hunting. Or even building their great empires.          We will never truly know the secrets of the past though. Most of the information we have came from folk tales than true history. How did we get the stories? They were told down as an oral tradition. From parent to child and then some. Yet the stories we have may not all be what they originally were since the Spaniards, the first people to meet the Incas, did not completely understand their language, and may have messed up some words.          Yet I find it fascinating that they were able to run a great empire for so long with only little knots and strings. Why knots and strings? Well, they didn't really have a form of writing. So instead they used a system of knots to keep track of everything. But we will never fully understand their labyrinth system.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations                   The ancient Incas from Peru had no writing system or formal alphabet. Instead, they made knots called in quipus, which are colored strings.  Archaeologists have found many quipus over the years, but still nobody knows what they mean. However, the Incas have left behind amazing portraits of their religion, art, archetecture, agriculture, government, transportation systems, and just their ways of life in general.Archaeologists have also found artifacts made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. A lot of these last for hundreds of years. Most turn up in the ruins of buildings; others in buried graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.          The first ancient Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They are known for their skills in basketmaking. At first nomadic, they were starting to lead a more settled way of life. Things such as farming replaced hunting and gathering. The Puebloans lived in pithouses in small villages, usually built on mesa tops, but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned how to make pottery and foudn a bow and arrow, a better weapon for hunting than a spear thrower, called the atlatl.          In Greece, there has recently been an ancient underwater city discovered by divers, oceanogrophers, and marine archaeologists. They believe that the city was submerged by 1000 BC, but it was only discovered about 40 years ago by a British oceanogropher. However, 40 years ago there was not enough digital technology to aid the marine archaeologists in surveying the city, so it had only been surveyed just this year. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlements enclosure, what they found reached all of their expectations. The exploration revealed a world full of courtyards, buildings, rock-cut tombs, religious structures, and main streets. Not to mention the shards of pottery that was also discovered.

Item_Response: Many ancient civilizations are so important to our history. The civilizations can give archaeologists information on how they lived. Some of the important ancient civilizations are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.        The Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. the first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using stings to keep records. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of archaeologists sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops.        The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') about A.D. 550. They are known as Basket makers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud. They built the houses one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pit houses or two in front.(Pit houses would later evolve into kivas.) From here on, these people are known as Puebloans, a Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers.' Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before. By the Classic Period(A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300), Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization, whose accomplishments in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America.        Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of  size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. The site, which straddles 30,00 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Although discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of sharp pf pottery. More than any other underwater site so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaean society. Marine geologists have yet to work out the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.        Some of the important ancient civilizations are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. The civilizations can give archaeologists information on how they lived. Many ancient civilizations are so important to our history.

Item_Response: I think the artifacts found by archiologists are very important. They give us a glimpse of the past, and maybe give us ideas to bring back some of the old culture or ideas.                        For the Incas, their treasures may inspire designers to make jewelery or buildings based on drawings and other everyday items. The religion they had might affect us somehow today after these findings. The books and letters the Spanish wrote to the Incas also give us a peek into the past. The clothing that the Inca wore and left behind were preserved and can be copied to use in the modern day.                      For the Puebloans, their skilled craftsmanship shows us what they did on their free time. They left behind their pithouses, which most people lived in. Over time, the Puebloans shifted from abobe construction to skillful stone masonry. These findings are important because they show us that the Puebloans were skilled craftsman and very civilized.                      For the Pavlopetri, it gave us a huge glimpse at ancient architecture. The buildings were still well preserved and there is still a huge amount of precious material still hidden beneath the ocean floor. These discoveries may lead us to see why Atlantis did sink, and if it could happen to other cities.                      These discoveries can be life changing for many people. The treasures found could inspire people and can influence their ideas. The scientific discoveries can foreshadow a very horrific event that could happen any minute, such as the sinking of a whole city along with its citizens.

Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri people are from ancient civilizations. Archaeology have studied them for many, many years and still have questions about them. They have also uncovered many things. Many things about the lost civilizations, the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, would not be known if archaeologist hadn't taken their time to research them.   The Incas were discovered by Europeans in 1532. The Incas ruled the South American empire between the years 1438 to 1532. The Europeans were amazed by how the Inca ran their empire using only knots in colorful string. Their is still no one who can read the knots in the quipus.  They used the quipus to keep a record of livestock. Some of what archaeologist know are from oral history told to them from Spanish visitors who were soldiers and priests. They used letters and diaries to describe the Inca.  The Spanish didn't speak the Inca language and could misunderstand what was told to them. We learned the most about the Inca from artifacts left behind. For example some of their textiles and clothing have survived through all of these years. Which help us know how they made their living and how they dressed. They can easily date the fall of the Inca's, since the Spaniards killed the Inca's last king in 1532. The Spaniards than toke over the empire. It's the origins that our more difficult to trace. Due to the many people who have inhabited the area since the Inca's.            All information found in source number 1 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past.'   The Puebloans lived about 1,400 years ago in Mesa Verde for over seven hundred years.In the late A.D. 1200s they moved away from their homes. The first Puebloans were known as Basketmakers, due to their great skill of craft. Soon their farming replaced hunting and gathering. They build little homes called pithouses. Which were build in small villages tight together. They learned how to create pottery and better weapons, such as the bow and arrow. They also used nature to an advantage when creating their many crafts. Their population continued to grow and they build bigger and better houses. Their name which means village dwellers describes them very well. Archaeologist can see how talented they were at the Mesa Verde National Park, where there is a spectacular reminder of their ancient culture.              All information found in source number 2 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World.'    The Pavlopetri is known as the sunken settlement. It was found underneath Southern Greece's waters. It dates,2800 to 1200 BC back to almost 5,000 years ago. Pavlopetri is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor and less than 1 % of the ocean floor has been discovered. Archaeologist were able to find a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. There was also thousands of pieces of pottery found. Since the site has been submerged no one was able to reoccupied the area.          All of the information was found in source number 3 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets.'    Many things about the lost civilizations, the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, would not be known if archaeologist hadn't taken their time to research them. The Inca were very talented and organized people. That were discovered by the Europeans. Many archaeologists have proven what the Spanish told them was true, but there is still alot to be proven. Since no one can read the quipus the Incas still remain a giant puzzle. The Spaniards ended the wonderful rule of the Incas when they killed the king and toke over the empire. The Puebloans were very well talented crafters. They build baskets, pottery, and different types of houses. Their population was very large, so they usually build in villages of multiple story houses that could have fifty or more rooms in it. The first homes they lived in were the pithouses, that later became into the kiva. Their pottery was well crafted with persise details and colors.They got their name from the way they lived, Puebloans means village dwellers. The Pavlopetri was discovered under the Southern Greece waters. Many always thought there was something there, but never looked. Most were amazed by how much there was discovered. It is one of the few areas discovered submerged and not reoccupied. Archaeologists have spend years discovering these ancient civilizations, putting all the clues together.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloan, and the Pavlopetri are all very important. They all will give us information about their past and may help us with our present and future. Also, we can learn new things from it.         What the archeologist discovered about the Incas was that they, used clay and different materials to build walls, rooms, and enclosures. They had farmlands which grew food to eat. All of the different foods the ate and different ideas the Inca's came up with can and will help us with our life style today. The Inca's clothing and materials showed how they kept warm and protected their bodies. The Inca's lived in mountain ranges, cold climates, and high climates. When people would pass away they would use the snow and cold mountains to store away there bodies. The Inca's keeping the bodies in cold measurements, help preserve some what of the bodies. This helped the archeologists know how they died.         The Puebloans were basket makers. They hunted and gathered. They made pottery and used bow and arrows for many different things. They lived in Pit houses; which had a sunken living room, four corner timbers that supported the roof, a fire pit that had an air deflector, and may have contained storage bins or pits. The Puebloans, first started out with adobe and changed into stone to build walls.The population grew and grew over the years. But, then the population shifted. Perhaps they moved back in the alcoves. Maybe because of religious reasons or maybe for protection. But, the archeologists figured out a lot of new things about the Puebloans, that may be key information.          The archeologists discovered so many new things about different religions that may help us in the future. It also tells what they had to go through and what we may have to go through in the future or can prevent from happening.

The Incas lived in the high Andes, so it makes living a bit more difficult for them, but not impossible. Archaeologists have found some evidence on how the Incan people have lived and the conditions they were in.

Item_Response: In ancient times the civilizations were far more complex then what they are today. One particular ancient civilization were the Inca, they didn't have an alphabet or a system of writing. They would use string and tie knots in them called 'quipus' this tool would be used as a calendar to tell when the crops and or livestock were ready. When the Europeans came over they were surprised at the capability of their ruling power. You may ask how do we know so much about the Inca when they're no more in existence to this day.  Well the Europeans just happened to make journals about the Inca and how they lived what they worshiped and the kind of food they would eat. Another question you may ask yourself is how do we know so much more then what the Europeans wrote. Its very simple actually logical more then simple, the evidence of their ruling was left behind. For example the portraits of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, transportation, and ways of their life.  Now of coarse everything has a beginning and and end. the Inca for instance lived high up in the Andes and even in caves, for the reason why, we don't know to this day. One thing we do know is that the last Inca king was in fact murdered by the Spaniards in 1532.           National Parks are great places to be with family and have fun. On the other hand some place like Mesa Verde National Park, where Ancestral Puebloans lived, are a little to ancient to play with. If you are wondering how old ancient Mesa Verde National Park is, lets just say around 1,400 years ago they disappeared. Their is a difference though in time. The Ancestral Puebloans first settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. The Ancestral Pueblanos were very good at crafts making, about A.D. 750 they knew how to make houses above ground. They also soon started to build with skillful stone masonry instead of pole-and-adobe. You may seem to wonder about this time about how the people were able to spread out into the world. Well it wasn't if they were able to but they had to. The reason why was because of the over population. Soon after though they repopulated and then caused declination in the quality in many materials.           Myths are great story's to tell children for their amusement. Although some might amuse you. One for example is the great myth or story about Atlantis, the great sunken city. Although their have been sitings of the fable of Atlantis in the southern Greece waters. The first thing you may ask yourself is how does a sunken city stay sunken and still have the ability to be seen after many many years. Well the answer to that is the sand settlements that shift and enclose in a protective bay. Now what about the pottery and rock-cuts of buildings courtyards, main streets, and tombs and even religious structures. The big question though is how did the famous Atlantis get to the bottom of the ocean. Well what experts have said is that either an earthquake shook the city and ground subsidence to the bottom or either an tsunami washed the subsidence to the bottom of the ocean. What Dimitris Sakellariou, from the Greek Institute of Oceanography, said was 'It is very likely a combination of the first two,'.
