Item_Response: There have been many discoveries that have been made about ancient cities like the Inca, the Puebloans, and Pavlopetri, that have facinated many Archaeologists. But a question has been asked, why are these cities that we are so fascinated by so important to us. Well there are many answers this question. We can learn the way of life of some of our ancestors that we didn't even know existed. Also we can find out things that the ancient people did that is good for our society so that we can improve our world.  The well known myth of the lost city of Atlantis is a myth to Archaeologist but the ancient cities that they have found are no myth to them at all.        We can learn the way of life of some of our ancestors that we didn't even know existed. This is very important to us, because everyday we strive to learn more about our past so that we can use that information to even better our future life on earth. Also it fascinates everybody to know what life was like for there ancestors. This has always been a fascination for me. When I get a chance to learn about my ancestors, I take that chance and fly with it.         Another important reason why the discoveries about these ancient cities are important to us is because we can take the information of what made these cities very brilliant and add them to our society. With our society we can use all of the help that we can get to make it better. I think that there can be very important lessons that we can learn for these people that have lived in these lost cites long ago.        So these are the reasons why the discoveries of these long lost cities are very important to us. Like I said we can learn the way of life of some of our ancestors that we didn't even know existed. Also we can take the information of what made these cities so brilliant and add them to our society. Just like I said every day, we strive to make discoveries of the past and this is a huge break through.

Item_Response: Many is to be known about the area in which the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri had inhabited, but little is actually known on what the tribes did there. The information we do have though, is very critical to finding out what these ancient civilizations were. This is why these discoveries are so important to the history of our world.               Information on the Inca is mainly all from oral history or from the stories that Europeans had told. This is because the Inca kept strings records-- records that were held by string. Very few people knew how to interpret these structures so we do not know what some of these mean. Even though direct evidence was found from the Europeans that wrote down some of the Inca's stories, we must be careful when determining and analyzing these because they are coming from a very unreliable source; most of these stories were myths and the Europeans could have also translated wrong when inscribing this.                However, Puebloans have much more direct and accurate information studied upon them because they left behind many ancient structures such as pithouses or kiva; a ceremonial room. They also built their homes on the edges of cliffs and such. Even though we have physical evidence of what there buildings look like we do not have much information on their social behavior, unlike the Inca.                 The Pavlopetri were commonly more known as the city that may have started the myth about the lost city of Atlantis. According to Dr. Jon Henderson this ancient settlement is the oldest under-water city that they have on record and know about. The ocean floor was covered with ancient towns, pottery bits, and many other clues that were a part of the Pavlopetri's way of life.                 Because there is very few information on each of these civilizations, it makes every little bit of information vitally important for the discoveries of history and the furtherly extended knowledge of the world.

Item_Response: The Inca's, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri            These three cultures have made very important discoveries in their existence. The Inca's had no alphabet or a system of writing, but they made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. That was a great discovery by the Inca's because now we have calendars to keep track of the days, weeks, and months.             The Puebloans learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow so they could hunt more efficiently.

Item_Response: You may have heard about many old civilizations like Chinese, Greek or Indians. But have you heard of the Incans, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri? I think not. One does not simply know about these three ancient civilaztions. I am here to tell about why the discoveries of the Incans, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important.                    The Incans were from peru and they didn't have a formal alphabet or system of writing. They made knots in colored string called quipus to record the calender to keep a record of livestock. The europeans were amazed and impressed by the ability of the Incans to run a huge empire using just some old strings to keep record. Nobody today can read these ancient quipus so understanding the ancient Incz is a lot like solving a mystery. This discovery is important because it shows that even without an alphabet or writing system, the Incans were able to thrive.                    The Puebloans were from mesa verde and they were skilled crafters. They were known as 'basketmakers' for their great skill of craft. they could make lots of items from bows and arrows, to pottery. They even built their own homes from scratch called Pithouses. They normally had a living room sunk a few feet in the ground and four corner timbers supporting the roof. this discovery is important because it shows how skilled craftsman this civilaztion was.                    These were very important civilaztions because they proved and helped us with a lot of things. The Incans were able to record data with just string and the Puebloans helped evolve crafting.

Item_Response: The Inca of Peru didn't really have an alphabet or a system of writing. Did you know that the Inca's made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock that they had. The first Europeans that met the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire, just using strings and knots to keep track of everything. How do we know about a civilization that for nearly 100 years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient rome? (1438-1532) Well, because the Inca left clues and artifacts that now show us how they lived.

Item_Response: Exploration of new areas that reveal history about the past, can be very exciting. In the three articles, the exploration of new areas excited many people to learn about the mysteries surrounding it. The necessity to further gain knowledge about certain parts of history leads to further exploration, like the Incans, Pueblanos and the Pavlopetri.         First of all, the Incan empire was one of the largest in South America that rivaled the expansion of the Roman empire. They kept record by coloring string and making knots in the string to mark important dates. Most of our knowledge about Incans come from historical stories told by the Spaniards from what they heard, but since the Spaniards did not understand the Incan language very well we can not be certain. The artifacts that some Incans had tell us a great deal about their history. Archeologist compare the stories to the artifacts to see if the stories are true or if they are just legends. Also, ariel photography helps us see patterns in the ground that we normally would not see on foot.         Secondly, the Pueblanos were groups of people who live in Mesa Verde and flourished there. The first pueblanos moved to mesa Verde in A.D. 550 and those people were very skilled in crafting and other arts. Basket weaving quality went down probably because of the rise of pottery. The pueblanos lived in pithouses which were primitive homes that included a firepit and air deflector. Overtime these homes evolved into adobe constructed homes. The Classic period included many more advanced homes. All of the pueblanos houses took advantage of the nature around it, to the benefit of themselves.        Lastly, the discovery of the underwater city of the Pavlopetri gave many greeks hope of further finding more underwater cities. This sunken settlement dates back from 2,800 to 1,200 B.C. The site straddles 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor and it is believed to be consumed by the ocean in 1,000 B.C. Tghe last time this underwater city was occupied can be dated back to 5,000 years ago! The discovery of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, raises the status of the settlement. There are three theories to why the settlement sank, one of them being that the sea level rise  while the other two  include the found subsiding as a result of earthquakes and a tsunami. Dimitrus of the Greek Institute of Oceanography says it is a combination of the first two. This submerged city is in fact reality but the lost city of   Atlantist is a myth, but this city keeps underwater exploration going. Less than 1% of the ocean floor has been discovered and there is still lots more to explore.         The discoveries of submerged cities keeps many explorers wanting to learn more about lost cities or empires. The necessity to gain further knowledge about new historical sites discovered, leads to the expansion of wanting more knowledge. More and more lost or mysterious sites are being explored for further knowledge and these lead to more and more discoveries.

Item_Response: The Incas were an ancient civilization that developed many ways of life.  They developed colorful, knotted strings called quipus   that served as a calendar. After the fall of the kingdom, archaeologists have found many artifacts tied to their way of life, such as   religion, government, and agriculture. The old legends and stories told through many generations represented what the Incas believed in. They buried the dead on hard-to-reach places, such as mountain peaks. These discoveries helped untangle the mysteries behind the Incas' way of life. It showed how they lived under different circumstances, and what they made that affected their lives.             The Pueblos were also an ancient tribe. They settled in Mesa Verde to start a new way of life. They were very skillful in the art of crafting. They farmed, hunted, and developed new techniques for catching animals. They produced the bow and arrow and found it more efficient than a spear. They also lived in pithouses, which contained an underground room, an air deflector, and four timbers that supported the roof.  Basketmakers made great profit making baskets. The people of Mesa Verde began to evolve their way of life, updating their tools. The Ancestral Puebloans built their homes underneath overhanging cliffs, to be protected by the environment.  It was not long until they evacuated their homes and disappeared. These discoveries advanced the understanding of ancient tribes, and how they lived in the past.              The Pavlopetri was an old group of settlers that built a big, tremendous city. The entire city inself was sunken into the deep water depths, which archaeologists have just rediscovered. Broken bits of pottery showed that the Pavlopetri had their own arts and crafts. The discovery of this underwater city advanced the understanding of ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: The Astounding Ancient World                   Since many ancient civilizations did not keep written records we know very little about them. For example the Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and the Ancient Greeks. Since we know so little , every shred of evidence we find is extremely important. The things they left behind give us clues of how they lead their everyday lives.             High up in the monumental Andes Mountains lived the Incas a great civilization that rivaled  Ancient Rome. The Incas had no written language instead they kept all their records using the knots on a string.  Which makes it difficult for us to fathom their everyday lives. So any time we find a untouched Incan site everything is recorded, down to the last pebble.               On the cliffs in North America you see the home of Ancestral Puebloans . Their is very little known about these people and why they later abandoned their homes in the cliffs.Since they left so long ago much of the things they used in their everyday lives are gone. Which further proves that no matter what little things are their every bit is extremely important so we can find out how they lived.                Deep down underwater is an ancient sunken city over 5,000 years old. Discovered over 40 years ago but not properly explored until today. This sunken city is frozen in time and since no one ever reoccupied it, is in perfect condition.  This city shows us what Greece was like long ago before the Romans sucked it into their empire. As result the very little we know about the Greeks came from the Romans. This proves that important discoveries such as this will shape history in the future.           The ancient world is a mystery we have not yet completely unraveled. With every clue we find we put a bit more of the puzzle together. Which is why even a shard of pottery is extremely important. Looking at ancient sites helps piece together how  people lived long ago which is why archeology is so important.

Item_Response: Divers are looking for a lost city. There is no doubt that that is the oldest submerged town in the world. the site is 30,000 meters of the ocean floor off the south Peloponnese, believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.            The shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. The seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.            Ceramic dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought.

Item_Response: Do you ever wonder how people back then lived? Not only from the 19th century and such, but way, way ancient?       Archaeologists set action to go to the ruins of where was said the Inca once lived. They found artifacts known as quip us. These instruments were used to record such data, such as—counting livestock. They were also used to tell stories, otherwise legends. Most Inca lived in the Andes mountains, which archaeologists have inferred that they had probably worshiped the mountain peaks. The Inca had flourished in the Andes, yet some were buried by rubble—which also helped them to stop being disturbed by looters, who take their artifacts. Did you know the Inca were taken over by the Spaniards? Apparently, Inca do not exist anymore because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king back in 1532. Archaeologists have studied Inca carcass to determine how they've lived and how they've died.       Archaeologists have also studied the Pueblo-ans of Mesa Verde. Thee people were known to be skilled in crafting. They used to live in pit houses, but then have upgraded to houses above the ground. These houses were one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pit house or two in front. They later evolved into kivas. Kivas were the finest built in Mesa Verde. The Pueblo-ans made baskets, which shows evidence of decline in quality. There were also cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde. They built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Sandstone was the basic material used for building. They were shaped into rectangular blocks, along with mud and water between them. They used sandstone to build kivas.       The archaeologists, Anglo-Greek, along with marine geologists, set out into the depths of the ocean to the lost Greek city. 'This city was the oldest submerged town in the world,' says Dr. Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. The team had found ceramics which they say dates back to the end of the stone age. They state that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago. Discovering this city has UNraveled the myth of Atlantis.       With all this being discovered, archaeologists can make inferred conclusions and tell the world how it used to be back when the people of the old age lived. If we have lived in these locations, we can learn about our ancestors and such. We could also learn how much, possibly, pottery meant to our ancestors. Or, we could wonder about the old historical landmarks and think, What exactly happened here? Where did these people go to? Or, even wonder if maybe where your flat is, was where burials or even an old shop was. That is how learning about the people in the past makes our curiosity even larger.

Item_Response: There are many reasons why the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. The ancient civilizations from the past helped us modernize the world to what we see today.       The Inca, an ancient civilization of Peru, invented things before we knew about them. The Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing, instead, they left knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Before we have had calendars, the Inca had already discovered a way to easily tell time.       The Puebloans, who lived about 1,400 years ago, chose Mesa Verde as their home. The Puebloans learned how to make pottery, a bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower, and also made pithouses, a fort where there is a fire pit in the middle and the roof is held up by four corner timbers. The Puebloans were advanced for their time.       The Pavlopetri, a lost city which may have inspired the myth of Atlantis, is a town that dates back 5,000 years and is completely submerged in water. The sunken town when explored, revealed to us 9,000 square meters of new buildings. By closer investigation, the archeologists discovered a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall which suggests the town had been used by an elite.       The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have helped us understand about our past and that other people have had inventions before we hadn't even thought of or had done differently. These discoveries help us know what happened yesterday to better improve the world tomorrow.

Item_Response: The past is as much an integral part of society as the future, if not more. Children are told to learn from the past, and not to make the mistakes their predecessors made. This past is found and organized by archeologists and historians, and told to the public with newspaper articles and magazines. Through discoveries from artifacts and the homelands of ancient civilizations, lots of effort on the parts of the archeologists, as well as pure dumb luck on the part of geography, the public has been able to learn about many ancient civilizations.            Archeologists have made many discoveries based off artifacts and cities of ancient civilizations. The buildings of what historians are calling the Ancestral Puebloans, which by A.D. 1000 were made of 'thick, double-coursed stone' and rose more than two stories high to join into 'units of fifty rooms or more', show the culture of a people that were 'adept at building, artistic in their crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land.' Also, Pavlopetri, the 'oldest submerged town in the world,' as a site on the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese has been dubbed by the associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham, Dr. Jon Henderson, has brought many discoveries about how the Mycenaean people lived. This 'world of buildings, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures' show that the town might have been used by the elite, and, as Henderson puts it, 'raises the status of the settlement.'            However, not all of the settings of archeological discoveries were as easy to get to as the cliff homes of the Ancestral Pueboans. Pavlopetri, the underwater city, was discovered by a British oceanographer in               geography and weather conditions can help 1 and 3   difficulties for archeologists 1 and 3

Item_Response: People tell myths to keep the history of the past alive. The Europeans tell the myths of the Inca of Peru. The Inca didn't have an alphebet or writing they just used pictures to express things. The Europeans wrote about the Inca's in diarries and in letters. Some of their old homes have been disturbed and there treasures taken and some haven't been discovered.       About 1,400 years before Europeans explored North America a group of people chose Mesa Verde as their home. After a generation or two they moved away leaving there belongings behind. A puebloans (or green table) was one of the first things found. People lived in pithouses from avout A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 as settled agriculture began. At about A.D. 750 they began making houses above ground.       Ever since 1880 when the cowboys reported the cliff dwellings archeologists have sought to understand these people's lives. Because there isn't a lot of evidence of them scientific knowledge remains unknown. However, they have found some evidence, like small things.       Other myths like the lost Greek city of Atlantis may also be a myth. Explorers and scientists have searched for this city before and have not found it. However this would be one of the oldest submerged towns in the world. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC. There are older sunken sites but none can be considered to be planned towns such as Atlantis.       Now all we can do is keep looking to find these lost things. maybe they are myths but they could be true. Many of thes myths are passed down by our ansesters to tell us about the past things that may be true.

Item_Response: My class is doing a report on archaeology. Archaeologists are the people that find things that are rare. They travel the world, and find many things. When you get older, would you like to become an archaeologist?       Achaeologists make a lot of ,oney because the the artifacts they find. They make  about 250 or 300 thousany dollars a year. My friends dad is an archaeologist and he gets paid a lot because of all the stuff he fnds. Did you know that if your an archaeologist the government pays for your plane ticket?       They also get to encounter many different exotic animals. They see elephants, monkeys, different types of fish, wild dogs, wild boars, and lizzards. In the caves they see bats and rats crawling all over the place. It can get a bit creepy at times, but you have to be brave to be an archaeologist. Thats is another reason I would like to be an archaeologist.       Archaeologists even make new friends on their journey. For example, if you need help finding something and someone helps you, they might become your new friend. Item_Response: There are many reasons why archeologists and geologists choose to discover more about ancient peoples, clans, and tribes. Mainly because from this research we can learn more about our own kind and where we came from. We can also learn what happened thousands of years ago on the land we live on today. There are many reasons why, but from what I've learned, here are some why discoveries I've learned about from the Inca, the Puebloans, and t Pavlopetri are so important.       The Inca tribes lived high in the Andes mountains, and they even worshiped mountain peaks! A lot of their tribes were remote, icy, and in high places. Many of the Incas were buried in these icy capsuals and the cold climates acted as a freezer. Not only did this make it harder for tomb looters to get in, but it also preserved the bodies of the Incas and their belongings/ artifacts. Experts can use modern medical scanning and equipment to learn how the ancient tribe lived. This is important because we can discover more about why the Inca tribe died off and why there are no living today.       The Puebloans lived in homes called Pithouses to keep warm and cook food during cold and summer months. The hole in the top of the house was used to let fire escape. From these fires, the Puebloans cooked food and used the fires to keep warm during cold months. A lot of the ancient tribe basket weaved which was usually done inside the Pithouses. When the tribe died off, these Pithouses preserved the baskets and archeologists were then able to learn more about the ancient tribe that once inhabited the Mesa Verde. This is important because archeologists are able to find out more about the tribe.       Beneath the waters of Southern Greece, Marine geologists discovered a sunken city with remains that dated back 5,000 years ago. Although it was discovered about forty years ago, with today's modern technology, geologists were able to survey the area. The exploration revealed buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. From this scientists were able to discover that due to natural causes a whole entire city was sunken! This is important because this means that more can be discovered.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru  had no formal alphabet or system of writing . They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Incu mad e knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The frist Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists  have found many ancient quipus- but today no one konw what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the  colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca are very hard to study. They would only use colorful strings to write and communicate. Nobody is able to read or comprehend this strange way of writing.             The only way we have discovered them is that there have been people who have met them and communicated with them. They still could not get very much information on them.             There are preserved bodies and artifacts. The bodies were preserved by coldness or by enclosure. The artifacts were preserved by being underwater or in the ground for a long time. It could be complicated to comprehend these artifacts due to erosion, but that does not mean we can't learn about the Incas.             They lived in cave dwellings and in little huts. They communicated by a special language and text. They could not leave archives for historians to study. The strings were called quipus.

Item_Response: What is the big idea about the discoveries about Inca, the Puebloans and the pavlopetri? Why are they so important? This is why they are.       The ancient Inca of Peru  had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They made colored knots in strings that are called quipus so that they could record the calendar so they could keep track of the livestock.      How do we know some of the old stories? Well we know some of them because they were written down by the Europeans that arrived in the empire in 1532. They were the Spanish soldiers and priests. The rest of our Inca comes from the artifacts, or the objects left behind, and also where they are found.      The structures are the evidence of the society, over centuries, accumulated skills and some traditions and passed them onto generation to generation  and so on. The accomplishments in the community living and the arts rank of the finest of expressions of the human culture in North America.     Secrets of the lost city may inspire one of the world's most enduring myths. The sunken dates back 5,000 years ago. 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' Dr. Jon Henderson said. It straddles about 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off of the Southern Peloponnese, it is believed to be consumed by sea around 1000 BC.      So now I think we know what the big deal is about with all this. Now we know why the Puebloans, the Pavlopetri and Inca is all about. Its part of our history and we can't just ignore it.

Item_Response: There have been thousands of lost civilizations... Some destroyed, some taken over, and some just disappear with no reason at all. The Mesa Verde, Inca, and the city of 'Atlantis' all are lost civilizations, eroded away over time. Archeologist dig away for things to help explain these 'lost cities' but sometimes, to no avail. Swimming, climbing, and digging are all part of an archeologists work but in these three cities they're going to need all three  skills.              In the Inca civilization, archeologists are unsure what their writing 'language' is yet. You see to keep track of time and livestock, the Inca's used bright colorful strings, leaving archeologists unsure. Though the Spaniards had notebooks to keep notes on the Inca's, archeologists are unsure how much is true, and how much is a legend yet. Through out the years, archeologists have learned very much through the Inca's artifacts left behind... They also examined the bodies of the dead Inca's so they could learn more about them. The Inca's had lived near the Andes so there are dead bodies that the archeologists can climb up the mountains for and since the coldness kept their bodies fresh they could easily do experiments to better see how the economy had worked for them.         In the Mesa Verde, the whole civilization was pretty much mad for art. They learned to Make pottery, Basket weaving, a bow and arrow and also Pit houses! Their population quickly escalated and since they were great with art they quickly learned how to make houses above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. Then once again they upgraded from pole building to skillful stone masonry. There were walls of thick double-coursed stone that often rose 2 or 3 stories high! and were joined together into 50 rooms! The poetry had also changed from simple designs on a dull background to black drawings on a white background. But then... they disappeared, moved to caves, lest their villages for no apparent reason at all. Archeologists believe that maybe there was a threat or a political problem, but at the time it is still unknown.         Finally 'Atlantis' the reason I put that in quotations is because archeologists believed this is the place that started the rumors of a sunken city. years ago a city sunk beneath the depths of the ocean off of the waters of southern Greece. But every one knows the story of the magical sunken city! Though I guess this isn't exactly magical but really a sunken city that just... sunk. Believe it or not that cities been there for the past 5,000 years! And it's the oldest submerged town in the world! When they found it, it surpassed all expectations, thanks to shifting sand and other natural causes, the exploration revealed courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures! To top that off there were thousands of shards of poetry around.             So there have been thousands of lost civilizations. Some were figured out... and some are just lost. Maybe the world will never know the secret of the colorful string or the beautiful artwork, or even the sunken city, we don't know, because all good things have a catch.

Item_Response: Have you ever wondered of the ipotance of the iportance of archeological discoveries? Probably not, but it is the only way we can find out about our past as humans. Three discoveries have been found about the Incas, Puebloans, and Greeks. Of all of these the most relevant one is the Incans.                                                           The Incans have an unknown history. Since they did not have a system of writing, the only was we can find out about them is through the artifacts and bodies of these people. The only true recording was from the spanish about how their legends and myths, but not history. This is why the Incan discoveries are important. They found that they used a quipus to keep count of something and use it as a record. The archeologists can even find out how the people lived and died. The Incans were buried in mountains sides, caves, and on the mountain tops. Because some of the bodies were preserved in a good condition, they can scan the and find the cause of death. This is why small discoveries can bring up a ot of information on this tribe.                          The Puebloans lived in th region of North America. There's even a park ran by this tribes desendants. We deffinatly know more about these people than the Incans. We know that they lived sometime in A.D. 1200. Over time they became skilled craftsman and lived in a clustered vilage. Eventualy, they lived in cliffs in the region of the U.S. We have already known about them because some of the cowboys reported of these people in the 1880's. Though we do not know why they left, we do know the structures and artifacts they left. They made temples that are comparable to churches.                           It has always been thought that the greeks were the ones to have started the myth of atlantis. A city was actualy found in southern greece which is under water. Could this city be Atlantis? Possibly, but it is beeing excavated. Archeologists have concluded that it is the oldest underwater city in the world. It was sunken sometime in 1000 B.C. They have found many artifacts like shards of pottery plus buildings, tombs, temples, etc. They are still debating what caused it to sink, if it was a tsunami, an earthquake, or both. but one thing is for certain, it i a wonder of the ancients.

Item_Response: In the mountains of Peru the ancient Inca civilization was created. The Incas had a empire greater than the Romans but their empire was destroyed by Spanish conquerors. Now there isn't much known for sure about their life style. Spanish soldiers and priests  wrote down stories told by Incas but it is unknown if the soldiers and priests knew what the Incas said or if they learned the Incas language. Most of the Incas stories have been lost because they had no alphabet or system of writing. The Incas burial sites have been found in the Andes Mountains with objects made from stones, pottery, gold, or silver. The bodies that are preserved tell about how they lived.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations Explanatory Article   By Hannah Lawson              There are many different ancient societies being discovered and studied currently.   To name a few there are the ancient Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. All three   societies existed around a similar time period. Like most ancient civilizations they are   mysterious, Wondrous, and harbor many secrets we have yet to discover.          The Incas lived in around 1438 to 1532. During that time they created an amazing empire with a religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government and even transportation. They lived happy and peaceful lives for many years and we know this because they left behind artifacts, passed down stories and even the Spaniards wrote down accounts of their lifestyle. Though we have many stories from the Spaniards we cannot entirely deem them truthful because the Spanish did not fully understand the Inca language. Incas had a system of colorful knotted ropes used to transport information but because we don't have any living Incas we cant translate or even vaguely understand them. The Incas had an extremely well developed civilization and deserve the widespread popularity they get today.          Unlike the Incas the Puebloans lived for some 700 years. They lived in Mesa Verde for the entire time then strangely in the late A.D. 1200s the entire population all moved away. While they were still there though they were known basket makers and lived in pit houses built into the ground and clustered together. They learned how to make pottery, began to use the bow and arrow, and better for hunting, the spear. They became prosperous and began living in above ground houses. They became more agriculture based and their art became more advanced. Eventually they grew in population to the thousands then suddenly began to move back to their ancestors preferred housing in cliff alcoves. They reverted for no apparent reason.          The Palvopetri were a great community that lived in a now submerged town in Greece.  They lived long and prospered and the town was thought to be occupied by elite due to a building found that very much resembled a courthouse. They think that the town sunk because of sea level changes and earthquakes. Also this is the only sunken ruin found that was created before Plato spread the Myth of Atlantis.          All in All these three ancient civilizations have blown away what we ever expected to come of the traces found of them. Yet we still have so much more of the world to explore maybe we will eventually fully understand these and many more civilizations.

Item_Response: The Discoveries of Ancient Times    Over the past decades, many ancient towns and ruins have been found. The lost cities and towns allows archaeologists to find many important artifacts. Such places as the Inca, the city of the Puebloans, and the underwater city of Pavlopetri have had many important artifacts. These places have helped find artifacts, clothing, and the way the ancient people once lived.    The Inca people were very important and archaeologists have found many important artifacts. Archaeologists have found clothing, textiles, buildings, and stories of Spaniards. The buildings helped archaeologists figure out how they lived. Stories are still being figured out. Archaeologists don't know if they stories are real or if they are myths. The Inca left many important artifacts behind, but some are still trying to be found.    Mesa Verde and the Puebloans are also very important. They left abandoned buildings behind. This helped archaeologists figure out how they raised crops and lived. Also, houses were found on cliffs. This shows that cliffs probably helped the Puebloans with protection. The Inca and the Puebloans weren't the only important founding, the Pavloperti were also.    The Pavloperti is extremely important. The Pavloperti is an underwater city. This can relate to the myth of Atlantis. Pavloperti also shows how people lived. The buildings and roads were important. there was also religious buildings. Even though the city of Pavloperti is underwater, it has a huge significance.    The city of Pavloperti, Mesa Verde, and the Inca people are very important. They show modern people and archaeologists how people used to live. It was very interesting. Many artifacts were found. Even if they are old houses, and underground city, or old clothing, everything shows something. Everything they have found is extremely important.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans and the Pavlopetry                                                               Have you ever wondered how your ancestors lived without electricity, and technology? Would you like to find out? For millions and millions of years people lived without the technology and electricity that we have today. Can you imagine your life without electricity or without technology? What will you do? Learn how your ancestors did it. Learning about how they lived is really important because it can teach us a whole lot.                   The Incas lived in the high cold mountains of Peru. They did not have heaters to keep them warm or easy water transportation as we do today. So how did they do it to get water across such big tall mountains? This is why it is so important to learn how they lived. Archeologists do not know much because mountain looters or treasure unters have took it all. But what can we learn from the textiles that have been found?                    What can we learn from the city that has been found in the ocean? We can learn alot. For example from the building that were found we can learn about their archictecture. There is alot more to learn. That is why it is so important to learn about this. We welcome you to do so.

The main three civilizations in this article are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.                            It is important to discover these civilizations because it gives us knowledge of what we were like in the past. It also lets us learn about how our ancestors lived, what they did, and what they belive in. For some people, this is not important, but for many others, learning about our past is an important task. Learning about early civilizations and how they fell also helps present day countries learn how to prevent their country from falling like their ancestors did all those years ago. Many others are just curios about how people lived before they did. I for one, am curios about how people lived a thusnd years ago, and I wonder ho people will live a thousand years from now.                           In conclusion, I belive that learning about ancient civilizations like the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri is important to us. I belive that one day, we might know everything about how we used to live.

Item_Response: Ancient cultures have always been a mystery in our eyes, most of us dont know much about them or there mysterys. Today we think of them as indians who were uncivilized and barbaric but in reality they were much more intelligent then most of the pepole you'd see out on your street right now. They were the begining of our human civlization, how we got to were we are now, but those same cultures have been decived and betrayed by far more advanced civilizations around the world and its because of that, they no longer excised today.           The Ancient Inca for example, they had no formal alphabet or any system of writing they worked with what they had. Incas tied strings into knots to record the calendar and livestock they were called quipus the strings came in many differnet colors. The knots in those strings are not yet known what they were used for. Not much written history has come to archiologists most of what we know now has come from oral history, stories passed from generation to generation. The only actual written history was from the Europeans who showed up to the empire in 1532. They discribed the Incas in letters and diaries. One of the greatist mysterys of the Incas was that they dissapiered, they vanished no one knows what happened to them or were they whent. The mystery still remains.             The Ancestreal Puebloans are another great example of Ancent civilzations, they lived about 1,400 years ago they chose Mesa Verde for there homeland. That remained there homeland for more than 700 years. One of there uniuqe charicteristics was that they made there homes in the canyon walls. These homes have givin Arciologists alot of artifacts and infomation. They were also expert craftsmen they were known for there basketsand homes. They also replaced there hunting and gathering with farming as there main ways of gathering foods.             Another extermly fancinating culture was the lost greek city that may just have inspired atlanis. It was discovered by an Anglo-Greek team of archareologists and marine geologists. It is the oldest submerged town in the world it has remains that reach all the way back to 2800 to 1200 BC . Now it is being explored by archareologists from all around the world they have revealed and under water world of buildingds and court yards.

Item_Response: The discoveries that were found about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are really important. They are important because we need to know how our ancestors lived in the past. We need to know how others lived in order to compare and contrast. Archaeologists can learn new ways of doing things learning from the cultures from many tribes. Not only is it important, but it is also very interesting finding the ruins of buildings, pottery, stones, people and many other valuable things. It is also important to know how things have changed in the past, from how they are now; in the present. We can also find out why we look the way we do by seeing where we came from. Many tribes have massive statues of their ruler at the time and we can see what they looked like. We can learn how they treated their people, how they acted, and what they did by looking at their carvings and writings from walls or caves. We might even find out what they ate at the time, depending on their surroundings and the shapes and sizes of their pottery bowls. We can find out how they treated their kings or emperor by the size of their king's home and throne.

Item_Response: The discoveries ???of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavolpetri are important because we want to know how they lived long ago. We learn their ways life by discovering where have they lived, their writing, art, music, and etc.                  How was the Incan civilization so important? The ancient Inca of Peru had no particular formal writing, but they used strings called quipus. they use to record the calendar to keep count of livestock. the people who first met the ancient Inca were the Europeans. They were shocked of how amazing they saw the Inca using strings to keep records. Sadly, the Incan strings could not be decoded or read into, but some clues were left behind by an Inca portrait, religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and ways of life.                             How was the Puebloan empire important? The first Ancestral Puebloans were settled in Mesa Verde around A.D. 550. They are known as 'Basketmakers,' for their skill of crafting items. Later around the civilization, the ways of their lives started to change; ffarmers now began hunting. The Puebloans lived in Pithouses, pithouses were usually placed in clustered, small villages or sometimes cliff recesses. They learned how to make pottery and know how to use the bow. They made bows so it was easier to hunt than using the atlatl, a throwing spear.                 Was Atlantis an actual city? The lost city of Atlantis was one of the great myths. Dr. Jon Henderson states that the long lost city was not the oldest submerged town because 'it was remained dating around 2800-1200 BC, long before the days of Greece.' Can this be true? What people found around Atlantis were shards of pottery and also rock-cut tombs, religious structures and etc. People today still wonder of how the the lost city sank down the ocean.                  It's important to learn the history of the past because we could how they lived and survived.

Item_Response: The first ancestral puebloans settled in mesa verde in a.d. 550.   Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood.   In about a.d. 750 they began building houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud.   The people of mesa verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry.   Walls of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more .

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations   How can we learn about the past if we possible can't go back to learn every little thing about it? Archaeologists have recently found out things about the past that most people wouldn't be able to find out about now. The Inca of Peru had no record of a formal alphabet system or a type of writing. The didn't have books for the Historians to study. For calendars they made knots in ropes to keep record of the livestock that they had. Archaeologists have discovered many interesting things about this civilization. Let's get more in depth.       How did these archaeologists find out about these civilizations if they couldn't go back in the past? Well the answer to that question is; They find clues in the area that they focus on then they test them out to see what they were used for, how they were used, who they were used by and what time period they came from. Pretty cool huh?       How do we figure out what all that ancient writing reads? It actually takes quite a while before you can actually read them. Someone first has to translate the alphabet, and then they must use the alphabet that they translated to translate the whole entire text. That might take quite a few years before we could be able to read the whole thing.       We can also learn about the past if there was a diary left behind by a King or Queen. After translating the text we can see what kind of leadership their civilization held, we can see what kind of conditions they lived in and we can also see what kind of life they lead according to those diaries.       If a city was sunken, archaeologists  would most likely go into the ocean to find out everything they can about that city and what it was like before it sunk and learn about the reasons it did sink in the first place. Although it maybe hard for archaeologists to obtain information about these ancient cities, in the end it was definitely worth it when you get to see how they lived before there was any technology

Item_Response: Ancient civilizations have been coming up all around the world, and we have been basking in their wonderful artifacts for centuries. The Inca lived in Peru, South America. Although alot of their artifacts have been raided by looters, what we have found is amazing. The Inca's mosaics are some of the best in the world, their farming tactics, cuting stair-case cliffs in the side of mountains to grow food, and their travel routes, are all amazing.       The Puebloans lived in the four corners of the world before the Europeans arrived, taking shelter in the stone walls of the canyons. Their houses aren't very elaborate, but they worked for them, and they were protection from the outdoors. Their weapons were the first of their kind, the atlatl (spear thrower) was used for hunting before they acquired the bow and arrow. Which is more efficient than the atlatl.       Have we finally found Atlantis? Maybe not, but there is a very good chance we did. Off the coast of the Greek Peloponnese is a sunken city, might be Atlantis might not. My theory of how it came to be under water is a freak natural disaster happened, like a flood or a tsunami, and it has been sunken since then. No one knows the name of the city, but alot of ceramics were found, scattering the bottom of the ocean floor, maybe they traded with other cultures? But either way, this is a great find.

Item_Response: You don't think the discoveries of antient civilizations matter. I hate to be rude, but I believe your wrong. Let me explain why. Everything we do/have is based from the discoveries of antient civilizations. Modern day would be immensly different if we hadn't discovered antient civilizations, we wouldn't have tools, weapons, even our cell phones! Some example civilizations are, The Inca, The Mesa Verde, and The Lost Greek City of Atlantis.   Well first of all the Inca, have been extremly hard to study, because they had no form of writing. What they did was, they knotted string and colored on it. I have to say would be more than dificult to study. Even with todays technology we still have no idea what these knotts mean. This civilization lasted nearly one hundred years (1438-1532). In 1532 the European showed up and killed the reining king of the Inca and conquered the area.   As for the Mesa Verde, they are extremly imprtant to our developed housing. Their civilizations lasted for seven hundred years! Around the years A.D. 1200s they packed up and moved away, they were gone like the wind. They were known for their beautiful basket making and crafting. One kind of housing are the pithouses. The living room sunk in a few feet, had four corneres, had a firepit in the middle, and were held up with four pieces of timber. they were pretty simple, not much to it. Another type of Mesa Verde arcitecture was the 'Kiva' which was basically like a church, where they could connect with the Gods or even join the afterlife.   The lost Greek city of Atlantis, has been discovered! I guess they can't make anymore goof-off movies that are factually wrong. This settlement is all the way back to the time of Homer's heros. the submerged city covers over 30,000 square meters of ocean floor, on the Southern part of the Peloponnese. The Greek city is believed to have sunk around 1000 B.C. Some things they found dated all the way back to the Stone Age. Which has made us think that this civilization existed over 5,000 years ago.   Have I convinced you? The importance of these civilizatons is greatly appriciated, because I have always enjoyed learning about past life. Just knowing that the past life has affected my life makes me feel like that one day my life will be important to a teenage girl writing an essay on why past civilizations are imprtant.

Item_Response: The Inca, Pavlopetri and the Ancestral Puebloans all have a very exciting history. They all have there own way of surviving. They all have their own spot to live far away from each other. None of the groups lived in the same time period. In fact, they lived in a far time frame from one another.       The Inca did not have a formal language or a formal way of writing to communicate with each other. They ruled the South American empire in the years of 1438-1532 which is almost 100 years! The Spaniards came to the Inca to take over and rule the South American empire. A lot of the Inca's artifacts were made from stone, gold, pottery, and silver. Many of the Inca sites were invaded by treasure hunters or looters. the Spaniards made it easy for researchers to study the fall of the Inca because they murdered the last Inca king in 1532. When archaeologists went to study the Inca, they found many frozen bodies on the Andes Mountains.       About 1400 years ago the Amcestral Purbloans lived in the Four Corners region in Mesa Verde. They built their communities in the alcolves of the canyon walls. They eventually left there and moved on. They settled in Mesa Verde in 550 A.D. They used pithouses for shelter, came up with the bow and arrow instead of using an atlatl. They were very good at arts and were named the cliff dwellers. Soon, they left and moved up to New Mexico and Arizona. Now, the Pueblo people today are all descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans.       The Pavlopetri people lived in Atlantis some 5000 years ago and is now known as the lost city. Some people now say that this is that oldest sunken cities in the world. The Pavlopetri made this city great with technology and buildings and was very rich. Archaeologists found a megaron, a monumental building with a big rectangular hall. That made them think that this place was used by an elite which automatically made it more interesting to study about it. Marine geologists thought that maybe an earthquake or a tsunami destroyed it and made it sink. This is the first time a sunken city has been found.       These three groups are very interesting to study about. they are all very different in their own ways. They are all in their own parts of the world, they didnt live in the same time period either. one group lived in the mountains, one lived on ground and now has sunken.

Item_Response: The discovery of the Ancient Inca was an important discovery because they left clues behind .The Inca form an amazing way of their religion,architecture,art,agriculture,government,transportation,and the way of life.Most of the artifacts left might be objects made from stone,pottery,gold,or silver.Some of the artifacts that the Inca's left behind last a long period of time, whilde some other materials were found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.Many of the artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. The archaeologists know some of the old stories because they were written down by the europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532,also the visitors were priests and spanish soldiers.The priests and spanish soldiers described the Inca in diaries and letters.The historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts because the spaniards didn't speak the Inca language well.Perhaps they may not understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate.Maybe some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history.Inca textiles and clothing also survived remarkably well.Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed be dampness.Treasure hunters and looters diturb Inca sites.The treasure hunters or looters may have taken anything that might be valuable.Now like today looting still goes on,but some treasures were taken centuries ago.              The Ancestral Puebloans were the first to settle in Masa Verde in about A.D 550, because of their skill at the craft they are know as Basketmakers. They were beginning to lead a more settled way of life.They sheltered in pithouses built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They found a way to make pottery and acquired a bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. From about A.D 550 to A.D 750 people lived in pithouses.             Atlantis was explored by Anglo-Greek team of archeaologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri. The area of Atlantis straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese,is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.It was discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago.It was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology,were able to properly survey the ruins. Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank.Atlantis is the first sunken city that has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.`

Item_Response: Why is it important to know about the Inca, the Peubloans and the Pavlopetre?       We are fascinated by civilization from the past because we want to know how they lived their daily lives & what they did.That's why it is important to know about the Inca, Peubloans and the Pavloptetre.       The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. But there are clues left behind by the Inca forming an amazing portrait of their religion, art and way of life.       The Peubloans; about 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde as their home. The Peubloans lived in Pithouses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting.       Now I'm pretty sure we have all heard of Atlantis! Like have read a books on Greek Mythology, watched the movie, or have learned it in Social Studies. Well the Pavlopetre is what the people were called that lived in Atlantis. We all know its under water and most cities aren't under water. Atlantis has remains of datings from 2800 to 1200 BC; thats why its such a important finding. The most important artifact was the pottery cause the Pavlopetre would write stories on them. One of those pots could have the story of what cause Atlantis to sink.

Item_Response: Archaeologists have uncovered many things that are important. Things like Atlantis, answering our qustions of mystery aand posiblity, as well as the Incas, satisfying our need to know about the past, and finaly the people of Mesa Verde, alowing us to learn about the people who inhabited this land before us.        The underwater city of Atlantis, real or fake? This age old myth has been uncovered thanks to archaeologists. Archaeologist have discovered a city that might support this tale and give it some backing of truth. This find allows us to know more about these myths and qustion our own beliefs.        What Archaeologists have learned about the Inca allows us to know about the lives of ancient people. Hand crafted pottery and large amonts of gold might lead us to know about the social ranking. Frozen bodies tell us more about their everyday life, how they died out, and even the rituals they followed, such as sacrifices.        Mesa Verde and the people that lived there are important to everyone especially the people living in North America. The excavation of these people's ancient lives allows us to find out more about the people who lived on the soil we live on centuries ago.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made of the civilizations are very important. They found bodies that belonged to the Inca civilization that gave the archaeologists a good understanding of what the Incas used and what they thought was good for a good afterlife. They lived high in the mountains so it is very hard to find the artifacts that they were using. The archaeologists also found out what they did as a city and what they built.       The Puebloans are a very interesting civilization as well. They lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. That is important because we found out they were skilled at building houses. Local cowboys reported first reported the cliff dwellings in 1880. Ever since then archaeologists have been searching to find out why they are there. The structures let us know that over centuries, skills and traditions were passed down from the Puebloans. The accomplishments of these people are one of the best expressions of human culture in our continent.       The Pavlopetri were a really interesting civilization because their civilization was found underwater. 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr. John Henderson. And he is right. All the things we found about this civilization has been underwater. We are fascinated with this civilization because it shows the advancement in technology that we have made since then. This lost city is very important because it is the oldest submerged town ever. It has many artifacts that show us their way of life. We find the things they used like clothes, weapons, documents, and even government structures.       All of these civilizations are very important and always will be. Some are way up high in the mountains and some are way down low in the water, but either way they are important. All the artifacts show us there way of life and what they used to live like that.

Item_Response: According to the article from the guardian the sunken settlement; pavlopetri dates back some 5000 years to the time of homer's heroes. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC long before the glory days of Greece. The site is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. The sea consumed the city around 1000 BC. They found a world full of buildings, courtyards , main streets, rock cut tombs, and religious structures. According to the excerpt the ancient Incas had no form of alphabet. This helped us to know what kind of reading and writing the ancient civilizations had. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The Europeans were amazed that the Inca could run such a large empire using strings to keep record. Today we have found many quipus but we do not know what they mean .

Item_Response: Discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri       The discoveries of lost citys are significant facts on how we run our civilizations today we find ancient artifacts among these places like article Lost Greek city the archaeologists found things like buildings,courtyards,main streets, rock-cut tombs, and many religious structures.                     How the Incas were important       In the Inca's civilization  played a big role in preserving important things for us to study over there weather was also so cold that people would die up in the mountains and the cold weather would preserve their bodies for the archeologists to be able and use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about the ways that those people died.The Inca's land structure also made it difficult for archaeologists to artifacts from there civilizations because they had to climb over mountains with all of their stuff with them.                   How the Puebloans were important       The puebloans were people who could make things out of stone and bricks wich made it easier for them then some people to be able to build structures and houses. They also lived in pithouses and they lived in them from A.D 550 to A.D.750. Some of the Puebloans were basketmakers and their population multiplied. In A.D.750 their civilization began building houses above ground.                   How the  Pavlopetri were important            The Pavlpetri were important because the were apart of the Lost city of Atlantis and they left behind many things like buildings,courtyards,main-streets, rock-cut tombs and many religous structures that we can research and use today with everything they also explained that the mythof Atlantis is true and that it is was a planed town that semergued.

Item_Response: This article is about the Inca, the Pueblo ans, and the Pavlovian using strings for keeping track of data, days, and etc. Old stories were discovered by the Europeans. They also clues left behind art, agriculture, architecture, government, transportation and way of life. It also lasted from 1438-1532 almost 100 years. The Europeans arrived in the empire in 1532.     The Ancient Inca was about the ancient Inca not having a formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quips to record the calender to keep a count of livestock. The Europeans were amazed that the Inca could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. The Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation.     The Mesa Verde was about a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their homes. For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here. In the late A.D. 1200's, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away. The Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture.    The First Ancestral Pueblo ans was about when they settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. they are known as Basket makers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pit-houses clusters into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations       Most people think that the now is better than the past. That what happened in the past should stay in the past. Yet what they don't understand is that by knowing the past, they can understand the future. The Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are some of the least understood ancient civilizations, and yet, some of the most mysterious.       The Incas were a great empire in the South Americas, and were very efficient, until they were confronted by the Spaniards. The Spaniards caused the complete and total collapse of the empire, and many of the things that the Incas had, many of their knowledge, was lost along with the collapse. And yet, archeologists spend millions of dollars trying to find even a small fragment of their artifacts to know more about the Incas. Why would someone do that? Because by doing so, we are able to understand more about what caused the empire to fall, what could have happened, and what did happen.       Another smart civilization was the Puebloans. They were able to use their surroundings to benefit themselves. If the archeologists knew more about how they did this, they could teach the rest of the world, so that we wouldn't be so reliant on technology, and we wouldn't mess up Earth as much as we are now. The Puebloans created homes using the sides of cliffs in the small valley gorge they lived in. Being very artistic people, they soon took on pottery, and made beautiful pieces. Though their stories and lessons that were on them are now a melancholic dark shade of black.       And the last civilization I will mention is the Pavlopetri. This is one of the most important civilizations, because their cities and towns have been found to exist on land that is now completely submerged. Archeologists and scientists want to understand what happened to this civilization, why their cities sank, thus ruining the existence of them. There are many theories, blaming tectonic movement, but it does appear to be a booster towards the myth of Atlantis.       Based on the findings from these civilizations, and millions more, scientists can piece together the evolution of the human race, maybe not just where it came from, but also where it is going. The scientists can also find how what we have now came along, the evolution of human technology.

Item_Response: Many inventions of today are based off of tools and objects of the past. Without knowledge of ancestors we would not have made the technology advances that we have. Discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have given us the chance today to flourish.             The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing like we have today. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar and to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Although, the life of the Inca is quite unknown to us and is a mystery, clues left behind give us insight into their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Oral history of the Inca has been an important way to preserve the society's history, along with old stories written down by the Europeans. The knowledge the Inca civilization has given us has made us advanced in our technology and in our school smarts, but we do not owe it all to them.             The Puebloans are another ancient society we owe our advances and discoveries to. Their structures in cliffs speak with a certain eloquence. They tell of a people great at building, artistic in their crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land. The ancient Puebloans have given us insight into how knowledgeable you need to be of the land you live in so that you may make the most of it. Eventhough, they left their land to to probable resource depletion and infertile soil, they used their sense to move. These people have given us geographical smarts we desperately needed.             The discovery of the Pavlopetri have made us realize that, yes we have explored our vast oceans and seas, but less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. Yes the world has come a great distance from men in caves to men walking on the moon, but none of that matters we still have not seen a fraction of what this planet has to offer. The underwater 'Atlantis' has let us know we r just a tiny spec on this spectacular world of ours.             The ancient civilizations of this world have given us so much knowledge, and they are what shaped our society. Honestly, they deserve the credit of making this planet what it is today. Maybe, in the future we will give them the credit they truly deserve.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important for many reasons. The Inca influenced many people by their amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture. They lived high in the Andes. The Inca were buried in caves on mountain tops. The bodies that were found reveal information on how they lived, most of them were in good condition. Modern medical scanning equipment can be used to learn how the people died. The Inca plays an important role in history.        The Puebloans were a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. They are known for being basketmakers. They were extremely skilled craftspeople who learned how to make pottery and also acquired the bow and arrow. The Puebloans lived in the cliff dwelings for less than one hundred years. The Puebloans are an important group.        The Pavlopetri lived in older sunken in sites in the world. In 1000 BC, the Peloponnese is belived to have been consumed by the sea. The sunken settlement dates back some five thousandd years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth. The Pavlopetri were an important team.

Item_Response: Without archaeologists, so many of the world's discoveries would have never been made. We don't only need archaeologists, we need special types such as high-altitude and marine archaeologists. Marine archaeologists are able to discover artifacts that are underwater such as towns that have sunk or other things that have gone to the bottom of the ocean. High-altitude archaeologists are able to get to artifacts that are high above the ground such as in cliffs and caves in mountains. Without those two specific types of archaeologists we wouldn't have half of the artifacts we have today. We also wouldn't know so much about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       When archaeologists find artifacts they can find out alphabets of different cultures and the different languages they speak. They can also find ways that they lived and how they survived by things they hunted and stories left behind. They find stories that families used to tell by finding paintings inside of caves and on the side of cliffs. Without these artifacts, we wouldn't have them in museums and students in school wouldn't be able to learn about different cultures and ways of life in school. It's important that we learn how people used to live because it's such a big difference on how we live today.       Archaeologists put themselves in a lot of danger when they are collecting artifacts because some of the situations can be very hazardous. When they are climbing up the side of a mountain, that isn't exactly a walk on the beach. When they are underwater they have to encounter dangerous underwater caverns and they also have to stay underwater for a long time. To be an archaeologist you have to go through a lot of training so you are prepared for those hard situations.       Some artifacts have surprisingly survived well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by wetness getting to them. Some have survived by being preserved in the dry deserts of Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Stone pottery, gold, and silver survive a lot better than the other artifacts even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. A lot of these artifacts will be buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. There are a lot of artifacts out there for archaeologists to find and discover. They will probably never find all of them because some areas are impossible to get to and search.       Without archaeologists we wouldn't have the knowledge we have today about past life and how they lived. Archaeologists are a very important part of our society. They provide us with information for school textbooks, displays in museums, and all other things that help us learn about other cultures. We can get a little look at the past when we study artifacts and we can compare it to today's life.

Item_Response: The discoveries of these ancient civilizations are important because we want to know what life was like in ancient times. We learned that the Inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing according to 'Past' by Beth Gruber. We have learned about what the first ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde lived in. We even found an ancient Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myths according to an article from 'The guardian'.         We have not been able to find much about the Incas.   We do know that they used strings to keep records. Most of what we know has been passed down via oral history. We know some stories from the Europeans that came to the empire.             We have learned about a civilization that has lived on North America long before the Europeans have arrived. This civilization was called the Mesa Verde Ancestral Puebloans. They first lived in houses called Pithouses. It featured a living room that sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof. The fire pit had an air deflector. An antechamber may of contained storage bins. Pithouses evolved into Kivas much later.         We have found a lost Greek city under water near the city of Neapolis. What they have found has surpassed all expectations. Thanks to shifting sand, the city has been exposed. It is the oldest submerged city in the world! It is unique because although there are older sunken cities, this is a very planned out city. Archaeologists believe it was sunk around 1000 B.C. The city is composed of a World of buildings, courthouses, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures.             We may of not found everything, but we have found alot. Discoveries like these a phenomal, and give us more information about what life was like a long time ago.
