Item_Response: In the years 1438-1532 the ancient Inca Empire of Peru was after the Aztec Empire. the ancient Inca had no formal writing, and they made knots and clored strings called quipus, to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus, but today no one knows what the knots mean. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life.        Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate, and some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history. As in many ancient civilizations, Inca artifcacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gols, or silver. Such materials lst a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried in raves for the dead to use in the afterlife. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well.         Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness, but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.Some Inc sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often don't tell archaeologists very much. Other sites are reported to archaeologists, who can dig them up carefully. Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniards' accounts of the Inca.        The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped to preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them, but it also makes the job of the archaeologist more difficult. High-altitude archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equipment up a mountain before they can start work. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died, and they also reveal information about how they lived.

Item_Response: Important Discoveries                       There has been many discoveries made from the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, but why are they so important? Archaeologists have found many artifacts, but sometimes don't know what they mean.                       One of the reasons why it's so important is because archaeologists want to know how the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have lived back in history. Some of the things that archaeologists know about the Inca comes from stories told by many generations. Even though they had passes on stories from generation, historian had to be careful. Because the Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language well, they might have misunderstood them. Also many of the stories were legends and not history of the Inca. The Inca did leave objects behind so that meant what was going on in their civilization. The Inca artifact are no different from other ancient civilization because they might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Archaeologists make sure to write down any possible information that they can possibly get out of the Inca artifacts. Just like in Greece where a sunken city has been found. The exploration has found world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures, plus there was thousands of shards of pottery. As Dr Henderson, professor at the University of Notthingham, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world.' For less than 100 hundred years, the Ancestral Puebloans lived int he cliff dwellings. Soon it was deserted because of the drought, but they have survived other droughts before. Of all the years of intensive use of the land resources, perhaps the it was just depleted, or they might have just wanted to live somewhere else.                         Another reason why it's important is to know how the ancestors came. The very first Ancestral Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. Even though Archaeologists couldn't really trace back when the origin of the Inca, they still knew the fall was in 1532. The fall of Inca was the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king which was in 1532. Since the area where the Inca had lived had been inhabited by different people, the Archaeologists didn't know the origin. They had to be careful because they didn't know which people built which site, but to find the Inca's predecessors they used some of the most advanced techniques in the world. The archaeologists used aerial photography to help them find patterns that they can't see from the ground.                         These were some of the most important reasons why these discoveries were made. Although they lived differently and their ancestors were different those were the most important because it shows how they were and where they came from.

Item_Response: Astonishing Ancient Inca Discoveries                        The ancient Inca didn't have a formal way of literature or a common alphabet, nor did they make the historians work easy when they studied them; however, they did have a unique method of keeping record of the calendar. They Inca's method was using quipus, which was the use of knots in colored strings. This technique fascinated the many Europeans which were the first in encountering such style of government.             Numerous clues have shown archaeologists valuable information about what type of transportation they used, their government system, religion and culture, art, but most importantly their way of life. Another way the world is informed about the history of the Inca is they way people pass on stories from generation to generation.             Because research has shown us that the Europeans arrived at the Inca empire in 1532, it is believed that they were the ones whom described the Inca in written diaries. Although they may have described them, their information could have not been accurate due to the fact that they had trouble comprehending the Inca language.             Another source of intelligence we have is the ancient artifacts, object, or tools left behind; the location in which they are found is also very crucial. The artifacts are mainly found in disintegrated buildings as well as graves.             Archaeologists who keep records on studied sites always note and photograph the artifact in the exact position they discovered it. They can confirm any doubts they may have by comparing information learned from an artifact and information given from Spaniards' accounts of the Inca.             The most important information leaned from the Inca was the fact that their last king was murdered by the Spaniards in 1532 which lead to the fall of the Inca. Because the place where the Inca used to live was inhabited by other people, it is more difficult for archaeologists to confirm which buildings were constructed by who. However, with the advanced technology we have today it'll be much easier.             In my opinion, the Inca civilization is very unique. I personally have concluded that it was thanks to the Inca that we were inspired to create and run our own society and technology.

Item_Response: Important Ancient Discoveries       Discoveries are always important, but why? What do discoveries do for us? Will it change our society? Discoveries were and are really important sometimes. Many explorers had found many interesting Discoveries such as ' The ancient Inca of Peru,' 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World,' The Cliff Dwellers,' etc. Explorers called Pavlopetri.       Explorers unlock secrets of the past, like the ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep records. Archaeologists had founf many ancient guipus, but  no one knows what the knots mean.Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful knots on the string.Clues left behind by the the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.       Long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. Mesa verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Archaeologists have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as ' the ancient ones' or ' ancient enemies.' In these days people call them Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern descendants. They and their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls.       Since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1880s, archaeologists had sought to understand the people's lives. Despite decades of excavation, analysis, classification, and comparison, scientific knowledge remains sketchy. They left no written records and much that was important in their lives has perished. Ancestral Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. Their basic construction material was sandstone that they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca               The ancient Inca in Peru didn't had a system of writing, instead the Inca's made knots to keep track of their livestock. Those knots were called Quipus, they were made out of colored string. The first people that met the Ancient Inca were some Europeans, they were surprised how the controlled such a huge empire using the quipus to keep records.From the quipus left behind by the Inca that archeologist have found they have been trying to figure out what they mean. Other items left behind by the Inca like: portraits of religion, art, cloth (but the cloth doesn't really last hundreds of years), architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their (customs) ways of life have helped us figure out about the Inca life. The Inca have also left behind artifacts made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. The artifacts left behind are usually long lasting materials.The things we know about the Inca we have found out by their remainings or part of the stories (oral history) that we know have passed down from generation to generation.Part of the Oral History was from the Europeans when the visited the Inca empire in 1532. The peoples remains were hard to  find, because where they lived it had been inhabited by many different people. Archaeologists had to very careful and precise the know who which people builted which sites.               Archeologist who study about the past are very, very careful about what they find, and write down exactly what the find. The archaeologist need to learn as much information as they can.The most important things to learn about civilizations are where it came from and what happen to it. Archaeologists use some of the most advanced equipment in the world to learn more about the Inca's history.       The fall of the Inca was an easy date to remember in 1532 the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king, and they took over the empire. Some Inca's lived  in the Andres Mountains, and they may even worshiped some of the mountain peaks. Others lived in buried caves in cliff faces, because the Inca lived so high up, that made the archaeologists job more difficult. The Archaeologist were high-altitude expert mountaineers; they had to carry their equipment up and if they found artifacts they had to bring it back down the mountains. Up in the mountains it was could as a freezer. Archaeologist found frozen bodies and used them for Modern Medical Scanning equipment to learn about how the people died and how was their life experience.                                                     Mesa Verde National Park               Long before the Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the four Corners region chose Mesa Verde as their home. Mesa Verde has been their home over than 700 years; the ancestral Puebloans descendants expanded their family's growth their. Then in the late A.D. 1200s, in span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away.              Mesa Verde National Park has a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Archaeologists have called the people from their Anasazi, (from a Navajo word translated as 'the ancient people' or ' ancient enemies') but now their known as the Ancestral Puebloans looking back at their modern descendants.              The first Ancestral Puebloan to settle in about A.D. 550. The Ancestral Puebloans were known as ' The Basketmakers' for their skills in crafts.They learned how to make pottery and acquire the bow and arrow. The started to lead a more calm way. Farming replaced hunting, they lived in pithouses clustered into small villages(usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.) People lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to 750., as settled agriculture began.The pithouses had a livingroom sunk a few feet down under ground. About A.D. 750 they began building house above ground with strait walls made out of poles and mud. They built houses one against another in long, curving rows. Starting from their they became known as the Puebloans a Spanish word meaning 'Village Dwellers.' By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Walls were thick, double course stone often rose two or three stories (floors) high and were put close together into units of 50 rooms or more! Their pottery also changed it went from simple desigh on a dull gray background to black drawings on white background.             Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300 during the Classic Period the population has reached several thousands. The stone walls of the large pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in mesa Verde. With their straight courses of carefully shaped stone.

Item_Response: The Importance of Ancient Civilation Findings       It is important to know about the past ancient civilizations today in our society   because we can learn something new or try and adapt to past ideas. Ideas from long ago can benefit our society today. Past civilizations can help us prepare for whatever may come our way. It also gives us clues and key facts as to what they majored in education because some people in the United States can argue that schools are not benefiting children's needs to learn.       Ancient civilizations probably had a hard time adjusting to the climate and location,   land wise. Even when you think about people now, it is always hard to communicate or relate to people around you when your new or out of town and you've just moved in. Adapt was and is very hard to do. Inca's always had a trouble fitting in. They would get robbed and treated differently. Its no wonder there civilization collapsed.       Past civilizations can also help us prepare for the future or at least be somewhat   prepared. Ancestral Puebloans were always prepared. They had different techniques of building shelter and artilery. They also had skill which played a key role in advancing in technology. They also used rock like platforms to build a small kitchen. Over the years they had advanced until they submerged to another civilization.       The ancient civilization of Pavlopetri is a well thought out city   and has the most educational impact on us today. Pavlopetri is such a unique town because of how it was planned to be structured. Without technology, which also played a key role in discovering it, Pavlopetri could have never been found. By technology, we could see how these people had a sense of wanting to be unifed in which some people may argue that the United States isn't. The artifacts found also shows how skilled these people were and how this could benefit us today by studying the remain and more of what they studied.       Ancient civilizations, in general, can be a phenomenol benefit to society today.   Ideas such as climate and harsh weather conditions and preparation are helpful for our daily lives.

Item_Response: Why are our Discoveries so Important?                                   Throughout the years, new technology has been aiding us on our discoveries of lost and ancient civilizations. Our fascination with learning about ancient society's different from ours, how they were created, and how they were ended has lead us to the discovery of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. These great civilizations can help us by reflecting on our own civilization and society that we have created today.                       The artifacts the Inca left behind, such as pottery, indicate that the Inca were hard working individuals and were skilled with their hands. They also used other materials such as gold and silver to make items. In our society today, we use things like plastic plates that are disposable and we over produce. There are very few people that create their own things today. The items we buy today are not very good quality and will not last as long as the ruins of the Inca have.                       The stone walls that the Puebloan left behind are remarkable. What makes the walls reamarkable are their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. With an increase of quality in their walls and aslo their pottery their basket making skills decreased. This is what is happening in our current civilization. Our demand for electronic items is greater that our demand for any other man made item. We are blinded by indulgence to see what we truly need for our civilization to survive.                                     Pavlopetri was a society that seemed to be flawless by all that we have found and discovered about them. Yet we have not found the reason why their civilizatin was destroyed. They were not very cautious on their surroundings , and neither is our society. We could be running the same risk as them.                                     Our discoveries of ancient civilization are not only fascinating but are also very educational. We get see what their errors were and that helps us be aware of our possible errors. With the information we aquire from the things they left behind we can strive for a better society.

Item_Response: We have figured out a lot of things from the Ancient Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti. Based on the artifacts that they have found helped us learn almost everything about them.            The Ancitent Inca had not form of writng. They did not leave very much for historians to study. Historians were able to figure out what they call the quipus. this was made of knots in colored string to record the calendar to keep a count of their livestock. To this day no one knows what the knots mean unless someone who can read the stories tied to the quipus. they also left other clues for us to figure there life out. We learned about their religoun, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their was of life. some of there artcracraft could have come have been made from pottery, gold, and silver. Some of our history came from the Incas. Even some of their clothing was proserved and are able to been seen today. Inca sitings have been bothered by hunters and other people.             The puebloans lived very differnt then we do today. Before the Europeans explored North America, about 1400 years ago, there lived a group of people in the Four Corners region. They did not buy their houses, they had to make them with supplies that they found. They lived in pithouses, they would have a bunch of them in their small villages. The people that put together the house was called the basketmaker. They also learned to make pottery and came up with the bow and arow. Their most used weapon was called the atlatl, it threw their spears.            These artifacts that seem like they would mean nothing do not really mean nothig. These things have helped us come up with all the things we know about these ancient places today. The people that have seen the things that were left make sure that they take carefull records, they do this by taking pictures or writing it down.

Item_Response: Many ancient civilizations were key to the development of our civilizations we have today. The discovery of civilizations, such as the Incan civilization, are very important because it shows how even in ancient civilizations they still had technology that we use today. Some architecture we see today have possibly originated from the Incan civilization. The census we see today originated from the Incan civilization that they used to understand how much resources they required to give to the citizens. Another importance for the discovery of this civilization was that it help archaeologist understand the harsh conditions from thye cold weather Incan's had to face, and their advancements in clothes and other resources to help them survive from these conditions. Today we have advanced materials to survive in the cold snow, but Incans did not have these materials so they often times had to resort to animal fur so they can stay warm. Their buildings must have been fire retardent for them to light fires in them to stay warm in locations where fires are not suitible for other weather conditions. Past civilization are of great importance to the development of our civilizations today and how they are run.   Civilizations from the past are of great importance today for how our world is run today. In the civilization of Mesa Verde, the discovery of this civilization is of importance because it shows how puebloans created advanced buildings to suit their needs to survive in both cold and hot weather. Their buildings have been made to be fire retardent for puebloas to survive during freezing conditionsof winter where snow would become a great threat for survival. To survive during hot summer conditions, puebloans have created windows to ventilate the air to keep it cool for survival. Another importance for the discovery of the civilization of Mount Verde is that they changed their old materials of sticks and mud to adobe bricks to support these new advancements inside their buildings. Adobe was the new material needed for the buildings to be fire retardent which would help them use fires inside their buildings. Adobe was a strong material that would have to preservere during snowy and windy months when debris would cause much damage. Many civilizations from the past help to create the world we know today.   Past civilizations are the reason why our government and other things in the world run the way they do. The ancient city in Greece shows how advanced their civilization was because of the reason the city was still preserved, and why all the old artifacts were able to survive through thousands of years. The materials used for the building must have had to be durable and be water resistant to allow the city to stay in tact which shows how advanced the civilization was. Because artifacts were still preserved, we were able to date back to find that this civilization has been around for thousands of years, and they lived lives close to how we live today. Civilizations from the past caused many of these advancements we see today.

Item_Response: Many may wonder why discovering or having the knowledege of an ancient civilization is important? Their are three discoveries that will be explained of their impotance: the discovery of Ancient Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and an underwater city.               The Ancient Inca civilization was an important find because they were much like our civilization today and we can see how we've developed. The inca used string to record count of their livestock. Today, keeping record of things is very important. We can clearly see how we have developed from this. We also need to know how we aquired skills and how they were used many years ago.               Conspicuously we know that the Ancestral Puebloans passed down skills for many generations. How do we Know if they are good skills for life? of course by the discovery of their civilization. Archelogists have realized these skills mad a civilization posper, such as their architecture. Building rooms of hard walls helped them become big towns, which we use today.                The finding of the underwater city of Grease could answer a myth: the myth of Atlantis. This myth has been around for a long time and people have been questoning it. Their finding tells of a unique city, such as the city of Atlantis. This discovery may also warn us about hardships that we could face, such as being swallowed by water.                  Clearly these discoveries are most important for answering questions such as why are our buildings like they are today or why is this skill needed in our life.

Item_Response: Discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are important because they provide further knowledge to archaeologists about how these people lived, what their culture was like, and their religious beliefs.  Artifacts that have been found are vital to the natural curiosity of people and to those who want to compare them to the things we use today to see how things have evolved and changed since then.  The fact that we have the technology today to study these things is proof enough that we have a more advanced system of studying equipment than the people we are studying.           The study of ancient Incan civilization brings about many interesting topics about the way they lived.  It is pretty amazing that we know as much as we do about the Inca considering that they do not have a formal alphabet or writing system.  The fact that they were able to record the calender and keep count of their livestock on a device called a quipu shows the people were intelligent enough to keep records just by using knots on colored strings.  Although it may not seem apparent by just one look, Incan clothing can tell a lot about the civilization's culture and religion as well.  Spiritual headdresses and robes have been found in other places, telling archaeologists that they believed in the god.  Some clothing in the Incan society could uncover more information that could be difficult to find elsewhere.  Archaeologist use some of the most advanced techniques to discover more about Incan predecessors shows that they put their best foot forward in trying to find out new things about the civilization.              Studying the Puebloan society helps archaeologist compare the items of the past to the ones we have today.  Their pithouses are nothing like to houses of the modern age.  Not only do these pithouses teach us more about what type of architecture they had, they teach us about their spiritual beliefs.  There was a hole for passage to the underworld called a sipapu.  They believed in gods and that they would come up based on ancient myths.  The discoveries made about the ancient Puebloans assist us to build on our technology.  We can use their experiences and devices to create something bigger and better than we have today.  Because we have made such great discoveries about the ancient Puebloans, we can make our generation better and, at the same time, learn about what they used to do.                People have always heard about places like the lost city of Atlantis.  The sunken settlement of Pavlopetri may have inspired that myth.  People are very intrigued by the fact that it is the oldest submerged, planned city in the world.  Marine archaeologist used the digital technology of today to survey the ruins.  They found a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures, revealing so much about their culture and way of life.  In addition to all these things, marine archaeologists found many shards of pottery and ceramics.  It showed how people lived at the time and the shallow waters caused great interest in natural scientists.  The myth of Atlantis led to the discovery of Pavlopetri.  The continuation of underwater exploration has helped scientists discover more about sunken settlements and the kind of things people had there.  This discovery should motivate people to explore the ocean because there is a lot more to be found.                   Humans have a natural curiosity and hunger for knowledge, and it has caused them to make some great discoveries about the ancient Incans, the Puebloans, and the underwater city of Pavlopetri.  These things will help the current generation to grow in their intelligence and make more discoveries in the future.  It is a great thing that we can find all this interesting information and use it to our advantage.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have helped to further the understanding of ancient civilizations. Intense excavating of ruins and research through documents adds to the collection of knowledge in the world and pages to its ancient histories. The artifacts, records, and culture left behind by the ancient peoples has led to world to the modern age in which it is today.       The ancient Inca empire was expansive; clues left behind by the Inca lead researchers to discover the richness and wealth of the once-glorious South American civilization. Although the Inca had no formal alphabet or writing system, they kept records using quipus: colored strings tied into knots to keep count of various items such as the days or livestock. Other artifacts from the Inca include ones made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver; these materials have lasted for hundreds of years and have been found to have survived through time, as well as Inca textiles and clothing that have been preserved in the ice of the Andes or beneath the dry deserts of the coasts of Peru.       For more than seven hundred years, a group of people lived in Mesa Verde and transformed it into their home, building a community and a cultural identity, only to leave and move away less than one hundred years after their prosperity had been flourishing. These people have been called the Anasazi, from a Navajo word translated as 'ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies,' but are now called the Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern descendants. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verede in A.D. 550, making homes in pithouses clustered into villages atop mesas and in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and wove baskets, earning them the nickname of 'The Basketmakers.' The buildings and architectural skill of the Ancestral Puebloans had been very high; their accomplishments ranked among the finest cultures in North America. Although they left no written records, the Ancestral Puebloans left  beautifully built structures and art that researchers have used in their search for answers to the questions left behind by the hands of time.       Off of the coast of the Greek city of Neapolis lies a city submerged where the Pavlopetri once dwelled. Having never been reoccupied, the Pavlopetri city represents a still moment of the past. The city is the largest sunken city to have been planned; other submerged cities have been found to be much larger but unplanned. With a large rectangular hall at its center the city suggests use by an elite group of Greeks, raising the status of the settlement, even though the settlement is approximately five thousand years old, as ceramics found have attested to. The finding of the Pavlopetri dwelling has surpassed all expectations, revealing a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, tombs, and religious structures: the makings of an advanced community.       The Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have left behind worlds of ancient treasures- whole civilizations to be researched and new groups of peoples to understand. The artifacts that have been discovered have furthered understanding of the current world, and what the future holds for the world to discover of the past in the future, will open doors to time that has been lost to the ages.

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri so important? This question is the thoughts of many people that wonder about, including some archeologists. The Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important for there religion, their remains of artifacts, and agriculture that help historians understand what it was like to be one of them.             Archeologists found clues of the Incas that were left behind. They had left behind their amazing portraits of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. From studying these clues, they could now peice together details of Inca life. The rest of the knowledge came from the artifacts, or objects that they have left behind, and from the sites in which they were found. From this they could find out where they were living and hidding. They discovered that the incas lived in the high Andes and may have worshipped some mountain peaks. Incas life explained many interesting things that helped archaeologists focus on today.            Looking at the life of the Puebloans they found some interesting things that may have been useful to other countries during that period. Some things they noticed were their buildings. they had built houses, one against another in long, curving rows, often with a pithouse or two in front. Pottery also changed, from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background. Farming also accounted for more of their diet than before, and much messa-top land was cleared for agriculture.            Lastly the Pavlopetri people before their town had submerged below the sea. When they had checked out the site where where the town had submerged they found very intersting things that they were very happy to have found. Such as buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. they also found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, and a lot of artifacts and left behind belonings.             The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are very important because of there ways of life and new inventions they had created. They all have amazing stories of how they all came to be and are very intersting to know about and get to share with the rest of the world.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations            The discovery of the Inca,the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri can be very beneficial to us for many reasons. One reason is because we can learn from their past mistakes. Another reason is to learn how they once lived. Then a final reason is because we can learn from their past designs. Whether its their weapons,structures,writings, or even money.         Learning from our past mistakes is one of the most beneficial to us. This is because if a past civilization made a huge mistake, we can learn from it and not make the same exact mistake in the future. If we haven't discovered ancient civilizations then we might have already failed which would lead to us falling as a country for the same reasons as the Inca or the Mayans.         Another reason it is beneficial to us is because we can learn how they once lived. This is beneficial to us because it is very interesting to learn about our past. It is human nature to want to learn about our ancestors. Learning about them is very interesting and exciting to know how people long ago once lived.          The final reason finding ancient civilizations is helpful is because we can learn from their designs. If past people built great structures like the pyramids we can learn from this. We can learn how to make things stronger and work more efficiently.           In conclusion discovering these once living civilizations can be very beneficial to us in many ways. Learning from past mistakes. Discovering how they once lived. Then finally gaining knowledge of past designs.If it weren't for these findings our civilization wouldn't be as efficient as it is today.

Item_Response: Inca Civilization                 Imagine if you were in the Inca civilzation of Peru, you will have no alphabet or a system of writing. All you had was strings with color called Quipus to record lifestock.The Inca's created the system so that people will not understand what the knots mean.        First,the civilization was around nearly a hundred years(1438-1532).The clues that the Inca left behind was portaits of their religion,art/architectecture,agriculture,goverment,transportion,and way of life.By studying these clues it will make it easier to piece the details together of Inca life.The old st ories were writting down by Eurpeans who arrived  at the empire in 1532.The Inca visitors were spanish soldiers and priests, later on the description of the Inca in their letters or diaries.         Second,the rest of our knowledge of ther Inca came from artifacts or the objects left behind.Some of the artifacts were objects made out of stone,pottery,gold,or silver.Some other artifacts are turned up to be in ruins of buildings, and some were even found in graveyards from the dead how they preserved the dead body's.Also some of the Inca's clothing survived very well, like some of ancient cloth are usually destoyed by dampness,but they have been preserved from the dry desert on Peru coast and the cold mountains of the Andes.But some Inca's sites of been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, the artifacts were even taken a centuries ago.         In addtion, the fall of the Inca's civilization was easy to date because the Spaniards murdered their last king in 1532 then took over the empire.The orgins of the Inca's are way,were difficult to trace then all the other civilzations because of the area they lived had different people who lived in that empire,so Archaeogists had to be careful to make sure that which sites were build by different people.The Inca lived high up in the Andes and may of worship some mountain peaks.Many of their sites are in remote/high places.Even some Inca's were buried in caves or even in cliff faces, or mountain tops.It's also to preserved the body's so the looters won't get to them that easy, so it make's it difficult for the Archaeogist to climb up to get to the body's and they have to carry their equpment all the way up.         As you can see, the Inca's lived in a high remote area and some are even lived on mountain peaks.The Inca's also worship many gods such as mountain peaks.And also remember what it will to live in the Inca civilization.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphebet or system of writing.  No historians studied them.  The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestock.  The first Europeans to meet the Inca were impressed that they could run a huge empire with only using string to record everyday.  Today, no one knows what the knots mean.  Finding everything out about the Inca is like solving a mystery.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because they talk about early civilization in the past. They let us learn about our past and talk about many interesting things that we may have never known about.          The Incas in Peru is a very important one of them because they kept records in unique ways. They would tell their stories by tying colorful strings together. The Inca past is lot like solving a mystery. Their stories are passed on to preserve the coummunity's history. The Inca also has many interesting discoveries like the Nazca Lines which nobody never knew where they came from. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by hunters and looters. People are still trying to find out where their civilization came from and what happened to it.              The Puebloans is also important because for more than 700 years their decendants lived and flourished in stone communities. Their span of a generation or two left their homes and moved away. Masa Verde National Park preserves their ancient culture. They now call them Ancestral Puebloans. They would build pithouses to live in and they were also skillful in stone masonry. Archaologists are still trying to figure out why they moved and what made them move.          Lastly , the Palvopetri interesting because it is a sunken settlement that dates back to about 5,000 years in Greece. They found buildings, courtyards, main streets, and religous buildings. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates when Plato wrote his tale of Atlantis. People say that Atlantis was all a myth. Divers have explored the sunken settlements. The site is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. It is believed that thye ocean comsumed it all arounf 1000 BC. What they found has surpassed all expectations and it is still talked about today.          They all have many important stories tied to them with some very interesting history. Thats why its important to learn about the past because it has some amazing history behind it all.

Item_Response: There were many discoveries that have been made about the Inca, Puebloans,and Pavlopetri's that are important to us. In Sources one, two and three, there were many artifacts that Archaeologists found. They were found, beneath overhanging cliffs, under the sea, and under ground. In many ancient civilizations Inca artifacts were found in the ruins of buildings and others were found buried in graves for us to use in the afterlife. They were made up of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Archealogists compare what they learn from artifacts and relate it with our future today. Archaeologists use advanced techniques to find artfacts that will help us discover more about Inca's predecessors. In addition, to advanced technology they use aerial photography to help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they cannot see from under the ground. Most of their artifacts were found in high places such as cliffs and mountain tops. This means archaeologists will have to carry all their equipment up on the mountain before they can start work. They'll usually find bodies in the icy Andes that are in good shape and can use medical scanning equipment. This will help us learn more about how they died. In source 3,the Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists explore settlement under the waters off southern Greece. Some sea life theories include tsunami, ground subsidence and earthquakes.  While exploring the site of the undersea city, they found things that they never believed they would find. This includes courtyards, religious structures and rock-cut tombs. Not to mention they also discovered a megaron this was a large structure. After much investigating, they concluded that it had been used by an elite and was raised by the settlement. There is a whole other world underwater that marine geologists have yet to find. We hope that further studies will help us with the discovery of new animals. Lastly, these clans had many artifacts that helped us find out more about are past. In the future, with advanced technology we hope to find more artifacts that we still have yet to find.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of peru were of the first civilizations to build complex temples and they were also one of the first civilizations to to be studied by us. Studying the Inca is difficult due to them having no formal alphabet or writing system and also due to many of their artifacts not being preserved well or being stolen. The only thing the Inca did do was keep track of their livestock using quipus which was a system of tying knots in colored string in order count. Many stories and legends from the Inca have been written down in the journals of Europeans who invaded them and conquered them. One artfifact that is much easier to study is the is clothing articles. Due to them having a dry climate many of their clothing articles have been preserved well making it easier to study the artifacts and find out more about their culture and the way they lived. Many descendents of the Inca have passed down the stories and legends of the Inca for hundreds of years from generation to generation. When the Europeans wrote down the stories and legends that the Inca told them it would've been very hard to understand because they did not speak the Inca language well so there may be many mistakes in the the stories and legends that we may not know about. These stories are kind of important because through their legends and religious stories we could find out what type of religions they had back then. Artifacts have been much harder to find because many of the valuable objects made of stone and silver have been stolen by thieves. The only artifacts that we do have left are very well presererved clothing articles. We can tell what type of lifestyle they used to live by looking at and studying what type of clothes they wore. Many of the sites in Peru such as Macchu Picchu and other historical temples and religious worship areas are very important in finding out more about the Inca way of life. Many of the artifacts found in the shrines and religious temples are also important to finding out how they lived, what gods they believed in and who they worshipped. Many of these artifacts and stories are important to finding out more about South American cultures and the civilizations that started many modern day traditions and maybe even holidays that cultures still celebrate today.

Item_Response: Archaeologists, marine geologists, and excavators have all        contributed to important discoveries regarding the ancient Inca, Puebloan, and Pavlopetri civilizations. Incan civilizations have been discovered in the Andes, the Puebloans in Mesa Verde, and the Pavlopetri in the oceans of Greece. These discoveries found all around the world have educated the archaeologists of today about ancient civilizations and their way of life.           What make these discoveries of ancient life important to the people of the present? Learning about a civilizations way of life presents an interesting past to which we can learn from. Source #1 tells of the Incan tribes, one that ruled a South American empire that rivaled that of ancient Rome. The Incas had left no written records, causing archaeologists to put together a story of their own. Through the findings of artifacts, archaeologists have learned about Incan religion, art, architecture, government, and most importantly, their way of life. They learn from these artifacts and compare, sometimes confirming a historical record. Archaeologists record as much of the information they gather, whether by the  rise or fall of the civilization, to ultimately learn from the civilization we have inherited our land from.            Source #2 tells about the Puebloans, a civilization who flourished about 1,400 years ago in Mesa Verde. Discoveries about the Puebloans are important to archaeologists today because they tell of how this ancient culture survived and thrived for so many centuries. What this civilization left behind was an example of their skills, priority of religion, advancements, and every day life. Puebloans showed amazing skills in stone masonry and other advancements. This allowed them to build large, strong households of fifty rooms or more. Their pottery showed more intricate designs on more elaborate backgrounds. Once the Puebloans had moved into cave dwellings, archaeologists had found a truly excellent example of their skills in creating a home from difficult land. Their structures show evidence of accumulated skills past down from each generation and even reaching and influencing cultures in New Mexico and Arizona. This ancient civilization had possibly created a culture in states around the southwest and influenced their way of life.            Source #3 tells of an ancient sunken settlement on the ocean floor of southern Greece that belonged to a community known as the Pavlopetri. This civilization had influenced the fable of Atlantis, one of the world's most known legend and dates back to about 5,000 years ago. The discovery of this ancient civilization showed an extraordinary town of buildings, courtyards, rock-cut tombs, and more. 'It is significant because as a submerged site it was never reoccupied,' said Elias Spondylis. This find leads marine geologists to create their own story of how this city fell. This important discovery is the only city found in Greece that dates back to Plato's tale of Atlantis. The Pavlopetri civilization continues to inspire underwater exploration today.              Sources 1, 2, and 3 show why the discovery of these ancient civilizations are significant to the people of today. These three cultures continue to influence more exploration and possibly the cultures of today. These discoveries help people learn about life before us ad a community. That is why the discovery of ancient civilizations is significant to the people of today.

Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because it gives modern day archaeologists and people a look back into history. Learning how a lot of the basic things and ideas we use today started is very interesting. Many artifacts and civilizations that we have studied give us today a glimpse into what it was like living in the past.        Knowing the history of a civilization and what happened to it is one of the most important things. Since history is destined to repeat itself, learning how the ancient people dealt with certain problems is very important to our society today. As it says in paragraph 11 of source #1, ' Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.' Our discoveries can reveal how we ended up the way we are today and how culture has changed over the years.        The ideas and inventions of ancient people can show just how advanced their culture was back then compared to the way we live now. In source #2, pithouses and kiva's are explained. If it weren't for the Puebloans, we may have a completely different design for our houses and churches today. Using the natural resources they had, the Puebloans learnt to adapt and mkae what they had useful; a great skill to have in even our modern society today.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti are so important because the discoveries inform the people who might not know about these ancient civilizations, what they were like, and what they did that led up to the creations of other civilizations to follow. The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti also inform people that civilizations actually prospered in that time. It shows how advanced their technology was for that time and how far it has come along.       Everyone knows the tale of Atlantis, but for many years that is all it has been known as, a fable, until now. The secrets of the lost city have been unlocked!  30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Even though this was discovered by a British oceanographer about 40 years ago, it was just this year that the digital technology was developed enough for marine archaeologist to be able to survey the ruins of this ancient city. Pavloperti's ruins were explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist; 'This sunken city dates back some 5000 years, to the time of Homer's heros and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say.'-Lost Greek city may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets. By Helena Smith in Athens.       Dr. Jon Henderson, associate professor of the underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham was quoted saying ' There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world, It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. There are older  sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique.' Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank, many theories have been suggested, such as sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. ' it is very likely a combination of the frist two,' said Dimitris Skellariou, at the Greek Institute of Oceanography.       It is amazing to me that for the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Even though Atlantis was a myth, it still keeps the underwater exploration of Pavloperti's ruins in action. It also seases to amaze me that the Inca were able to run an empire based on knots in a string. Just the thought of our government trying to run our nation simply based on knots in strings is hard for me to wrap my head around. This is why I believe that the discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti are so important.

Then they believe that they moved out of Mesa Verde because of the loss of food sources and crops. The use of pottery and cliff dwellings also gave away information as to how they lived and what they did as an everyday thing.       The discovery of the Inca of Peru was interseting also. Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incas are a big step of our knowledge about them. All that we knew about the Incas have been old stories passed down generation to generation and some old stories from the Europeans. The discoveries of the Inca artifacts have told us what we know now about the Incas. The artifacts we have found show what their culture was like. The finding of their clothes show what whey wore and what conditions they lived in. Its a shame treasure hunters and looters took the artifacts. This has been able to tell us how the Incas dissappeared, when the Spaniards killed the last Inca king.       Mesa Verde is a place in the four corners region where a group of pepole lived for a short time. These people, the Ancestral Puebloans, settled here around 550 A.D. They were nomands that decided to settle in the area. They lived in pithouses, which were a few feet underground with supports at the four corners of the room. They were becoming prosperous and started building better houses above ground. About 500 years later, the population could of been at several thousand. One day, they just decided to give up what they have built and return to the mountain alcoves. Archeologists who became interested in researching these people were having little luck. They left no records and many of the items that were important to them have perished. All we have are their buildings that they built, which show how they lived. They lived pretty welt until about 1300 A.D., when Mesa Verde became deserted.       The fable city of Atlantis, a sunken city that is tied to a great myth, has beed discovered. Found beneath the waters of southern Greece, this is one of the oldest submerged towns discovered. Atlantis, which takes up 30,000 square meters of ocean floor, is said to be submerged around 1000 BC. The exprolations brought up several buildings, courtyards, streets, and various tombs and religious buildings. Geologists are still trying to figure out why the city sank. Some are believing it sank because of sea level changes and ground subsidence. Several people are excited to find it and researchers are continuing to work torwards finding everything the city has hidden.

Item_Response: The Inca made knots in collored to keep track of months they had for lifestock. Archaeologists found many of these quipus but no one knows what the knots mean. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government and the way of life. We know some of the old stories because they have writen them down. And some of the Incas stories were legends not history. Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others found buried in graves.          The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde in about 550 A.D. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. about 750 A.D. they began building houses above ground. They built their house against another in a long, curving rows. By 1000 A.D. the people of Mesa Verde advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to stone. Often rose three stories high.

Archeologists haven't found many clues or writings of Atlantis due to the fact it's underwater. Item_Response: The discoveries of ancient civilizations are important because it helps us know more of our world & why many things are how they are. It also helps us know more about our ancestors. Some of these discoveries are tools & we can recreate them & help us.       For example, clues from the Inca civilizations help us learn more about their religion, art & architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, & also their way of life. Most of what we know of the Incas come from oral history. The rest comes from artifacts that were left behind. For example, Inca artifacts might have been made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These kinds of materials last a long time. Some Inca textiles & clothing have been preserved in the dry deserts or cold mountains. To study more of the Inca civilization they need every single piece of evidence they can gather. Sometimes archeology confirms Spaniards' historical records. Also, some bodies found in the Andes reveal information about how they lived. Some of the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from & what happened to it.       Also, archeologists have founded pithouses in villages from the first ancestral Puebloans. These pithouses reveal that they lived a more settled life. In this way of living farming replaced hunting & gathering. Later, these pithouses evolved into kivas which were gathering places & sometimes also places to pray. These were also later compared to churches.       Another discovery is Pavlopetri, which is a submerged city. This is sometimes related to the Greek myth of Atlantis. Step by step, more cities have been discovered underwater. These cities encounter that the sea levels have changed drastically or that many natural disasters have happened to make these cities submerged. These types of discoveries help us understand more of our world.

Item_Response: Have you ever imagined how people lived in the past? To be able to live on the side of cliff in the icy Andes of Peru or to design a magnificent building in ancient Greece. What did does civilizations eat? How did they, in the first place, make such an advanced empire that ruled their part of their world, but ended up collapsing and vanishing? There have been many discoveries that have been made by archeologist involving ancient civilizations that answer those questions.These answers can also give insight on how other civilizations rose to power, lived and thrived, and how they collapsed. The Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri discoveries are important discoveries.      The Incas were an ancient civilization located in modern day Peru.They were so advanced even thought they didn't have a writing system. They developed these strings that had knots that were used to keep track records called quipus. We know that the Inca civilization lasted for about a hundred years (1438-1532). During those years they developed such advanced religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation,and way of life that even rivaled the expansion of ancient Rome. Archeologist were able to decipher the civilization by clues left behind. For example, old books written by Spaniards told the suppose history of the Incas. Also, clues left behind on pottery, textile, and cloth gave archeologists clues about the traditional way of life.Among the most important things, experts were able to learn about how the ancient civilization fell. They know that the Incas were concurred after the Spaniards killed their king. Archeologist had to face obstacles trying to reach the sites on the mountain such as the freezing cold and the tiring hike up the mountain.      Another civilization called the Puebloans were also advanced. They lived in North America in the Four corners region in Mesa Verde. This civilization was known for their crafts. They started out like most civilizations. They started to farm, build pit houses, and develop a society. They used nature to their advantage.They build their houses beneath overhanging cliffs. They also did many crafts. Their pottery left clues behind on their living, background, and agriculture.However, their downfall isn't very known. Archeologist think that they collapsed because of intensive use of land and resources or crop failures.       One of the most interesting civilizations is the Pavlopetri. There town is found sunken in the ocean off the coast of southern Peloponnese. Archeologists and divers have founded that their city is as old as the ancient Greek. They've found pottery, streets, tombs and religious structure underwater. Archeologist are not sure why their city sunk. Maybe it was because of sea level changing, earthquake, or tsunami. Eexperts think that this city inspired Plato to write the story about Atlantis.        All of the discoveries of these civilizations are important. They give insight on our past. If we know our past we can control our future. We can learn from their achievements. Also, it lets us search places we have never search before.Also, it feeds our curiosity. All of these civilizations are important and gives us insight on our past.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca is impotant because back then they had no formal alphabet or system of writing. Instead of writing like how we do today they would make knots in colored strings called quipus. They used these knots to record the calander to keep a count of livestock. Today archaeologists have found many knots but no one today knows what they mean. This is all important because passing on stories is a good way to preserve a community's history.         Also, the Ancestral Puebloans are important because they are known for building stone communities. This is important because today archaeologists call them 'the ancient ones.' Another thing they are known for is their craft skills. They would make baskets, pottery, and bow and arrows. This is all important today because they lead a more settled way to live.         Lastly, the Pavlo petri are important because they discovered many secrets under water. They dated back to 5,000 years ago. They also studied everythiung that had to do wiuth the undersea city.

Item_Response: History. Although it may be a word that can stand for almost anything, History is a timeless subject that analyzes the depth of the ever-expanding past and allows us to learn about where we came from. Although many may think of history as a chore, there are many areas of history that are rarely discussed. One of them is art. Every civilization had its own way to tell stories and express the emotions of their people. The findings about the Incas, Ancestral Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are significant because they could help us understand and respect ancient life on a deeper level by showing that history can also be appealing to not only historians, but artists as well.                  In Peru, an ancient empire thrived in the rocky Andes Mountains. Their proportions were comparable to that of the Romans. They left behind astounding monuments and artifacts made of gold and silver. Away from the mountains and under the sea, a ancient city lies in a shallow bay. It is said to be the oldest submerged city in the world. The sea bed glistened with shards of pottery. A distance from the depths of the sea, along the arid cliffs of the Four Corners region, a tribe thrives and expresses life through basket weaving and pottery. They began making pottery soon after settling in Mesa Verde. Their baskets were made with intricate and gorgeous designs. This can be of interest of not only historians, but artists as well. It shows that even in ancient life, people could be artistic and express their feelings. This shows that the beautiful art of the past was kept alive throughout the ages                Art is intertwined in everything we do. From the way we speak to the way we think and express or feelings. Ancient life can help us discover the artist within us. It can entertain us with beautiful art like the pottery from the Puebloans and Pavloperti. It can bring forth new knowledge of the arts that were originally unknown. It can bring a new found respect because it allows one to understand that even ancient civilizations possessed beautiful art.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. They are important because they explain the cultre they had. It is also important because you learn about what they used to live and what they did to survive. Another reason why they are important is that you learn when they were around how long ago when they were around. The final reason why they are important is that you can learn what happened to them and why they left where they were living.          The Incas lived a long time ago from (1438-1532). They were a tribe that had no Alphabet or the system of writing. The Incas used a system of knots to record the calender and to keep a count of lifestock. Archaeologists have found many knotd but today nobody knows what they mean exactly. in 1532 spanish soldiers and priest came to the Incas and described them in there letters and in there diaries. When the historians find these letters and diaries they hace yo be careful when they try to interpret what they mean because the spanish didn't speak the Incas languguage that well. The rest of the knowldge we know about the Incas is there artifacts. The artifacts that the Archeaologists find are made from stone, pottery, gold, and silver. These matrieals we find are over a hundred years old. Finally, the Archeaologists who work on these sites keep careful records on what they are doing and where they found the items.          The Puebloans lived about 1400 hundred years ago before the Euorpeans discovered america. They lived in the four corners region. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about 550 A.D. They were known for their basketmaking skills and crafts. They built houses above ground  with walls made from mud. They also, built houses against another in long curving rows. Puebloans is a spanish word for village dwellers. During the Classic period the population had grown to several thousand. Mesa Verde is spanish for green table.            The Pavlopetri is an ancient city that was found underneath the ocean. Archeaologists have dated the city about 5,000 years ago in Greece. Dr Jon Henderson said 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged city in the world. Its remains date back from 2,800 to 1,200 BC. Marine geologists have yet to make how the city got submerged. The theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence a result from earthquakes, and a tsunami. Archeaologists have found many artifacts from the city.            In conclusion, the discoveries of the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important because. The Incas have old pottery gold ,stone, and silver we can learn from. The Puebloans lived in houses above ground and they built next to each other. The Pavlopetri was an under water city that is the oldest under water city in the world.

Item_Response: Hundreds of years ago lived three important civilizations. The Incans of the Andes were talented people in crafts. The Pueblos lived in Mesa Verde as great builders and creative minds. The Pavlovian lived in a small advanced town near Greece. These three civilizations even help archeologists today on how we see the past.        The Incas were not a long lasting civilization. They had some trouble with Spaniards. But the Spaniards did not stop them from having a creative but also there intellectual minds. The Incas had magnificent clothing which was perserved by the weather. This can help us see that back then that clothing was not an issue for the history since this small civilization was able to achieve this. They were able to form governments and transportation. This does not just come to one. The Incans were a small but powerful nation teaching us that a creative mind leads to success.        The Pueblo ans were somewhat like the Incas. The Pueblo ans made pottery and had buildings that stood tall and strong. They had lived in pit houses that kept them safe from disasters. These highly almost undestructable buildings help increase the population a lot as they were protected by the buildings. The Puebloans had taught us the ways we can improve the way our structures today could be prepared for anything.        The Pavlovian civilization definitely had passed the Incas and Publicans in terms of there lifestyle. The terrible tragedy of a natural disaster had ruined all of there advancements. These people had made roads, somewhat invincable buildings that lasted from sinking. This was all done in one tiny town. They had done all of this in a short amount of time. The Pavlopetri civilization had taught us the great advancements that we should use today.        In the end, these and other civilizations have taught us the way we live today. The Incas, Pueblo ans, and Petrologist have taught us the arts, building structures, and the way of living. The past is very important because it teaches the present the advancements of the past.

Formerly nomadic, they were beginning to lead a more settled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood.         They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops, but sometimes in clif recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more effcient weaponed for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. These were fairly prosperous times for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied.

Item_Response: There are several reasons why the discoveries that have been made about the Inca,the puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important. To begin with, during the ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. But later on Inca began making knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender of their livestock.In fact, the Europeans were amazed by this that they thought they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records.Also, some Europeans who wrote stories had arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish and priests they described the Inca in letters and diaries. The reason why all this was important was because as in today these are some of the things we use today in our daily lives.             First,Inca textiles and clothing have also survived well because of its ancient materials. For example, in ancient times like cloth are usually destroyed by damoness ,but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Even. archaeologists can learn from artifacts and sites with the Spinard's accounts of the Inca . Although sometimes archaeology can even confirm any historical record you may have. This is important because keeping track of any kind of record is important to many people either because its confidental information or it has to be kept.            Second,Ancestral puebloans is imporatant for several reasons.  The first Puebloans was settled in mesa verde which means 'green table.' Although the gree table is basically known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft.These were sta rting to be useful for farming hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. Archaeologists learned how to make potterty and acquiered the bow and arrow as a more efficient weapon uses for hunting .Many of these people lived in pithouses from A.D 550 TO a.d 750 As Settled ariculture began.   This was important because of these pithouses later on as in today it has became a place for people to live like an apartment or a house.                               Third ,in a lost greek city a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece was found . The explorers who had found this was an Anglo-greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists which are known as Pavlopetri. In fact, the sunken settlement dates were back about 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes .   Although, this was the first time a sunken city has  been found in Greece that predate the time that Plato had written his allegorical tale of the suncken continent of Atlantis. As you can see these were all very important because of the different myths people found geologists and many others turned ancient times into something that we can still use today. Item_Response: Since the Inca did't have a formal language or system of writting they didn't leave any archives for the historians to study. Although they used colored strings called quipus to record the calender and to keep track of the livestock. When the first Europeans meet the Inca they were highly suprised by how they could run a huge empire by using strings to keep records of things. Some Archeologists have found quipus butstill today no one knows what the knots on the strings mean. If we dont have anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is like trying to solve a mystery.                  The Inca left behind clues that tell us about their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, and the way of life. All of what we know about the Inca cames from oral history, and or stories passed from generation to gneration, and passing ont he stories was an important way to preserve a community's history.                  I think all of what the Inca did was just the beginning of a new language at the time, and once the first Europeans killed the last of the Inca and took over their empire they kind of just carried everything out of what the Inca did and changed it up a little to where it was understand able.                  The Inca were very productable, they made an entire village full of these things called Pithouses which they lived in from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. They also made this building called an Kiva which had a venilator, bench, air deflextor, fire pit, sipapu, and a pilater. The word Kiva is a Hopi word for ceremonial room. There were undergrund chambers comparable to later churches. As you can see the Inca were very modern people who made the best of what they had and then some.

Item_Response: The findings of these groups are incredibly inportant. Especially in the way they live.       Finding the Inca civilization is important becuase of the way they live. They use pottery, silver and gold to help them live. Their textiles and clothing are preservative, but also easily destroyed. Some of these sites have though been disturbed. Those who do take anything usually valuable. Archeoligists keep careful records of their findings. The most important thing is finding out where a civilization came from and what happened to that civilization. Archeologists do dangerous things to get their findings.         The findings of the Mesa civilization is also very important. They have lived there in their stone communities for more than 700 years. They farmed instead of hunting and learned how to make pottery and acquire bows and arrows. They also lived in pithouses and made baskets. A.D, 1000 their housing changed and so did their pottery design. There were cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde who dwelled under overhanging cliffs.           Last but not least are the findings of the Lost Greek city that is Atlantis. Divers went under to explore the lost city which is southern Greece. This site takes up 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off of the southern Peloponnese. Exploring this underwater city they found buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. Marine geoligists connot figure out why this site sank. There is still alot to be found.            These are some important findings for these lost civilizations.

Item_Response: The discovery of ancient civilizations have led to many exciting investigations and explorations, the Incas for instance, lived up in the icy regions of the Andes where traveling up or down the mountain would prove difficult for the Incas would have frozen to death, but arcgeologists have discovered this frozen bodies and the examining of them have proven useful on how they died and how they lived.       for over more than 700 years, the Ancestral Puebloans have lived in Mesa Verde and have flourished in this community, even leading up the building of stone communities, but in the late A.D. 1200s they left the land and moved away. The Ancestral Puebloans have used nature to their advantage, they built their homes under overhanging cliffs. When they left, they traveled to New Mexico and Arizona where some of their descendants live today.       The secrets of southern Greece have led to one of the most explored myths in the world, the lost city of Atlantis. It is believed to cover over 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. It is believed that this settlement was occupied over 5000 years ago, but marine biologists have yet to discover why this settlement sank, theories include earthquakes or tsunamis but the real reason is yet to be found. What we do know is that the excitement of an exploration will take place until the truth is revealed.
