Item_Response: Ancient History About the Inca, the puebloans, and the Pavlopetri            How much do you know about ancient history of Inca,the Puebloans, and the pavlopetri? I have came to realize that some of this information i didn't even know.  I am going to tell you about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the pavlopetri.         The ancient Inca of peru had no alphabet or system of writing.  They didn't leave much for historians to study.  The Incas made knotted strings to record things.  They recorded things like the keeping of livestock.  They even put knots in strings to record the calendar. These strings were called quipus.  The Europeans were amazed when they met the Inca and saw that the Incas could run a large empire off of using string to keep record of many things.  Archaeologist have found plenty of quipus, but without nobody being able to read the message tied into the strings we may never have they understanding of Inca. The Puebloans were known as basketmakers.           They were called this because they were good with crafts. Farming for them replaced hunting and gathering as their man livelihood. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. The bow and arrow was more efficient for hunting than the atlati or the spear thrower.  This was good because basketmakers and their population increased.  These people were known as puebloans, a spanish word meaning 'village dwellers'. The pottery also changed from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings with white backgrounds.  The widespread use of pottery meant less attention to the craft of basket.The stone wall of the large pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesaa Verde. The last group I would like to tell you about is the pavlopetri.            The secrets of a lost city was discovered by an anglo-greek team of archeaologists and marine geologists and known as pavlopetri. They mainly saw sunken sites. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. It is believed to have been consumed by the sea about 1000 BC. Even though it was discovered by a british oceanographer about 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. Thanks to the shifting sands the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. Some ceramics were found. They dated back until the stone age. investagations also revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. More than any other underwater sight so far, the find offers potential insights into the workings of Mycenaean society. locals in the nearby town of Neapolis are delighted.             In conclusion, I wonder how much information you now know about ancient history of Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. I have also learned more. I hope you have also.

Item_Response: I have learned a lot about the Inca. I find it interesting that we still have this information today.  Now, I will tell you why the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important.       The Inca has been talked about for years now. Some of this information comes from oral history, or stories that have been passed down. Why Inca is so important to us now is because they did not leave archives for historians to study. Knowing about the Inca helps the archaeologists understand a lot more about history. Things we have learned because of the Inca is like a portrait of their religion.       The Puebloans helps us understand our world a little better. Who built the first houses here and lived here. The Puebloans lived in pithouses. Pithouses are houses with a hole in the middle of the roof for the smoke of a firepit to escape. They also made Kiva's, another word for ceremonial room. The Puebloans are important to history because they help us understand living better.       The Pavlopetri are important to us because they found the city of Atlantis. If they had not found this, we would probably still be looking for it to this day. The Pavlopetri also found more things. They have found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age and they have made new buildings that we later found. This is why the Pavlopetri are important.

Item_Response: Archaeologist have studied ancient, and lost civilizations for   many years. The weather, and other natural occurrences have helped us learn about them. There are three important civilizations: Ancient Inca's, Mesa Verde, and the lost Greek City.       Ancient Inca:    Ancient Inca did not have a formal alphabet or system of   writing...that we know of. They used quipuis to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Quipus is knots made in a colored string.   How do we know about this ancient civilization? Some of it   comes from oral history, or even passed by generation.       Mesa Verde:   Long before the Europeans came and explored North America-   1,400 years ago, people living in the Four Corners chose Mesa Verde as their home. They lived in stone communties in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. In the late A.D. 1200's, they moved away and left thier homes behind. These Anasazi's are actually an important part of the history you learn today.

Item_Response: Learning about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. They are important to learn about because these civilizations give us clues to what the world was like in ancient times. All over the world archaeologists are studying the ruins and artifacts of ancient civilization.    The artifacts of the Inca can tell us about their civilization. There isn't much left over from the Incans, but whatever we can find to learn about them is interesting. They did not have a language or a written language. They recorded everything using colored string. Spanish soldiers later discovered and wrote letters about the Inca. Most archaeologists aren't sure whether or not to use the letters for information, considering the Spanish barely knew anything about the Inca civilization.    The Ancestrial Puebloans are another ancient civilization archaeologists still have much to learn about. Currently there are modern day Puebloans scattered. Archaeologists discovered Puebloans were nomadic hunter-gatherers, but later changed their ways and became farmers and began making villages. The Puebloans left behind some of their art, such as baskets and pottery. They used the bow and arrow and the spear for hunting, which are very efficiant weapons. Archaeologists do not know if the Puebloan civilization was a violent one.    The Pavlopetri of Greece are another interesting civilization we have yet to learn a lot about. The ruins of their city were recently found under the ocean. Archaeolgists have no clue about this civilization, but the ruins of the city. They have also discovered that this civilization was around about 5,000 years before the original Greece was existant.    These civilizations, like many others, can teach us about the past. Archaeologists can find out about the empires that ruled. They can find out about the civilizations art, weapons, way of gathering food, and their language. And all of this will be in the history books one day. Maybe even our time will be information to learn about in the future.

Item_Response: Finding artifacts and items that were used long ago can help us understand how people generations, or even centuries before our people lived. Archeologists are able to identify how people lived, what they wore, what they ate, all by looking at items left behind. Archeology is important to our life because that way we can understand how far our world has come and understand how it has changed throughout the years. Discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri tribes are essential because they provide us with information about how life was like before breakthroughs in technology, or the dgrastic change of lfe.         The Inca were originally from Peru. It was important to study the Inca because they were an important ancient tribe. This was a challenge for archeologists, because the Incan tribes did not have a formal way of writing, so the historians were not able to study archives or books, literature and stories which could have been left behind. Instead, they used strings called quipus to have a calendar and keep record of livestock. It shows us that even though Incan people did not have formal writing that most people in our time have, they still were able to carry out familiar activities in unique ways. To know more about the Inca, historians have studied stories that were passed down through generations, and also artifacts. It is important to see how these artifacts were crafted, so we can get a mental image of how Incans went through life.          The Puebloans were people who lived in the Mesa Verde section of North America. It is important to understand the way of life for them, because they had a very successful lifestyle, and their comunity flourished over time. They bulit actual houses our of wood and rocks, and some of them were over two stories high and had fifty rooms or more. Their population has been estimated around seven-thousand. The Puebloans lived a very elaborate lifestyle compared to others and it was almost a luxurious way of living for people at the time. They have left behind artifacts that have allowed historians to understand their way of life.        Without studying the way of life back then, archeologists would cease to exist and we would be uneducated on how far our world has come today. What people leave behind can help us unlovk the secrets of our world, and how mankind has developed over the years.Without historians, I don't think our world would be able to flousrish the way it has over the years. The study of history has played a huge impact in our lives.

Some Inca sites have been disturbed by looters which are treasure hunters. But the most important things to learn about is were the civilazation came from and were it happened. The fall of the Inca date is easy to find because the spainiards murdured the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. But the orgins of the Inca are harder to discover becuase their land  has been inhabited for a long time by different types of people.           This is one of the lost empires of the world, the Inca. Although we barely know about them, more will be discovered in the future because technology will go stronger by then and will track down more about the Inca and the other lost empires. But for now, we will; have to try our best to find out what we can find.

Item_Response: Do you know about the past?  Some major discoveries about our past have been discovered by archaeologists.  These include the study of the Incas and their ways of life as well as the past of Atlantis.  In the Inca tribe, they wove cloth, hunted and gathered, made pottery, did arts and crafts, and wrote scribes and books on their daily life.  These are artifacts that have been discovered, here in todays society.  Archaeologists do face some struggles on finding evidence of the Incas existence.  They do not know exact dates of the events that were enlisted and they have a hard time examining the procedures that the Incas endured.            The lost area just off the coast of Greece, Atlantis, has been rediscovered by geologist willing to risk what they have to learn about our past and the history behind the lost area of Atlantis.  Geologists have found artifacts about the area, such as stones that relate back the the stone age and some cool rocks that have been recently found.  The lost area hides many amazing things that could help our future.  Geologists do struggle to identify why this place sank or what even happened to it.  The mystery will hopefully be solved in the near future.             Thank you for listening to my essay on Earths past.  I hope you enjoyed learning about the discovery of all these ancient places and artifacts as much as I did!

Item_Response: In recent years archeologists have uncovered many new civilizations and artifacts.  These civilizations are important to us because they let people know what happened in the past and how ancient technology was invented.  Three important ancient civilizations are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the underwater city.  These civilizations have supplied us with much needed information on ancient civilizations.        The Inca were a south African civilization that ruled for about 100 years.  They made colorful quilts and textiles that have been recovered from their ancient site.  The Inca discovered a way to keep records by using quipas, which were knotted strings that could be read.  The Inca were a well adapted culture that thrived in the fourteen and fifteen hundreds.       The Puebloans were a culture known for their crafting and weaving.  The lived in houses called Pit houses which were dug about 3-4 feet into the ground.  The Pit houses had a fire pit, a supported roof, and storage bins.  The Puebloans also had a church called a kiva.  the kiva was where they prayed and had gatherings. This prosperous civilization lived many great years in the Mas Verde.        The underwater city was found by archeologists of the coast of Greece.  They found underwater buildings from about 5,000 years ago.  This settlement has 9,00 feet of buildings and other structures.  The archeologists are continuing to discover what in the underground city.

Item_Response: Our ancestors are people that we hardly think about.  Very few people wake up in the morning and think to themselves, 'I'm going to find out how people lived thousands of years ago!'  Yet, some people do, and (God knows it) those people know what they are doing.  However, you might not necessarily know what they're up to.  Archeologists are people that discover and study artifacts from long ago civilizations, people, and animals.  Now, when you hear this, you may think, 'Hey!  Indiana Jones does that!'  Well, no.  Although the main idea of finding artifacts is directly related in Indiana's adventures, most archeologists don't have daily gun battles, and usually they don't try to chase a military convoy to find the holy grail, or whatever.  What they do usually do is study ancient relics...like those of the Incas, Pueblo Native Americans, or maybe even Greek items!  For instance, they might find out things like this!              For about one hundred years, (1440-1535) Inca people ruled over the land of South America.  They couldn't write, so archaeologists didn't know what to expect when they found colored knots in string!  As it turns out, that was a form of counting livestock and other things way back when.  And that's not all that was left behind for us to find!  They also had religious art, and other buildings and items that showed us how they lived, worked and ate.  However, not everything that we know about them was dug up from the dirt.              Some of what we know about incant people was passed down straight from the horse's mouth...or really...their descendants mouths.  Some stories tell about how people from Europe landed in their settlements in about 1532, and about how they came into the new world.  Archeologists can find evidence that parallels these stories in tombs and other buildings in the ruins.  Unfortunate as it may be, looters have robbed many of these grounds.  That is one thing that Indiana Jones has in common with real archeologists: they both scare off looters!  Much more is left to be found about this culture...and as always, we'll have archeologists working on it.  However, there are also other cultures that archeoligists comb in search of treausre.                Native American people used to live in the southwestern United States...and now all that's left of them is their cities of stone.  These people were called the Pueblo Indians, and they lived in many kinds of houses.  Sometimes, they dug huts out of the clay, and other times, they built cities into the sides of mountains.  This gave them the name: Cliff Dwellers.  However, after about 100 years of living in their cliffs, they, for some reason, migrated out of the area, and assimilated with other tribes in the nearby area.  These people are very mysterious...which is the complete opposite of our next specimen.                 Much of Greek culture is pretty well known: for heaven's sakes, a couple book series have been writen about it!  However, archeologists have still been uncovering some of their secrets.  For instance, off the coast of Greece lies a city...under the water!  This is a classic example of archeoligsts finding a hidden site full of relics!  many buildings and ceramic jars were found...which dated back to over five thousand years ago!  This is a huge find...but only one of many.                  People have, since the beginning of time, searched for answers to things that they didn't know.

Item_Response: Even though the sites that archeologists have found are worn down from the environment, there is still archeologist fascinated by the places they have discovered, and are hungry to find more. They have found ancient cities that belonged to the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri that were in places they have never imagined.           In the great Andes, the Inca population once lived and had a great city. Today, there are still great artifacts of the past that archeologists have found. Some of the artifacts you can find includes objects made out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. There are some found even on Peru's coasts.           Another city is Mesa Verde in A.D. 550 and was home to people known as Puebloans. They are also classified as Basketmakers from their crafting skills. As they gained more population the quality in baskets declined and pottery was used then. They had migrated into the caves of Mesa Verde and lived there for less than 100 years.           In great Greece there once was a city called Atlantis and was home to the Pavlopetri. The city now is underwater but once was thought to be above sea level. 'It remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC.' said Dr Jon Henderson. It was the first time an underwater city was discovered in Greece. But once it was a very massive and planned out city and now a sunken tresure.

Item_Response: The Importance of Ancient Civilizations             The discoveries of ancient civilizations like the Incas, Pueblanos, and the Palvopetri have led many archeologists to continue making more discoveries. These civilizations have given valuable information and clues to archaeologists who want to discover why the civilizations collapsed. These dicoveries are so important because they help many people know more about the past. If we know more about the past then we'll be ableto understand better how things are to this day. Although some civilizations remain a mystery on why the disappeared, much information has been discovered due to the artifacts found and where the people settled. Ancient civilizations help people understand how cities worked in the past.         To begin with, the discovery of the Incas civilization was imporant since it let archaelogists take a step forward to know more about the past. The Incas, for example, lived on the Andes. Since they lived in the Andes, archaeologists were able to realize that the Incas were preservers. They were preservers since they buried their dead in the caves that were in the Andes. Once those bodies were uncovered, scientists were able to find out that person's cause of death with the technology these days. The importance of finding the cause of death was that with that information, people were able to know how people died in the Inca civilizations whether it was sickness or natural death.         Secondly, we're able to know more about the past and how it works because of the discovery of the Pueblanos. The Pueblanos built pithouses and the importance of this is that archaeologists were able to find out how the architecture was in the past during the time of the Pueblanos. Since the Pueblanos advanced in pottery, archaeologists were able to find that the pueblanos were skilled craftsmen. The pueblanos built kivas which very uncomfortable in the winter. Because of this, archaeologists can conclude that the wethaer must have been harsh in the past. Also, archaeologists have the ability to say that the wether must have been an important component when it came to growing crops.         Finally, the discovery of the Pavlopetri civilization also contributed to learning more about the past. Geological events might have (earthquakes, tsunamis, etc.) sunk the civilization. The importance of this was that the land and its geographical features must have been affected by the movements the earth. Archaeologists were able to learn that the people of the Pavlopetri civilization must have been skilled architects since mainstreets, courtyards, religious structures, and buildings were uncovered. They must have been skilled craftsmen just like the Pueblanos since thousands of pieces of pottery was found all over ther seabed of the location where the Pavlopetri civilization was found.         In conclusion, all these civilization discoveries added to knowledge we have of the past. The more we knoe fromthe past, the more we will be able to understand why things are the way they are today. Many more civilizations are yet to be discovered. It is important to know that without these civilizations, the world will continue being a mystery. Some people forget about the civilizations or say they aren't important but little do they know that the information archaeologists find out about the past civilizations could some how be traced to those people. Without these discoveries, the world would still be wondering how they got to the place they are today.

Item_Response: THE DISCOVERIES OF ANCIENT CIVILIZATION        The discoveries made about the Ancient Civilization is very important for people like us in the new generation. These new discoveries will lead us to learn more about their culture and way of life. I believe these discoveries can make a lot of changes in our life.   Since the archaeologists and other explorers have been investigating more on past life, we got to learn more and more about our ancestors and how they used to live. These discoveries have also changed some of our knowledge.        How would we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome? All of the clues left behind by the Inca's have been retrieved by explorers and they have examined it very clearly. The archaeologists and other explorers have put together details of Inca life. The clues left behind can also tell you about what happened to the empire or what what happened to the place that was here thousands, or even millions of years ago. If we had not discovered these clues and had not examined these clues they would still be buried down under, without us knowing anything about it.        We wouldn't even know what happened to the Puebloans and what was their secret to surviving those years were. If our explorers hadn't preceded with their exploring we wouldn't have found the Lost Greek City. Nobody even knew that there was a Greek City under the ocean, before this.         So now you know why discovering all these clues were important and also why these places and people were important.

Item_Response: The Ancient Inca                                The ancient civilization of the Inca lived from about 1438-1532 AD. Seeing that they had no form or writing they had no writen history for historians to study. Instead of having writing though they had a made a system of knots on colored strings called quipus to record their calander and to record the numbers of livestock they had. Europeans who met the Inca were amazed by the huge empire that they managed to run with only knots and strings. Even though Archeologists have found numerous quipus no onw knows how to interpret them correctly. Not knowing how to read the quipus makes understanding the Inca almost impossible.            Most of what we know about the inca is from oral history (the act of handing down history from generation to generation though spoken word). This is mostly unreliable seeing that the Inca liked folklore and legends instead of factual history.            Some stories are known by the Europeans who had arrived there and had written down some of their oral history. Most is not very reliable because the Spaniards did not speak the Inca language very well and may not have understood the inca very well. Their discription of the Inca could have been very accurate.            The rest of the information about the Incas that we know comes from objects left behind, or artifacts. Also the places where they were found. Most Inca artifacts inclide stone, pottery, gold, and silver. All of these materials stand up to weather and do not deterate easily, even after hundreds of years. Some objects are found buried in graves and others found in ancient buildings.            Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters looking for anything to sell. Looting has been going on for centuries aned is strill going on today. The sites that have been robbed often have little to no value to Archeologists.            The people who study these sites keep very accurate records. They write down and take pictures of any artifacts they find and mark the exact position that they found them. So they can get as much information from the artifacts as possible.            One of the most important things to learn from the Inca are how they started and how they ended. The beigenning of the Inca is hard to date, where they once lived is now inhabitted by other peoples. It is much easier to tell when they ended, because the lsat Inca king was killed by a Spaniard and taken over by him. That led to the fall of the whole empire.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations Explanatory Performance Task       Archaeologists and Historians are very important in finding Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri and are a key role in helping our future.       The Inca's lifestyle has a very bit impact on how we live today. Historians have discovered the way of Inca's lives through their artwork. The Inca were very artsy people, their alphabet consisted of tying strings in a special pattern. Discovering the Inca's techinques are very important because we get to adapt to their religion and we get to study it too. One religion that we have today has the same worshipping technique as the Inca's. They worship at high mountain tops. Also, the Inca were good climbers, that is possibly how we got the idea of rock climbing. Source #1 (Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past') talks about the Inca's ways of life.       The Puebloan's lifestyle is different then the Inca's, but it is still important to us too. Our house designs may have came from the Puebloans house design called the Pithouse. We have adapted to their church designs, except we changed the design a little. The camping technique where you cook food over a fire, may have originated from the Puebloans idea of fires to cook food. Cowboys were the first people to report the cliff dwellers in the 1800s, giving archeologists hope on discovering their techniques. Source #2 ('Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World') talks about the Puebloans way of life.       The Pavlopetri's living is still different from ours, but probably the closests out of all of the three. We have taken some of their techniques, changed them a little, and made them ours. We have taken some of their pottery shards and discovered them to help us create pots. Their idea of buildings were taken as well, and if you look at a city, you will see tons of buildings. The fable of Atlantis created a story (we created it) but without the artifacts, that really popular and well known story wouldn't have existed. Source #3 ('Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets) talks about the Pavlopetri's lifes.       I think that if we hadn't found the Inca, Puebloans, or the Pavlopetri, our lives would be very affected and different.

Item_Response: The discoveries we learned Inca are that they made portraits of their religion, art, had transportation, and government that helped understand their way of life. Inca artifacts were made of stones, gold or silver. Inca textiles were left in dry deserts or cold mountains to preserve them. This is important to us because it teaches us what other religions are like. It also teaches us that we can preserve our clothes by leaving them in dry or cold places.       We learned that the Puebloans made baskets, pithouses, and kivas. This is important because the pithouses kept people safe and it could help use think of ideas to make houses of our own. Kivas were important because they had a ventilator, bench air deflector, and a fire-pit. It taught us how to  make a house for small gatherings.       We discovered that the Pavlopetri had been consumed by the sea at 1000 BC. We also learned that the lost Greek city had a lot of buildings. The cause of the city to sink was a earthquake or tsunami. This is important because where we live could be consumed by the sea. This is also ompotant because earthquakes and tsunamis can cause a lot of problems in the world.

Item_Response: Lost Civilizations             Unlike today in the modern world of technology such as the internet, iPhones and whatever other form of technology that has been created in the past 10 years, back in the day, in the 1500s when if people wanted music, they made it themselves. And when people wanted food, they had to go and work for it. Back then, you couldn't just slouch on the couch, pick up the phone and order any kind of food you want. Now, you may not think that the olden days were important, but without them, the world would be entirely different today.           In the 1500s, there lived an aspiring empire that led on to become of the strongest and largest economies of the time. They were called the Inca Empire. The Inca Empire never had an alphabet or system of writing. They used knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar and keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet them were astonished on how they could run their economy on just strings. The empire has given many people may challenges of uncovering the mystery of the Inca Empire. The Inca has passed down many stories and legends to the modern day world. The Inca was known for their pottery or handwork and crafts such as gold, stone or silver, and these have helped archaeologists find out more about the Incas.           Another empire that also has influenced us in may ways is the Puebloans. These people built their empire on what they called the Mesa Verde about A.D. 550 they are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft.They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization, whose accomplishments in community living and the arts rank among the finest expressions of human culture in North America. Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. By about A.D. 1300 Mesa Verde was deserted. No one really knows why but maybe they were just looking for a new beginning.           Also, another empire that affected us in may was today were the Pavlopetri people. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths -- the fable of Atlantis -- have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece. Explored by and Anglo-Greek team of aarchaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. 'it has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. These are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why it is unique,' says Dr. Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. What archaeologists found exceeded all expectations, thanks to shifting sand and the settlements enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.           Do you now see how important the old civilizations were? Because if you don't, you need to go learn some more about it, because it truly is fascinating. And even though you can never go back and discover the world back then, you can always learn more about it. Except instead of going online to look for clues, facts and answers that might not even be true, go to the library and check out a book. Reading a book is a good way to exercise your brain. Now, you may not think that the olden days were important, but without them, the world would be entirely different today.

Item_Response: You may have heard many stories about Ancient Civilizations that existed hundreds of years ago. Well do you want the facts? Here it goes. The ancient Inca of Peru, The Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde, and last but not least the well known fable of Atlantis. These three civilizations have a lot in common, such as how their artifacts and living areas were used to help archaeologists learn more about them.   Lets start with Inca. According to Source #1, the Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. Instead, they made knots in colored strings known as quipus were used to record the calendar and keep count of their livestock. The problem here is that no one knew how to read them. So, they also used some of the Inca artifacts and other things that some Incas may have used. One by one, they pieced together the extraordinary details of Inca life. The archaeologists keep records of the sites that they study and visit so they can learn as much information as they possible can. Though the Incas steps were difficult to trace, due to their area being lived in by others, archaeologists are careful to make sure which people build each site. Incas lives high in the Andes mountains and worshiped mountain peaks. Archaeologists found it quite difficult to study the Inca due to their choice of living. This has become worth the sweat since the bodies found helped reveal information of how the Inca lived and survived using modern medical scanning.   Lets go ahead and move onto the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde. Mesa Verde holds a massive amount of ancient culture that has been left behind. The first Ancestral Puebloans settles in Mesa Verde around A.D. 500. They are also known as Basketmakers at the time due to them being so skilled in crafting them. They made pithouses to live in that would be clustered into small villages built on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. Their population multiplied, talk about prosperous times. In A.D. 1000, they had advanced from pithouses to kivas. They made kivas by building them beneath overhanging cliffs. The construction material consists of sandstone that has been shaped into blocks, the mortar used to stick the blocks together was a mixture of mud and water. Unoccupied rooms in the back or on upper levels were used for storing their crops.   People often think of Atlantis as one of the 'world's most enduring myths'. Well an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists are about to prove that it is not just a myth. The settlement goes way back 5,000 years. The sunken world has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before classic Greece came into play. The site being studied is about 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. They found ceramics that were back to the end of the stone age. They revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings.   So before you think that ancient civilizations are just a big myth, think again. There is much more to these spectacular days back in time. You may be surprised of what you find.

Item_Response: History is a main part in everyday life. In school we learn the past and how it affected the world today. Many different people, from many different places, did and discovered many different things. The Inca's, the Puebloans, and the Palvlopetri are just three of the many out there.         The Inca's, 'Unlocked the secrets of the past.' The Inca's were found to form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. This was a typical day of an Inca life. We find all these clues from either, clues they leave behind, or oral history, being passed on from generation to generation. Therefore, I stick with my statement, that the history of the Inca's were important to today's life.        The Puebloans had their own world. They made crafts like baskets and were known as Basket makers. Farming replaced hunting and gathering because they wanted to live more of a nomadic life style. The Puebloans were a main part in history in Mesa Verde because they were the ones that began building houses above ground, making pottery, weaving baskets, farming, and making other tools with what they had. Say the Puebloans had never been around. Mesa Verde today would not be the same. Everyone in the past, has some kind of impact on the future. My generation today will affect what happens in the future. Just like every other one.        The Palvlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. This was no doubt, the oldest submerged town in the world that was so unique. They discovered that the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. If we didn't have the technology we have today we would not be able to do everything that we do. People in the past affected how we come up with tools like them. They inspired us from what they had, to give us an idea.       As you can now see, the Inca's, the Puebloans, and the Palvlopetri are three kinds of people that had an effect on where ever they were located. They have their own special way of putting it out there for us to find it.

Item_Response: April 11,2013                                         Ancient Tribes          In the last few hundred years, archaeologists have made some extremely important discoveries about the ancient civilizations of some native people(the Inca,the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri).         We have learned so many important things about the ancient Inca of Peru, like the fact that they don't have a formal alphabet or system of writing; Instead of having an archive to keep records in, they put knots in strings to keep tract of the livestock. Even though we still don't know what the knots mean, the archaeologists are still discovering more and more each day.         Other civilizations have been found as well, like the Puebloans. We have learned about many of their ways of life, like the expertly made baskets that have been found on their land. We now know that the Puebloans made pit houses that they lived in on top of mesas. These people, as archaeologists have discovered, were pretty modern in their way of living when it came to hunting for their next meal. By using a bow and arrow, they could be much more efficient than with the spear throwing.         One of the most intriguing stories ever to be proven true, Atlantis, at least that is what they thought they were seeing when they came across the long ago sunken settlement of the Pavlopetri. Aarchaeologists have slowly put together the pieces of this massive puzzle, and by massive, I mean 30,000 sq. meters of the ocean floor! We have been able to find in this huge city: main streets, courtyards, tombs of rock, and pottery covering the ocean floor.         Even now we still have about 99% of the ocean floors left to discover. Who knows, we might even find the real myth of Atlantis, thanks to these ancient civilizations!                                                                                          Eilia

Item_Response: There have been many discoveries, but the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri are among the most important and interesting. Many archaeologists found old ways of living and communicating in each civilization. Although not everything was able to be uncovered within each expedition, many new discoveries were made of each of the civilizations.             The ancient Inca civilization of Peru was very powerful and unique.    The ruled for nearly one hundred years and had an interesting way of communication, or lack there of. In an excerpt form 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past,' by Beth Gruber, we learn quickly that 'The ancient Inca of Peru had Jo formal alphabet or system of writing.' Instead they had what is called a quipus, '... the Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock.' Although we know what they keep a record of, no one is can actually decipher the code these stories and calendars. The Inca civilization was located in the Andes mountains, which made getting to the artifacts difficult. In the end it payed off because 'The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died.' This helps us to see how the ancient Inca civilization came to an end, and helped us to  see how a bit of how life was when they ruled.             We see more interesting and important history within 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World.' This article goes just a bit back before the Europeans explored America, well maybe a little more than a bit. It was actually approximately 1,400 years before that, when '...people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. for more than 700 years their descendants lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities...' The article goes on to mainly explain the different types of buildings that were in Mesa Verde. One of these was called a pithouse, and 'People lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D 750... The pithouse featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground.' They go into deeper detail and even have an illustration of a pithouse, but they also found and described a Kiva. 'Kiva is a Hopi word for ceremonial room---here underground chambers comparable to later churches. Based on modern Pueblo practice, Ancestral Puebloans may have used kivas for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop.' The Puebloans built amazing structures and left a lasting impact on America, in fact '...dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there.'             Lastly, an article of a lost Greek city named Pavlopetri discusses how it may have impacted another popular sunken city. The article 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets,' by Helena Smith submerges themselves in facts, and water. They take divers down deep to uncover '...the oldest submerged town in the world... It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece.' But not only was it a submerged city,  it was a historical gold mine, for artifacts that is. 'We found ceramics dating back to the end of the Stone Age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than what we originally thought... Our investigations also revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings.' Although, 'Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.' Thus was a huge discovery, but we must be reminded that 'Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found.'             To sum everything up, we have had some amazing finds that helped us understand life long ago. The ancient Inca got by without any formal communication and their bodies were preserved, allowing us to understand their downfall. The Puebloans created many buildings that are remarkably similar to those we have today. The lost city of Pavlopetri shows us that although we have discovered great things, there are so many more to find. Each of these discoveries is incredibly unique and helpful to our knowledge of ancient history today.

Item_Response: These discoveries about the Inca, the Peubloans, and the Palvopetri are a very important part to the archaeological society. Without these discoveries, we might have never figured out what happened to these great civilizations. All three of these societies have rich histroy, and are a very valuable resource for further knowledge.       The Inca lived high on the Andes mountain range in what is Peru today. They worshipped many gods, and to appease the gods, they would make sacrifices to them. Europeans, mostly Spanish soldiers and priests, come to teach Christianity, arrived in 1532. They documented the people's lives in journals and diaries. But, since the Spaniards didn't understand the Incan language very well, the descriptions might not be accurate, which will lead to misconceptions about the Incan people. The mountains are so cold in the Andes that Incans who died had their bodies almost perfectly preserved. Scientists can use modern medical scanning equipment to find how they had gotten there and why.       The Puebloans were a very interesting society. Like the Inca, they worshipped their own gods, but did not sacrifice to them. The Puebloans first built homes, called pithouses, in the desert. These were indents in the ground that were covered with animal pelts and supported by wooden rods from the inside. They were hunters and gathers, both stalking prey and farming. Around A.D. 750, they began to build houses above ground, called pueblos, with mud walls and wood supports. Most of there food was now coming from agriculture, and most mesa land was cleared for farming. These people had places of worship called Kivas.Kivas were dug out of the ground and used for ceremonial purposes. Around A.D. 1300, the cliff dwellers and the Puebloans moved from their dwellings in the desert to someplace else. The reason is unknown why they made this move.       Off the coast of Greece, there is what some might call an 'Atlantis'. This sunken city was discovered and excavated by a group of Anglo-Greek archaeologists. Since the sand and the water have somewhat preserved the stone buildings, this city is truly a arcaeological wonder. Pieces and shards of pottery lay in the sand. The archaeologists even confirmed the site of a megaron, which is a building the elite used, and that raised this sites popularity by

The very first place im going to be talking about is The Inca's. The Inca's is a very old anciant civilization and has been around for more than a thousand years. One thing that you might not know about is that Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. I thought that was a very interesting fact. There were so many clues left behind by the Inca's like a amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agraculture, goverment, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues archaeologists and others can piece together details of the Inca life. A good thing about finding and looking at artifacts is that we get knowledge and learn more about how that civilization lives and what life was like there. Inca artifacts are mostly made from Stone, Pottery, Gold, or Silver. What is amazing to me is that alot of those materials last a long time even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Some of the artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.        Nextly, the civilization Puebloans is a 1,400 years old. Long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their decendents lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Mesa Verda National Park presereves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Many Arche9ologist have called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes transalated as the ancient ones.        Lastly, In Pavlopetri im going to to be talking about under water artifacts. These are the most amazing things that anyone could have seen. These artifacts under water can be around for more than 5,000 years. When you find a artifact underwater keep it forever because those things can last forever untill the day you die.

Item_Response: There are so many things that are unknown on our planet. So many things that we have little information on, or don't even have a clue that they exist. If we could find everything and understand it, we would have very little issue s left because a lot of problems would be solved. But for now, we are just trying to work our way there.              Ill start off first by talking about the ancient civilization of Inca. The Inca people lived high in the Andes mountains. We know that the Inca civilization ruled South American empire for around 100 years because of clues that they left behind. We have found an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation and ways of life. The Inca had no formal alphabet but they used knots in strings to tell stories, track livestock, and tell the date. Some objects made from stone, pottery, gold or silver were also found, along with some textiles and items of clothing. To find out more about the civilization, high-altitude archaeologist traveled up into the mountains. They discovered many bodies that had been preserved on the mountain through ice. Some bodies were in such good shape that experts could use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died and how they lived while they were alive. It was relativity easy to date the fall of the Inca because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532.              Next  would like to talk about the Pavlopetri. The Pavlopetri lived in the sunken city of Atlantis. The city straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. Oceanographers dove down into the waters to explore this city. 'There is no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr Jon Henderson. Thanks to the moving of the sand and shallow ocean waters searching the city was pretty easy. Their investigations revealed over 9,000 square meters of new building, streets, and town squares. Marine Geologist are yet to have found out why the settlement sank.              So many things out there are yet to be discovered. So many mysteries, discoveries to still make and questions that are still being asked. So many answers to so many issues. But the reality is, we have only discovered a tiny portion of what lies out there.

Item_Response: Ways of hunting Ways of living ways of farming Final/ conclusion                                                                                                   Living in historicle times! (rough draft)       Put yourself in this place, it's 500 A.D you are hunting with your father when you suddenly encounter another tribe! What happens? About 500 A.D many Inca tribe members had to defend themselves in these situations. But many just observe the other tribes ways of doing. They observe their housing, artillery, food, members, land. Many of them lived in pit houses, they were small, dirty, and could easily be the homes of rodents. But their were not to many options for them. Thats how they lived in 500 A.D.       Hunting is another topic! Many tribes did not have enough weapons for actual hunting so they fished. Most fished in streams, ponds, and rivers. They would then take the game back to their small village and it was expected of them to bring enough for everyone, but to do that almost everyone would have to be out their participating. When the men and children returned the woman and elders were to clean, gut, cook, and serve the fish.   When hunting for deer or other animals in the wild the same rules applied. This is how hunting worked back then.       The last topic is farming, most Inca tribes planted vegetables or fruit mainly whatever would grow in the hot climate. They worked all day and when the big harvest came they needed everyones help. Farming is what kept them alive in winter when hunting was unable to be done due to hibernation. Men would plant the crops in spring, woman would water and nurture duing spring and summer, and children would pick the the grown food. That is how farming worked back in the time of the Incas in 500 A.D.       That is my article concerning Inca lifestyles 1,500 years ago. It was mostly all different with the living situation but in modern day people still use farming and hunting everyday to make a profit and keep their business going. Some humans still live like the incas do its called camping. The sleep overnight in a pithouse like chamber but its made out of fabric not hay and sticks. That is the overall explanation of my article Living In Historicle Times! Item_Response: The discoveries made about the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important.                                                                          The discoveries made about the Incas is important because it explains why South America is a Spanish continent instead of Incan. If we never discovered anything about them, we could have thought that the Spanish discovered South America and created countries there, but that isn't true. The Spaniards took over Incan civilization and murdered their king in 1532. The Spanish taught the Incas their language and converted them to their religion. Incan customs were wiped off the face of the earth in no time. If we never discovered any artifacts then we wouldn't know anything about them. Artifacts have helped us learn a lot about other civilizations from different times periods and without them we wouldn't know anything about the past.   The discoveries made about the Puebloans are also very important. The discoveries showed that there were other people living on American soil before Christopher Columbus, Native Americans, and the English got here. All of those people may think that they discovered this continent, but there were plenty of other people living here before they arrived. The discoveries made about the Puebloans also proved that peoples life centuries ago were not that different from ours today. Of course, we have plenty of new technology, but we still lived similar ways. The way they built their homes is very much like ours. If we didn't discover anything about the Puebloans we could be thinking falsely about who 'discovered' this land.   The discoveries made about the Pavlopetri is also very important. If we didn't discover anything about this city then we could be forgetting that there is millions of miles of oceans that are being ignored. The discovery of the Pavlopetri reminded us that that could be answers to our biggest questions about people before us just below the sea. If we never discovered the city, answers about the past could never be solved.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri empires are extremely important.  though some people may not believe this all these different societies have shown us things we may not have thought of as possible.  Like an underwater city untouched and perfectly preserved for almost 5,000 years, or or an entire empire keeping records with knots in strings.                    Let us begin with the Inca empire.  The Incas did not have an alphabet nor a system of writing therefore, there were no archives for historians to study.  They did however leave quipus.  These quipus were used from record the calender to keeping track of livestock.  Europeans who had met the Inca were amazed that such a powerful empire could keep records with knotted strings.  Even with many ancient quipus found by archaeology we still do not know what the knots actually mean.  Having these pieces of string does not help us piece together the whole story of the Ancient Inca.  The Incas ruled a South American empire for almost a hundred years.  It even rivaled the expansion of Rome!  There are few clues left behind but they do show amazing things about their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, and transportation.  In addition there are few stories passed down from the Incas.  These stories were written down by early Europeans.  The Spanish soldiers described the Inca in letters and diaries.  Although the Spaniards spoke some of the Incas language they did not speak it well.  Therefore historians must be careful when interpreting the Spaniards counts.  They may not have understood what they told hem so the descriptions might not be accurate(Also, many of the Incas stories were legends rather than history).  The Inca artifacts that were found were objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver.  These materials last a long time even if they have been in the ground for hundreds of years.  Many artifacts are found either in ruins of buildings or in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife.  things like cloth are easily damaged by dampness but, with the dryness of Peru's deserts and the cold of the Andes mountains, cloth textiles were kept almost perfectly preserved and in tact.  Like other ancient ruins they attract treasure hunters and looters looking for anything that may be of value.  Some treasures were taken centuries ago but, looting still continues today.  Many sites that have been newly discovered are reported to archaeologists to try and get artifacts before looters discover it.  The archaeologists keep careful records. they photograph, and even write down the exact position the artifact was in when they found it.  They will then compare what they found with the Spaniards records and sometimes confirms a historical record.  Even with all these clues a big question still remains; Where did this civilization come from, and what happened to it?  The fall of the Inca is easily dated because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532, however the origin of the Inca is difficult to trace.  Archaeologists studying the sites have to be careful to make sure they know exactly which people built which site. Aerial photography helps them find patterns in monuments they cannot see from the ground.  Even with all this information we are still unable to determine a straight forward explanation of the Inca.                  The Puebloans turn,  The first ancestral Puebloans called Mesa Verde their home.  Their decedents lived and flourished there for almost 700 years.  They eventually built elaborate stone communities and sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls.  But, with the expansion of one or two generations they moved away in the late A.D. 1200s.  Now, the Mesa Verde National Park preserves the spectacular reminder of their ancient culture.  Originally archaeologists called these people Anasazi, from a Navajo word translated to mean either 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies'.  They are now called the Ancestral Puebloans.  They originally settled in Mesa Verde (Green table in Spanish) around A.D. 550.  They are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft.  They were originally a nomadic people and were beginning to lead a more settled life.  they replaced hunting and gathering with farming.  They resided in pithouses grouped into small villages and usually built on mesa tops but occasionally in cliff recesses.  they learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient way of hunting than atlatl(a spear thrower).   They had prosperous times and their population soon multiplied and began building houses above ground in about A.D. 750.  These houses were built using poles and mud for upright walls .  From here the people are known as Puebloans (meaning village dwellers). The people of Mesa Verde advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry.  This advancement was made around A.D. 1000.  double-coursed stone rose an average of two to three stories high and were units of 50 rooms or more.  their pottery had also changed from a dull gray background with a simple design to black drawings on a white background.  Between the years of A.D.1100 and A.D. 1300 the population is believed to have reached several thousand.  Their stone walls are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde with straight courses and carefully shaped stones.  their baskets however, declined dramatically in quality possibly due to the introduction of pottery which meant less attention to the craft.  In about A.D. 1200 a major population shift was seen when people started moving back into cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors.  No one is quite sure of why they moved but it is thought that it may have been for religious or psychological reasons; Or maybe even because the caves offered better protection from the elements.

Item_Response: Many discovires about the anicent people are important. There is only so much that we know about the Incan, Puebloans and the Pavlopetri. Their artifacts have tought us a lot.       The discovries that people have made about the anicent people are very important. The incans didnt have a formal alphabet, they made knots in string. But no on enow knows what it means. The Eurpeans were the first to meet the Incans and were amzed how much they were advanved in technology. Most incan history comes from oral history or stoies that we have leanred about the people. Only some stories have beem written down. Also many sites where the incan have lived have been looted for their treasures making i thard for us to learn about them. Archeaologits dont much about the history about these amazing people, but most of what we do know comes for the artifacts that we have found. Such as some of the clothing that has able able to be preserved thanks to the mountan peaks of the Andes. Or the sites that might have been untouched because looters couldn't get to them.       Learning about the Mesa Verde has been imporant for us, they were some of the first people to use natural landmarks has shelters. The y had abput 150 houses being bui;t above ground. They were also very skilled basketweavers, as well of measony. they used walls of think, double coursed stone to build their houses two or three stories high. Some buildings have had more than fifty units attached to them. There were more than one kind of people in the Mesa Varde, there were also cave dwellers, people that used natural caves as places to live. They used sandstone to walls using a mixture of mud and water to hold tings together. Archaelolgists have leanrned a lot about how these people lived and how they survied for thousands of years with not a lot of things. The discovery of their artifacts have teached us a lot, like how they bulit their houses, how the made their money, how they were able to surive by growing their own food, and how and why they might have all left the place they lived in and just disappeared.       The lost city of Antanlis is on e of the best discovries that archeaologits have made. They  have been able to use modern technology to discover what lies beneath the ocen floor. Most of the ocean floor around the discpvery is filled with pottery that has ended up there due to sand shifting. Alothough areeaologists dont know exactly why the settlemtn has suken they are trying to figure it out. Even thpugh most of the ity is under water we have stll been able to find artifacts that prove they the city wqas before the glory days that Greece had. New investigations have shown that over 9,000 meters of new buildin g hvae been discovered. One building suggested that the town had been used by an elite and automatically raied the staus of the settlement.  Not much is known about the whole settlement, but what we do know helps us figure out what is was like for the anicent people to be  living during these times.  Some archeaologists thnk that the town was submered by water due to sea level changed, ground settlement as result of earthquakes or even a Tsunami. Town around the submerged city are exicted to be learning sbouyt the new city that people are findin g out more about. The few artifcts that archeaologits have found show a lot about what has happned to the city and its people.       In concusion, the artifacts that archeaoloits are fiding are an important part of the worlds history and that people should keep looking for them so we can find out more of our history.

Item_Response: How were the discoveries about the tribes important? There are so many ways that people of the past have changed the way we live.            Why are the discoveries that have been made and found about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri so important? Scientists and Historians have traveled and searched for so many years looking for old artifacts or information about the tribes before. Some parts of these things help us understand the reason why we live like we do now. One way that still is unknown is how did the ancient Inca of Peru understand without no formal alphabet or system of writing? They did not leave archives for historians to study. Inca's made knots in colored strings called quipus, that was the way they kept record of the calendar to keep count of live stock. No one has cracked the code, yet. How do we know about a civilization that for a hundred years ruled a south American empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome? There have been thousands of clues left behind from art, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. Studying and understanding these clues have helped archaeologists and others to find details of the Inca life. Maybe from the way they lived we have copied some of there actions.            People have spread so many rumors about the past that the only way to believe them is with proof. That's why thousands of historians go search for facts of past times. Once a diver explored the sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. Can you believe it? A whole town used to be where a lake is now? People say  that the Atlantis myth is started from the Lost Greek city underwater. Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. The undersea city was found close by Neapolis. Some of the Inca clothing has also survived which could help us make new fabric and advance in that area. Many 'pit houses' have been found. People lived in pit houses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, as settled agriculture began. A pit house shape is basically a tent. Maybe the inventor for a tent got the idea from pit houses? There was also a structure called a Kiva. A kiva was a Hopi word for Ceremonial room. Here underground chambers comparabled to later churches. Based on modern Pueblo practice, Ancestral Puebloans may have used Kiva's for healing rites or to pray for rain, luck in hunting, or a good crop.            Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery.            Most Ancestral Puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. By about A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted. Several theories offer reasons for their migration. We know that the last quarter of the A.D. 1200s saw drought and crop failures, but these people had survived earlier droughts. Maybe after 100 of years of intensive use the land its resources were depleted.            Some inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usally destroyed by dampness, but these have been reserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes.            So basically to sum everything up, We have advanced and learned so much off of tribes and how the tribes survived in the base.

Item_Response: The Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important. We know a lot about them today from letters, journals, and artifacts we find. It lets us know about how other people lived.       The Inca had no form of alphabet, they made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. With these clues, archaeologists can piece together details of Inca life. We know a lot about the Inca from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. Some of the old stories we know of were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. A lot of our knowledge we know about the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found. Such materials like stone, pottery, gold, or silver last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundreds of years. Some Inca clothing have also survived that were preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. It helps that Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and photograph and artifacts they find, and not the exact position in which they find them so we can get as much information as we can. The Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire which makes the fall of Inca easy to date. We know that some Inca lived in the mountains because bodies were found in the icy Andes. The bodies also revealed information about how they lived.       We know about the Puebloans from Mesa Verde National Park. Puebloans lived in Pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They began making houses above ground, with upright walls made of poles and mud. Puebloan baskets show evidence of decline in quality, possible because widespread use of pottery meant less attention the the craft. Archeologists have sought to understand the cliff dwellers lives. They never left written records and much that was important in there lives so we will never know the whole story. The structures are evidence of a society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and passed them on from generation to generation. When the cliff dwellers  left Mesa Verde, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there.                                                                            Today we study Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years ago. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. The site is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. The settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago due to the ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. An investigation revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildings. The world's oldest submerged city shows how people lived at the time is also of great interest to natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow.

Item_Response: Long ago the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopertic they all lived here. They have made many significants to our society.            The Incas of Peru had no alphabet or any kind of system writing. The Incas would make knots in colored strings to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock which were called quipus. The Inca civilization lasted for nearly a hundred years which was for 1438 to 1532 they ruled a South American empire that fought against the expansion of ancient Rome. The clues left behind by the Incas was a portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture,government, transportation,and the way they lived throughout their lives. The Inca civilization was an oral history and was passed down by many generations to other generations. many Incas were described in many letters and diaries. Many Incas artifacts were made from stone, pottery,gold, or silver. Many artifacts found by the aerologists were mostly weather damaged.             The Puebloans were also significant to our society to this day. The Puebloens lived in this civilization for about 700 years ago before the Europeans went to go explore the Northern side. The First Ancestral Puebloens lived in Mesa Verde in A.D. 550. They were most significant for being known as basket makers. They lived in pithouses that were stuck into small villages built be mesa tops or cliff recesses. To make their resources they used a bow and arrow, and a spear thrower. The Pueoloens stepped up from a pole-and-adobe coursed stone to building two or three story high houses of 50 rooms or more.              The Pavopertic was known as the sunken settlement which dated back 5,000 years back. Because of shifting sands and settlements enclosure it revealed a world of buildings, courthouses, mainstreets,rock-cut tombs and religious structures. The seabed was changed with thousands figures of pottery. Many of the Pavopertic civilization artifacts were found under water and was known as the sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. Theories have said that the settlement sank was because the sea levels have changed, ground subsidence to the result of earthquakes or tsunamis. The Pavopertic was the first settlement and civilization to be sunken city that was found in Greece.               All these civilizations have different differences but they have all helped throughout our society and how we live now.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have been so important because they helped us learned more about their cultures and lifestyles. We had a different perspective on how people from different countries used to live their lives.     We learned many new things from them. For example the Inca's did not have an alphabet or writing system; so they would make knots in colored strings to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The Inca's artifacts are usually made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. These materials were intended to last a long period of time.These artifacts are usually found in ruins of buildings, or buried with the dead for their supposed afterlife. Other stuff that also have been discovered is the textile and the clothing. The reason why they were not yet destroyed was because they were in the deserts or the mountains. Hunters that come across and Inca location take anything that might be valuable. Those sites that have been looted are not very good archaeological places. But thee one thing archaeologists do look for is where the civilization came from and what happened to it. Inca was destroyed when the Spanish killed the last Inca king in 1532. Inca's usually lived in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountains peaks. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde around A.D. 500. They had a very good still at crafting and were known as the Basketmakers.     All of these new cultures helped us become a better and more understanding.

Item_Response: Archaeologists around the world have discovered a total of many types of civilizations, spread all throughout the world. In this article, I will mainly be focusing on the Incas of South America, Mesa Verde in North America, and the city of Atlantis in Greece. Throughout the years, archaeologists have discovered artifacts and ancient realms, which brings a better understanding of the history spread throughout our world, over the past years.   The exploration of these three civilizations help archaeologists understand how the different cultures managed to live and carry out their lives. When the archaeologists were exploring the Incan civilization, they found a type of alphabet carried on through coloured strings with certain amounts of knots and other tied strings attached to them. This is signifacant because it helps archaeologists understand their system of communication and messaging systems much similar to the letters we send today.   During the discovery of Mesa Verde, the archaeologists discovered workings of the way houses were built and weapons made by the tribes that lived their at the time.   When the archaeologist were investigating ancient Greece and the myth of the city of Atlantis, the came across some helpful information. They discovered that there was in face a city down below the water and much of the remains were preserved. The Scientists came to a conclusion that earthquakes or tsunamis were a possible source for the reason the city was underwater.   As a whole, the discovery of ancient civilizations helped the idea of developement throughout the world and the thought of how these civilizations grew differently from each other.
