Item_Response: Worlds history lost civilization . In source one Archaeology unlocks the secrets of the past . But how do we learn what we know about the past ? Ancient Inca of Peru didn't have no writing technique or an alphabet. They didn't leave any tools or archives for historians to study . They made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep count of the calendar . Europeans were amazed with what Inca of Peru had came up with keeping count of livestock. Many historians find these quipus but none seems to know what the knots mean. Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery . Only way of actually understanding something was old stories by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532.           How do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a south America empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome ? Clues that were left behind formed a portrait of their religion , art ans architecture , agriculture, government , transportation , and the way to live.  Archaeologist haven't exactly found out everything but there getting there little by little they are putting pieces together. Some clothing ,Inca textiles are still there you would think they are destroyed but these have been preserved in the dry deserts on Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes .          In source 2 the first ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde preserved a reminder of this ancient culture. They call it these people Anasazi ,from a Navajo word sometimes ,translated as 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies', they are now called ancestral Puebloans . They lived in a pit houses . People lived in pit houses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 , as settled agriculture began.  This pit house included a living room sunk a few feet in the ground ,four corner timbers supported by the roof . The fire pit had and air deflector .An antechamber might contain storage bins or pits . These homes later evolved into kivas.They learned to make pottery and acquired  the bow and arrow a more efficient weapon for hunting strategies. Pottery changed from simple designs on a dull gray background to black drawings on a white background . Farming accounted more of there diet than before and much mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture.Between A.D 110 and A.D. 1300,  the population may have reached thousands. It was much more based in compact villages of many rooms.  The stone walls of the large pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde . People started moving back to the cliff alcoves  that sheltered there ancestors before.          Lost Greek city that may have inspired the Atlantis myth gives up secrets . A diver explores the sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece . Explored by an Anglo Greek team of archaeologist and Marin geologist and known as pavlorpetri the sunken settlement dates back some 5,00 years to the time of homers heroes and in terms of size and wealth of details is unprecedented ,experts says. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going,' said sakellariou . 'Less than 1% of the worlds ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found'.

Item_Response: Throughout time, many civilizations have roamed the Earth only leaving ounces of trace behind them. Some of those civilizations include the Incan, Ancestal Puebloans, and Pavloptri. These civilzations go back to about 5,000 years ago when they were still alive. They also range from different locations from Peru to under the sea. Although discovering more information about these cities may seem slim, stories, artifacts, and geography helps us in the understanding of these civilizations.       Stories help archeaologist get a better understanding of the civiliations that had came before us. When the Europeans came to the Americas, they wrote notes and stories about the Incan civilations.  Europeans, consisting of Spanish presists and soliders, arrived to the Incan empire in 1532. They wrote down stoies and legends told by the Incan in letters and diaries. Archeaologist were first worrisome of the new found knowledge, because there were afriaid it wasn't exact since Europeans didn't speak their lanuage. Even thought some of the information may not have been correct, but left to a greater knowledge of their daily lives.       Artifacts, objects that they left behind, led researchers to a better understanding of how and when these civilizations lived. Incan artifacts were made of materials ranging from gold to stone found in the ruins of buildings and undergound. Ancestal Puebloans left behind baskets hinting information of their daily lives to researchers. While Pavloptris left behind ceramics and structures leading to the discovery of when they might of had occupied the area. Artifacts were inportant clues to archeaologist because they helped them understand and discover many important facts about civilizations.       Geography was the main contributer when it came to keeping the civilations alive. The geography of the Incan civilization was in the Andes on mountain peaks where it was colder than most places leaving bodies frozen. With those frozen bodies, scientist have been able to learn how they lived. While some Icans lived on moutains, some lived on the deserts. The dry deserts of Peru's coast kept clothes and artifacts still attached. For the Pavloptris, it was their location under the sea that helped scientist. They were constantly hit with shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure, which led to the discovery of the architecture of their city.       As you can see, without stories, artifacts, and geography, many of the great discoveries abou these lost civilizations would not be found. Stories acted as clues and information to their daily lives. Artifacts showed us how they lived there life and when they occupied certain areas. Geography made it possible for the discoveries to be found. Without these three factors, our knowledge about these civilizations would be extremely limited and we wouldn't be as informed as we are now.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Publoans, and the Pavlopetri are important. How do we learn what we know about the past from lost civilizations? Some come from what we know about the Inca thats come from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation(source #1). By studing these clues, archaeologists and others can peice together details of Inca life. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may ven have worshiped some mountain peaks.          About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home(source #2). In the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes nd moved away. The first Ancestral Puebloans setted in Mes Verde about A.D. 550. For instance  this was the fist ancestral puebloans in Mesa Verde. Peoplelived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 as settled argriculture began. The pithouse featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof. These were fairly prsperous times for the Basketmakers, and their population multiplied.          Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets. The secrets of the lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myt-the fable of Atlantis- have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southeren Greece(source #3). 'There is no doubt tht this is the oldest sumbereged town in the world,' said Dr. Jon Henderson, associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. What they found surpassed all expectations. Thanks to shifting sands and the settlements enclosure in a protected bay, the exploration revealed a world of bulidings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. In addition, the seabed was relete with thousands of shards of pottery.  Mesa Verde National Park Ancestrial Puebloans and their world. Aso the first ancestral puebloans in mesa verde.          We kno some of the old stories because they were written down by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Archaeologists who study these sites keep carful records. Item_Response: Lost civilizations are the societies that were once here, but are now gone. They hold many secrets that are the answer to why we do things today the way we do them. A few lost civilizations include the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. Scientists and archaeologists work together to uncover the mysteries of these abandoned civilizations by exploring the area and collecting data. They collect data through artifacts, writing, and even dead bodies. Knowing about these objects and settlements is important because it lets us know what happened in the past and how it contributes to our present.                The ancient Inca civilization of Peru lacked a formal writing or alphabet system so instead of finding written archives, archaeologists found colored strings, called quipus. The quipus contained knots inside and served as a calender to keep count of livestock. Our knowledge of Inca also comes through passed on stories, the diaries of the Europeans who arrived in the 1500s, and abandoned artifacts such as clothing, pots, and textiles. When gaining data through artifacts, archaeologists have to make sure they record as much information they can get. Bodies left in the Andes mountain peaks were also considered artifacts. The cold weather preserved the bodies so that they were in a good enough condition for research. All of this gathered information tie together to create what we know about ancient Inca, one of the many lost civilizations.                Another lost civilization we know about is the Ancesteral Puebloans who lived in Mesa Verde over one thousand years ago. The first Puebloans lived in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They were talented at basket-making, farming, and building pithouses and weapons. They learned to make pottery and used a bow and arrow. By A.D. 1000, their architectural and agricultural skills increased significantly. They had new construction ideas, new pottery designs, and more farming space. About A.D. 1200, the Puebloans began moving back into the cliff alcoves, their home centuries before. These people became known as cliff dwellers. They built kivas out of sandstone where they would gather together or organize daily routines. Our knowledge on these cliff dwellers and why they left Mesa Verde is limited. When the Puebloan cliff dwellers left, they traveled into New Mexico and Arizona. We even have people today who are descendants of the Ancestral Puebloans.                One more lost civilization is a submerged civilization below southern Greece, also known as Pavlopetri. Even though Pavlopetri dates back 5,000 years ago, marine archaeologists explored it only about four years ago with the help of modern technology. Because the city was enclosed in a protected bay, the courtyards, tombs, structures, and other buildings were revealed. A discovered megaron, a monumental structure with a rectangular hall, informs us that the civilization was of high ranking. We still do not know why or how the Pavlopetri sank but it is likely due to sea level changes, or ground subsidence. Not only is this civilization the oldest underwater settlement in the world, it is also the first submerged city to predate Plato's tale of Atlantis.                The discovery of these civilizations, plus many more, are significant to our history because they let us know about the way people lived before. This can help us because these discoveries might even lead up to new ones. The ancient Inca created their own calender out of strings and had homes high up on mountain peaks. The Pueebloans and cliff dwellers built homes out of sandstone, were skilled in building tools and making baskets. Pavlopetr

Item_Response: The ancient civizations of the Inca, has shown archeologists how they lived. The artifacts discovered by the archeologists has told us that they had no formal alphabet. The Inca invented strings or quipus to keep record of livestock, or the quipus was used as a calendar. Empires used the quipus to keep records, many Europeans were astouned.   Although, the Incas didn't leave many archives, historians were able to find out about what they wore, what language did they speak. Archeologists have discovered clues left behind to tell us their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and their way of life. The clues allowed archeologists to piece together their life.   Stories of the past were past down by genereation to genereation. They started when the Europeans wrote down about the Incas, in 1532. Soldiers and presits described the Incas in letters and journals. They told of how they dressed, what they ate, how they cared for the sick, their burrials, the way they cared for their livestock, and how they invented machines or tools to help them. Some of these stories may not as well be accurate, because the Europeans didn't speak their language well.   The sites where the Incas were found, often were disrupted by treasure hunters or looters. Archeoloists dig up the sites very carefully and take records and pictures of any artifact they find. Learning about acient Peru, is vital to archeologists, their goal is to know about the Inca and their ways. They compare their evidence to that of the Europeans, sometimes archeology confirms history.   The most important of all the evidence is to find out what happened to this civilization, (the rise and the fall). The Inca was easy, because we know that the Spaniords killed the last Incan king in 1532.   The Inca lived in the Andes or in Peru's desserts. Many of thier homes are in remote sites. Their dead, still buried tell archeologists how they died. The burrials were extremly cared for.

Item_Response: The First Ancestrel Puebloans in Mesa Verde        The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'Green Table') about A.D. 550. They are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Formerly nomadic, they were begining to lead a more settled life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithoouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses.They lived in pithouses from A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. They learned to make pottery and aquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting then the atlatl, a spear thrower.

Item_Response: Archeologists have found many discoveries from Inca, the Puebloans, and Pavlopetri. These discoveries help scientists look into the pass and put themselves in the shoes of our ancient civilization. If archeologists find out about ancient life, it could possibly change our world and help the present predict the future.                   Our ancient civilization had a lot of knowledge and were very skillful. They used colorful strings in place of calendars. They even built stone communities and later made small villages that consisted of pit houses. As soon as they all settled, agriculture began. As population increased, so did houses and communities. This took skillful stone masonry. Farming became an essential part of their diet.                   We will never know the whole story. The ancient civilization left no written records. Most of the important things in their life have perished. The building that are still standing tell a lot about their way of lives though and their skills. The way the civilization made the buildings shows they were artistic in their crafts. They also made their home on difficult land. The structures provide evidence of society. Accumulated skills and traditions have been passed from generation to generation.                   Although archaeologist aren't completely sure how to understand every discovery, they do know its important to know our ancestors life. If we could figure out every discovery that we found, we could maybe have a better understanding of the present and predict the future.                   Our societies and generations continue to progress and develop more everyday.                         Maybe we will discover something and our whole world will change forever...

Item_Response: Ancient Discoveries             Archaeologists have made lots of discoveries through time. Some of them    were important and some of them were probably just some dirt or a little bit of rocks. But, in an Archaeologist point of view, those were some important discoveries. For example, if they found dirt, they would be able to know what kind of soil they grew their crops in.                                                    In this case, all discoveries are important because they contribute to the everlasting question of how some of the ancient civilizations were eventually wiped out. Some discoveries, like, carvings on walls, or paintings on walls have a big influence on the answer to that question. The paintings may show what they wore, what they hunted, or even what they ate. Over the years, there have been alot of discoveries of paintings and carvings, and some dicoveries of cloth that some tribes wore, however, Scientists and Archaeologists still dont know what killed most of the tribes other than each other.                                 Though we have found evidence that there was life on earth way before our time, we still dont know what happened to them. Scientists and Archaeologists still have this question echoing in their head,'What happened to Ancient civilizations?'

Item_Response: We have heard many stories about lost civilizations and cities. People may say that some of that stuff is just a myth without even doing research and going through different articles or findings to support their claim. I, on the other hand, did my research and studies on lost civilizations, such as the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. I found very interesting claims and facts that might be helpful for you, the reader, to know. So lets continue with our research.         Lets start of with the Inca. A civilization everybody knows about, but not really sure if more then half of the findings are true. We know that the fall of Inca happened when the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire. Since they lived so long ago, and even since then different people have took over and called this place their own, it is a very difficult place to try to trace. Some Inca were buried in caves or on mountain tops, this has made it very difficult for looters to break into and try to steal valuables from them. Therefore it is a very well preserved site. Even thanks to such cold temperatures from the mountains, this has made it possible for bodies to be in such good shape to study. It is also believed that the Inca might have worshiped mountain peaks. Many sites are in high, remote places. Even though most of this evidence may not be true, since the Spaniards told us about the Inca that know and have learned, we have to trust our instinct and try to find out as much as we can about this civilization to give us a better under standing of how they lived, survived, and thought many, many, many, years ago          Moving on, we come to the Puebloans. It is said that about 1,400 years ago, before Europeans started to explore North America, there was a group of people living in Mesa Verde for their home in the the Four Corners region. In the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away, after living here for more than 700 years. They have been called Anasazi, a Navajo word that means 'ancient enemies' or 'the anicent ones'. First settlement in about A.D. 550, the puebloans settled in Mesa Verda, which in Spanish, means 'green table'. Being nomadic, they started to live a more settled way of life. instead of hunting and gathering, they started to farm. Pit houses is what they lived in. It was several feet into the ground. It was four corned and supported the room. They also had a special place where they kept their valuables, an antechamber. They also did crafting and made pottery. Several theories about their migrations are that maybe they moved because of the many droughts they have suffered. All of their plants and soil have been dried out, and as we know they farmed, so this was very harsh for them. They simply got tired of it and migrated away. Some people still have Puebloan blood in them  in New Mexico and Arizona.           Last is the Pavlopetri. This is an ancient Greek civilization that is believed to date back to 5,000 years ago. Some people believe that this city is a myth, but other claims and information say otherwise. It is said that that this city was consumed by the sea around 1000 B.C. The well known name is Atlantis. From moving around sand and the  protection of it in the bay, we have been able to find buildings, streets, tombs, and religious structures. Also shards of pottery. Over 9,000 square meters of new buildings have been reveled. Not many is know about the Pavlopetri, but we can say the reason for the underwater sea is most likely of sea levels, earthquakes, and a tsunami. It shows how people lived and is truly amazing, since it is around waters so shallow. Its was the first sunken city found. As stated by Sakellariou 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps  underwater exploration going.'          In conclusion, civilizations that has been a mystery to all can be figured out with just a little research and studying. I hope that you have found out a lot of new information from reading this. We still don't know a lot about these civilizations. Everybody learns something new each day .Do some studies of your own and see what you come up with, you'll be surprised about all the cool things you can find out by just reading an essay, or an article.

Item_Response: These lost civilizations are important to our world and age now days because it has influenced how we live, learn and comprehend our world and its ways. With what I've read and researched is helping me with this article. The studies are over the ancient Inca civilization, the Ansestral Pueboans, and last the Pavopetri civilization.       First, the Ancient Incas were smart peoples. the learned to adapt to there sorondings such as land, weather, nature and more. They mostly hunted at first and they lived in the deserts of Peru. some also  lived in a whole new environment the cold Andes mountains. They adapted by farming and staying warm with new houses. Some sites have been ruined by treasure hunters and looters. Archeologists look for anything the can salvage for our history. They some times even have to climb mountains with some equipment to study there findings and they have to carry it down the mountains to further explore it. The Spaniards finally killed the last kings in 1532 and took over the empire.       Long before the Europeans discovered America there was a civilization the people are presently called the Ansestral Pueboans. They lived under cliffs, and revolutionized there houses over time. they went from hunting to growing crops. They were former nomads. They had a pretty straight forward religion. In the summer fires were only used for cooking but during the winter there were fires through out the villages. There are also many tribes still alive today.       The Pavopetri ccivilization was found under water recently and was a huge discovery. a lot of artifacts such as building and pottery have been distoryed under water. It is off the coast of Greece and is probably where the myth of Atlantis came from.

Things that were left behind show their way of life.       The fall of the Inca was in 1532. We know this because the last Inca king was killed by Spaniards at this time. This is when they took over the empire. The area in which they lived was taken over by many different people.       Many of the Inca sites were in high places, that would most likely not be bothered. Some were buried in caves, or on mountain tops. This was because it was hard for looter to get to them, and they body would be undisturbed. But this made the archaeologists job harder too.

Item_Response: Archaeology is very important to everyone in the world. The discoveries of ancient civilzations have lead to new ways at looking at the world. The discovery of the Ancient Inca civilzation has lead to the dicovery of new historical facts, and has proven some of these facts wrong. Like when the first spanish met the Inca, it was said that the spanish know what the Inca's were saying, but actully the spainish didn't.        In the finding of the Ancestral Puebloans, we found out what people in that era's houses would look like. Also we found out that this civilzation lived in homes in a side of a canoyn. These houses also sparked some of the idea's for what houses should look like today. Like the Pithouses they used sparked a idea for small apartments, or hotel rooms. The Kiva is like a old example of a church for this civilzation. These places also could hold get togethers out side, and or inside. This is like the idea of family reunions. Also the Ancestral Puebloans used nature as a advantage. Today we also use nature as a advantage, like bunkers will be hidden by soil or a house will be built around a tree, or it could make a tree house.       The finding of the Lost Greek City was very important. From it we learned that Pluto, the famous Greek writer may have made the story of Atlantis from this underwater city. This discovery also may have been one of the first great greek cities just before the Greek golden age. Also it shows that greek city-states may have started before we actully thought. It also is the largest underwater city known to man today. Which makes it very good for historical finds and other great stuff. It also gives scientists a mysetery to solve. That mysetery is how did the city become submerged in water. It also has made nearby towns delighted. Another mystery some scientist agree on is why is the water around the city so shallow. This may be the city Pluto was writting about, but still, less than one percent of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. Which still leaves tons of ocean to find what Pluto was writting about.        So discovering new things that have to do with lost civilzations, will help us actully discover how life in the past was!

Item_Response: The Ancient Incas        The Ancient Incas of peru were a very resoursful society, but they had no formal alphabet or a writing system. The incas made knots in colored string to record the calendar to keep track of livestock they were called quipus.                  The first European to meet the incas were astonished that they could run a huge empire by just using string to keep records. Many archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows wat the knot means. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the string understanding the incas is like solving a mystery.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the ancient civilizations of the past are important to our modern society.  The past holds the keys to the future.  The Inca, Puebloans, and Greeks hold the keys.  Whether the keys unlock the secrets of the future or help us from repeating history of tyrants and poverty the will guide the human race to peace and prosperity.       The Incas learned to rule a vast empire that rivaled Rome, only by using colored strings.  These strings, or quipus, were used to keep track of sates and livestock.  The Inca didn't have a formal writing system but governed with the strings.  Even the first Europeans to arrive in South America and meet the Inca were amazed at the power the quipus had.        The Puebloans also had influential technology.  They created mortar with mud and water.  Mortar is still a building material today.  Their building skill were great as they created building material that is still used to day even if it is a little updated.  The puebloans also discovered the bow and arrow which was used as a primary fighting tool in many countries pre-gunpowder and even after gun powder as some armed forces use a crossbow, a variation of the bow and arrow, for stealth.       Finally, the Greeks were important because they spoke of The Lost City of Atlantis myth when it was right under their nose.  The Greeks had many myths and after this myth that lasted five thousand years turned out to be true who knows what is real.  Did the Greeks ever encounter a minotaur in a labyrinth? Did Medusa turn people to stone? or are these adaptions of what really happened.  Also if the city sank because of sea level changes, ground subsidence from an earthquake, or a tsunami scientist and world leaders can help the human race and set up precautionary measure to ensure less destruction.       The ancient civilizations of the past can benefit the generations of today.  The past can teach the future to help better the human condition.  The Greeks, Inca, and puebloans all help further and better the human race.

Item_Response: Artifacts and other discoveries have an immense and very important impact on what we consider to be true about the past. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri have left behind ancient aftifacts that are now extremely significant to modern archaeologists. These preserved objects provide an immense amount of information on the lifestyle, diet, culture etc. of these past settlements. These three informational articles have greatly supported the importance of discoveries to help today's people learn more about the past civilizations and their customs.   The first article, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past,' by Beth Gruber, states 'Archaeologists can compare ehat they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spainiards' accounts of the Inca.' These discoveries can either deny what was thought to be fact or confirm what was already thought to be true.What is discovered here will go into history and will be read by millions of others. These artifacts will shape the present and future with the information they provide to archaeologists.   The ancient Puebloans have greatly influenced modern society through the discoveries made about these people and their culture. This ancient civilization   The Pavlopetri is a settlement that was discovered deep on the ocean floor and today it gives archaeologists an immense amount of information about their daily life and common objects. The article, 'Lost Gree'...the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.' These preserved buildings are very alike the buildings and structures common today. These people will give the archaeologists information on their lifestyle and cities. This newly collected data can teach people of today new and somethimes easier methods of doing tasks. This information has the possibility of greatly benefiting modern day citizens for the future, as well as educating them on the past.    Discoveries and new information found about ancient civilizations have made a huge difference in society on Earth today. Most of what we know to be part of common life today has originated in some way from knowledge from the past. The Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are just a few of the ancient civilizations that have greatly affected modern life. The discoveries made at the sites of these settlements and many others are especially significant because of its effects on life today.

Item_Response: Studying ancient civilizations has always been a habit prompted by human nature's relentless curiosity. Yet curiosity does not even begin to explain the true siginificance of our ancestors and their societies, for history and archaeology helps us connect with those who came before us and learn from their accomplishments and failures alike. The discoveries that have been made concerning the Inca, the Pueblonians, and the Pavlopetri are no exception to this rich tradition of embracing human history, and these civilizations have much to contribute to our knowledge of the intriuging world that came before us.   First and foremost, the excavation of Incan sites greatly impacts our view on history because they were such a complex society. Though they had no formal alphabet or system of writing and therefore could not leave archives for historians to study, the Inca were advanced in other ways. Historians marvel at their quipus, which were knots in colored string that the Inca used to keep numerical records. Because of this simple yet impactful advancement, historians and the general public are aware that the Inca were forward thinking and civilized enough to value a definite system of counting. In addition, the oral history of the Inca is perhaps historains' most powerful tool, for the stories often emphasize religious and societal values. Though they are not a precise facsimile of the original story, they still reveal what may have been important to the Incas, such as their customs and legends that shaped their society. We can find hidden lessons in the Inca's oral history and piece together the daily life of and Inca. Evidently, the quipus and the rich oral history of the Inca once played a major role in their civilization, thus making it significant to the modern world.   Another interesting civilization is without a doubt the ancient Pueblonians, for their advancements in building structures depict their slow but steady forward thinking. The Pueblonians never stopped innovating and perfecting the skill of building, and their determination is seen in the evolution of their structures. Pueblonians began with pithouses, which were primitive underground housing structures that eventually evolved into kivas. By A.D. 1000, the Pueblonians switched from the basic pole and adobe construction to stone masonry, which furthered their success in the building aspect of society. Obviously, the Publonians refusal to stop innovating inspires today's generationto ocntinue to improve our lives, thus rendering the Pueblonians as a significant part of human history.   Last but not least, the Pavlopetri are arguably the most fascinating civilization to study, for the circumstances of their disappearance is thought-provoking on many levels. The civilization tied to this lost Greek city may have inspired the legend of Atlantis, and it is far beyond interesting to examine the lives of a civilization who conceded their existance to water. Historians believe that the wealth of this civilization is unrivaled, which prompts us to wonder what may have become of the Pavlopetri if they had not come to such an abrupt end. Perhaps they could have risen to the level of recognition of ancient Rome if given more time to expand. In another sense, the discoveries centered around the Pavlopetri make us question if a number of other cities are lost underwater, waiting to be found by archaeologists. There is no limit to what history can hold if cities can be located and investigated underwater, which foreshadows greater things to come in the future of archaeology and our knowledge of ancient civilizations.   Overall, history is a rich terrain that humans are obliged to explore

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incas, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have made an enormous impact on the world we live in today. The invention and findings of these archaic societies have explained to people how different life was in the ancient times. These findings have also given us the knowledge on how technology has advanced immensely.         The ancient Incas of Peru were an intellectual group of people. Though they had no writing system or alphabet, they create quipus to record as a calendar and keep track of livestock. Their textiles and artifacts have helped people discover how they actually lived. For example, the intricate patterns found on textiles have assisted the findings of monuments that cannot be seen from the ground. The Incas contributed greatly to the word of today,but also did the ancient Puebloans.          The ancient Puebloans of Mesa Verde were very skilled and crafty. Today, many people have made more advanced versions of the things that the Puebloans created. For example, the ancient Puebloans built and lived in pit-houses, which today has been transformed into sturdy homes made of wood and cement. Not only did Incas create the first homes, they also built the first church. They built places of worship called a Kiva, which means ceremonial room. These Kivas have been transformed into the much bigger and more intricate churches seen today. Their inventions has helped people discover more information about them, as well as the lost city that inspired the tale of Atlantis.         Beneath the transparent waters of southern Greece, there lays a sunken settlement that inspired the tale of Atlantis, known as Pavlopetri. The most interesting fact about this settlement is that it was a planned city filled with buildings, courtyards, streets, tombs, and religious structures. Not too long ago, marine archaeologists have been able to finally search the lost city and have discovered many new things. For example, investigators were able to find a possible megaron, which gives the idea that the town may have been used by an elite. The ceramics and pottery shards found have also helped archaeologists discovered the city that had fallen.        In conclusion, these ancient cultures have played a crucial role in the discoveries and technologies found today. The artifacts and finding found have proven that they Puebloans, Incas, and the Pavlopetri were intelligent people who have inspired many of the inventions of today.

Item_Response: the ancient inca of peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing.THey did not leave archives for historians to study.   the inca lived high in hte andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. A lot of their sites are in remote, high places.some inca were buried in caves in cliff faces.   About 1,400 years ago, long before europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the four corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home.   The first Ancestral Puebkians settled in Mesa Verda (Spanish for ''green table'') abput A.D.550.They are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft.   A diver explores the sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. ''There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,'' said Dr Jon Henderson,associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham.   The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of acean floor off the southern peloplnnese, is believed to have been cinsumed by the sea around 1000 BC Although discovered by a british oveanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists,aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca wrote and artifacted many differnt things, but they dont have a formal alphabet or system of writing. The Incas artifacted many things with stone, pottery, gold, or silver. They textiles and clothing, the materials were usually destroyed by damoness. Tthe Incas were hunters. Archaeologists study and find things about the Incas. Archaeoloists compared what they learn about artifacts and sites with the Spaniards accounts of the Inca. They found that the Spaniars murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and took over the empire.       Mesa Verde were known for basketmakers and for their skiled at crafts. They made pithouses in about A.D. 550. The people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe contruction to skillful stone masonry. Walls of thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stories high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more.They, also, did pottery too.       Lost Greek was a secrats of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths. The sunken settlement dates bakc some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes. In terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. They say it's 30,00 square meters of ocean floor of the southern Peloponnese. It's believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 B.C.

Item_Response: Have you ever heard of the lost city of Atlantis? Or heard stories of cowboys finding people housed in cliffs? How about people who lived high in the mountain tops? These stories are true. With the help of Archaeologist, the myths were put to rest and finally the facts were revealed. These discoveries were important because it can help us to know about things that can happen to us in the future.       Archaeologist have found the 'Lost city of Atlantis'. It was discovered beneath the waters off southern Greece. Many speculate on how it sunk. Some say that it was sea level changes. Others say it was due to earthquakes. I think its important that we found the city because we now know that a city can sink. Ceramics were found that dates back to the stone age which suggests that the settlement was occupied around 5,000 years ago. Scientists originally thought it was 1,200 years later than that. The city is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. It is believed that this city was were the Atlantis myths started.       The Puebloans were very skilled at crafting baskets. That's how they got the nickname 'Basketmakers'. They were originally nomadic but started to become more settled. They lived in pit houses in small villages usually built on mesa tops. The Puebloans used to be hunters and gatherers but moved to more of a farming lifestyle as they got more settled. Archaeologist have found their deserted homes and are wondering why they deserted them. They believe that maybe there was a severe drought. Another theory is they got forced away. Either way, it has taught us about droughts and conditions in the past in that area. That's why it's important that cowboys reported their dwellings and archaeologist have looked into them.       The Incas were a great society. They kept record of events with rope and knots. They survived for a very long time. That is until the Spanish came and invaded their society. The Spanish killed the last Inca king. They lived high in the Andes. Some Spanish kept record of their society but not a lot. It is why we don't know a lot about them. It has taught us to keep good record of what happens in the present and to preserve the past.       As you can see, it was really important that archaeologist found these society's. They have taught us a lot. Although archaeologist have had some tough challenges, they still got a lot of the information and recorded it.

Item_Response: Archeologists have used artifacts and remains to examine ancient civilizations and uncover many interesting facts. They can also see how modern civilizations has grown and adapted. Artifacts that are no longer used can tell how the ancient people survived and lived before modern technology.       The Inca Civilization ruled for about a hundred years and only left a portion of things they had. This is because the spanish conquistadors had visited and destroyed most of what they had. Looters could have also stolen important artifacts. Weather could have also harmed artifacts, but many survived.       Records were also kept by the spaniards, but they didn't speak the Inca language very well so they could not really interpret what they said. They also did not have a formal system of writing. One document could have the same essential information as another but be written in a different format or words.

Item_Response: Discovery's of Ancient Civilizations             The findings of ancient civilizations, is a great way to find out about our past. The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavloperti is very important to us.          The Inca civilization is located high in the Andes Mountains was a very active civilizations during their time period (1438-1532). The Inca had no formal alphabet or a system of writing. The Inca civilization believed that their rulers would be sent to the afterlife, like Egyptians, and when the ruler of the Inca people died; the Inca people would preserve the body and burry it away with gold, silver, and many other tools that the people believed the ruler would need in the afterlife. The Inca had a textile and clothing that survived over hundreds of thousands of years. The Inca welcomed the Spaniards with open arms, but in 1532, The Spaniards betrayed the Inca for all they did for them by killing the last king of the Inca people. After the murder of the king the Spaniards took over the Inca empire.          Over 1,400 years ago, before Europe began exploring America, a group of people settled in the Four Corners region. Archeologist who studied these people called them Anasazi, from the Navajo work traslated as, 'ancient ones,'  or 'ancient enemies. The Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde (Spanish for 'green table') around A.D 550. They were known as Basketmakers for their skill in craftsmenship. They were once nomadic. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as a main livelihood of the Puebloans. They learned many diffrent crafts such as, pottery. They also learned to create new weapons such as, the bow and arrow. The Puebloans lived in Pithouses. The Puebloans left their territory and decided to move elsewhere. The Pueblo people and other tribes are decendants of the Ancestral Puebloans.            From myth to reality, the ancient underwater city that inspired the myth of Atlantics has been discovered. The discovery of this ancient underwater city was 30,000 square miles on the floor of the ocean off the southern Peloponnese. The archeologist found many diffrent wonders of this city. They found buildings, courtyards, main streets, and rock-cut tombs and creligious structures, like churchs. They also found verious shards of pottery on the seabed. The people believed that this ancient city was shallowed up by the sea and was placed at the bottom of the ocean. This is the first underwater city ever discovered in ancient Greece.

Other reasons are it could simply be facinating. Also we could learn how to not run an empire. These are some of the reasons studying ancient civilizations is important. Or certain laws that govern us, we need to be careful when choosing them. Choosing leaders is a major factor if a kingdom will thrive or not. Learning from our misakes can help a kingdom thrive.    In conclusion studying ancient civiliztions can be a very impotant thing. They can help govern our society. We could learn from previous mistakes. It can help us decide if a leader will be a bad one or a good one. All and all studying past civilizations is one of the most imporant things we learn, wether it's in history class or it's in real life.

Item_Response: Why Ancient Discoveries are Important            Have you ever wondered what life would be like in Inca society, Anasazi culture, or a sunken Greek city? If so then these discoveries will interest you. Ancient discoveries are an important insight to an ancient culture. This article will tell you about one discovery made and about two cultures.            Firstly, in 1969 a sunken city was discovered by a British oceanographer but due to a lack of technology available it was explored in 2009 by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists. It was known as Pavlopetri and dates back some 5,000 years, and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented. In the words of Dr Jon Henderson 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. It has remains dating back from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece....' It is 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese and is believed to be consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. If not for shifting sands and being in an enclosed bay exploration may have not revealed the buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, religious structures, and the seabed was covered with shards of pottery. What really took the scientists by surprise was the discovery of a possible megaron, a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall, which raised the status of the settlement. Marine geologists have still not found out why the settlement sank (as of 2009) theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence because of earthquakes, or a tsunami.            Now from below the sea to the top of the Andes in Peru. The Inca ruled an empire from 1438-1532 that rivaled Rome. They had no formal alphabet or system of writing, they used knots in colored string called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestock. Since no one knows what these knots mean the job of understanding the Incas is like solving a puzzle with a missing piece. Most of what we know comes from artifacts and oral history, some of the old stories are known because they were written down by Spaniards in 1532 in letters and diaries. We have to be careful when interpreting these accounts for the Spanish did not know Inca language well. Since being in the dry deserts or cold mountains in Peru some textiles have survived unbelievably well. We know that they fell in 1532 when Spain killed the last Inca king and took over their empire.            About 1400 years ago the Anasazi lived in the Mesa Verde area. The first Anasazi are known as basket-makers for their skill at the craft. They lived in pit-houses on Mesa tops or in cliff recesses. In c. 750 A.D. they built houses above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. They are now known as Puebloans or 'village dwellers'. In A.D 1000 they advanced from pole and adobe to skillful stone masonry walls often rose two or three stories in units of 50 or more and the diet changed mostly to agriculture. Circa 1200 A.D people moved back in the cliff dwellings of their ancestors.Why? No one knows for sure. They used nature to their advantage building beneath overhanging cliffs . In A.D 1300 Mesa Verde was deserted no one knows why.            Did some of these paragraphs leave you hanging? Yes? That is why discoveries are important they don't leave scientists wondering about what happened to these ancient people. So now do you want to go discover something?

Item_Response: Over the years, we have discovered numerous ancient civilizations. Examples of these civilizations are the Incans, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. These discoveries are important in how they have aided us in learning about the past.                  To begin, the discoveries we have made about the Incans help us study their lives. For example, we have uncovered textiles and clothing that can tell us about Incan lifestyle. The style of the clothing hints what the weather may have been like, what resources they had, or even what the fashions were back then. Also, there were bodies uncovered from the Andes that can inform us of what the people ate or how wounds were treated. Not to mention we can learn how the civilization ended.                  In addition, the Puebloans were an important find too. The artifacts left behind tell a story of what events occurred. We know by A.D. 1300, the Puebloans left Mesa Verde. We don't know why currently, but once we find out, we can learn from their mistakes. We would know what not to do in order to prevent that from happening to us. Furthermore, many of the people in Mesa Verde are in some way descended from the Puebloans. By studying them, those people can learn about their ancestors.                 Finally, the Pavlopetri may help us understand more about one of the infamous legends heard around the world, the legend of the city of Atlantis. This civilization may result in us finally knowing if the city of Atlantis ever did really exist. It will let us learn more about the evolution of us also. We can study the architecture and the way the city is set up. And let's not forget how this will keep underwater exploration going in hopes of finding more things.                 To close, discoveries of past civilizations have aided us greatly. From them we have learned how the people's lives were back then, how they built shelters, and how our civilizations came to be as they are today. Hopefully, we will continue in uncovering more miraculous finds.

Item_Response: Will all of our history ever be recovered? Though we have found many relics that come from our past scientists still have a long way to go to find a great portion of our history. Recently scientists have discovered what is the remains of an ancient Inca civilization The Inca textiles and clothing have been recovered from the site and have survived remarkably well. This find shows us what the Inca's once used as clothing. We have discovered that the Inca's were buried in caves in cliff faces and on mountain tops. Doing this has helped preserve the sights, because looters cannot easily get to them. the Inca didn't have a formal alphabet or system of writing. Using a portrait you can identify many different topics such as religion, art, and architecture. Most of what we know comes from oral history or stories passed down from generation to generation???.       Long ago their were the pueblos who had chosen there settlement to be Mesa Verde. They made pithouses to live in from the years of A.D. 550 to A.D. 750. By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde advanced from pithouses to thicker walls, double coursed stone often rose 2 or 3 stories high and were joined into 50 rooms or more. Fires built in summer were mainly for cooking. In winter many fires  burnt throughout the village. when the people of Mesa Verde left they traveled south into new Mexico and Arizona.                 Do you know the myth based on The Lost City of Atlantis? Scientists have discovered what is supposedly Atlantis. A city found at the bottom of the ocean. their is not very information that could be recovered because of the artifacts being submerged for so long. It was found near Neapolis. the investigation revealed 9,000 square meters of buildings.       These three sites have shown scientists many different things about many different locations and people. With these discovers scientist have learned a lot more about our ancient history.

Item_Response: Learning the Inca, the puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. All three llost Civilization were important from past world to the modern world. They were the first to make important things that were used today.                              The Incas of Peru didn't have Alphabelt or system of writing. The europeans were amazed when they found out about the Incas were able to keep a huge empire with just writing it into a strings of records. The Incas lived in the high Andes Mountain many of their sites are in high remotes areas. They were known for nearly a hundred years and rivaled against rome.  They were the first one to make portriats of their religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. The Fall of the Incas was when the spaniards murdered the Last Inca king in 1532. This Information discovered by archeologist made them think what they did and didn't to make them survive in that time. The cold mountains in the Andes act liuke giant freezer for dead bodies from the incas.                                           The Puebloans lived about 1400 years ago before europeans explored North America   A group of people living in the four corners chose masa verde as their home. In A.D 1200s in the span of a generation they left their homes and moved away. The Puebloans were known for their craftmanship and started building pithouses clustered into a small village usually built on a mesa tops. They also made pottery and acquired the bow and arrow for a more efficient weapon for hunting and a spear thrower. In A.D 750 they began building houses from above ground with a upright walls made of poles and mud. By A.D 1000 they had evovled their houses from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone mastery. The Puebloans then began building Kivas a ceremonial chamber in front of rooms. Archeologist studied the tools and items their used in their time to learn more about what they did to their empire, trading, and their civilization. The archeologist were amazed what the puebloans mad for shelter the pithouse.  About A.D 1300 mesa verde was deserted. Several theories offer reasons for their migration. By A.D 1200s saw drought and crop failures. When cliff dwellers of mesa verde left they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kins who were already there.                                                            The secrets of the lost cites in southern greece was found by marine geologist and archeologist. they were known as the pavloperti the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years ago the time of homer heroes. It is the oldest submerged town remaining beneath the waters dates back from 2800 to 1200 Bc long before the glory of days of the classical greece. It straddles 30,00 sqaure meter of thge ocean floor of the southern Peloponnese and has been believed it was consumed by the sea around 1000 bc and was discovered by a british explorer some 40 years ago. They found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. It has over 9,000 square meters of new building. Marine geologist and archeologist were amazed and suprised on what the discovered and find under beneath the ocean of southern greece.                                       Archeologist found something important about the three different civilization in different places. They learn about what the did to survive against intruders and what cause them to disappear around that time. Archeologist also learned the tools they made before were still used in the modern world today.

Item_Response: Throughout the different discoveries made by archaeologists about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, each contained qualities as to why they are important. These ancient civilizations allow us greater knowledge of our past as human beings and will further let us improve our qualities of life.   The Ancient Inca ruled for nearly one hundred years. Throughout this time they were able to run a huge empire using strings, called quipus, to keep records. The Inca had no written language or alphabet, so it is fascinating to learn more about them through different artifacts including clothing and every day items. One main reason archaeologists study the Inca is because of their well preserved artifacts. Artifacts hidden in the Andes mountain are still in very good condition even after hundreds and hundreds of years. With these we can more easily learn about the past of people before us.   The lost city of Pavlopetri has confirmed many people's beliefs that there is an Atlantis. This city has been submerged for 5,000 years and is now being explored by divers in southern Greece. Untouched by nothing but sea life and water, this city is intriguing to everyone.  It is in our human nature to be curious about the things unknown to us.   The Pueblans were an interesting people. living in a desert, they somehow managed to live in it's harsh conditions for many years. Their place of stay was deserted, though, and no one quite knows why. They left no sign of why they left, so it is only in our nature to be curious as to what happened to them.   These civilizations are a good example for why empires and civilizations like these are so important. This is classified as history, and we need to know history so we know what things turned out well and things that did not turn out well. It is important to not repeat the mistakes we have made before, and history allows us to learn from them.

Item_Response: The important artifacts of the Inca's, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, found by archeologists, are important to us because they give us details about how they lived, what they used as their calendar and lunar systems, and their every day routine.         First, all the important civilizations have helped us discover how they lived. For example, they artifacts found give certain details about what they wore and what they made their houses out of. We have come to the detail that many of the civilizations explored are advanced in a way that their houses had a perfect structure.         Secondly, the way that many of the people knew what time of day it was and how they calculated their years is sort of impressing. For example, lunar calendars is how we have come up with a more developed form of the year. The phases of the moon is an incredible discovery made by the civilizations and everyone after them trying to adjust it and make the exact calculations correct, so we are not off by one-fourth of a day in the year.         Third, their every day routine explain if they accustomed their day to the same activities or did something new. With the knowledge of what they had, like textiles and clothing that doesn't get destroyed by dampness, heat , or other extreme temperature.         Apart from being intelligent and discovering certain things we don't fully understand, they were able to be advanced in certain things we don't know of yet. I think that what have discovered to this day, are incredible in the case that it helps better understand what concepts they did use and how they used certain tools we have not yet discovered to this day.

Item_Response: The discoveries made of ancient civilizations are very important because they help to show people how their ancestors lived and how we have progressed so much from their times.             Archeaologists are so interested in the history of ancient cultures that they travel the world locating civilizations and uncovering artifacts that may have been deemed unimportant to the people of the civilization.Those artifacts are what we use to learn about ancient societies and we treasure them like they are pure gold.              Many people who become archeaologists do not simply say they are fine with not knowing of the ancient worlds around them and look to further our education of those worlds. They do this not only because they love history, but also because they want other people to learn about these societies and become archeaologists themselves.             Archeaologists are not the only people with this interest, historians also learn about the ancient cities and gladly tell people all they can about early civilizations and their inventions.              Many ancient civilizations have created many things they need to survive in their environments, and the first ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde are a great example. They were known as basketmakers because of their skill with that particular craft. They also settled down from their nomadic period and started farming instead of hunting and gathering. They lived in pithouses in small villages mostly built on mesa tops and occasionaly in cliff recesses. They made pottery, bows and arrows and a spear thrower.             There are examples of evolution when the Puebloans started making houses above ground with a few pithouses. They then started to use stone to build their supplies and dwellings and progressed greatly until they moved back into the cliff alcoves their ancestors had lived in before them.              Many other civilizations evolved the same way the Puebloans had, including the lost city in Greece. This city had been submerged by water nearly 5,000 years ago and is the oldest submerged town in the world. Marine archeologists examined this city and were fascinated by it and its artifacts.              People should know about the past because things could happen again and they need to be prepared for it. They might also like to know about their ancestors and this is a good way to do that.

Item_Response: The discoveries of the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri were very important antient civilizations. Discovering these civilizations helped us find more and more civilizations that we haven't heard of.     The finding of the lost city helped us discover how to find more things underwater. When they started to find artifacts underwater such as the potery that they made they new they were close to the soon to be found lost city of Greece.     The Inca civilization was another great finding in history. The Inca did not have a writing or a number system. They used quips which were knots in colored string to count their cattle. The Inca were very hard to get to because they lived in the Allps. It was hard for the archioligist to get their equiptment to the the top.     The Puebloans were nomads until they finally settled. They made their own weapons to hunt animals for food. They made their own houses. They were called pithouses. It had an air deflector, antechamber that stored bins or pits. Were later evolved into kivas. They advanced from pole-and-adobe construction and did skillfull stone masonry.     These discovories helped us do better at finding other actient cities. Discovering about the Inca helped us know what to do when we look for a city in high mountain regions. The finding of the lost city helped us find other things underwater. These ancient citys helped us in every day life.

Item_Response: In the articles, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past', 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World', and ' Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets' by Beth Gruber, Roy Anderson, and Helena Smith are about ancient civilizations from the past. The first civilization were the Incas. Historians and archaeologists who have studied this civilization have discovered anicent artifacts and objects from the Incas. Some historians have some ideas that before the fall of the Incas, the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king in 1532 and had taken over the empire. Archaeologists used techinques to discover more hidden artifacts and even hidden sites. The next civilization was the Mesa Verde Puebloans. From around 1,400 years ago,longer than the Europeans discovered America, a group chose Mesa Verde as their home. In the late A.D. 1200's, they had left their homes. the first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They began their way of living. They lived in villages in small clusters all over. They lived in houses, and in pithouses. As they began to grow, their population was grew too.The last civilization is The Lost City of Atlantis. This civilization is very unique because people didn't know if was a myth or it actually existed. This civilization was a perfect world. It straddles at 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor. An archaeologist belived that it was submerged by a war a long time ago. The shifting sands and the settlement's enclosure help discover a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures. There was also thousands of shards of pottery everywhere. Archaeologists found ceramics that were from the end the stone age. Investigations reveled 9,000 square meters of new incredible buildings.

Item_Response: Evidence of an Ancient Society, whether it be bones or artifacts from the bottom of the ocean we can use them as a valuable tool to look into the past that we cannot experience our selves.                      The Ancient Incas settled in a part of the Andes Mountains located on the edge of South America. We have found a object with knotted strings called a quipus. We believe that the color of the strings and how many knots on each string can be used as a type of record keeping device used by Incan 'runners'. But on top of that scientists have found burials on the freezing Andes Mountain Ranges. Since the bodies are well preserved we can use the information to find out what type of burial they had and how they died.              Before they settled in Mesa Verde the Ancestral Puebloans were supposedly nomadic. but for some reason they started to farm more often and eventually settled in a cliff filled area. They lived in homes called pit houses that were clustered into small villages. They started to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. This weapon was a great achievement because it was more efficient than the atlatl, a almost spear type weapon.                  of the coast of the lower part off Greece, divers and scientists have discovered and under water city. The city dates back to 1000 B.C. In the submerged city they have discovered courtyards, buildings, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. But on top of that the ocean bed was littered with thousands of shards of pottery. The ceramics had been dated back to the end of the stone age, about 5,00 years ago. Its has also been thought to the myth of the underwater city 'Atlantis'. But this also may not be the last underwater city we'll find, because so far only 1% of the worlds ocean has been explored.

Item_Response: Ancient Civiliations                         The Incas, Puebloans, and the sunken city near southern Greece have many mysterious about them. They have found many artifacts, pottery, buildings, writings, oral stories, and drawings. These tell archaeologists their way of life, religion, agriculture, political and social life, origin, and their fall.             The Incas, Puebloans, and the sunken city have many undiscovered mysteries. The Incas never created a writing system but left many other things that we can study to learn about them. They made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep count of livestock. Archaeologists cant uncover the meaning of these quipus. They ruled a South American empire from 1438 to 1532 using this system. The origin of the Incas is still a mystery. The Anasazi also called Puebloans flourished on Mesa Verde for more than 700 years. They lived in a place with rough terrain and bad climate for agriculture but still settled. They moved away from it for an unknown reason. They lived in the Four Corners region before they settled in Mesa Verde. An Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists found a sunken ancient city near southern Greece. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC. This is the oldest sunken  city found. Also, these dates are near the time Atlantis is believed to have sunken. It has brought back the idea of Ancient Atlantis. Archaeologist do not know the reason why the city sank 5,000 years ago or who inhabited it. Archaeologists are finding artifacts, buildings, and writings to uncover these things.             These 3 ancient civilizations left many mysterious thing for archaeologists to uncover. The Incas left the quipus and how they first began. The Puebloans left their homeland for a reason unknown to us. The ancient city near southern Greece left us with the theory that Atlantis can be a real city that sank. There are many undiscovered mysteries that ancient civilizations leave us. These are just three.

Item_Response: Discovering the Past            How do we know what we know about the past? Some might say a time machine, magic, or Google. Well that is wrong! Today we discover things about the past because of archeologists. Archeologists discover ancient civilizations and study their artifacts to try to know and learn about the people that lived there.               Sometimes archeologists have a hard time putting the pieces of the past together. Its not easy to pick up a strange object and discover what it is. Archeologist have to study it and record what they found. But you can learn alot through the artifacts. You can learn about their religion, gouverment, daily lives, and more.            The ancient Inca was a civilization in Peru. Archeologist discovered that they lived in the Andes Mountains. They may have even worshiped some mountain tops. But there is a mystery about them. They used string and tie it in knots. They believe it might have been used as a calender or to keep track of livestock, but archeologists are still not sure. This find is importand because the Inca had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They could not have written down events or what the string was used for. So this find has left archeologists puzzled.            Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. Archeologists discovered that they were farmers and made good quality baskets. They lived in Pithouses which were underground. They eventually moved their homes ontop instead of underground and built them into skillfull stone masonry. But then they migrated and began building their homes in the sides of cliffs. Why would they suddenly move and build their homes in strange places? Archeologists say it could be because of drout, but they have survived many drouts before. Archeologists have studied, analyzed, and compaired them, but they still have little knowlage. This find is important because it is still a mystery.            Atlantis was once a great city in ancient Greece, but is now underwater. Archeologists discovered that the whole city is undwerwater. People used to live in Atlantis and may have been home to wealthy people. It is still unknown how the entire city made its way underwater. Before people in Greece thought Atlantis was a legend, but thanks to all the discoveries people are very exited about it. This discovery is so important because it is still a mystery how the city made it underwater. Some archeologists think its because of an earthquake or a tsunami. We may never find out.            These are few of many reasons why artifacts are so signifigant. When you find an artifact you may discover something new about a civilization's gouverment or agriculture. You might even discover an entirally new civilization. You could even find out some mysteries of the past. So never stop looking for answers.

Item_Response: 'Ancient Civilizations'                    There have been many great civilizations throughout our history and time periods. They have brought many cultures and ideas from other locations and locations around them. Three ancient civilizations are the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlovian. The discoveries of these three ancient civilizations are very important. They each have a role in our old and new society because some people still follow many of their cultural ideas.           The Incas would use colorful string to make knots and use them to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. In our time, historians have found these strings and are trying to find out the true meaning behind the knots. It's more like a mystery that hasn't been solved. Historians are still trying everything.                                                                 The Puebloans were significant because they chose Mesa Verde as their home. For more than seven hundred years, them and their descendants lived and flourished there, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered acloves of the canyon walls. In the late 1200s A.D., the Puebloans left their homes and moved away in a span of a generation or two.                                                                                                                   The Pavlovians were cliff dwellers. They used nature to their advantages. They used sandstone to create their buildings which they shaped into rectangular blocks about the size of a loaf of bread. They used a mixture of mud and water to stick the rectangular blocks together. Then they created rooms and other buildings with these materials. Rooms averaged about six feet by eight feet, space enough for two or three persons. The Palvovians lived in cliff dwellings for less than 100 years. By about 1300 A.D., Mesa Verde was deserted.

Item_Response: I am writing an explanatory article about lost civilizations, I have three sources Source #1: an excerpt from the 'National Georaphic Investigations' Ancient Inca: Srchaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past, Source #2 an Abridgement from the National Parks Service, and Source #3 an Article from The Guardian. These are all very important discoveries, and I'll tell you why.         First, lets start off with The Ancient Inca's. This find was important because, we got a better understanding of the Incas. Like, archaeologists have found many ancient quipus, which were used to keep records, but today no one knows what the knots mean. Also, that their civilization is nearly a hundred years (1438-1532). I think this is so important overall because we learned things about the Incas we never could have just thinking about, we had to go and investigate what things were, who they were, and what they did, and thats why I think the Incas are so important.          Next, we have the Ancestral Puebloans and their world. This find was important because, we got a better understanding of this ancient culture. Like archaeologists have found that the Puebloans lived in Pithouses which featured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground, and four corner timbers supported the roof. They were also known as the Basket makers. Now this find was important because, it practically took us back into the ancient civilization. Thats why I think its important.            Finally, we have the Lost Greek city. This find was important because, the secrets of a lost city that may inspired one of the world's most enduring myths, Atlantis, this might be where those myths started. Also what archaeologists found surpassed all expectations. thats why I think this is an important find.              So, this is why I think that these finds are so important, and 'why do we keep searching?' people ask because its about history, and that we are so curious all the time, it's just like nature for humans. So, thats why I think this is so important.
