Item_Response: The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri were founded by many people in the past. They all have created things for our use in this time and age. The things that they created are very usefull to us now. They have left clues behind such as art for archaeologist to know which culture created it. But the Inca did not leave things for them to study.    The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored string called quipus to record the calander to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Clues left behind by the Inca form a portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. when archaeologist study these clues they can piece together details of Inca life. As many ancient civilizations, Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Some Inca sites have been distured by treasure hunters, or looters who will take anything that might be valuable. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peeks, Some Inca were buried in caves or cliff faces.   The first ancestral Puebloans setteled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft. They were beginning to lead a more setteled way of life. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow a more efficient weapon for hunting and the atlatl which is a spear theower. These were fairly prosperous times for the basketmakers, and their population multiplied. About A.D. 750 they began building houses above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. They built the houses one against anotgher in long curving rows often with a pithouse or two in front. From here on these people are known as Puebloans a spanish word meaning village dwellers.   The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the worlds most enduring myths the fable of Atlantis have been brought to light from beneath the wateres off southern Greece. Explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist and known as pavlopetri the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homers heroes and in terms of size and waelth of detail is inprecedented. There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world. What they found surpassed all expectations. Thanks to shifting sand and the settlements enclosure in a protected bay the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyeards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious stuctures. In addition the seabed was replete with thousand of shards of  pottery. It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken contient of Atlantis.

Item_Response: Many civilizations have been explored over the many years it takes to find clues and put them together like a puzzle. Archaeologists have worked very hard to find evidence of these ancient people.       The Inca people are located in Peru. Many stories of the Inca were passed down from generation to generation. These sources of innformation are not as trusted because many stories are considered to be legends and are not all true. Although, clues have been left behind of the ways of the people. Artifacts are found hundreds or even thousands of years later. Mostly buried in the ground, some artifacts were taken by looters. Anything that they could find that was valuable was taken. Many of the important things were taken therefore, we do not know as much about these sites. Archaelologists keep records of any artifacts that are found. Many artifacts were preserved from the high peaks of the Andes mountains. Looters often did not visit these sites because they were so well hidden. These artifacts are very important in reevaluting the great Incan empire.       The people of the Mesa Verde land built their homes from stone in the canyon walls. The Basketmakers were known for their skill at the craft. Farming became their way to get food. These people moved back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their family many generations before. We do not know why they moved away from their homes. There are many different possibilites for the change. No written records have been left for the cliff dwellers, so we may never know the story. The structures that archaeologists have discovered have left evidence of skills and traditions that these people once had. The overhang from the cliffs preserved the homes of the people. We now know the way the people made their homes. Archaeologists have discovered that there might have possibly been a drought which caused the people to leave. The land had been used very much and began to deplete the resources.       Near the city of Neapolis, an ancient city lies beneath the sea. Atlantis was perhaps the only planned city. Atlantis is the oldest sunken city in the world. Marine archaeologist have surveyed the area with the aid of digital technology. The city was preserved with the help of shifting sands and the areas protective bay. Artifacts were found from the end of the stone age. Marine archaeologists do not know why the city was sunk. The waters around the city are shallow which is very interesting. The land around contained many ancient people who knew what had happened but time has since stopped the information.       There are many other civilizations that archaeologists know nothing about. That will not keep them from exploring knew places and trying to find out the ways of the people.

Item_Response: The discoveries that have been made about the past can teach us many things. There are many ways we can learn about the past like reading books and going to a museam. The past can teach us many things we don't know. It can even teach us how we have the technology we have now.                                                                                                     The discoveries of the Incas is important because archaeologists can learn how they lived and where they lived. The location that they found can tell how they got their food.  Some things found are material like cloth that survived well.  The artifacts found can tell how they lived everyday life.  The most important thing about the Incas is learning where they came from and what happened to them.  The Inca civilization still has mysteries.       The Puebloans made stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of canyon walls.  These people were known as basketmakers for their skill at the craft.  These people learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow for hunting.  The buildings rooms averaged six feet by eight feet, enough space for two or three people.                             The Pavlopetri people have a city that was submerged and lost.  Archaeologists are still finding artifacts of the ancient civilization. The artifacts found are ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age.  And this is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece and this makes archaeologists think that maybe there are more sunken cities. These are why the discoveries are so important.

Item_Response: So I think theres some thing that we need to talk about the importance of our ancestors; the Incans, the Puebloians, and the Pavlopetris. They all have very important civilizations that show us several things like how they lived, archaeology, agraculuture, pottery, and so on. Lets break it up to talk more specifically about the civilizations.                 First lets talk about the Icans in the article they didn't have any formal system of writing. They kept strings with knots as a calender but since their is nobody left to read it it is still a mystery. Some of what we all know about the Incas is from stories passed down from generation to generation. Historians had to be careful interpreting these accounts because the spainereds didn't speak the Icans language well so their descriptions might no be accurate. The rest of our knowledgee comes from artifacts and their settlements, some were gold, silver, stone, or potery. they lived in the mountian tops of the Andes so their location also helped to preserve sites from looters that stole anything valuable. Bodies that are found in the Andes are in such good shape that experts use modern scanning technology to find out how they died to help them reveal info about how they lived.            Next is the Puebloians, they lived in what is now the Messa Verde National park. The 1st Puebloians were basket weavers. they also replaced farming with hunting and gathering food as a livilihood. They lived in pithouses which later led to kivas (houses above ground). They learned to make potery, bows and arrows.wide spred of potery led to the decline in basket quality. They used mostly sand stone to build with. they lived in cliffdwells for less than 100 years. They saw in the 1200s there was a drought and a failure of crops. so they moved on to New Mexico and Arizona.               Last is the povlopetrians, they most likely lived in the lost city of alantas(the only concidered planned town) which is now submurged underwater and dates back to 5,000 yearsto the time of homers heros. It has remains dating back to 2800 to 1200 BC.it sraddles 30,000 square feat of oeacn floor.thanks to the protective bay itrevaels a world of buildings rock cut tombs, religous stuctures, potery, and ceramics. It is like a moment frozen in the past.

Item_Response: Acient Facts       Acient Inca were very important to find. Accordinng to Archaelogy unlocks secrets of the clues left behinde about the Inca  form an amazing portriat of their reliogion,art,and architecture, agiculture, goverment, transportation and way of life. Since these clues archaeologist and others are starting to piece together the Incas life.    Some thing we know about the Inca comes from oral history, stories passed down to new generations. The rest of are knowledge comes from artifacts , or objects that the Inca have left behinde. Some of the thing they have left behinde pottery, gold silver. Some of the Incas clothing have survived!    Thing we know about the Incas, They lived in the Andes  there is reason to beileve they worshiped the mountin peaks. Most of there sites are in high places. Some incas were barried in caves. Mountin climbers have found bodys, the ice act as a giant freezer. Most of the bodies are in good shape.       About 1,400 years ago Puebloans Lived on this earth. They lived in Mesa Verde, they built stone communities in canyon walls. these stone houses were two or 3 stories and were joined into units of 50 rooms or more They also changed pottery from a simple designe on a dull gray back ground to black drawings on a white back ground.     Then in late 1200s in the span of a generation or tqo, they left and moved away.  According to Mesa Verde National Park Ancetral Puebloans and their world they beileve they could of left because of a drought  or maybe therre recorses like soil, forest, and animal were ruined. Or perhaps there were social and political problems and they simply looked for new opportunties. No one will really no the reasons they left.

Item_Response: Important civilizations             Have you ever wanted to know how people lived in ancient times? Well, thanks to scientist who research these ancient civilizations, now you can learn. Scientists, like the ones from National Geographic and different national parks, are working hard to uncover some of the worlds greatest, forgotten civilizations.        Now you may ask, 'What's so great about settlements that have nothing to do with me?' but in reality, these lost cities have all the world to do with you. These discoveries are extremely important because they teach us how people lived way back when. They tell us everything about that civilization, from what they are, to their religion, to what they did in their free time. We can use these discoveries to invent new things to make our  life easier.        For instance, scientists have located an invention from the Inca's called quipus that helped them keep count of their livestock. From this invention, we know that the Inca's were farmers. From this discovery, scientists have invented a new and more advanced tool for the present day.        From the Puebloans, scientists have located church like structures up in the sides of mountains. Theses churches, called kivas, tell us that these Puebloans were very religious. In these kivas. they have ventilators, air deflectors, fire pits and all of these things, we use right now. These kivas have been around for quite a while and have shown us inventions that we use daily.        Last, but not least, is the sunken city of Pavlopetri. This city from southern Greece has opened up a whole new world for marine scientists. Divers located this sunken city off the coast of southern Greece. Scientists have found underwater settlements before, but this particular one was put together just as it was on land. They found streets, tombs, buildings, religious structures and thousands of shards of pottery. These discoveries suggest that they did practice a religion and the women liked to make pottery in their free time. The discovery of Pavlopetri has made scientists realize that not all ancient settlements are found on land. Sometimes, you just have to look a little bit deeper.

Item_Response: When it comes to the past, how do we learn from it? In ancient Inca of Peru there was no alphabet or system of writing, so how would someone from today learn from them in like the 1400's. Luckily there were some ways to learn from them and even others or other things in the past. Clues left behind by the Inca develop amazing portraits of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life. Because archaeologists study these clues, they can gather information of Inca life. Somethings that people know about them come from stories passed from generation to generation, or books and such. The rest of the knowledge comes from artifacts/objects left behind from the past. every single piece of evidence they find, they use to put information together and create a story.            The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde. They were known for their skill at the craft. They began to lead a more settled way of life. They had a huge population, it had multiplied. Houses were constructed and built from different, well obtained material. Pottery was changed from simple designs on dull gray backgrounds to black drawings on white background. farming accounted for more of their diet then before, much mesa-top land was cleared for agriculture. From 1100 to 1300 A.D. the population grew even larger. People began to move into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestor centuries. The structures are evidence of society that, over centuries, accumulated skills and traditions and were passed on from generation to generation.        The ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Marine archaeologists aided by digital technology were able to properly survey the ruins. They found something that surpassed all expectations; ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that settlement was occupied some million years ago. They also descovered many buildings that were destroyed, and a town that had been used by an elite. For the first time a sunken city had been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis.

Item_Response: Ancient Lost Civilizations           Many Archeologist are very interested in the ancient civilizations of mankind, but have you ever wondered what happened to these lost civilizations, well that's the job that archeologists do they help out on how these ancient civilizations came to ruins.             Many artifacts can tell many different things about a civilization how they lived, even who or what they worshiped. Also so structures of buildings may also help tell Archeologist how the advancements in their technology was. Like the Incas for example they used string call quipus to record and keep track of their livestock. Another example is where they lived, the Incas lived in very high and remote places, some may have even worship mountain peaks. For another example take the Pueblo-ans they first settled in Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. they are known as Basket-makers for their skills at crafting. They learned how to built their own houses call Pit-houses. Later they have advanced in such way to have made pole-and-adobe which was like stone masonry. One other example is the lost city of Atlantis it dates back long ago it is believed to be the oldest sunken city with many artifacts.              So the importance of an archeologist is to find out about the earths history so that we can have knowledge on how many ancient civilzations have lived and survive for  many years.

Item_Response: Archaeologist have discovered Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri. The discoveries are important because it helps us know the history of the places, how they lived, and their way of life.       The ancient Inca of Peru has left behind some items that help us figure out how they live. For example, there were knots that were found and no one knows what the knots actually mean. Also there are clues about their religion, art, agriculture, government, transportation, and their way of life. Also stories have been passed down telling us about the history. Most of the knowledge comes from artifacts or objects left behind. Inca artifacts could be made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver and can last for a long time. Archaeologist can learn much about Inca from what all they have found.       Archaeologist have been able to discover that Puebloans would live in houses made out of mud and poles. Also they have learned that farming has replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. also they were able to find out that throughout the summer fires were used to cook and in the winter they were used throughout the villags.       Learning all of this information helps archaeologist know how people use to live in different places around the world. Also this helps us know what all we have in common and the difference between then and now.

Item_Response: Have you ever went swimming in the ocean? Did you ever wonder what was beneath you? There are lots of interesting things in the ocean that surround you. Some of the things you may not be aware of. The ocean has a plentiful amount of exotic animals. It also has ancient civilizations.       Archaeologist search the ocean each day for priceless artifacts. (Artifacts are objects that help you reveal things about the past.) Archaeologist have found three major civilizations underneath the ocean from the past. One of the civilizations was found beneath the waters off southern Greece. Another Civilization was found  in Mesa Verde. The last civilization was found in Inca.      The civilization that was found beneath the waters off southern Greece was believed to be the city that may have inspired one of the world's most  incredible myths - the fable of Atlantis. This civilization was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist.This settlement straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese.This site was discovered by a British oceanographer. However, what they found surpasses all their expectations.     The civilization in Mesa Verde started over 1,400 years ago, long before the Europeans explored North America. The descendants stayed in Mesa Verde until the late 1200s A.D. Archaeologist called these people Anasazi. Now, we call them Ancestral Puebloans. The first Ancestral Puebloans settled about 550  A.D. They are known for their skilled craftsmanship of baskets. Farming was their main livelihood. They lived in small pit houses clustered into very small villages. About 750 A.D, they began building their houses above ground. These houses were more moderns. From here on, these descendents were known as Puebloans. By 1000 A.D, the people of Mesa Verde  had advanced to stone masonry. Between 1100-1300 A.D, the population may have reached several thousand. About 1200 A.D, the population shifted back to the cliff alcoves that had sheltered their ancestors. Archaeologist have yet to find out why they moved back to the cliff  alcoves. They lived in the cliff dwellings for over 100 years. by about 1300 A.D, Mesa Verde was deserted. The cliff dwellers were reported in the 1880s. Archaeologist will never know the full story because they left no written records.     The civilization that was found in Inca has no system of writing. They did not leave any archives for historians to study. This civilization ruled a South American empire. Some of what we know about Inca comes from oral history (stories passed from generation to generation.) Oral history was an important way to preserve a community's history. Some of the stories were written down  by Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. Historians have to carefully interpret these accounts. The Spaniards may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions may not be accurate. Inca left behind few artifacts. Unfortunately, some of the Incas sites have been disturbed by looters.  The Incas lived in the high Andes. Most of their sites were in high, remote places.This is a good thing because it's not easy for looters to  get to the artifacts.      These civilizations are important because they tell us about how people from the past lived. We can get useful ideas from our ancestors.  It is also important because it tells the scientist about how the climate has changed. We can learn many things from the ancient civilizations.

Item_Response: The Lost Civilizations   This article is about a lost civilizations about 1,400 years ago, people will live in the north America, for the people to chose mesa Verde for their homes. For more than 700 years they and their descendants lived and flourished here. People will make there homes that was called pit-houses the living room sunk a few feet in the ground. People lived in pit-houses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750, then about A.D. 750 their population multiplied and they began building houses above ground. With upright walls made of poles and mud,they built the houses one against another.   The cliff Dwellers they livied in the cliff that's how they got their names then kivas were the name of the house the roof was made of mud they had a ventilator,bench,airdeflector,fire-pit,sipapu,pilaster. The Kivas were used for healing rites or to pray for rain,luck in hunting, or a good crop. Kiva is a hopi word for ceremonial room, the dwellers basic construction meterial was sandstone that was shaped into a block about the size of a loaf of bread. The rooms averaged about six feet by eight feet, space enough for two or three people.Ancestral puebloans lived in the cliff dwellings for less than 100 years.When the cliff dwellers of mesa verda left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, setting among their kin who were already there.   The lost Greek city of Atlantis, The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.In terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say, it has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, long before the glory days of classical Greece. The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. It was discovered by a British oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologists, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. In the area of Neapolis in the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. This myth about Atlantis keeps underwater exploration going.

Item_Response: The Lost City                          Have you ever thought of a city being lost? There is and it is not Atlantis. It's a submerged city found in southern Greece not that far from Neapolis. It is called Pavlopetri. They're lifestyle is unique and quite like no other ancient civilization. There are many reasons why their unique and I'll tell you how.            The people from the lost city were skilled and educated people. They made many structures and buildings with many detail. Dr. Jon Henderson, a professor at the University of Nottingham, states, 'There are older sunken sites in the world but none can be considered to be planned towns such as this, which is why its unique.' Also, they made religious structures. In the article, it states, '... the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.' I believe that they made the religious structures to be unified and meet about their religion. They also made rock- cut tombs. I don't believe that anyone made tombs like that, except the Egyptians.            The people also had unknown size and wealth. Experts state,' The sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented.' No one knows how much wealth they have, but its still yet to be discovered. The size of the city was enormous. The article states,' The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.' Also in the article, Henderson states,'Our investigations also revealed over 9,000 square meters of buildings.' All together, they had 39,000 square meters of land! Who knows maybe they discover more meters of land.             Here's a question? 'What happened to the lost city?' In the article, it states, 'Marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, earthquakes, or a tsunami.' No one knows how the city sank, but its still trying to be discovered for its disappearance. The article also states, '... is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.'  the marine geologists believe that it was by a tsunami, but its still a theory.         Many of the ancient civilizations that we know like the Mayans, Incas, etc. have been amazing, but  we want to know more. You never knew that there was a sunken city, right? Some information of the Pavlopetri is similar to other ancient civilizations and even to ours today, but there's never been a sunken, ancient civilization. That's what makes it unique and there's still more to be discovered of Pavlopetri. We just have to keep on looking.

Item_Response: The Lost City                    The lost city is found! Geologists and archaeologists have found a sunken settlement that is about 5,000 years old. An English-Greek team of archaeologists and geologists are exploring the new-found sunken settlement, the size and wealth of the city is very unique.            This settlement is one of the oldest submerged towns in the world. It is unique because it is considered to be a planned town. This means that the people who lived here were smart and civilized. These people were planning to make a civilization. It is believed that the city sunk at around 1000 BCE. The exploration revealed buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures that were preserved by shifting sands and a protected bay. It is believed that the main streets were used for travel and trade. The courtyards were most likely used for coming together or for social gatherings. The buildings must have been very sturdy in order to be able to withstand the impact of when the city was submerged. These people must have been so caught up in trying to create a utopia that they forgot about the possibilities of there being a natural disaster that could wipe them out.             If the city hadn't sunk, it would still be standing today. If you ever want to make a perfect utopian society, then you should not only think about the good things that could happen, but also think of the bad things that could happen. You should always expect the unexpected.

Item_Response: Ancient Inca:   Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the    Past   By: Beth Gruber           The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of  writing. Instead they used colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. They did not leave archives for historians to study. Clues left behaind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way or life. By  studying these clues, archaeologist and others can piece together details of Inca life. Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descripions might not be accurate. And some of the Inca stories were ledgends rather than history.           Mesa Verde National Park   Ancestral Puebloans And Their World      Illustrations by NPS/Roy Anderson       About 1,00 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. For more than 700 years they and their decendants lived and flourished here, eventually builfing elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the can walls. In the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of generation or two, they left their homes and moved away. Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular reminder of this ancient culture. Archeologist have called these pople Anasazi, from a Navajo word sometimes translated as 'the ancient ones' or  'ancientenemies.' We now call them Ancestral Puebloans, reflecting their modern decendants.       Lost Greek city that may have inspired    Atlantist myth gives up secrets.        By: Helena Smith in Athens          The secrets of a lost cuty that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths-the fable of Atlantis-have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.   Explored by an Angelo-Greek team of archaeologist and marine geologist and known as Pavopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heros and in terms of size and wealth of detail od unprecedented, experts say.   The site, which straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor  off the southern Peloponnese, is believed to have been consumed by the sea around 1,000 BC. Although discovered by a oceanographer some 40 years ago, it was only this year that marine archaeologist, aided by digital technology, were able to properly survey the ruins. Marine geologist have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of eatrthquakes, or a tsunami. It's the first tome a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent Atlantis.       'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration goin,' said Sakellariou. 'Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is srill a lot more sown there that has to be found.'

Item_Response: Ancient inca:                 Archeaology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past             The Incans had no formal alphabet.They only used colored strings called quipus to keep record of live stock. The only Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empiree only using quipus to keep records.When the Europeans who did travel to the Incan empire. Most were spanish soldiers and the others  were priest who wrote about the incans in their letters and diaries.Most of the archaeologist knowledge comes from the artifacts they have found in these ancient ruins.Alot of these artifacts were made from stone.pottery,gold,or silver.Also, Incan textiles and clothing have also survived remarkbly well.The fall of the Incan empire took place in 1532 when the spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the empire. The Inca lived up high in the Andes, and worshipped high on mountain peaks.Some Incans were buried in caves in a cliff face.                                     Mesa Verde National park                    Ancestral Puebloans nad Their World             The Puebloans lived about 1400 years ago, way before any euorpeans came to North America. Later in the year  A.D. 1200 was when the span of generations left their homes and moved away. The first of the Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. Farming soon replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. These were some prosperous times for basketmakers, And the population had began to multiply. Also, about A.D. 750 they had begun to bulid houses above ground. In the year A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced to skillful stone masonary. From the year of A.D. 1100 to the year of A.D. 1300, the populatin had reached several thousand. Major population shift caused some people to move back into cliff alcoves. Ever since local cowboys first reported cliff dwellings, archeologists have sought to understand the lives of the Puebloans. In the classice period the Ancetral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization. About A.D. 1300< Mesa Verde was deserted. Several theories as to why they migrated were talked about. Maybe because of the drought they experienced or the crop failures. Maybe the natural resources had depleted. Or maybe even they were looking for new oppurtunities.                    Lost Greek city that may have inspired                Atlantis myth gives up secretrs.           Secrets of a lost city may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths the fable of Atlantis.Explored by an Anglo-Greek  team ofc archaeologists and marine geologists claims that this establishment dates back to 5000  years to the time of Homer's heroes. It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC long before Greece's glory days. This sites straddles 30,000 square meters of ocean floor. ' We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested thet the settlement was occupied some of 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier then originally thought,' said Henderson. The investigation revealed over 9,000 square meters of new buildsings. Some people believe this city sunk, because of sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of an earthquake, or a tsunami. Older generatons of  Neapolis always knew something wads there but never could pin point it exactly. This was the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his tale of Atlantis. Even though Atlantis is a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater expolration going. Less than `1% of the world's oceans floors have ever been surveyed. Even though this was an extraordinary find there is even more to be found.

Farming then took over hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in small pit houses in villages. Eventually the Puebloans's population grew bigger and started building houses out above ground with upright walls made out of mud and poles by A.D. 750. The puebloans advanced even more by A.D. 1000 they advanced from. pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry. Walls of thick stone masonry three stories high and joined into units of 50 or more rooms. Their pottery also changed from a dull grey background to black drawings on a white background. Item_Response: The discovery of the Incans, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri was important because it led to a portal into the past.With these discoveries, archeologists could discover ancient civilizations and learn about the ancients world. This allowed a broader scope of thew world and let them discover other civilizations. This allowed a richer Earth.          With the Incans, the discovery of them allowed them a glimpse of ancient South America. With their mummies, we could see how they looked and what they wore. They also had many other artifacts that let us look at there culture and their daily lives. And although we can't read there system of writing, the quipus allowed us to see there way of life. This allowed a good view of Incan life and how they lived.          The Puebloans and their way of life allowed a unique view of the South-West natives. When they discovered the bow, it allowed them to protect themselves. When they built pithouses, that allowed them to live in buildings. They were then able to build walls, which allowed more protection. The discovery of pottery allowed scientist to see that they were cultured, not just defensive. When they moved to the cliffs, this showed they faced a threat. They then upgraded their homes, building Kivas, ancient churches. All of this allowed a view of a modern civilization.          Pavlopetri was important because it allowed a glimpse of ancient Greece. Because it showed age, scientists discovered it was consumed by water in 1000 B.C. They also discovered tools dating 5,000 years ago. It was the oldest planned city, and had many relics. This allowed a vision of ancient Greece.

Item_Response: People today have always been fascinated by ancient civilizations. As humans, our minds are wired to investigate and find out more. We kick into this gear even more when presented with a mystery. Three lost civilizations that have piked the interest are the Inca, the people of Mesa Verde, and a sunken city off of the Greek coast.       The Inca lived in Peru and the Andes mountains. From 1438 to 1532, they created a vast empire that rivalled the ancient Rome. Their religion, art, architecutre, governmenment, transportaion, and way of life, have been revealed by clues that they left behind.

Item_Response: The reason the Inca are so important is that they were a part of history. A civilization was nearly a hundred years old from (1438-1532) ruled a South American empire. The people know some old stories because they are down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. They lived in the Andes and many even were worshiped some mountain peaks.       The Puebloans are important because they are know for the skill basketmakers. They tell of a people adept at building, of their crafts. The kiva roofs created open courtyards where they daily took place. Puebloans built their dwellings beneath the overhanging cliffs. They have lived there for less than 100 years.       Atlantis we explored by Angle-Greek team of archeaologists and marine geologist and known as Pavlopetri. Atlantis is the first sunken city in Greece. It was discovered by a British oceangrapher.

Item_Response: The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus-but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding the Ancient Inca is a lot like solving a mystery.       The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff aces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped to preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them. But it also makes the job of the archaeologist more difficult. High-altitute archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equipment up a mountain before they can start work. Anything they find has to be carried down the mountain for study. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shap that experts can use modern medical scanning equipment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived.       About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North American, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verde for their home. For more then 700 years they and their descendents lived and flourished here, eventually building elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, in the span of a generation or two, they left their homes and moved away.       Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, during the Classic Period, the population may have reached several thousand. It was mostly concentrated in compact villages of many rooms, often with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls rather then out in the open. The stone walls of the large pueblos are regarded as the finest ever built in Mesa Verde, with their straight courses of carefully shaped stones. Baskets show evidence of decline in quality, possibly because widespread use of pottery meant less attention to the craft. About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people bein to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before. Why did they make this move? We don't know. Perhaps it was for defence; perhaps it was for religious or psychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elements. Whatever the reason, or reasons, it gave a rise to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is most famous.       Ever since local cowboys first reported the cliff dwellings in the 1880s, archeologists have sought to understand these people's lives. But despite decades of excavation, analysis, classifaction, and comparison, scientific knowledge remains sketchy. We will never know the whole story: they left no written records and much that was important in their lives has perished. Yet for all their silence, these structures speak with a certain eloquence. They tell of a people adept at building, artistic in their crafts, and skillful at making a living from a difficult land.       When the cliff dwellers of Mesa Verde left, they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there. Whatever may have happened, some of today's Pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendents of the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde.       The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths - the fable of Atlantis - have been brought to light from beneath the waters of off southern Greece. Explored by an Anglo Greek team of archaeologists and marine geologists and known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement dates back some 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes and in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented experts say.       It is the first time a sunken city has been found in Greece that predates the time that Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. 'Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going', said Sakellariou. 'Less then 1% of the world's ocean floors have ever been surveyed. This is an extraordinary find but there is still a lot more down there that has to be found'.

Item_Response: The discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important. You may ask why these are important they but I will tell you in this five paragraph essay.      In Source one 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past' in paragraph two it says, 'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art, and architecture'. Why this is important is because we can see what god or gods the Inca worshiped, what kind of art the Inca made like mosaics or portraits, and what kind of building materials that the Inca used for their major buildings and houses.      In Source two 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their world' in paragraphs five and six starting with paragraph five the passage says,'By A.D. 1000 the people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and-adobe construction to skillful stone masonry'. this means that the Puebloans started to modernize instead of living in pit houses they started to make houses made of skillful stone masonry. In paragraph six it says,'About A.D. 1200, another major population shift saw people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before...Perhaps it was for defense; perhaps it was for religious or psychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elements'. This means that the Puebloans think that their god or gods are going to punish them for their big move from pithouses to houses made from stone or the Pauebloans think that one of their enemies are going to come and attack them because of their skill at making stone, or perhaps it is because of the season and winter is coming soon so they want to be protected.      In Source three 'Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets'.   In this article it says,'We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, which suggested that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought' (paragraph 6). This article is so important because, the archaeologists found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age, and that was 1,200 years earlier than thought. So by coming upon these things we now know that the end of the stone age was 1,200 years earlier than thought. This article also says in paragraph six,'... that the town had been used by an elite, and automatically raised the status of the settlement'. This is important because now the archaeologists know that the town ad been used by an elite, and now they can try to find out who this elite is.      This is why the discoveries that had been made about the Inca,Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important.

The findings have taught our current culture that the things that are important to us now like our phones, computers, and teleivision have not always been so important. other things used to be way more important like religion. Also you wouldn't have time to use a phone or computer because back then everyone had a job, they had to it was the only way to survive as a clan. But, in many ways acioent tribes are just like modern day people.         What are some everyday things that you do now that other people used to do in years like 1438-1532 A.D.? We all write and talk right? Well to do all of that you have to have an alphabet, in current discoveries reaserchers have found an acient Inca alphabet recorded. So even in little tribal clans they used an alphabet everyday just like us. Inca people also went to war, which is something that happens everywhere.          As you can see acient tribes really arent that much different that modren day people you just have to dig a little deeper and find what you are looking for. So next time you are in History class and you are thinking ' This is so boring' don't spend all of your time thinking about how bad and boring it is think about how much you in current day have in common with the history.

Item_Response: Sometimes you are told to think outside the box, infact; it is encouraged. My question is, what's wrong with inside the box? Inside the box is where you got your product, and it is where the instructions came with it; so why not use what you have? Why make things more complicated than they need to be? In my opinion the archaeologists in these articles are just making things so much more difficult than needed, yes, you do need helpful hints here and there, but who says you can't figure out the story yourself?   In the article 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past' it states 'Archaeologist have found many ancient quipus- but today no one knows what the knots mean.' Would these archaeologist know what the knots mean if they would have just stayed in their box? There is so much information just right there in their box. (The box is an interpurtation of their findings and in their findings area). Maybe they went too far out of the box and just can't get back in, time is killer and with it on their hands wasting it looking elsewhere but in their box; well that will do nothing but cause them problems.   So next time you decide 'I am going to think outside the box' maybe you should rethink that decision. But that is only my theory, what is yours?

Item_Response: In Ancient times, the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri lived different lives than we live today. Have you ever wondered how your ancestors or even people lived in the past? Most Archaeologists do, they search the world for lost civilizations, artifacts, or even ruins to learn about the past. The Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri were civilizations that would show people how remarkable the past was, also how these civiliations lived.               The Incas were a extraordinary civilization from having recorded time to having a large city. Incas had no formal writing or alphabet, they didn't leave behind written records or journals for Archaeologists to study. They did have a smart strategy to have colorful strings called quipus to record their calendar and keep count of their animals. Some Incas would bury their relatives and make them into mummies. Only royal families or wealthy families could mummsize their family member. Archaeologists find mummies an amazing artifact to discover, most tombs are hard to find and some are robbed from the expensive jewelry the mummy carries. Some artifacts from the Inca civilization are kept well preserved from the weather. Archaeologists hope to learn more about the Inca civilization from the years to come.                     Much like the Incas the Puebloans were an amazing civilization. They started their civilization in Mesa Verde in A.D 550. The Puebloans are know for their skill at crafting and art, they were nomads at first but they began to lead a more settled life. Farming was mostly their work than hunting or gathering. Puebloans would build pithouses that were clustered into small villages. Pithouses were mostly made on mesa tops but rarely on cliff recesses. They were artisans they would make their own pottery, tools, and weapons. In A.D 750  they began building houses one against each other in long, curving rows, sometimes with pithouses in the front. Between A.D 1110 and A.D 1300 they Puebloans buliding skills changed and so did their way of making pottery. They would make intriqute buildings and beautiful pottery that were made from their hands. But in about A.D 1200 the civilization's popularity decreased people began to move back to the cliff alcoves to where their ancestors sheltered before. By about A.D 1300 Mesa Verde was deserted, some people became cave dwellers like their ancestors but most of the population began to look somewhere else. Archaeologists still have questions to answer and solve about the amazing Puebloan civilization.                     The Palvopetri was a ancient civilization that lived in Ancient Greece. They had a remarkable city. That city became known as the 'Lost Greek City' because it became submerged underwater. Palvopetri people made exquisite designs with the buildings they made and the way the runned their city. They built main streets, made their own pottery and even made a megaron. A megaron is a monumental building that has a rectangular hall that was only used by royal or elite members. This civilization was enormous, it had more the 30,000 square meters. It is the oldest submerged city in the world and the first submerged city in Greece. This city inspired the myth of the submerged city 'Atlantis'.The Palvopetri people occupied this settlement 5,000 years ago. Archaeologists still don't know how this city became submerged, some suggested that it was cause by a earthquake or a tsunami, other say both. This is a very ancient civilization and is to yet to be discovered, the Palvopetri people were an astonishing civilization that brings questions to people's minds.                       Whether it was the Incas, Puebloans, or the Palvopetri people these civilizations have teached us how people lived in the past. With the artifacts that are left behind, most civilizations are yet to be discovered and understood. It shows that life was different before us.

Item_Response: The discovery of The Sunken city in Greece is important because it is the largest and oldest sunken city found. The city dates back to 5,000 years ago, around the time of Homers Heroes.   The sunken city straddles 30,000 square meters on the ocean floor off the Southern Peloponnese.What they found surpassed all expectations, the exploration revealed a world of buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. No one knows for sure how the city sunk. theories include tsunamis,earthquakes, or rise in sea level. Atlantis was a myth but this myth keeps under water exploration continuous.

Item_Response: Learning about about ancient civilizations , I think they are quite fascinating to the modern world (as we know it ). When we find sunken city that may have caused myths of Atlantis or finding a whole community in canyon walls or in a mountain top.We can figure out how society worked 5,000  years ago or longer.                                 What really shocks me (personally) is that a whole town sunk and we found it 40 years ago. They sunken city was 30,000 square feet on the ocean floor. this is amazing because we can still pull artifacts from it. These artifacts are huge on society like how we developed as humans in height ,size and mind . how towns , city's , country's have developed . this city is believed to have been sunken in 1000 BC . it has started myths of Atlantis, on how powerful a tsunami or earthquake can be to sink a whole town that big. how people lived in comparison to now. Some of  the most important tools we have today came be found in an old city ruins.                        the ancient Inca of Peru had no alphabet or system of writing but surprisingly we have learned a lot bout them. the Inca made knots in colored string to keep the calender also to keep track of live stock . archaeologists have found many strings that they use but no one has quite figured it out and the best theory we have is that they use it for the calender  and live stock. most ancient ruins are for the most part 'easy to understand ' but with the Inca 'understanding ' is a lot like soling a huge mystery.    the Inca have given us many clues about the portrait of how religion 'grew' , about art,farming , the goverment, and most importatly a way of life.   they most we reallybcan find out is from the oral history and stories passed thourgh generation to genertaion (to presever communitys history).

Item_Response: Why are the discoveries that have been made about Inca, the Puebloans, and the                                                    Pavlopetri important?           Have you ever thought about how important discoveries are? Probably not but they are very important. In this article I am going to be talking about why discoveries are important. I got my information from three other articles they are Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past by: Beth Gruber, Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and Their World illustrations by NPS/Roy Anderson, and Lost Greek city that may have inspired Atlantis myth gives up secrets by Helena Smith in Athens.            In the first article Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past by Beth Gruber it talks about several discoveries. One discovery was the quipus, and the quipus was a way for Inca to keep track of livestock. It had colorful strings that formed into knots. But the bad news is today no one knows what the knots mean. We don't know if one knot means 10 cows or 20 chickens. But this discovery was imporant because know we know that they could keep records and run a huge empire all by themselves. But if the archaeologist can find someone that knows what these knots mean they will be able to learn a lot more about the Acient Inca people.  But not all of the discoveries have to be one item. In paragraph 2 it says 'Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and the way of life.' This sentence is saying that these were very smart people. They knew how to do so many things. We could learn from the Inca people. Also the Inca people made artifacts made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. So these people could have influenced people now. Like pottery they could have influenced our pottery making. Item_Response: Have you ever wondered what our past was like? How the Incans, Puebloans, and the Pavloperti's lived? Well archaeologists have been working on that and have found answers to most of our questions.  They have had struggles with treasure hunters, they have found artifacts. and even a lost Greek city.                Most people have heard of treasure hunters.  They go to archaeological sotes and steal artifacts that arent theirs.  Most valuable is what they are looking for.  hey want to pocket money.  But archaeologists have to deal with this.  Not always having the best find because someone else has already been there.  But they always seem to cope and get results.               Archaeologists have found many artifacts.  Big and small.  From bowls to clothing and everything in between.  In the Andies, they found knots in colored string called quipus that used to be a calender that kept a cound of livestock.  They have also found pithouses where people lived and Kivas which people gathered, like a ceremonial room.                They have also found a lost city.  This city was found underwater beneth the waters of Greece. They think it is the oldest submerged town in the world!  Some of the remains date back to 2800 B.C. to 1200 B.C. which was long before classical Greece.  Most of this settlement was occupied by people 5000 years ago which was way earlier then first thought.  The archaeologists founf a megaron-a monumental structure with a large rectangular hall- that suggests the town had been used by an elite.  This site is a magnificant find because everything there was 'frozen in the past'.              Archaeologists are working hard to find out a lot about our past.  They are dealing with treasure hunters, finding artifacts, and still discovering parts of our world that we never knew exisisted.

Item_Response: There are many reasons why the discoveries of the Inca, Puebons, and the Pavlopetri's are so important. The first of many reasons is that, these artifacts are like an ancient hiustory text book. They tell us there way of life. It provides of with information about their lifestyles and what they did.        Artifacts from these cultures are like an ancient textbook. They tell us how they lived. They tell us what they wore. Specuial events that happened in their lifetime. Who was there leader and so on.        These ancient artifacts tell us how they lived. It tells us because its kinda like art. They show special events or moments that happened in their lifetime. If certain people were elected to lead or if there culture decided to move. Or join a different group and unite and become a union.        They explain their style of life. They explain it just like how we express ourslef in art. That is basically what these artifacts are, art. They used these to either express theirsleves our note certain things that happened in their lkife. Or certain emotions.       Inca, Pueblons, and Pavlopetri's artifacts should be preserved. One of the three reasons is that they tell us how they lived. Their agriculture. Also because it is like an ancient history textbook.

Item_Response: There were many discoveries found in the ancient inca, ancestral puebloans, and the lost greek city. We know about a civilization for nearly a hundred years ruled a south american empire that ricaled the expanse of ancient rome because of clues left behind. About 1,400 years ago, long before europeans explored north america, a group of people living in the four corners region chose mesa verde for their home. The secrets of a lost city that may have inspired one of the world's most enduring myths- the fable of atlantis- have been brought to light from beneath the waters off southern Greece.            Ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet ot system of writing. The Inca made knots in colored strings called 'quipus' to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first European to discover the Inca was amazed how they could keep record ny tying knots. Archaeologist have found many quipus that no one knows what the knots mean. Ancient Inca is a solving mystery.            For more than 700 years ancestral puebloans and their descendants lived and flourished in North America. They eventually started building stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. In late A.D. 1200s they left their homes and moved away. Whatever may have happened, some of today's pueblo people, and maybe other tribes, are descendants of the ancestral puebloans of mesa verde.

Item_Response: Explainatory Article            Ancient civilization of the Inca, Ancestral Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri  has become an important part in our history. This three magnifacient civilizations contain many secrets of ancient time that most of them haven't been discovered by archiologist yet. Maybe you might be thinking that ancient civilization might not be as interesting and important to our civilization of today since its from thousands years ago. However, they have so many information thathas influenced and effected our world of today.               The Ancient Inca of Peru was one of the earliest civilization that was build hundred years ago.  It was difficult for them to know how to start their culture since they didn't know about communication, transportation, technology, education, ect. However scientist had discovered how the Inca kept track of the time. The Inca used a quipus (knots in colorful strings) that keep records. With this invention they could run their empire very well and had learn how to govern it. Scientist had also found letters and documents from Europeans and Spinards that describe thier communication with them. They didn't know much of their language and sometimes the confused themself, but they did build up a way of communicating and trading routes with the Inca . Inca had showed scientist what their civilization religiuos view was, and what they worthship. The mountains of Andes have helped achealogist by keeping dead bodies in a freezing point preventing them from wasting. This helps them analyzed their bodies and detect any diseases that can be prevented from today.         The Ancestral Puebloans had affected our lifes of today. Puebloans were one of the few civilizations that created many materials that we use in our everyday lifes .They created pithouses, which were shelther back in their days. They taugh themselfs how to make a strong shelther that were in good conditions to live, and prevents dangers from around them. They had also made tools that are used to catch food such as bows, arrows, and spear throwers. Like the ancient Inca they had also had a religious view. In theire civilazation they build Kivas which were kind of chruches where they prayed for luck. But one of the most important fact about them is that for them in order to live, they took advantage of nature and used nature's materials to live and learn.         Last but not least, is the Lost City of Atlantis. It is one of the most magnificient civilization that ever existed and contains many secrets that hasnt been discovered yet. The fact of it been underwater makes it mysterious and interesting to the achiologist and scientist since it can let scientist know deeper background knowlege of the weather. In other words, its discovery of how it got underwater will help scientist determine what and how it causes this. Also it will help how to predict if it will happen farther in the future from today.        This civilizations had brough us so many background information and had helped us improve our societies, cultures, government, health and our needs. It is and will be important to our world and people.

When it came to the Spaniards they did not even speak the language the Inca did. The Ina's artifacts were made out of remarkable things such as pottery, stone, gold, and silver. Also some of their clothing survived all these years and are used for research now.  Plus some of the Inca sites have been disturbed by people known as 'Treasure Hunters' or 'looters'. The Inca Lived in the Andes and may have even worshiped the mountain peaks.Plus the most remarkable thing When Incas died they were buried in the mountains or caves, The people in the mountains and because the mountains act as a freezer the dead bodies have been in such great shape that experts can use medical scanning equipment to learn how they died.

Item_Response: Ancient civilizations are important to us today. They could tell us many, many things about life in the past. These things could give us hints to natural disasters, and tell us could this happen again.               The ancient Inca of Peru used quipus instead of writing like us today. The only problem we face is we don't understand it. There are other ways to find out about them, but if we could understand could find out so much more about them. Archeologist use their clothing to find out maybe how big or tall the average person was or if they were the elites. They could use other things such as weapons to what they hunted or if they hunted, or if they fought in battles or wars. They could also use things to find out what they did for fun. Some use bodies to find when they died or even how far the Inca empire dated back.                 In the article it said the first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde at about 550 A.D. They were skilled craftsmen.They made pottery and bow and arrow, which were more efficient than spearing throwing. The types homes they lived in were called pit-houses, which were in villages on mesa tops. Sometimes they would put them on cliff recesses,but very rarely will they do so. At about 750 A.D. they made houses above ground with upright walls made of poles and mud. 250 years later they took and poles and mud ,and used thick, double-coursed stone. Farming at this time was big to, as it made up half of their diet. They cleared lots of mesa- top land just for farming because it was such a big part of there lives.                  In conclusion the discoveries of these ancient civilizations helps us find out what life was like in the past. They show us what they ate, what they wore, and even how they had fun, and that's those discoveries are important.

Item_Response: Ancient Civilizations   There are many known ancient civilizations, some are more know than others. Some of them we know more about, and some still have many mysteries. Then Inca, the Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde, and the Lost Greek City are some of the most well known civilizations we have heard of.       The Inca are known for many things, where they lived is one. They lived in the Andes moutains and in the dry deserts of Peru's coast. Their language has not been able to be read because it was lost just like their people. Gone, but no one knows where. They both just disapered. The Inca did not leave with out a way to know that they were ever there though. They left behind many artifacts, some include clothing, and othere objects made out of pottery, stone, gold, and silver. They also left behind their bodies, their bodies were well preserved in the cold climates of the Andes mountains. So preserved that some reveal information about how they lived.       The Ancestral Puebloans in Mesa Verde, were know as the 'ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies' from the name that the archaeologists gave them, Anasazi. The first Ancestral Puebloans that settled in the Mesa Verde were also know as the Basketmakers for the skill in making baskets. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on the mesa tops with few in cliff recesses. They made pottery and used the bow and arrow for hunting. They eventually started to make pole-and-adobe cunstructions with walls of thick stone that rose two or three stories high. They then made buildings called cliff dwellings. Archaeologists have tried to understand these people's lives but we will never know the whole story they like the Inca left no record. They also just left. the Mesa Verde wa deserted with no sign as to where they had gone.       The Lost Greek City was thought to be the city Atlants. It dates back some 5,000 years to times of size and wealth. The site covers about 30,00 square meters of ocean floor off the coast of southern Peloponnese. It is believed that the site was consumed into the ocean around 1000 BC. They found a world of buildings,courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. There was also thousands of shards of pottery on the seabed. More than any other site so far, the find offers potentail insights into the workings of Mycenaean society. Marine geologists still have to work out why the settlement sank. Some theories include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami.

Item_Response: Many secrets lie within the ruins of ancient settlements, such as the Inca, Hopewell, or Mayan. Archaeologists use information from artifacts, such as clay pots, ancient calendars, or crumbling bodies. All of these artifacts contribute to the expansion of our knowledge, towards this subject.       Knowing about ancient times is important to present generations, because it tells us about our past, and may help us to predict our future. The ancient generations began modern civilization. They began technology, although simple, eminent. Without the help from the past, we would lack many of the things we have today. If the wheel had not been invented, we would not have cars, bicycles, or machines that build these items.       Discovering artifacts from the ancients decode messages and mysteries. Finding knots that people had made to keep track of time or to count for their livestock, have developed into a much more complicated way of life. Ancient stone calendars helped to keep track of the moon phases, and the seasons, so early astronomers could predict what type of weather would occur, and when it was the best time to grow crops.       Thanks to ancient peoples, we have the advanced technology that we have today. Their lives have been preserved in museums and exhibits to show us, that we have developed many of our ways from  our ancestors.

Item_Response: Many years of digging, excavating, and speculating have given us many new ideas about the past. Some of the most major discoveries are the Inca, the old submerged Greek city, and the Puebloans.They have shown early advances in planning, counting, materials used, religion, and many other things. These show us the past, and allow us a good idea of what life was like back then. From their geography to their artifacts, these are some very amazing finds.              The Inca were an ancient civilization within South America. They lived way up in the mountains and used bridges made from rope and wood to get to other places. They were very smart, and developed methods for recording, counting, and other types of math. They were a flourishing civilization until the Spanish came to the Americas. They killed off most of the Inca, but we know about them based on what the Spanish wrote in letters and diaries. Although we will never be able to see how they lived first-hand, they have left behind many artifacts and records to give us a pretty good idea. However, we still know about them through the discoveries we have made about them. All the information gathered was through digging and excavating, and these discoveries show us how people lived in ancient times, what they ate, hunted, grew, and without that we wouldn't know how we used to live back then.           There is an old city near Greece that very few people have seen. It is an ancient submerged city that dates back thousands of years. No one knows for sure how it ended up underwater, but what makes the city so special is the fact that it was a planned city made way before the first recorded planned city. It has roads, houses, and stores, which no one knew truly existed at the time of this city. It is a huge mystery that we can only try to solve through what they left behind. There are pots, pans, fireplaces, brickwork, and a numerous amount of other things left behind that can tell us how these people lived back then. This discovery shows that there were advanced people before recorded history. We need to know this, because if we don't, then we know even less of ancient people. If we never find these lost civilizations, then we lose much of the world's history.           The Puebloans, also known as cliff-dwellers, were an ancient race who left their homes for unknown reasons. They were very advanced and were able to let their population grow to several thousand. They were excellent house makers and their food mainly originated from farming. They used adobe bricks and sandstone bricks for their houses and used a mud cement. The Spanish discovered them, but they were never wiped out by them. They Left their homes for some reason that is unbeknownst to us. However, that leaves room for speculation. The discoveries of ancient civilizations don't always provide the answer to the questions that we have about it. So, we use speculation to determine what has happened to something. Without the use of speculation we would never be able to answer our questions, leaving us in the darkness of the unknown.

Item_Response: All of these civilizations have different types of cultures and architecture that they have left behind for us to study from. They all have one thing in common, they all had the same idea for their environment and culture. The Inca and the Puebloans had the same idea of their writings and their living situatioins. The Cliff Dwellers and the Puebloans had both used what they had to build their own homes from what they had in the environment around them.            All of the Inca writings and communication were made by hand. They didn't have their own language to talk from or hand signals. They used hand made calendars and made knots with colored strings for their calendar called quipus. People today still don't know what the string and the knots stand for, and there's nodbody still alive today to explain it to us. The only reason we know about the Inca civilization today is because they left behind some clues of their art and government which made us to piece togeher their city. Some of the information we know today comes form the anciet fabels and stories that were passed down from generation to generation. When the Spaniards had an incounter with the Inca's they didn't quite understand their language, so the information the Spaniards give us today might not be accurate. Also the Spaniards did kill the last Inca king, so they may be lying about some part of their culture. The rest of the information we have been given came from artifacts made from gold and silver. The Inca lived in the Andes and were believed to worshiped mountain peaks. Most Inca sites are hidden or remote or on mountain tops so its not easy to find their locations. When archaeologist's find Inca bones up in the mountains they study how they carried their equipment up these mountain tops alot and by studying ther bones they figure out how they died and how they lived.            Before Europeans explored America, there were a group of people living in Mesa Verde, they lived their for more than 700 years, enough time to build cities and communities. Eventually they moved away. Now there is Mesa Verde National Park dedicated to this ancient civilization to remind everyone of their culture. At first the people located on Mesa Verde were called Anasazi, translating to 'the ancient ones', but now we call them Ancestral Puebloans, from their modern decendents. They had a skill for basketmaking and replaced farming for hunting and gathering. They lived in small villages on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. They learned how to make pottery in their spare time, and started using bow and arrow for an easier an faster way to hunt. As the population grew, the basketmakers started building more houses above ground were they weren't so isolated. As they began to interacte with people outside their tribe, they ecame known as the Puebloans, a Spanish word meaning 'village dwellers'. The Puebloans started to build all of their newest buildings with pole-and-adobe construction. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, their population grew to several thousand. They also had the finest buildings and architecture built in Mesa Verde.              The Ancestral Puebloans, were skillful with their crafts and decorative with how they made them. They were an example of a very advanced tribe and had the most exsquisite expression of human culture. Their architecture was normal block shaped building made of sandstone. Soon after their arrival the Ancestral Puebloans, deserted their land from drought. Drought made a decrease in crops and then there was no way for them to have food. But it must have been a bad drought because history says, that they had suffered droughts before, but none like this. When they left their land they migrated into New Mexico and Arizona, settling with people that already had families there. Some of their desendants may still be living in New Mexico today.            The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Cliff Dwellers 'the ancient puebloans', all left their civilizations one way or another. Some from drought and others from weather and location. Their architecture was unique and culture was interesting. The one thing all these tribes had in common was how they all left behind their cultures for people today to study from and learn how people from the era of A.D.
