Item_Response: The discoveries of Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important for various reasons. To star out, each discovery is an important part of history. The Incas with their extraordinary way of communicating without a written language. The Puebloans with their unique construction skills. And lastly, the Pavlopetri with the discovery of a city which is sunk undewater. Some even have a legend or myth behind it. They all have a interesting background.           In addition, the Incas had a really durable clothing. Not long ago, archaeologists found Inca clothes in not a bad shape even though they hhad been left without care. And that is how they came to infere that the Incas clothing was durable. As I mentioned earlier, the Puebloans were really good at constructing homes. Archaeologists say that their skills were amazing. That is how they got the nicknames Puebloans which is village dwellers in Spanish. Now going to Greece, the underwater city discovery created many myths. One being 'The Lost City of Greece, Atlantis' which became known all over the world.           The Inca was one of the early civilization which means that a lot of its history couldn't be discover. But with the sources found by the archaeologists, they could connect the information together to figure out their lifestyle. With the Puebloans homeland being at the top of cliffs, research was difficult to be done. And last but not least, It was impressive to discover the underwater city in Greece. For that, I believe those discoveries were important.

Item_Response: The study of the ancient Inca of Peru is important, because it thought us what happened in Peru a million of years ago. We also learned how they lived, how they made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of lives stock. Also is important because we need to know about the history that happened, not only the one in the U.S, but the one outside the world. Now the study of the Mesa Verde helped us because it told us the fist people that ever lived there, Ancestral Puebloans. The Ancestral Puebloans settled int Mesa Verde in about A.D. 550. We know they're best know for 'Basketmakers'. They also learned how to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a weapon used to hunt. The Ancestral Puebloans lived in pithouses, as agriculture began. Over the years the people of Mesa Verde, advanced their way of living. By the Classic Period, Ancestral Puebloans were heirs of a vigorous civilization. Ancestral Puebloans livedin the cliff dwellings for less that 100 years. By A.D. 1300, Mesa Verde was deserted.

Item_Response: The discoveries of ancient civilizations have affected the modern era and the outlook we have on life. Learning about our past is just as important as controlling the present, if not even more. The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri all had quite advanced lifestyles compared to other empires. The knowledge we have gained from them can help with our current situations and in the future.          Looking into the past will allow for a better understanding of the present and contribute to the future. Having to sources to see what worked and did not in the past helps prevent the same mistakes from happening in the future. For example, Britain having control over the Tirteen Colonies did not succeed. This sets a precident for future countries and the land they control.          The world would not be what it was today if not for our past. As one travels back in time to the era of the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri, an overall better understanding for the world is endured. We can see how our ancestors lived and how we are who we are thanks to them.

Item_Response: The ancient Incans had left behind almost nothing but the archaeologists have found Quipus. Quipus were used for some sort of organization method, it could have been used for keeping track of livestock and othere various reasons. When the europeans first me the Incans they were astonished about how amazing they ran their empire and how much they had accomplished with so little tools to use.          Incans ruled the South American empire from 1438-1532 and revaled the expansion of Rome. We can tell how they lived and how their empire expanded. The archaeologists have found other signs about how they lived and how their empire has died.           The archaeologists have to be careful that they are digging in the right site so they dont dig up the wrong site and mix up the civilizations and create a huge mess.             They lived in the high Andes and probably lived and worshiped by the mountain peaks. Alot of the Incans sites were remote and in secret mostly in high mountain places like the tops or in crevases. The excavators have a more difficult job because of their civilizations.              The excavators have to climb high mountain peaks with all of their equipment but all of that weight could cause one of them to fall or injure themselves badly. Once they are at the top or the destination they were trying to reach they still have to excavate all of the reminents and clean them and pack them. Once the jobs done they still have to lug alll of the excavation tools and all of the reminents back down which can cause more injury or possible damage to the artifacts.               Incans were an amazing and interesting civilization to studdy and they have shown us how we have advanced and developed from helpless to completely independent creatures.

Now that we know more about them we can relieve are self's of the burden of not knowing are hidden past.For example the way we know what the Inca did like knots and clothing helps us understand that no matter what, we are all have the same and similar mind.The Inca did not know about clothing from other people across the world but thought of it on their own. Just like the Europeans and others.       By looking back on history we can see the mistakes made and avoid them to prevent them from happening again.All we have to do is find out what went wrong the Inca were conquered and the people of Atlantis could not avoid theirr fate of a natural disaster.       The way that they lived showed that as a human being like all human beings and animals adapt to their surroundings. The Inca lived in mountains and had a ton of gold silver and wood so they made tools. The Puebloans lived closely together probably to have each others backs. They depended on one another and relied on each other. The communication with each other showed their survival as a group.       Even though Ancient Civilizations are in the past they still can help the present and future. They can also determine a humans characteristics and ideas. Without those Civilizations would we be as we are today? Would we know what the humans natural nature is?   Would we stay as it is and not move on? Who knows but the future has been and will be decided all he have to do is wait and rely on faith and the past.

Item_Response: Inca's, Puebloan's, and Pavlopetri's  discoveries were so important. Not only because their way of lifestyle and art were so fascinating, we also learned very much from these amazing tribes and their way of lifestyle and skills are still used today.       Inca's were very smart and skilled people. The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. Instead, the Inca made knots on colored strings call a quipus to record the calendar to keep count of things. For example; Livestock, crops, money, etc. Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire, just using string to keep count. Archaeologists  have found many quipus, but not fully understanding them. Clues were left behind by Incas for Archaeologists to study, for example; architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Thanks to these clues archaeologists can put together details of Inca life.       Puebloans were also very helpful, they first settled in Mesa Verde. They were known for their basketmaking, skill and craft. Farming was used more than hunting and gathering as a livelihood. They lived in pithouses and there were so many of pithouses that they were clustered, built on mesa tops, and cliff recesses. They lewarned to make pottery, bows and arrows and were more efficient for hunting
